Ratings.comment: I had Bonnie for BUSOBA 2320 and 2321. The BUSOBA department is the absolute worst organized department in Fisher, if not the entire school. I swear Bonnie Schroeder and Terry Klinker saw what Marc Smith was doing, copied it but made everything worse. For the love of all things holy, my final exam building/room was locked and I could not get in.

She teaches everything completely different from the STAT 1430 class and makes everything exceptionally more difficult than it needs to be. I swear she chooses to teach the most difficult ways to reach an answer. I don't understand why she teaches things different from the 1st stat class, makes everything 10x harder to understand.
she makes me want to kms

Gambled away my health for an A. Not worth it. This class is unnecessarily stressful and at the end of the semester I got tinnitus from the stress of this course. Please do extra credit hw and don't believe anyone who says the group cases were easy. They were the bums of their group.

Hearing all the horror stories about this course, I entered with the mindset that time & effort would get me through it smoothly. I was wrong. This was by FAR the hardest & most time-consuming class I have taken in my 3 years at OSU. I cried as I studied for each exam. Bonnie makes everything horrifyingly confusing. Please do the HW extra credit.

this class was a living nightmare. there was about 10% of students who truly knew what they wad doing. whatever u do do not take it by her. She is a terrible teacher. my friends was able to explain the topics better than she ever did. Truly the worst course to take at fisher TRUST ME.  My grade was a b only becasue of the homeoworks
There is a lot of extra credit, and the exams are not as hard as everyone says. However, the lectures are incredibly boring, and one should expect to learn everything on their own.

While her lectures can be hard to pay attention to, the class itself is very well organized, has plenty of opportunities for extra credit, and the exams are extremely fair. She gives plenty of leeway when it comes to earning credit (HWs, extra test questions for bonus, etc.) and gives a few excused absences.

Bonnie's lectures are boring but they are not as bad as people say. If you choose to actively pay attention and try, you will succeed. The content is not difficult; it mimics AP Statistics. Bonnie's teaching is very confusing as she makes the content more complex. There is a ton of extra credit and leeway built into this class.

Quite possibly the worst course I have ever taken at any level of my education. The homework had typos and errors ever week. Bonnie did not submit grades on time and took several days after the hard deadline to post them, JUST TO GET THEM WRONG and email every student that they need an EXTRA WEEK to fix them. We pay 35 thousand a year for this bs?

Ok hear me out. This course is hard. However, Bonnie gives you lot of opportunities to succeed in this class (6% extra credit + curves). If you can build some strong study habits and come to class already having a pretty solid understanding of the material you will do very well. I hated statistics coming into this class, but now I actually like it.
Class kinda annoying basically teach the whole class to yourself. Honestly if you put in the work it's really not that bad.

Worst professor I've had at this school. Was very disinterested and rude during office hours, and she showed little willingness to actually teach students. Exams were challenging, lectures were uninspiring, and the three group projects lacked proper guidance. Tenured, out of touch, and a poor representation of this institution.

Had her for analytics and liked her much better. My TAs were english as a second language which made learning much more difficult. Your group mates are hit or miss on their quality and who grades your project has a big impact on the grade. Schroeder is a nice lady, but boring, just envision your grandma teaching you stats.
Just don't
Bonnie hates her students
Boring lecturer that makes everything much harder than it should be.

Incredibly boring and bad lecturer.The subject matter really shouldn't be that hard, but Schroeder essentially forces you to learn everything on your own as attending lecture was basically useless. I also remember her scolding some people for leaving lecture early even though attending is not required. I don't blame them for leaving early.

Bonnie has an old-school style of teaching that to me was very hard to learn from. You learn more from recitation than any lecture. You are required to watch lecture videos before lecture, then attend lecture where she talks about the same things, and goes on and on and in general, is not nice to students. I would not recommend.
Worst professor at Fisher. Her lectures are all over the place, and I don't think she ever got through all the slides. Exam averages are constantly 70 or below. Needs to retire.

Arguably one of the best professors in Fisher. He can explain complex technical concepts in a fun way that makes his lectures worth going to. Pay attention in his class, not necessarily just for the grade but because the concepts are very important in the real world. His classes made my MIS degree completely worth it.

By far the absolute BEST professor at fisher! His lectures are super engaging and fun and are never boring, he's also a super caring professor with the coolest British accent and has a rich career with his experiences as CIO of Hertz and Wendy's which he often provides examples from. Highly recommend an absolute gem at fisher.

An amazing person. He has experience as a CIO, and you can learn a lot in his class. The midterm exam is open-note, and the grading for assignments is very friendly. He introduces art pieces at the beginning of the course, and he can play the piano! I just hope more people get to know him and choose him; he's worth it. Go to his office hours.

Lectures are useless, he gives minimal materials, and the entire class circles around one singular textbook that is unorganized and written entirely by him. Very nice and caring guy, but I cannot believe this course not only exists but is a business req. Tests are horribly made and make up well over 2/3rds of your grade. No one even shows up. Bad.

His class can be boring, but he seems like a genuine professor. I recommend understanding his book. The book is easy to understand. Memorize the cases and their results. He goes over the material in class. Because class was in the evening many students didn't show up (including myself).

He may know what he is talking about, but he is not able to explain it concisely or thoroughly at all. The course structure is set up to make you struggle. I studied so much, went to every lecture, and still got a 60 on the final. The wording is meant to trick you. Basically, do everything you can not to take this class if you want an A.

prof. blackburn is SO kind and cares so much about his students. i spoke to him after probably every single class, and he had so much advice to offer. HOWEVER... this class sucks lol. he really doesn't actually teach you anything during lecture, so you'd be fine just reading the textbook and studying that.

Clueless class. If I weren't a law nerd, it'd have been tough. The professor rambles about his daughter and nonsense. I only attended the midterm and finalâ€”finished both in under 10 minutes (20 & 30 questions). His book is free online. Thought I was on Punk'd after the first lecture.

His lectures are incredibly useless, don't bother showing up to class, all he does is ramble on about randomness. He makes the exams way harder than needed. If you have him and it's still possible I would drop and get a different professor if you care about your GPA at all. Not a bad guy, seems to care about his students but he is a bad professor.

Professor Blackburn's BUSFIN3500 class is a relatively easy one, with weekly writing assignments and open-note exams. While his lectures can be dry, the textbook is helpful. Unstuck study was a great study tool alongside the course materials.
Great professor and person who is very accomplished and qualified. Cares about his students.

He is a very nice guy, but he is very old and doesn't do a great job explaining the content. You basically have to read the entire book but it is probably the easiest textbook I've had to read. The class is based on only tests and a few quizzes so if you get a few questions wrong youre screwed. The test are hard too. Did curve the grade 5% though.

His class is literally impossible. He expects you to read the textbook consistently & listen attentively in lectures, because many times his lectures will contradict the text. Studying does virtually nothing because the exam questions are so open-ended, & there is never a clear answer. He added 5% to everyones grade because we all did so poorly.
All exam based questions are impossible and he doesn't know how to teach at all. He talks very slow and doesnt care about his students at all.
Exams are impossible. Had an A going into the final and finished with a B-.

Course was fine. Only graded by quizzes (which he gives answers for during class) and exams. You need to purchase one of his physical textbooks to succeed. I went to all the lectures but would have been perfectly fine if  I didn't. Course was fine, just boring.
Fairest class participation grading system I ever encountered
Don't bother going to lecture because you won't learn anything. Grade is based off a few exams and you get no material to study so good luck

Professor Blackburn was a really nice guy, and his lectures were cool but he does go off-topic sometimes. His quizzes and tests are directly pulled from the textbook, and they were all so easy, as long as you read the textbook. However, the final was a mess :( and was not representative of what we learned at all IMO.

This class was so stressful simply because his tests and quizzes were designed to trick you. Pay attention to every word in the question. Dont bother going to class, his lectures dont help because he always goes off track and rambles. Entire grade is made up of a few quizzes and two exams- no extra credit.
Lectures were monotonous and uncaptivating. Quiz questions were subjective. Hard to get good feedback or clarification. Entire grade determined quizzes and exams.

Pretty straightforward and easy class format. If you give an effort on the papers, you'll get 100%. Textbook is helpful for exams, but I didn't read it completely nor attend lecture/recordings. I've heard that he will restructure this class in the future because the grades are too high and this was used during COVID.

Short writing assignments every week that he gives 100% for if you give any effort. Strongly suggest reading the textbook and highlighting it because his in-person sessions are focused on discussion more than direct teaching. Open book exams were nice as well.

The class is super organized and easy to follow as long as you watch the videos and use them for reference. The exams are based on the material in the slides and he also hosts two review sessions during the midterm and final to tell you exactly what to study and how.
Maybe I'm just bad at logistics but it was like he was speaking a foreign language watching these lecture videos. Very tough exam, make sure to study.

The class was run incredibly well, the lectures were always pretty streamlined and the exam review sessions were incredibly helpful. Out of class assignments weren't too bad at all. The exams themselves are on the harder side, so definitely study a good amount for them. Would take another class with Professor Pritchard again for sure.

I am not fond of 1.5 hr classes. This class was all memorization and the exams (2) are worth 40% each. The exams consist of true/false questions with specific details from lectures. I struggled with this class and I'm glad it's over. The content was interesting however, I strongly disliked the exam layout. He also responds super late to emails.
Great professor, great course! Everything is organized on Carmen and exams aren't bad if you go to the review sessions and study what he tells you to.

Took this class online. Lectures were incredibly boring. Exams were pretty difficult and he asks very specific questions about material that he glosses over in lecture. Overall, not a hard class to get a B+ or A- in.
Just go to lecture and listen and you will be fine. There is extra credit available for both exams and he gives you a pretty good expectation about what you will be tested on.

This was my favorite class I have taken so far, and I have no interest in logistics. Dr. Pritchard is a really good professor, he is very clear and knowledgeable, and you can tell that he actually enjoys teaching. The homework's are very easy, and as long as you study and follow his exam study guide you will get an A.
One of the nicest professors at OSU. Truly cares about students. Go to class, especially exam review days.

Fantastic professor. Tries to teach his material in the clearest way possible without any unnecessary assignments or overlong lectures. He cares a lot about his students and is always accessible for questions and help. I don't think he could have structured or taught the class any better.

Dr. Pritchard was a great professor for 3380. His class was very straightforward and the exams were pretty easy if you showed up to class and studied the material he tells you to study! If I had to take this class again, I would definitely take it with him.
Great professor. He actually helps you understand the material and does an excellent job preparing your for exams. Awesome guy
I love this man so much, he actually taught everything in a highly sophisticated and engaging way i would take every class he teaches w no hesitation :)
Great professor

If I could take every class in the Logistics dept with Dr. Pritchard I would with zero hesitation. He is SO kind and genuinely cares about what he is teaching. 1 big group project (graded super leniently), 3 homework assignments (2/3 can be done with a partner), and 1 exam. He was super accessible outside of class and legit my favorite professor

Favorite professor of the semester. His class is super straightforward on what he expects and makes it really easy for us. I took it online so could go back to the lectures. Gives you a study guide for the exam which is really helpful when studying  would recommend him 200% for logistics.

Alan is a nice person, the cea and discussion posts give little to no instruction but as long as you put in effort on them you will get an A. Offers a few opportunities for extra credit which is nice. Pretty easy class.

Professor Pritchard is one of the best professors I have met at OSU. You can tell from his lecture that he truly loves logistics. I am not in his major, but his class makes me reconsider double major options. Class is mostly lecture based with several exams and homework.
The tests make you think a little bit but not that much. Do all the homework and projects and you'll get a good grade.
Clear grading criteria, very friendly and genuinely caring person, no surprises on exams, and a class that is relevant to today's world. Can't ask for much more! Would highly recommend Dr. Pritchard.

This class is inherently difficult because of the large amount of content and often times confusing legal terms. Professor Helmreich uses TV shows or movie clips to explain a lot of the concepts and also gives good examples to clarify confusing terms. She did a great job teaching the class but you need to study and read quite a bit to do well.
Best professor ever for this class I recommend you take her!!

Dr. Helmreich is a great professor. She makes the class interesting by using examples of law from famous movies which did the job of keeping me engaged. However, the hour 35 minute lectures were difficult to sit through. She does have videos to view if needed. She offers extra credit which helps due to the exams being very tricky.

I'm so glad I had Helmreich! The class is very fair in terms of grading and workload. Just of a couple of assignments out of the McGraw hill textbook per week, a midterm, and a final. The tests are very predictable , but you'll have to do a good bit of studying to do well. She's great at lecturing and plays lots of TV clips to explain things

Julia is one of the best professors at Fisher. Her lectures are entertaining and easy to follow and she provides a generous extra credit opportunity before the final exam. The exams are challenging but not difficult at all as long as you pay attention in lecture.

Julia is the best professor for business law (BUSFIN 3500)!! She makes her lectures really fun and engaging, which helped me learn more! There aren't many grades in the class, but she makes it easier to get a good grade on the exams by making you do a vocab review assignments before the midterm and final. Take her!!!

If you do well on the exams, it's a very easy A. Homework is a completion grade and attendance is mandatory but it helps your grade a ton. Go to lecture, almost all the exam is from class examples, reading the textbook isn't necessary except key terms. Julia is super friendly, couldn't recommend a better professor, super under-rated within fisher!
Extremely hard exam! 54 questions with 45 mins.....

Professor Helmreich is a great professor. She knows the subject matter extremely well and does a great job at connecting the ideas to real world scenarios that can help you outside of class. The weekly quizzes are easy and so is participation. The exams are very fair as long as you use the online lectures to study. One of my favorite classes!
Great professor! You have to know your stuff to do well on the exams, but everything is clear and the examples she uses are interesting.

Prof Helmreich has the perfect amount of work for a 1.5 credit class. I never felt overwhelmed with this class and it really only took maximum 2 hours/ week to pass with an A (1.5 hours of lecture about and 0.5 hours of just doing a quiz or survey). Plus, the lectures are prerecorded so you never have to go to a zoom session if you do not want to!!

This was a pretty tough class in general, but Professor Helmreich did a really good job of conveying difficult legal concepts so that things were less confusing. It is very important to read the textbook and take good notes. Quizzes are easy. Do not wait till last minute to do legal terms because they take forever but easy points.

I expected this class to be easy but it was actually a lot harder than Id hoped it would be. The midterm and the final were very difficult as they required you to be able to apply the different laws and rules we learned in class. Just know going in that you need to read the textbook and youll probably be ok, its not an easy class though

Overall, Julia Helmreich is a great professor. The class is not difficult at all and she explains the topics easily. Participation matters but you only need to participate like once or twice per class. The tests are scenario based, but not too difficult. She also gives extra credit opportunities. I would definitely recommend her.

Lectures twice a week, participation and attendance count for a good amount of the grade. She's very approachable and knowledgeable about the topic, and makes the 80 minute lectures very bearable. She also offers extra credit and there aren't a lot of assignments.
Highly recommend taking BUSFIN3500 with her. She is definitely someone to look up to! The class is not hard if you pay attention. She gave a lot of extra credit at the end.

Easily dryest lectures I've needed to go through for Fisher. Sits there with the Powerpoint's and instead of just teaching it has people answer in a lecture hall to give credit and everybody just reads right from her slides. 2 exams were 70+% and were all application based which made them super tough to study for. B law tough all profs though

If you're wondering who to take for Business Law, take her class! Graded off of participation (answer one or two questions each class), a few Carmen quizzes, and a midterm & final that were easy as long as you took decent notes. Prof Helmreich is kind, helpful, and wants to see you succeed unlike the other business law professors.

She is the ONLY Business Law professor at OSU worth considering - the others have terrible reputations and students rarely do well in their classes. Miss Helmreich, on the other hand, is a fantastic lecturer and sets students up for success. I truly enjoyed her class and learned a lot from her, and received an A without much trouble at all.
she was very friendly to our class and excited about the material, although pretty dry. didn't make it overly difficult. really enjoyed her as a professor

Dr. Inks is my favorite professor at Ohio State. I've never had a professor that cares so much about their students and is so knowledgeable. His classes go by super fast because he is very interesting and also just an all around great guy. I didn't the tests were that bad as long as you read the book. 10/10 professor and person.

I don't understand why people are giving him bad ratings, Larry is a great professor who cares about his students very much. The exams are fair (I got 100% on both Exam 1 and 2, they aren't as hard as you'd think), and he curves them if needed. Your grade is only basically consisted of the 3 exams tho. My only complaint is that he tends to ramble.

You can tell he really enjoys teaching and cares about his students. Lectures aren't required but go! Out of 320 points, 20 are the 4 writing assignments and 300 are the 3 exams. As long as you attend lectures, take notes, READ THE BOOK, and follow his study guide you will do good. A lot of test questions involve applying the concepts and terms.

Every week there is at least two long chapters in the TWO required textbooks and (for me) prerecorded lectures and zoom lectures. He rambles on about nonsense, but it doesn't matter because the exams aren't on the content he teaches anyways. His exams suck and they are the only grades except for three 5-point assignments. He is pretty funny tho
Professor Inks is a cool guy, but the class can be tough. Lots of reading and exams are the main grades. Unstuck study was helpful for studying key concepts.
Dude only grades 3 exams and they're hard for what

He is a very interesting guy with engaging lectures but sometimes he gets off track. The class is based on tests only so if you grind the concepts you should be alright, it is a lot of memorization. Personally thought the first test was the hardest.
He is a great person and his lectures are pretty interesting. However, the class is based on exams and they are super difficult even if you study hard.

Professor Inks is a great guy, cares about students way more than the average professor. The class concepts are fairly easy to grasp, but he prides himself on "not teaching for exams", so studying 7-8 chapters at once with little to go off of can be difficult. Read the textbook and attend online/in person lectures!

He is a really cool guy who is pretty fun in my opinion, but not the best teacher. The tests are pretty difficult and the entire grade is just 3 tests. This makes it pretty hard to get a good grade. He requires a lot of reading as well which sucks. Just grind for the tests and you should be good. No attendance for lectures either.
Great guy, tough class

Super down to earth cool guy. Sometimes professors feel like just that, but its nice when a professor can be personable and make you feel like more than just a student. Unfortunately the exams are hard and those are basically all you are graded on. He doesn't necessarily teach to the exam so you have to do a lot of reading in the textbook.

I have never sat through more boring lectures of my life. I'm trying so hard to listen to the lectures but Inks just never gets to the point, he spent such a LONG way of explaining terms and concepts that I'm lost by the time he finish. I rewatched all his lectures at least three times over for his extremely subjective exams and it's not enough.

Professor Inks is a good guy.  He had good lectures that were interesting most of the time and often tried to tie in some current events as well.  The only downfall was that the only assignments were three exams that were worth I believe close to 80% of the grade which seemed kinda high.  Study lots of definitions for the exam.

No matter how much you study this course it is extremely difficult to do even average on exams. He does not "teach for exams" yet exams are basically the only grade and the averages are in the 60% range. Very great professor for what he teaches but the class is not a learning environment where you can succeed which is unfortunate.

Covers only half the material in online lectures that are posted every week, and is very definition based. Only had 3 in person classes over the whole semester, 1-2 weeks before the exam which was proctored online. Average for the first exam was only a 67% and didn't improve much on the second one. Only take if you have great time management skills
Screw this guy. Studied my ass off for test and half of questions were subjective. A lot of which is least false like wtf kind of technique even is that. Dont take this clown

Professor Inks is a very good guy, was very engaging. But the exams...... one of the hardest classes I have taken at OSU. The exams are pretty much the only grade in this class (besides the writing assignments), so if you do bad on one or two, you're screwed! Study everything in this class and still struggled on the exams, very misleading.

Dr. Inks is the best professor I've had at Ohio State. Great lectures, even on Zoom, covering really important material for anyone in the business school. Exams are challenging but fair, especially as he provides considerable study materials to help you. Writing assignments may take a bit but the questions are worth thinking about.

I loved Dr. Inks. He creates a very welcoming environment even on Zoom and he obviously cares about his students a lot. Gives lots of great advice. But the exams are hard. He's very upfront about how he grades and what type of things will be on the exam. If you don't study for the exam, watch the lectures, or read the textbooks, you'll struggle.

He isn't a bad guy, but did not love his teaching style. The PowerPoint presentations did not always line up with the lectures, and he was impossible to reach outside of class. The exams were not awful if you were prepared but challenging. Overall, I would see if you could have another lecturer for this course.

You will waste a lot of time figuring out what horrible directions mean, and you have to spend $100+ on a textbook you will never use so you can take quizzes and watch his youtube videos (yes he puts quizzes and lecture vids behind a paywall).

Very bad directions on model building exercises, for how long this course has existed these should be organized, waste a lot of time figuring out bad directions. Also forces you to to buy a useless textbook (that I never used) so you can watch his youtube videos and take quizzes. (Yes he puts quizzes and lectures vids behind a paywall)

Class was disorganized and Terry came off as arrogant. I didn't find him helpful at all in lecture. Videos are the only thing that helped. Exams aren't hard content wise, but he'll frame questions on the test in a way that is completely foreign to example problems. Just make sure you use common sense. Do every easy assignment to cushion your grade.

Quite possibly the worst course I have ever taken at any level of my education. The homework had typos and errors ever week. Klinker did not submit grades on time and took several days after the hard deadline to post them, JUST TO GET THEM WRONG and email every student that he needs an EXTRA WEEK to fix them. We pay 35 thousand a year for this bs?

This class is an absolute disaster. Almost every model building exercise had errors in the instructions, completely forgot to post a quiz to the textbook publisher, and awful communication to students on due dates or guidelines. All the course content is reused yearly (Lecture videos from 2015), how is this class so disorganized? Waste of tuition.

This class is really just an applied algebra 2 class, but with how disorganized this course is it feels like everyone is rooting against you. Like 6-7 times a TA would announce a day before a hw was due that there were 3 errors in the instructions that we had to fix. The exams and group project really arent as hard as people say though.

Klinker is hands down the worst professor I have ever had. Every assignment he sent out had SO many typos. They make you buy a textbook that you only use to click youtube links that Klinker recorded himself. So, essentially, you're buying youtube links. Nothing was ever clear in this class, lectures were unhelpful, and the group project was a mess.

Klinker is a good guy and cares about his students, but it's hard to get anything out of his teaching style. The lectures are online videos with the powerpoints, however, they are unorganized on the modules and the powerpoints don't always match up. The class in person is not really helpful. Exams are difficult as it's hard to know what to study.

Klinker was good. He wasn't too accessible from email but the feedback I'd get from him in person was great. He's an old fashioned military guy, so some in the class didn't like his style. If you've ever had a tough boss at an internship, Klinker is that tough boss. Overall, he's smart and a good professor. He truly cares about your success too.

Klinker himself is a good guy and the class is pretty easy to follow if you attend lectures recitation. However, this class is the least oranized class I have taken. Due dates are always wrong on slides, incorrect directions on weekly assignments and quizzes with the wrong answers. Should not be this bad when he's taught this course for so long.

Klinker is the course coordinator for BusOBA2321 and the course is structured horribly. All MBE instructions were posted late and always had many typos and incorrect instructions so I ended up going to office hours solely to ask the TAs what the directions were actually supposed to say. Would not recommend if you aren't required to take.

Professor Klinker's teaching style takes some getting used to, but the structured format and helpful prerecorded videos make studying more manageable. unstuck ai complemented the course materials well for exam prep.
Rude, makes very distasteful jokes about women, disorganized

Although the class material is not hard, the teaching style makes it way harder. Lectures are extremely hard to follow, and the material skips from class to class. For a 1.5-credit-hour class, you will easily do more than that. Instructions on assignments are always wrong, and then points will be marked off, would not recommend.

Worst professor and class I have ever had. Spends half of the class berating his students. Makes mistakes on the instructions for virtually every assignment posted. Gives students no leniency but doesn't hold himself to the same standards. The actual content is easy to understand but he seems to enjoy making it intentionally more difficult.

Klinker is simply the worst. Wish I had more space but; Extremely rude, harsh grader, unorganized (mistakes on every assignment), 2 exams are 60% of your grade, Payed for a textbook just to watch youtube videos HE MADE, Feedback is vague and not helpful. Klinkler seems like a guy who has is out for his students. Would give a 0 if possible.

What an awful professor LOL. Vague grading criteria and no willingness to help. Not responsive at all. What a disgusting class. The group project had no clear criteria or assistance with difficulty, so prepare for sub 50% grades on that. No info on the exam yet as I have yet to take it, but wow. What a horrible course.

He's okay overall. his classes can be entertaining, but honestly, he's a little too full of himself. This isn't much of a problem, but dealing with a professor w this personality, means don't expect much leniency. also, its funny that he complained about us having to buy the book because we dont use it, but come to find out it's his book lol.

His grading criteria on the assignments is very vague and he takes points off for ridiculous things. The homework we're assigned barely pertains to what is going to be on the midterm and final, and doesn't help much at all. He's not approachable and doesn't seem to want to actually help his students.

Just a guy that wants you to learn. He's clearly been doing this for a while and knows how to get the most out of his students. Had him multiple times and would take more courses from him if I got the chance.
Wonderful professor! Very much recommend

Awesome professor. You will have to pay for the tophat textbook for this class but its a breeze. Just show up and participate and you're good. He even gives gift cards for to discussion posts on Packback.

Steve is a good guy class is pretty much taking notes as he reads them off the board. One big group project that you have to present to the class but overall not bad. Final exam a 50 question multiple choice. I would take this guy he's not bad at all compared to other professors i've had a fisher.

Took him for 4386, and I'm convinced that he is the best professor in Fisher! He is hilarious, and his lectures are filled with relevant material to today's business world. Professor DeNunzio actually gets you excited for a career in Logistics, and is more than happy to answer any questions pertaining to the logistics field.
I've taken 3 classes with DeNunzio - he's a great prof and is excited to teach. All his classes have a pretty similar structure, he grades fairly, and presents straightforward exams.

He is very clear about what he asks for on the exam, just follow his study guide and its an easy A. He has a sense of humor. Be ready for one or two group projects but he is not a tough grader, fair prof overall. Wished I could have taken more classes with him.
Hands down the best Logistic professor at OSU. Very understanding. Always make corny dad jokes in class. Exams are literally everything from study guides he gave.
He's a great teacher. Very knowledgable and super nice. Loved his class. Quite easy. He gives out a ton of bonus. You will need the book for the exams, but  not much else.
Great guy, knows a lot about what he's teaching. Class is pretty easy, if you read the textbook and pay attention it should be an easy A

Andrew himself is amazing! He cares so much about students and tries to learn everybody's names. The class itself is way harder than other business core like accounting. The chapters are very long and the exam questions are "abstract." He could explain the topics in more detail. Go to his office hours because he will spend time getting to know you.
His exams are so hard for no reason. He does too much and makes a basic introductory course hard because he probably gets off on it.

He himself is a caring teacher, that is it. His lecture is all over the place and does not relate to class material. Quizzes are fine, you will need to look at every single material. Test are very hard, if you do not watch his videos, then you are doomed because he WILL give questions from his lecture videos. Good teacher, bad teaching style.

He's a great guy and all, but he spends a lot of time talking about himself and goes into many irrelevant details. The concepts in the course are not that hard, but he makes his exams difficult for such an basic course.

Absolutely love this guy. Best professor I have had in my time at Fisher so far. Lectures are interactive and fun, and he genuinely cares about all of his students. It's not even a hard course I just don't enjoy marketing so I got a B. A+++ lecturer.

He is a very caring teacher who enjoys teaching to his students who even memorizes everyones name. There is plenty of opportunities for grades its not just exams. Exams were a bit difficult but not impossible. But Andrew is a very great teacher and has alot of people who come in to talk to his students.

Took the honors version of this and would recommend to other to get a smaller class size. Lots of reading but the exams are fair. Go to office hours and ask for help when you need it and you should be fine. Be prepared to participate in lectures and weekly class activities in small groups

The difficulty of this course is above the middle of all the business courses I have taken, Follow the requirements, read the textbooks, watch the recorded lectures! Quizs are not designed to be hard except The final exam, which in my view, is deliberately to make it hard for you. Content during the in person lectures will not appear in the exam.

This class is not friendly to a non-native. Too many vocabularies. You will have weekly closed-book quizzes with a proctor extension, and normally take you a full afternoon to get at least 80. Final exam's average was 73. No curve and no round up. Be ready to remember tons of vocabularies and definitions. But overall Andrew is a great prof.

Andrew is a very upbeat and energetic. He makes his lectures engaging. Get ready to meet your neighbors as you talk with them every day. Exams are a lil tricky, but he gives you a vocab list to study with for the midterm and final. Read the textbook for vocab and focus on the videos for the exams. Long live the Old Town Ps and Sweet 4 Ps. Just wait

I really enjoy his lectures and he trys to make such a big class into a smaller one so everyone at least feel somewhat connected to the professor and classmates. His exams are pretty hard but it is manageable if you put in the effort to study. Quizzes can be hard sometimes depending on the material, but overall a decent professor.

This class is the biggest waste of time you will ever have. Piletz talks about himself and his career for two hours straight, then gives you an unnecessarily hard exam that is very tedious and unrelated to any class content. His whole thing is proving marketing is hard and not just an easy business class, so he takes pride in his C averages.

Andrew Piletz is extremely passionate about teaching this course however the exams are pretty tough for 3250. You have to remember very specific details from the lecture videos and in-person lectures. Additionally, there is a lot of vocabulary to memorize. Take advantage of the extra credit and redoing the simulations.

One of the worst professors here at OSU, his exams consistently averaged C's. I'm not the smartest student ever, but I got A's in almost all business foundation classes. I think that clearly shows the unnecessary difficulty of this class. He also expresses his religion a lot which is fine, but it's weird that he pushes it on his students at times.

Piletz really cares about his students and makes the lectures entertaining but all of the actual learning is done through textbooks or videos.  The exams are fairly difficult but he provides extra credit opportunities.

First, his in person lecture is not helpful in terms of learning, just there to socialize with other people and bring bunch of very unhelpful fake situations. Second, he instill his belief heavily into his class and he would ask students who came to his office office what they want him to pray for which is uncomfortable for me. Very hard exams.

Professor Piletz is a genuinely really nice guy. He wants nothing more than to see his students succeed. I came to office hours in search of help on a subject, and we ended up talking about life and he helped me reduce my stress. He makes a 105 minute lecture enjoyable and really helps make a class that lacks exciting content, exciting. Great guy.

If you want to go to class to socialize for an 1:45 minutes take this class. Class was used to test our knowledge on the videos we had to watch outside of class. The exams were pretty hard even though the concepts seemed easy. He was a nice professor I just do not care about marketing and wish the class was a little easier bc its just a core class.

He is just unhelpful. His lectures were not helpful for the exam, and he deliberately is vague about the exams so the grades were low. It's just more work with the weekly readings and video lectures than any other class, especially for a core class. When I went to his office hours he prayed over me before I left, which made me super uncomfortable.

He is a very nice guy and the lectures are very engaging but I hated them. Somehow he knows everyones name and makes us talk to our neighbor for 2 hours straight. He makes good lectures but still makes you read the textbook which is annoying. Still one of the best professors you can get here. Class is relatively easy for Fisher.

Dr. Lee is a enthusiastic professor who cares about his students. Unfortunately, the praise ends there. The assignments are arbitrary. The class itself has no meaningful content. For an MBA course, I expected to be challenged and discuss complex topics, however the content was so meaningless, there was no intellectual discussions to be generated.

The expectations far exceed a 1.5CR course - there are several papers (ranging from 2-8 pages) plus a major research project and presentation. The feedback on assignments is very general and not at all helpful for improvement and understanding. The syllabus was not clear and asking questions didn't produce useful answers.

This class was a 1.5 credit hour class however the work load was much more than expected out of a 1.5. The feedback on the grading was very general instead of giving direct feedback on the papers so the students would have an opportunity to learn to improve their grade. 
Nice professor though!

The expectations of this course far exceeds the 1.5CR hours.  The syllabus isn't detailed on the required assignments (2 minor papers, 2 major papers, and a recorded 15-20 minute presentation).  There were also required meetings outside of class with a randomly assigned group to discuss final project topics and progress.

"We do NOT expect you all to finish this exam in the time allotted. This may seem odd, but we are doing this to create a grade distribution. DO NOT PANIC! This is by design. Do your best." Literal comment from the mid term, the curve was at 70/100. Does not want students to succeed. Gives arbitrary feedback on assignments. Worst Fisher prof.

Lots of problems with the MBEs. Every other week there was an issue which was great because that meant something is getting curved or extended. I'll choose him over Klinker any day. He truly cares about his work and makes the content understandable too. if you attend all lectures and recs, you can drop an MBE and Quiz. memorize how to do things.

Professor is very rude and unprofessional. Makes fun of students and rambles. Will not respond to emails and grades based on how he feels about you and he will not give you an explanation or bully you about it. Also rounds down. Best luck is to kiss up or be "different" or he'll just throw a low grade at you for doing exactly what he asked for.
Going to be honest, he's pretty mean. He's a quirky and funny guy but I didn't really enjoy his teaching style. There are better professors out there.
G

Greco is the quirkiest and weirdest professor I've ever had. If you want to be entertained and made fun of while looking at spreadsheets and charts, he is your guy. First semester of immersion he rounded everyone down and he just gives people the grades he feels like instead of what is deserved. Nobody got an A at all!
It was very, very unfair, you didn't learn anything in his class, but he gave you a very low grade every time, and he gave you a grade based on his mood. Don't take his class!

Awful teacher, you will learn nothing and be graded based on how he feels about you. He has no rubrics and is not helpful at all. Do not waste your time with this class if you don't have to take it as you will learn nothing. and not get the grade you earned or deserve. Learned more from one youtube video than I did his entire class.
Gives little to no feedback on assignments, and you learn pretty much nothing in the industry immersion analytics program. Complete waste of time and would not recommend to anyone.
mean. just very rude and mean.
Avoid if you're taking him for the BA Industry Immersion. Take something else, as you don't learn anything and he just rambles about nonsense for the entire semester.

I took the BA IIP and I don't understand how Greco is a professor when he teaches absolutely nothing, just tells you to take an online course to learn tableau, and then gives you poorly constructed projects that he grades with no rubric. He talks about random things during class and I always leave wondering why I did this program.

I took his class with the industry immersion program, and I regret it. He would promise you many good things at the start and you feel like you are going to learn a lot, then he would never even follow his syllabus. When you ask him about the more advanced topics he will just tell you to look it up by yourself. Avoid him and take some CSE instead.

Incredibly disorganized professor who graded on a seemingly random scale, as others have mentioned. No rubrics, minimal feedback- just gives you a grade. There's no avoiding him for DA majors in the Business specialization, so you just have to get through it. You will learn almost nothing, yet he expects some crazy scale he never tells you.

He is the worst professor in the OSU. His grading system was nonsence and the feedback was useless. I had no idea to figure out how to improve my work, even though I did what exactly he required. Do not take this class!!!

Online videos explained nuts+bolts of data visualization. Feedback on HW's was unbearably scarce and vague. Difficult to figure out why points were taken off. Final project was a portfolio for students to improve HW's. Without useful feedback on HW's, how to improve was guess work. He seemed to have made unfavorable last-minute grade adjustments
He is soooo suck! Avoid him at any cost please! Only talk sh*T at class and teach nothing at all!
Would release rubrics for projects the day before they were due and would expect them to be flawless.

I thought he was better the 2nd semester than the 1st. He will give you whatever grade he feels like though so the best approach is just to relax and try to enjoy your project. He never even graded the final project, but the project I worked on was actually pretty interesting. If you work hard on it he will probably notice and give you an A.

Greco is the worst professor/teacher I've ever had. I learned absolutely nothing. Grading is unpredictable. Shows up at least 20 mins late if you try to meet him outside of class and gives unhelpful feedback. He also only ever called on one of the 6 girls in my class and implied we didn't know what we were talking about because we are girls.

Boyer is the man. I had him for service ops and sustainable projects.  Projects is three hours long and it is the only class I'm excited to attend every week.  If you're an ops major take this professor.  (service ops and sustainable projects)
The lecture is not helpful, learning materials are useless, but exams are difficult. we don't know what he is teaching in class. He always makes mistakes, and he is even confused on solving problems.

Boyer is a terrible cannot figure out the example problems clearly Leanred nothing from him. I advice you to not take him, makes class very boring is not helpful. Spends more time saying  hes not going to go over things than he actually does teach. Worst professor I have ever encountered and would avoid him at all cost. VERY RUDE.

Ken Boyer is the ONLY BUSMGT 630 teacher that will properly prepare you for the tests.  He gives a few relatively easy quizzes and drops the lowest one.  The cases aren't that hard as long as you put in the work.  And he does a lot of in class practice to help you prepare for the mid term and final.  Much better than the other 630 profs.

Boyer is a good prof, you can tell he has a deep knowledge about the material and can usually communicate it clearly.  He likes to joke around with students and uses a lot of real life examples, which made an 8:30am class bareable! Read the book and pay special attention to the powerpoints.

Had decent expectations for this class that were dashed by some of the most deficient teaching skills that I've ever encountered. This class was a snoozefest of epic proportions. I really was looking forward to a fertile learning environment, instead I was trying to stay awake. Decent guy, but teaching skills that need to be taken to the woodshed.

Professor W. is decent, but I wish he provided more resources, such as lecture notes, a detailed study guide, and additional practice exams. So far (before Midterm 1), this class hasn't taught me anythingâ€”I don't need student loans, and I already understand how credit cards work. Studying their history doesn't seem particularly useful to me.

Professor seems like a great guy but he really cannot teach. I understand this is generally taken by upperclassmen and they assume that we can teach ourselves but little more structure will help. He seemed to go around in circles and didn't really solidify any concepts. I had to study hard for exams with plenty of notes taken during lectures.

This class is foundations of finance- professor needs to assume that students have never studied finance ever before and provide any sort of baseline information for his content. Both in person lectures and video lectures do not cover content in exams.

Made it to my last semester of college and this will be my first C, if that means anything to you. Lectures are just so boring and exams are somehow difficult. I well on the midterm and the final dropped my grade over 10% when I studied significantly more for it. So much material and I think its just based on luck of if you study the right things.

Professor Weiner was okay. His lectures didn't cover anything, so get ready to read the slides and chapters outside of class to get the whole picture. Go to class and take the WSJ quizzes, all easy 100%'s to boost your grade.

Content isn't difficult but exams are impossible. To do well on exams take really good notes, most questions are over random things he says within the lecture. Exam questions are rarely supported by slides or past quizzes and are sometimes irrelevant to mastery of the subject. He seems like a nice and really smart guy but is an awful professor.

The content in the lecture slides does not align with the exam content. He does not teach any math during the lectures, then puts equations on the exams expecting you to know how to solve them. Never posts assignments on time.

For his exams, you should know:
- The PowerPoints
- All the stuff he randomly says in the lectures which aren't posted anywhere
- The book which includes info not in the PowerPoints
- The lecture videos he uploads on Carmen

No matter how much you study he'll find a random sentence you glossed over to test you on. Worst professor I've ever had.

Lectures do not go into depth on meaning of vocab words or how to use equations you need to know for exams. Exams were difficult even though questions were supposed to come from previous quizzes and items we were told to "Write down". read your textbook as much as possible if you want to do decent.

Test only cover 6-7 questions from quizzes given every week. When lecturing he does not go into depth on subject matters, what they are used for, and what they correspond with. He is a great guy but could go into depth better.

He is an overall good professor, in his lectures you use a slide show made from the book but does not go into depth of how items work or what they go with. He states that most multiple choice questions from the quizes go straight onto the test but only 5-6 questions actually do.

Professor Weiner means well but is not a good teacher. His exams reflect obscure concepts that get talked about briefly in class during a random lecture throughout the unit. Studying for exams is difficult as little guidance is provided regarding its content. Exams are written poorly and averages are always low. Does not set students up for success

was not good at lecturing at all would talk about random stuff in class and expected us to know what he was saying. his exams are so unfair and cover none of the content he has in lecture so if you can avoid him then do it. not worth it. would rather drop my business minor than take this class.

He is a super nice guy but his class is super unorganized and he is not good at teaching the material. He will talk about random stuff most of class instead of teaching, exams are mostly made up of the random stuff he mentioned once for five seconds so no one does good, doesn't offer an extra credit/curve, and exams make up most of grade. AVOID!

Ronnie is a nice, but his exams are not reflecting of class at all. Material itself is easy, you can prepare a week ahead for exams and still fail, which is the average anyways. All study materials are nothing like the exams and I think that's why people do poorly. Material is not bad, but exams are unfair and the downfall of the class.

Professor Weiner is a nice guy who means well. He lectures from the textbook-provided PowerPoint and is very dry. He tries to make his classes enjoyable but mostly falls flat. His quizzes and exams make up most of the grade and are very easy. He usually has a semester-long group project, which can be quite draining and overly complicated.

Professor Weiner is a nice guy, but a horrible professor. His class is super disorganized. He took feedback halfway through the semester and thought adding two presentations during class was what students wanted. Syllabus did not match class and schedule was constantly changing. Written parts of exams graded harshly. Nice guy, but unprofessional.
This lectureâ€¦I can't.

One of the best professors in Fisher. Made the class very interesting and applicable to all majors. Just do what she tells you to do to prepare for her exams, and you will get at least a B on the exams. Highly recommend and have fun with her, she really tries to make the classroom a fun place to learn.

This is for Maneesh Ajjuguttu. When I signed up for this class I signed up for Newsome, came in the first day and didn't have her. I attribute 80% of my failures to lecture, I learned nothing, it was hard to read his writing and to understand most of what he was talking about. Just fell too far behind to climb out of the hole later in the semester.

Honestly, so many of the Fisher core classes are way too packed to provide a good learning environment but she tries her best to do so. I wished she could just focus on more important concepts instead because a lot of the challenging calculations and concepts are at the end of her slides and she runs out of time a lot.

Avoid, completely wastes your time in lecture going over the least demanding concepts and then will run out of time for the more intensive problems and concepts. Gives out a lot of busy work. You would be better off to not show up to class and just read the textbook on your own. Exam questions are worded to trip you up to keep a low class average.

This class wasn't terrible. Some of the material is out of date (warehouse productivity video from the early 90's) so it can be hard to convert that information into today's world. The 3 exams are not awful, you're allowed a cheat sheet with formulas/notes on exams. If you go to class and listen you will understand the material enough to pass.

Lots of algebra and math with the different processes in Newsom's class. Sometimes could get confusing but overall it was understandable. In-person lecture quizzes and 3 exams during the year. 1 exam was insanely difficult and other 2 not bad. You are allowed a page, front and back, for a cheat sheet on the exams. I recommend taking her for Ops.

There were weekly readings and assignments to do. Lecture material usually did not match up with recitation topics and both would be on exams. Exams were somewhat difficult and there was a lot of material to study.

Lectures were kinda all over the place. Not too much work for this class though, only homework due every week and 3 exams. The exams were tricky and heavily math-based but she gives you a cheat sheet to use. Go to her office hours if you are confused, she is a very nice person but not the best lecturer.

Best choice for Ops! You can tell she loves what she does and she communicates her lecture material easily. Recitations help a lot as well so definitely go to them. Exams are fair and you get a front and back cheat sheet which is nice. Some homework, but not bad at all. Would definitely recommend Newsom any day, really a great professor!

Personally did not enjoy Newsom's class- typical Fisher GE. Content is 99% common sense, very disconnected from the real world, and the exams carry a ton of weight. Allowed 1 page formula sheet for exams which is great, but doesn't make up for the lecture we watched a 45min video from the early 90's about "process improvement".
Love her! Her class is tough, but if you visit her in office hours, she's very helpful. Best ops professor :)

This class gives you plenty of opportunities to make the grade you want. She drops 7 of the homeworks and the content is relatively easy. Her lectures are actually pretty interesting and shes very well versed on the topic. Exams are also pretty easy so you can easily focus on learning.
I would definitely recommend going to lecture and recitation. Not going to them will hurt your grade. The class is not hard though. I think she's a great professor to take it with.

Newsom is a great professor for Operations Management. She keeps the lectures interesting, and recitations as well. She allows a page of notes for each exam, which I really appreciated. The class wasn't bad at all. I recommend her greatly.

Can be sort of "Mommy-Like" teacher at times, but other than that she is a very good professor. Final was kind of tough, but the Midterm and rest of the class aren't bad, so I had a 99.5 before the Final. I'd recommend not missing that many lectures, because the problems don't have solutions on Carmen.

30 percent of the grade is attendance. 30 PERCENT. In addition, Of the three hw types, one you get five shots at and the other is rounded up to 100 if you break 70 so 45% of points are free. Get a B+ on the exams you get an A, not A-, an A. INSANE

a GREAT professor to take into to ops with! Lectures and recitations are clear and you get points just for attending class. Midterm is very straightforward, final is a bit more challenging but she offers a ton of help and makes herself very accessible should you need her. Makes a potentially boring/hard class fun and very do-able.

Professor Newsom was one of the best professors I've had in Fisher. She is very knowledgeable and her lectures were very interesting. You have to attend class for lecture attendance points and in-class group work. If you take need to take intro to operations, try and take the class with Newsom!

Newsom is one of the nicest professors I have ever had! This is also the easiest class I have ever taken. You have to come to class to get your points but once you get to a certain point you no longer have to come. She gives great feedback and really cares about her students! I would highly recommend her!!

Susan's online lectures are hit or miss, but the textbook and recitation sessions are essential. Lean on study resources like unstuck AI to supplement the course material. Exams are tough, so stay on top of the work. Overall, a challenging but manageable class.

Terrible professor. The online textbook is horrible. Tests are auto-generated by MindTap. No in-person lectures. Instead, old COVID-19 era videos where the audio only comes out of one headphone. She outsources all the work she could possibly do as an educator. Why become a professor at this point, Susan?

Susan knows the content and is probably helpful if you need her, but her lecture videos are kinda useless. If you have good recitation people who give out study guides and can explain the content well, then you're set. Not much you can do to control that, though.
You'll be better off ignoring all the lecture videos and reading the textbook. The TA's were the only reason I was able to get by. She's retiring so maybe a blessing in disguise
Susan is an absolutely terrible lecturer and the tests are a lot harder than the recitation problems. Overall this class is very tricky and I would avoid her if you could.

No in-person lectures and the video lectures she posted did not help at all. Basically had to teach yourself the material, which is unfair for a core class. Highest exam grade from the two times I took this class was a 70%. Unfairly drops some HW and attendance which hurts most people. AVOID HER IF YOU CAN.
Fully online lectures and in-person recitations. The online lectures are totally a mess, I couldn't learn anything from her videos. Textbook and recitations are much helpful.

Online lectures are useless. Reading the textbook and going to recitation will save you. Only graded by attendance, weekly quizzes and exams. Even if you get 100% on all of the quizzes and attendance, you can still only get 2 questions wrong per exam (4 exams) to get an A.
I really enjoyed this course. Prof Clark did a great job explaining concepts in the videos and I was prepared for exams from the recitation problems and textbook problems.

Never met Susan because her lectures are online. Lots of homework. Recommend reading textbook over her lecture videos if you are going to choose one. Recitation TA's made everything much easier to understand, and the TA's in the tutor room help just as much. Definitely read the textbook and utilize the resources you are given.

Susan teaches everyone intro to finance the way Ty teaches everyone business presentations... though lecture videos. Overall her lectures are so confusing the first time you watch them SO GO TO EVERY RECITATION!!! I would rewatch her videos to study and I found that helpful. Overall she is okay just make sure you don't fall behind!

professor clark is a very nice teacher and definitely cares a lot about her students. the class can be difficult as it covers a lot in a short time, but with practice you can easily understand the math and concepts. the tests are fair and a good portion of the grade is determined by homework.

Never met Susan and her online lectures were unhelpful. TAs are the only saving grace, but even they were limited in that they only went over practice problems. Content was essentially self-taught and there were no grade curves. Some exam questions were extremely picky details from the textbook not highlighted in lecture/recitation.

class is horrible. online lectures and only recitations for actual learning. will mostly be learning on your own. exams can be difficult too. Susan Clark is a nice lady though who will help you but the class does suck

Horribly run class, especially for a core business course like this. Susan basically does nothing, the only time I saw her the whole semester was through a computer screen on her awful lecture videos that look they were recorded circa 2007. The whole course is taught through your TA, who also presented the material horribly.

Susan doesn't really do anything. Her lecture videos are short and barely gloss over how to do problems. She does not give averages on Carmen for exams which is suspicious in itself. The course is basically run by her TAs.
Her lectures are very poorly structured and require a lot of textbook reading. The class is also weighted 70% on 4 exams and the only other grades are homework.

Absolute joke of a class. Didn't see Susan once throughout the entire semester because of her only using pre-recorded lectures as course material. I met more times per week for a 1 credit hour elective class than I did for this 3 credit hour mandatory business class. Hopefully you have good TA's because they are the only people you will see.
Useless lectures that she just reads off the slides. Hopefully your TA can help because she won't.
Horribly lazy lecture videos. Entirely self taught with zero help except from TA's. She does not care about you or your grade.
Such a good teacher he is so inspirational
He gave us all suckers cause we were all good students
Really fun teacher Always gave help to the people in help flexible learning programs

He was very adaptable and flexible toward situations like if we have family members that we need to talk about and we have no time to do the homework he will give us extra time. And I always know what is a good for people.
He was one of my fav teachers and he taught us well

Honestly I like it when he would help me with my homework and me and him new each other from him being a good coach to me during high school football season and we all loved him by far 1 of the best teachers.
Very good professor and he's kind great integrity and he has great communication skills I would love to take his class again

Charles Buchanan shows outstanding grit and exceptional levels of heroism (my hero). Lots (and I do mean A LOT) of out of class extra credit, take advantage and this class will be a breeze and amazing. Brings great amount of energy during and after class. You will have an awesome time with Charles Buchanan. Go Buckeyes!!!
Really good teacher has really great integrity
Really great professor especially in the good way
This teacher has good communication skills and is really good, helpful, and inspiring to say the least
This teacher is very fun really easy teacher he cares about your well-being
Charles Buchanan is one of the best teachers he always gave us extra credit and he respected all of us he's funny and overall a really great teacher.
Really great professor. Really fun. Really smart. Really good person to be taught by. He might be a little rough on you sometimes, but he's a really good person. Just give him a chance
He was my favorite professor and he was very funny and I would love to take this class again.
Great class easy on work and I had very fun in this class if you do take this class have fun.

This class was taken as a summer course for the SMBA program and I really liked his teaching style. Really low stress class and if you do the assignments, you'll be fine. I don't have anything bad to say.

Leadership Class.
Charles did NOT respond to multiple emails or Canvas messages and posted grades 3-4 weeks after assignments were submitted. Given that the course was only 6 weeks long, this left little room to implement any feedback.

A majority of the class was spent reading HBR articles and writing papers. Why would anyone pay for that?

Leadership and Character has been one of my favorite classes at OSU. Charles is a great guy, you can tell that he is passionate about what he is teaching and he wants to see his students succeed. Work load is totally manageable and he gives like 2 weeks for the final (open note extended response) and essay. I definitely recommend this class!

Took his class in leadership (course code not available here). 
I would never take another class from him. He was unresponsive to emails and graded things about 3-4 weeks after they were submitted. Our course was only 7 weeks long, which left no room for improvement after receiving said grades.

Sean did a great job in a complex and mathâ€“heavy elective to make it easy to understand and be successful. Sometimes classes like this are a challenge as the professor flies through the material leaving you confused, but the complex equations were walked through, explained and he made sure we understood the process and purpose of the work.
Sean is a great instructor, cares about his students, assigns challenging yet reasonable work and is very prepared for class.  I am glad I have had this experience.
This Professor is a hidden gem. If you don't take care of him at Fisher I will be very disappointed.
Don't hesitate!! just take his class!!!!
Dr. Wan is the kindest professor that I've had in Fisher. You can tell he really cares about his students and wants them to learn the material. Would definitely recommend for any class!
Dr. Wan was very helpful, it feels like he want everyone do well in his class!

Sean is one of the better professors at Fisher who enjoys helping students understand the material and his class was easy as long as you paid attention. You are only graded on four items, so be sure to take it serious and let him know if you do end up falling behind. I wish he would implement a participation grade, but overall I can't complain!
Best Professor in Fisher!! Love him!!!

LOVES kahoot. such a chill guy. He explains the material clearly. Had a few laughs in his class. Fun fact: He loves Chipotle. I would say to understand the material conceptually because on the exams, there were a few definition questions, but you have to know what you are doing for the others. Loved the TAs. Not hard just practice.

This teacher is by far the most compassionate business teacher I've taken! He works very hard to make himself available for office hours and at your convenience if necessary to help you succeed. He is super easy to talk to and work with and will gladly fix any grade miscalculations for you. Allows full front-back cheat sheet for exams too.

Especially for a first-year senior lecturer, he seems very well versed with the content. Occasionally misspeaks in the lectures but will either correct himself or will have it be addressed in the recitiation. 1 page of notes for exams, just pay attention and you should be fine.

Very kind professor! Each class is explained in a very logical manner and questions asked by students are answered in detail to ensure understanding. The exams are a bit difficult, but with careful listening and reviewing the PowerPoint, you can master the knowledge to a great extentï¼

My favorite class/professor so far in college. Really engaging, loves the material he's teaching, and makes it relatable to students. If you do the work, you are in a great spot to succeed. Sneaky good sense of humor in lectures as well if you pay attention.

I would willingly take his class again if I could. It is very clear that he enjoys teaching and cares about his students. He gives lots of extra credit opportunities. If you complete & study the textbook assignments and study his lectures (go to class and take notes!), you will get an A on both tests.

I took 3500 and 4510 with Professor Smith and loved them. His passion and commitment made challenging material engaging. Unlike other classes, success required full attention, which inspired me. I value the practical knowledge gained and believe Professor Smith embodies what great teaching should be.

This class is difficult only because it is so much information crammed into half a semester. Ivan is a great guy who cares a lot about the topic. He offered SO much extra credit, it was just time consuming stuff and I was just too lazy to do any of it. He even offered us extra credit if we attended a basketball game!

Nice dude, kind of awkward at times but very genuine. There were only two exams and one quiz that was 85%, attendance and homework was 10% of the grade. I thought the exams weren't too hard and it was fine as long as you paid attention to the lectures. I looked forward to going to this class and would take it again :)

I never rate professors. I literally made this account so i could rate this guy because I gotta give him his flowers. Such a good guy, cares about the material and his students. His lectures are engaging. He's a family man and just a down to earth person. the tests are hard and I didn't get the best grade but goddamn I enjoyed each lecture.

Professor Smith does not help students understand the material and gives no assistance for preparing for tests. The class is based off of two tests and meaningless homework that only is 5% of the grade total. The two tests make up 85% of the grade. If you are looking for a professor to help you prepare for the tests and the material, its not him.
Professor Smith's class was very tedious. I never felt like I learned walking out of there. The exams were very difficult. I wish there was more opportunity for extra credit.
Shepfer's class is a hit-or-miss - you either get a great TA or a not-so-great one. The material and grading can be quite challenging, but Unstuck ai has helpful study tools to prepare.

Although the content of this class isn't too difficult, the group presentations are strictly graded. Ty makes this class pretty fun and enjoyable. The honors version is better as the students are more motivated and easier to work with. The course content was not super interesting; most of it was common sense and the two exams are pretty specific.

I recommend taking this Honors so you have Ty. He grades harder than if you were to take it non honors, but he does make the class fun and is a good guy. The exams are silly though as he asks you very specific and meaningless questions from the textbooks and videos. Has this weird crush on shell oil. I wish someone loved me like ty loves shell oil
Great teacher interesting class style I took honors because the students cared more so group projects were much easier.

I took him for BUSMHR 2292 but I never saw him. It was run by TA, the class itself is super easy to do. A lot of working with groups but pretty enjoyable. However the exams are super specific and are pretty difficult to study for and to do well on.

This class is mainly presentations and group work. Easy to get a B, hard to get an A. Exams focus on very specific points of material over the course of the term and make it almost impossible to study. The class is ran by the TAs. Never saw Ty.

This class is overall easy, and you never even see Ty. He makes his TA's grade very strictly and he also does not believe in perfect grades. This class is a very easy B, but hard A. The group projects are worth most of your grade as well as the mid-term and final. As long as you read the textbook he wrote and watch the videos you will do fine

Group project heavy definitely need a good group. Exams focus on details about the examples and specific phrases in the text. Look out for anything he says a lot or says from the readings. Never met the guy but my TAs were cool.

The class itself was interesting to me, but the exams are ridiculous and will focus on the smallest of details. The TA's do everything and attendance is mandatory for the recitations. The lectures are all online and you have to buy a textbook that Ty wrote.
Absolute joke of class. Exams don't cover course material rather very specific examples that you don't actually need to know outside of the course.

The only time I saw Ty so far at OSU was him getting coffee at Rohr, otherwise you'll never see him in person. The TA will be the only one that is running the class and the group you are assigned to will be really important for the biggest assignments. HIs exams like everyone said asks way too small details.

You probably won't meet Ty in 2292. The course material itself is not hard. The main assignments are the group presentations and 2 exams. For the groups pray you get put in good group because if you don't you're screwed (you are graded as a group not an individual). Tests require you to memorize tiny details which aren't useful outside this class.

Never really understood classes where the biggest chunk of the grade is determined by the competency of an 8-person group rather than yourself. Dude makes it unnecessarily difficult to know which assignments are due when, tests have the most obscure questions on them, and the whole layout of the class is just pointless.

Dude makes you pay $60 for his shoddily written "textbook" used to answer 3 questions on Tophat. Lectures and book are full of mistakes and typos and overall represent his lack of effort in this course. Most sections never even meet the guy. Probably the most overpaid staff member at OSU

Ty is very organized and explains exactly what he wants out of you to do well in his courses. He cares a lot about the personal development of his students and is genuinely interested in the material. He can be a bit of a tough grader, but more by just having higher expectations than most professors. If you put in the work you will do well.

This quite possibly is the most useless course created by mankind. You have to buy a TOPHAT textbook just to answer 3 multiple choice questions a week for homework. To ace the exams all you have to do is memorize every single niche bit of information in the textbook, lecture slides, videos, and record every second of your TA's breath. Get real Ty.

Lectures consist of old videos he did during covid. Exams are tricky and target very very specific questions like a question from a paragraph you read in week 2. The only thing you can gain from this class is the desire to drive without wearing your seatbelt just to see if you can die before you make it to his class. Most useless class at Fisher

Every concept you learn is pretty much common sense, but on the exams, he tries to trick you. I get he wants to make the exams difficult, but doing so by asking the most niche and specific questions is just cruel. The score I got did not reflect my knowledge in the class. ex: "what CEOs did we talk about in week 2?" Like okay.

This class is horrible. The whole class is just given to your TA so if you don't have a good one you are in for a long semester. The lecture videos that Ty uses are all multiple years old and the exams are based on the lecture videos despite the fact we never talk about the videos in class.

Good luck if you even get to meet the guy. He pawns off his classes to be taught by graduate students and reuses lecture videos from Covid. Honestly feels like dude somehow conned OSU into letting him teach for an easy bag. Worst class in fisher you will take. Beyond the professor the material is actually useless brainrot information.
Sherry's course is easy to understand and she pay much patient for student. You can ask question and go to her office hour, she also reply email quickly. I learned a lot in her class!!
She is definitely my favorite professor so far. She is really nice and kind, not a hard grader, and as long as you attend lectures and do your homework, there is a great chance that you can get an A.

Sherry is one of my fav professors at Fisher. She is very knowledgeable. Her class content is straightforward, easy to follow, and quite clear to me personally. She is also always willing to answer students' questions and always gives clear answers. I highly recommend taking her class, my fav marketing class so far.

Sherry is amazing so understanding and kind. She truly wants her students to succeed. There is a lot of group work involved and statistics, but if you put in the time it is doable. Overall a decent class and an amazing professor. TAKE 4202 WITH SHERRY
He is so monotone and unbearable class. Just skip class and study the slide.

She is a very nice and sweet person, but she is difficult to understand. Her classes were unorganized. There was sometimes 10-20 minutes of awkward silence during class. More importantly, I learned almost nothing from the class. The skills required for the assignments were not taught in class, so it's a self-learning class.
