one of the most horrible teachers i have ever had.  She does not teach, but rather lecture from the notes.  Her average on the tests are in the high d low c range, and she grades on a scale, so 15% get a's 20% b's and so on, so you can earn an a and get a b because of her stupid ass curve.
Unclear

She talks really fast at times, but she's always willing to go over something again if you don't understand.  Allows a formula sheet for all quizzes and exams.  If you go to office hours, have questions ready or she won't really help you.  Go to class and pay attention, cant do worse than a B-.
Fairly hard class, but the teacher makes the material as interesting as possible and the class as best as it can be.  Fairly good teacher for a bad class.

I don't really like her. She is smart, but doesn't know how to explain anything. Even when I went in for help, she didn't seem too willing to do so. Don't take any class with her if you can help it. You'll be sorry if you do.
Hard class, but she was definitely willing to help and was very easy-going.

Stay awake in class!!! The sample test questions are just that--do them and youll be golden (write them on your formula sheet). The material can seem boring and long, but really isnt all that difficult. I got an A and understood a lot by the end of the quarter.

those who complain about her never asked for help. all you have to do is approach her during office hours and she'll be more than willing to clarify any questions you may have. those who disagree don't get off their lazy ass and probably failed due to their own shortcomings, not hers.

Wonderful teacher, it's the course content that makes her class hard.  She speaks articulately and really knows the material well.  Always willing to help!  I'd suggest sitting in the front row... she's very personable.

She was one of the best teachers I've had at OSU. She knew exactly what she was teaching and was always willing to help. As long as you're willing to put in the work, she is willing to help. The material and class is boring, not her.
She is a horrible teacher.  Doesnt explain things very well.  BORING
Class is a joke.  Just study the review questions and the questions in the book and you should get at least a B on the tests, they are the exact same questions.
This course is so god damn boring,it has no point..and her teaching was not good at all.
definately not her area of expertise, and sometimes we spend days on just one page of notes, but the tests are pretty easy, dont worry guys 331 ain't as bad as 330.
Although tests are rough, go to her office hours. She gives lots of help.  Do the practice problems she provides, they are similar (if not the same) as some of the test problems.
Great teacher, always took her time to go over notes. Pretty hard tests, but gave extra credit opportunities. Always willing to help outside class.
Great teacher.  She explains the subject very well and does not rush through the material.  She takes her time during notes and uses a lot of examples to make sure everyone understands the material.
The class was extremely hard, but she wanted us to do well. She was always willing to meet for extra help and gives extra credit assignments.

The class was tough, but she was always willing to meet with you after class if you needed help.  She gave some extra credit opportunities as well.  She was clear in her explanations and knew what was was doing.
Worst teacher I ever had. If you get her, drop the class. Doesn't even have her PhD.
Not clear at all...tests are really really hard
Bonnie is the worst teacher I have ever had.  Hard tests.  No help.  She knows how to read off other's notes.  That's all she does.

Although this class is heavily focus on Tableau, he did not teach much and expect us to figure out, planning is messy and never have carmen updated in a timely manner, if you plan to learn more on the technical side dont take this class for iip. I've never left a review before, but my experience with Prof Greco has warranted one. I couldn't avoid taking a class with him, but those with the option should avoid him at all costs. "We do NOT expect you all to finish this exam in the time allotted. This may seem odd, but we are doing this to create a grade distribution. DO NOT PANIC! This is by design. Do your best." Literal comment from the mid term, the curve was at 70/100. Does not want students to succeed. Gives arbitrary feedback on assignments. Worst Fisher prof.

Lots of problems with the MBEs. Every other week there was an issue which was great because that meant something is getting curved or extended. I'll choose him over Klinker any day. Professor is very rude and unprofessional. Makes fun of students and rambles. Going to be honest, he's pretty mean. He's a quirky and funny guy but I didn't really enjoy his teaching style. There are better professors out there.
G

Greco is the quirkiest and weirdest professor I've ever had. If you want to be entertained and made fun of while looking at spreadsheets and charts, he is your guy. It was very, very unfair, you didn't learn anything in his class, but he gave you a very low grade every time, and he gave you a grade based on his mood. Don't take his class!

Awful teacher, you will learn nothing and be graded based on how he feels about you. He has no rubrics and is not helpful at all. mean. just very rude and mean.
Avoid if you're taking him for the BA Industry Immersion. Take something else, as you don't learn anything and he just rambles about nonsense for the entire semester.

I took the BA IIP and I don't understand how Greco is a professor when he teaches absolutely nothing, just tells you to take an online course to learn tableau, and then gives you poorly constructed projects that he grades with no rubric. Incredibly disorganized professor who graded on a seemingly random scale, as others have mentioned. No rubrics, minimal feedback- just gives you a grade. He is the worst professor in the OSU. His grading system was nonsence and the feedback was useless. I had no idea to figure out how to improve my work, even though I did what exactly he required. Do not take this class!!!

Online videos explained nuts+bolts of data visualization. Feedback on HW's was unbearably scarce and vague. Difficult to figure out why points were taken off. He is soooo suck! Avoid him at any cost please! Only talk sh*T at class and teach nothing at all!

I thought he was better the 2nd semester than the 1st. He will give you whatever grade he feels like though so the best approach is just to relax and try to enjoy your project. Greco is the worst professor/teacher I've ever had. I learned absolutely nothing. Grading is unpredictable. I have nothing more to add from other submissions, but just awful. You will also probably get terrible group members for the projects. If you're in DA good luck, you're going to be stuck with business kids that don't know anything and they certainly won't learn it in class.

The worst professor I've ever met in OSU, picky grading and no rubric(even change the grade of project 1 at the end of the semester without reason), you can learn absolutely nothing during his class. It is my first time to rate a professor. It is the worst professor and the most unorganized course that I ever experienced in OSU.

Business Analytics Industry Immersion Class. I took this for credit for the Business Analytics Minor. The first semester was easy and boring, pretty much just show up and get an A. I recommend taking this Honors so you have Ty. He grades harder than if you were to take it non honors, but he does make the class fun and is a good guy. Great teacher interesting class style I took honors because the students cared more so group projects were much easier.

I took him for BUSMHR 2292 but I never saw him. It was run by TA, the class itself is super easy to do. A lot of working with groups but pretty enjoyable. However the exams are super specific and are pretty difficult to study for and to do well on.

This class is mainly presentations and group work. Easy to get a B, hard to get an A. Exams focus on very specific points of material over the course of the term and make it almost impossible to study. The class is ran by the TAs. Never saw Ty.

This class is overall easy, and you never even see Ty. He makes his TA's grade very strictly and he also does not believe in perfect grades. This class is a very easy B, but hard A. The group projects are worth most of your grade as well as the mid-term and final. As long as you read the textbook he wrote and watch the videos you will do fine

Group project heavy definitely need a good group. Exams focus on details about the examples and specific phrases in the text. Look out for anything he says a lot or says from the readings. Never met the guy but my TAs were cool.

The class itself was interesting to me, but the exams are ridiculous and will focus on the smallest of details. The TA's do everything and attendance is mandatory for the recitations. The lectures are all online and you have to buy a textbook that Ty wrote.
Absolute joke of class. Exams don't cover course material rather very specific examples that you don't actually need to know outside of the course.

The only time I saw Ty so far at OSU was him getting coffee at Rohr, otherwise you'll never see him in person. The TA will be the only one that is running the class and the group you are assigned to will be really important for the biggest assignments. HIs exams like everyone said asks way too small details.

You probably won't meet Ty in 2292. The course material itself is not hard. The main assignments are the group presentations and 2 exams. For the groups pray you get put in good group because if you don't you're screwed (you are graded as a group not an individual). Tests require you to memorize tiny details which aren't useful outside this class.

Never really understood classes where the biggest chunk of the grade is determined by the competency of an 8-person group rather than yourself. Dude makes it unnecessarily difficult to know which assignments are due when, tests have the most obscure questions on them, and the whole layout of the class is just pointless.

Dude makes you pay $60 for his shoddily written "textbook" used to answer 3 questions on Tophat. Lectures and book are full of mistakes and typos and overall represent his lack of effort in this course. Most sections never even meet the guy. Probably the most overpaid staff member at OSU

Ty is very organized and explains exactly what he wants out of you to do well in his courses. He cares a lot about the personal development of his students and is genuinely interested in the material. He can be a bit of a tough grader, but more by just having higher expectations than most professors. If you put in the work you will do well.

This quite possibly is the most useless course created by mankind. You have to buy a TOPHAT textbook just to answer 3 multiple choice questions a week for homework. To ace the exams all you have to do is memorize every single niche bit of information in the textbook, lecture slides, videos, and record every second of your TA's breath. Get real Ty.

Lectures consist of old videos he did during covid. Exams are tricky and target very very specific questions like a question from a paragraph you read in week 2. The only thing you can gain from this class is the desire to drive without wearing your seatbelt just to see if you can die before you make it to his class. Most useless class at Fisher

Every concept you learn is pretty much common sense, but on the exams, he tries to trick you. I get he wants to make the exams difficult, but doing so by asking the most niche and specific questions is just cruel. The score I got did not reflect my knowledge in the class. ex: "what CEOs did we talk about in week 2?" Like okay.

This class is horrible. The whole class is just given to your TA so if you don't have a good one you are in for a long semester. The lecture videos that Ty uses are all multiple years old and the exams are based on the lecture videos despite the fact we never talk about the videos in class.

Good luck if you even get to meet the guy. He pawns off his classes to be taught by graduate students and reuses lecture videos from Covid. Honestly feels like dude somehow conned OSU into letting him teach for an easy bag. Worst class in fisher you will take. Beyond the professor the material is actually useless brainrot information.
Never even saw Ty. entire class was ran by TA and grades were really designed to have a C average in the class.

I made the mistake of taking the non-honors version of this course, leaving me stuck with an uninterested (and often uninformed) grad TA, and leechy group members for two of the largest assignments in the course. Besides requiring his own $60 textbook though, I don't have many qualms with Ty himself. +1 point for the Buckeye Donuts office hours.

You don't meet Ty unless you're in honors, so all his lectures are pre-recorded. The exams are harder than they seem, so make sure to watch all the lectures and read the TopHat. Oh yeah, the TopHat is $60 and mandatory for the class (did I mention he wrote it?). Overall not a great guy, no wonder he fit in so well at Shell Oil!

Class literally relies on your TA for your grade and the group you are placed in for the two big 60 point group projects at end of semester. The 2 assessments are meh, i thought this class would be a free A but i got stuck with a a**hole of an TA. Don't be like me and research ur TA before you take this class.

Never interacted with Professor Shepfer personally, the entire class was run by a grad TA. Pretty much a coin toss if you get a good one or not. My TA was uninterested in teaching the class and sometimes didn't know what we were meant to be doing. Presentation grading is quite hard, even the best presentations in the class can end up with an A-.

I took 2292 thinking it was going to be a pretty easy class, but this is not the case. The homework assignments are all completion. The group projects are not awful if your group can work well together, but the learning assesments are way too specific and its very hard to receive an A in this class. Ty Shepfer will not stop talking about Shell Oil.

I enjoyed having Ty as a professor. He expected more out of us so graded us a little harder, but honestly, I liked it. It can be time-consuming depending on how much work you want to put into the projects but it was pretty simple stuff. I would highly recommend taking this class in the honors format.

I could tell how much Ty cared about this class when I never saw him in person the entire semester. The textbook is written by him and littered with grammar and spelling errors. Your TA will decide your grade based on group projects. The exams require you to recall irrelevant facts that have nothing to do with the content.

My TA wasn't even a business major (figure out a good TA to take it with), knew nothing about the course, and clearly had no interest in the material. You also have to pay like $60 to get a book written by him that could've easily been a PDF. The exam questions were nonsensical. Don't have a single positive thing to say about him or this class.

Boring material from a book he wrote that he makes you buy (you submit weekly homework through it and use it for class attendance so you can't get away with not buying it). My TA was fine and my group was great so the class ended up not being that difficult, but the learning assessments (basically the exams) are awful.

This class and your experience of it relies solely on the TA you get, not Ty Shepfer. The TA for my class was very bad, only grading things towards the end of the semester, clearly not caring about actually teaching it, and always had a "bored" demeanor for literally every class. This class could be great due to its content, but mine was not.

Ty made us buy a $60 book that was written by himself, and he never shows up to class. He already makes $211,000/ yr. The lectures he provides were recorded in 2018 and just reuses them year after year. The class is run by two TA's who are grad students, so you better hope you get good ones. Grading and criteria is extremely unclear and unfair.

Ty is a very self-centered person who never once showed up to our class. He relies on the TAs to teach everything, so hope you get a good one. The guidelines/due dates for assignments or projects are very unclear, and they didn't even give us a rubric for the final crisis project until after they graded it. Choose another professor if you can.

I was required to buy a textbook THAT HE WROTE for $60. He then proceeded to never attend a lecture(I've never seen him)and throw us in a room with a TA. The book is also horrible and stuff you could find on google and None of the assignments are on carmen so you're constantly scared that you've forgotten something. Worst class I have ever taken.

- makes you buy his book for $60.00 which is on Tophat which is information that literally can be looked up on Quizlet or the internet 
- never even seen his man yet he is our professor 
- None of the assignments are on Carmen to remind you
- TA makes or breaks the class honestly
- the grading is so hard for this class, which is so pointless

TA is so boring that most of the class doesn't pay attention, ironically within a class on large part about how to make an engaging presentation. Professor is nowhere to be seen, with old required online lectures. Grading scales/rubrics are vague and completely based on the TA's opinion. If your TA is incredibly boring like mine, drop the class.
Ty clearly doesn't care about his class. Avoid him at all costs
He is absolutely nowhere to be found when you need him. Your only hope is your TA. He also doesn't post ANY due dates in Carmen. Overall just careless about his class.

Ty cares a lot about himself and is pretty self-absorbed. TA makes or breaks the class, I had a pretentious MBA student who put little to no effort into their sessions. Lectures have nothing to do with group projects, exam questions come straight from the lecture videos.

This class felt like a waste of time. The group projects were graded far too harshly given that at least three of your eight group members don't contribute at all. Graded negatively for the poor performances of others which is just unfair. Was still able to finish with an A through the extra credit and studying for the two exams.

Engaging professor & content. He genuinely tries to pick and present information that is relevant to our future careers. However, the bulk of the grades rely on the competency of your group. Also, the 2 quizzes require you to take overly detailed notes (open-note quiz).

I never met Ty, and all though he seems like a great and genuine person, the class just wasn't as good as it could've been. All the lecture videos and readings were online and the content was barely discussed in class. This class is strongly based on your recitation leader and group. A lot needs fixed to make this class actually useful.

Lectures are posted online, lectures are fine but need to put them on 2x speed because he is monotone. Class is mostly all group projects and presentations. Two tests that are open book but timed so you will not have time to look anything up. Grading is extremely tough and one group project there is no rubric and assignments are not posted.

He hasn't updated his content in 3 years and seems to have no interest in actually doing his job. The class was laid out poorly and it felt like he copied a lesson plan but didn't know how to actually implement it. The TA will decide all of your grade besides the exams. Ty is useless and if you want to get anything out of the class id avoid him.

Loved the class but hated the structure. Why try to be different and only put assignments on the syllabus? Its an intro level class there is no need. I also thought it was hard to get a good grade, at least in my recitation section. Lots of groupwork but thankfully I got lucky and had a good group.

Grades harshly and is VERY unclear about grading guidelines. More than half of the grades in this course are out of your control. You get stuck with a team for the whole semester and if you get a bad team then you'll likely not do well. Overall, this class is very disorganized and just hard for no reason.

This class definitely has its benefits and is very beneficial in helping students find future jobs. Outside of that everything else in this class sucks. No homework is posted online, Ta's grades are really hard and tell students on the first day of class that it's impossible to get an A in this course. Lecture videos are not beneficial at all.

This was a terrible class. First of all, this class is like 70% group projects, and you're stuck with the same group throughout the entire semester. Lectures are all pre-recorded and are from who knows how long ago. Trevor Gillespie was my TA. Worst TA ever. Do not recommend. He was the head TA this semester. If you end up getting the head TA, run

Ty as a person is wonderful. He genuinely does care about students and is willing to meet with them regarding their concerns. However, the class is way harder than it needs to be. Depending on your TA you may get a low score on projects. Our got the highest score on the ethics presentation and still missed 5 points. Hard to get an A.

Ty has a very very big ego. He isn't clear about grading standards (grades are often based merely on his opinion not a set rubric). He isn't willing to work with students, and doesn't give the rubric for a project worth ~40% of your grade until after the project is completed. Take the non-honors version of the class to avoid having Ty as your prof.

Missed an A- by 0.25%, professor doesn't round up at all. Gave 3 points of extra credit. Received the highest crisis case score in my class which was still a 54/60. Tests are 40 LONG questions in 40 minutes. You can use notes on exams, but the questions are EXTREMELY long in comparison to time - it takes a whole minute just to read the questions.

Ty's lectures were videos posted on Carmen, so I never got to meet him in person, but I found the class to be one of the most practical ones I'll take in Fisher. I think the class is organized pretty well, but definitely put a TON of effort on the 2 group projects and study a bit for the learning assessments if you want an A.

This dude thinks he's so sweet. I didn't learn a single thing in this class, he just likes to hear the sound of his own voice. On the crisis case as a the recitation leader he gave everyone a C average, just cuz he picked that arbitrary number. He didn't outline clear grading criteria at all for the biggest assignment of the year. He is the worst.

Ty is a great professor who genuinely wants to get to know his students. I learned more from his class than I have from any of the other classes I have taken combined. Be prepared for group work, and do your best to get everything you can from your experiences in his class.
Ahhh... good ol' Ty Shepfer. I had him during Spring of 2021. I won't say he's anything exceptional (if I could I'd rate him a 3.5), but it's a solid choice for the profs that teach this class.

He has little interaction w students and videos are obviously old. The reading is pointless but he makes you pay for it. Weekly inquisitive discussion boards, 2 tests, and 2-3 partner/group projects that are most of the points. If your group sucks oh well, all students in group get same grade. Extra credit & class is easy but its not easy A

Ty Shepfer seems like an interesting person, but you never see him. He just recycles recorded lectures once a week and this class entirely depends on your TA and your team. If both are good, easy A, if not then good luck. There were only two exams, both weren't too bad but definitely prepare for them.

Ty is a nice guy, but does very little to no actual teaching in this course. The course includes lecture videos from years ago, and Ty uploads a 30 second video of himself presenting what is due in the coming weeks. Wish I got paid to teach this course. Multiple group projects, TA's run the course. Learning assessment are harder then necessary.

This class is my favorite class I've taken through 2 years and the class I've learned the most in. I really enjoyed Ty's pre recorded lectures and my in person recitations. You learn extremely useful skills that you will use in everyday life. I also got to know the students in my group who will be in the same classes as me throughout school.

Really don't like how he set up this class. It's not really him teaching it's mainly watching pre-recorded videos and then having a mandatory recitation where the TA's give out group projects. If your group is bad you're basically screwed. He seemed nice but you have no interaction with him whatsoever.

There are too many group projects, especially in an online course. He doesn't actually do anything for the course except release weekly announcements that are just copied from previous weeks. He makes the TA's do all of the work and grading, and recitation attendance and participation are a big part of your grade. He makes you buy the readings.

Mandatory recitations (with cameras on and graded participation for online version) is the most annoying part of this class. Lots of busy work but there are some useful things such as assignments that require you to complete a resume and LinkedIn profile. Ty is a decent lecturer with a ton of cool experiences to hear about.

This class is hit or miss depending on your TA and your group. If both are good then it's an easy A. Ty basically just does the lectures, I don't really see him as the professor cause I don't interact with him at all, the TAs are the main characters. Tests are pretty easy, hardest things are the group projects if your group doesn't help out much.

This was one of the worst courses EVER! Trying to do the group projects in an online environment is difficult at best. The TA's are morons, as they have no industry experience, yet are grading you on real world situations. They are MBA students, and most of them are full of themselves. 90% of this course is rehashing material from other courses

I wish all Fisher profs were like this. He lays a great foundation for all business students. Taking it in summer didn't feel rushed at all (with 2 other courses). He is genuinely interested in helping you, even for things that might seem below him. Everything was clear-cut with open-note exams, but you still learn so much.
AWFUL Experience! He DID NOT response to ANY question about the course agenda clearly!!! If you forget one, you will not receive an A anymore
Great professor! Watching the lectures and doing the readings makes the tests super easy! Make sure to attend class and participate! There are several group projects, but overall a super easy class!

For the "global awareness survey" MAKE SURE you don't click through it quickly, I got a zero on this because I was below the minimum time threshold (15 min I think)- otherwise he's a cool professor, recitation is annoying with the group projects. However, every other Fisher student is in the same boat with you. Readings are important for quizzes.

Lots of group projects which can be annoying, especially if you do not have a good group. Learning assessments are very specific about the content from lectures and the reading material. Make sure to participate in the recitation.

Ty is very passionate about what he teaches and genuinely cares about his students. I enjoyed both recitation and lecture and feel like I learned a lot from him that prepared me for the business world. Participation is important, and getting a good group matters because most assignments are group projects. You definitely have to put in the work.

This is my all time favorite class I have taken so far! All of the lectures are so interesting, and Ty is so knowledgeable and wants to help all his students in any way he can. My TA was awesome too, but there are a lot of group projects in recitation throughout the semester. I loved this class!

2292 was not the most exciting class, but I really liked Ty. He was a really cool guy and I could tell he was genuinely passionate about what he was talking about, and he cared about his students. He also rocked the blue plaid suit almost every class. I took this class at 8 a.m. but Ty made a class that early bearable.

Ty is a great guy and I enjoyed his class. You can tell he's passionate about business and wants to develop his students. I'd recommend taking his hybrid class so you can watch his lectures whenever you want. Lectures are bearable so don't worry. Recitations are long and require group work, but the assignments are not terrible. An A is possible :)

It's not a tough class, but it's a lot of work! You'll be working with a group off and on through the semester on top of doing other busy work in his class. Expect some mock business situations thrown at you. The work isn't hard, just time consuming on top of other classes you may be taking. Plus, you'll do 4 "learning assessments" (exams).
class is utterly pointless, and ty does his best to make it fun. can't say he succeeds, but he tries
Horrible class that is not taught very well. Lot of the material is just a rehash of microeconomics and macroeconomics. Waste of time.
This guy isn't bad but his learning assessments are unnecessarily hard. His lecture doesn't really help. If you want to get a good grade you need to be lucky to have good teammates.

I don't understand why people hate on Ty. I have found his lectures to be interesting and him to be very approachable outside of class. The key to this class is taking recitation at favorable times and having a good group for the projects. If you pay attention in his lectures and skim the readings, you'll get a B at least. Loved this class.

This guy really does not care if his students are not performing well in class, his only agenda is to give a very vague discussion of business jargon which ends up on exams/quizzes. The first quiz had 8 detailed mc q's over material he just spoke about (not on slides) for 2 minutes out of the whole hour. Anyways, good luck.

The readings for the class are easy, and there are not many. Read all, and read carefully. The material in them is not directly discussed in lecture or recitation, but the test questions are very specifically based on them. Pay attention in lecture, there are questions about those on the tests too. Graded by VERY few things. Turn everything in.

2292 is a hard class because the material is very unrelated week to week so studying for the tests are hard. Ty is a good lecturer and he is very helpful during his office hours. The weekly readings are important for tests so make sure to review them. Recitations are unrelated to lecture but they aren't difficult to get through.

Make sure you watch/attend lectures!! And you HAVE to read the readings like ten times because hell ask super specific details on tests and quizzes. Overall an awesome lecturer and interesting and subject material is totally useful, but the tests and quizzes are definitely harder than they should be! And btw- most people dont get an A

Ty is by far one of the best professors at Fisher; his passion for business is evident. If you're in his honors class (like I was this semester), participation is crucial to getting a good grade. In addition, don't skip lecture. Even though it's not mandatory, he goes over specific info. Tests are hit or miss; he likes to throw too specific Qs in

This class was a lot harder than what it should have been. Lectures were somewhat useful in understanding the business world. Ty is super friendly and makes it interesting. If you want an A you really have to put in the work. Don't go in like me and think that this class will be an easy A :/

Ty is a cool guy and I enjoyed his lectures, he keeps them interesting and engages the class. Its really about who your recitation leader is tho since they grade your projects. Hope for a good recitation group or youll hate it cuz youre stuck with them. Recitation is also unnecessarily long and sometimes pointless. Just participate a little.

Great lecturer, wish I took him in person instead of online. Overall, a lot of the material is common sense, yet many of the test and quiz questions are very subjective and specific from certain readings/lectures. Pay attention during lectures and earn the easy points during recitation and you'll be fine.
Interesting class that had real life applications. Great lecturer that was interesting to listen to and made me want to attend class. Clear instructions for grading made this class pretty easy.

Taking the recitation with Ty is a completely different experience. Taking 2292H is the only way to know what is exactly on your midterm, otherwise you just read lecture slides in hopes of an A. Ty cares a lot for the honors class and will be much more forgiving than the TA's who seem to grade much more arbitrarily.

Ty is a good lecturer. Don't forget any small HW if you want A. Presentation is hard, especially the final group presentation, be sure to prepare as early as possible. Try to fix the problem based on your rec leader's opinions, because grading is very subjective. For 3 tests, mainly focus on the lecture slide.

This class really depends on who your recitation instructor is and how harsh of a grader they are. Unless you are in the honors class with Ty, then he does not do much for you. The exams question you on every little thing, so study the PowerPoints and take good notes in lecture. Recitation is pretty pointless, but you need it for the points.

What is universally an easy class through most business schools, and known to be an easy class at OSU, has become tougher. Ty mentioned this on the first day of class that this course has now become tougher. I'm not totally sure why this was done because it really will be the most unimportant class you take. Content is simple, but exams are ticky

Good professor. The concepts and terms in this class are very easy to understand, but they make the quizzes and exams very tricky which is frustrating. I think they do this on purpose to try and call the class "rigorous" and not an "easy A". The lectures and recitation feel completely different.

The lecture and recitation felt like separate classes. The lectures were full of general content that was made confusing for the quizzes and tests. The recitation projects were great for practicing public speaking, but other than that the class felt disconnected.

Ty takes this class too seriously. In all seriousness, I felt this class only had a couple days that were quite useful like when giving presentations or writing CSR paper. Other than that all test and quizzes are made unnecessarily difficult and wordy.

I didn't like how this class is set up. The wording on his quizzes and exam were supper confusing. This should be an easy class but he made it harder than it should. He said final exam questions would be primary focus on the metarials after the midterm but actually 40% came from metarials before the midterm.

The tests and quizzes are vague even if yo read everything and did all the work you ended up guessing. The class easy but designed to be hard to get a grade in. If you forget one assignment your hopes of an A are gone.

2292 was the most general class I have ever taken. The exams were not hard just confusing and wordy. He covered anything from resume building, to presentation skills, to a large range of general business definitions. Hard to put his class into a short description.

Ty is a really nice guy and makes lectures on very simple material bearable, but my only issue was how unpredictable the exam questions were. You definitely should go to lecture if you want to do well on the exams. Recitation is brutal however, each class is 2 hours of going over material that can be done in 15min. A lot of presentations too.

Ty is an okay lecturer, somewhat entertaining. As the coordinator, he can be a bit disorganized. The syllabus is a bit weird in terms of layout. Some quiz and test questions seem like he is deliberately trying to trick you. IMO a very fair grader for presentations and the final paper. Not a ton of room for error in this class, though.

He's nice and a good lecturer, but he made so many errors on tests and quizzes. Easy class but tests very specific, random details. TA's are inconsistent on grading. Felt like this class could have been fit into a half semester. A lot of our 1 hr 50 min recitations were over in 30 min. Learned some good stuff but often felt like a waste of time.

Lectures from Ty are posted online or you can attend them in person. Make sure to watch them! The recitations were simple but lengthy. The class material is easy, however, the midterms and quizzes contain questions about specific stuff so you do have to study! Participation matters in recitation! Lots of little point assignments that all matter.

Ty had some great lectures, but this class was a tireless effort to make difficult a class that should not be. Tests and quizzes were tricky, points were deducted for silly things, and there seemed to be no consistency among TA recitation leaders. Team building stuff was cool. Would be more effective if it were more straight forward and focused

I don't really get the purpose of this class but.. His quizzes and exams are more challenging than it should be i feel like its the way he asks the problem. class doesn't involve too much work but is super boring with recitation that is pretty much 2 hour long. Like him as a professor but not the way he makes his exams

Ty is cool, but this class sucks. Quizzes were unclear, essay was poorly explained. Going to lecture makes it easier, but even then the material you need to know isn't flushed out well at all. Class shouldn't be hard at all, but the way they revamped it makes it sort of difficult. I'd take Ty again, but not this class.
Ughhh I HATED this class so disorganized and confusing and really a huge waste of time. Not specifically Tys problem maybe its how the class is designed or set up? Just an awful experience

Ty is easy going, caring and pretty fun overall. The class is straightforward and he has worked hard to make it more useful to the students seeking internships and life knowledge. The quizzes/exams can be tough if you don't attend lecture or read the materials. I would definitely take him again.

Class is an easy A if you follow the directions, work with your group, and practice the steps they teach you for presentations. A few short papers, but other that it's presenting in front of your peers.

The class itself is an easy A as long as you do the readings. Grades the presentation kind of tough.  Ty is great. He cares about his students and their success beyond the classroom. If you put in the work to achieve your goals, he'll do whatever he can to help you. If you can take one of his courses, do it.

While Ty is the course coordinator, he teaches some recitations and that's where I had him.  He is a really laid back easy going guy who makes the 2 hour long class somewhat fun.  The class itself is in my opinion pointless, I took nothing away from it, it's basically just another freshman survey class.

Professor Shepfer is so nice and wants you to succeed. He's understanding and I liked having him as a lecturer, but he wasn't my TA so I can't say much about that.  As for the course material itself, this class is absolutely useless. I think I actually became stupider by taking this class. Such a waste of my time + semester.

Ty cares about his students like no other. There is no textbook, he prefers articles and encourages discussion. Ty is a great guy and is always there to help a student in need. He assigns group projects because teamwork is his thing. 2292 is an easy class, make sure you have TY!

Seriously one of the coolest professors I've ever had. Really approachable, funny, and actually cares about you as a student. Wish I had another class with him. Lectures got long real quick, but he brought you back into it. Fair grader imo because he gives really specific criteria on rubrics. Real easy on the eyes as well, definite stud.

Reading is really important! Reading is really important! Reading is really important! As an international student, this course is not that easy if you skip reading! I did not do the reading, so I just got 72/100 on my midterm. Then I start to do that, I got 90/100 on my final. Lots of stuffs need to do but fairly easy grader.

If you attend lectures, you should get above a 90 on the midterms.  This was his first time organizing the course, but overall, pretty easy.  Has Group projects and presentations but fairly easy grader. I usually don't like these kind of classes but Ty was an awesome professor and made the class fun.
Awesome! Very helpful. Entertaining. None of the TAs for this class are bad though.
He was very helpful and the class didn't take too much time.  Recitations took attendance, but don't bother with the actual class, Tansky just drones.
Ty is an awesome TA!  He teaches better than most professors.  He actually thinks about what he is saying and doesn't talk just to hear himself talk.  He has helpful and insightful things to say.

best TA for this class. sooo much easier than the others. cool guy, fair grader, knowledgeable, helpful, and understanding. good recourse beyond the class. best TA you can get. do whatever you can to have him. i'm a guy and i think hes a stud so ladies you're in for a treat!
Great teacher and makes class fun! Really nice guy and always has good career advice.
A really great guy. Very passionate about the subject. Seemed to grade slightly harsher than the other T.A.s but you really can't get a horrible grade.
Awesome!!
Simply awesome!
Great TA.  Really passionate about teaching and his students.  Nice to look at too...

He's a good guy and a great lecturer. He cares what his student's think and changes things based on our feedback which is nice. The quizzes are easy, but the exams are tough. Still very doable to get an A even if the exams don't go well thanks to quizzes, simulations, particapation points, extra credit etc.

Andrew himself is amazing! He cares so much about students and tries to learn everybody's names. The class itself is way harder than other business core like accounting. The chapters are very long and the exam questions are "abstract." He could explain the topics in more detail. Go to his office hours because he will spend time getting to know you.
His exams are so hard for no reason. He does too much and makes a basic introductory course hard because he probably gets off on it.

He himself is a caring teacher, that is it. His lecture is all over the place and does not relate to class material. Quizzes are fine, you will need to look at every single material. Test are very hard, if you do not watch his videos, then you are doomed because he WILL give questions from his lecture videos. Good teacher, bad teaching style.

He's a great guy and all, but he spends a lot of time talking about himself and goes into many irrelevant details. The concepts in the course are not that hard, but he makes his exams difficult for such an basic course.

Absolutely love this guy. Best professor I have had in my time at Fisher so far. Lectures are interactive and fun, and he genuinely cares about all of his students. It's not even a hard course I just don't enjoy marketing so I got a B. A+++ lecturer.

He is a very caring teacher who enjoys teaching to his students who even memorizes everyones name. There is plenty of opportunities for grades its not just exams. Exams were a bit difficult but not impossible. But Andrew is a very great teacher and has alot of people who come in to talk to his students.

Took the honors version of this and would recommend to other to get a smaller class size. Lots of reading but the exams are fair. Go to office hours and ask for help when you need it and you should be fine. Be prepared to participate in lectures and weekly class activities in small groups

The difficulty of this course is above the middle of all the business courses I have taken, Follow the requirements, read the textbooks, watch the recorded lectures! Quizs are not designed to be hard except The final exam, which in my view, is deliberately to make it hard for you. Content during the in person lectures will not appear in the exam.

This class is not friendly to a non-native. Too many vocabularies. You will have weekly closed-book quizzes with a proctor extension, and normally take you a full afternoon to get at least 80. Final exam's average was 73. No curve and no round up. Be ready to remember tons of vocabularies and definitions. But overall Andrew is a great prof.

Andrew is a very upbeat and energetic. He makes his lectures engaging. Get ready to meet your neighbors as you talk with them every day. Exams are a lil tricky, but he gives you a vocab list to study with for the midterm and final. Read the textbook for vocab and focus on the videos for the exams. Long live the Old Town Ps and Sweet 4 Ps. Just wait

I really enjoy his lectures and he trys to make such a big class into a smaller one so everyone at least feel somewhat connected to the professor and classmates. His exams are pretty hard but it is manageable if you put in the effort to study. Quizzes can be hard sometimes depending on the material, but overall a decent professor.

This class is the biggest waste of time you will ever have. Piletz talks about himself and his career for two hours straight, then gives you an unnecessarily hard exam that is very tedious and unrelated to any class content. His whole thing is proving marketing is hard and not just an easy business class, so he takes pride in his C averages.

Andrew Piletz is extremely passionate about teaching this course however the exams are pretty tough for 3250. You have to remember very specific details from the lecture videos and in-person lectures. Additionally, there is a lot of vocabulary to memorize. Take advantage of the extra credit and redoing the simulations.

One of the worst professors here at OSU, his exams consistently averaged C's. I'm not the smartest student ever, but I got A's in almost all business foundation classes. I think that clearly shows the unnecessary difficulty of this class. He also expresses his religion a lot which is fine, but it's weird that he pushes it on his students at times.

Piletz really cares about his students and makes the lectures entertaining but all of the actual learning is done through textbooks or videos.  The exams are fairly difficult but he provides extra credit opportunities.

First, his in person lecture is not helpful in terms of learning, just there to socialize with other people and bring bunch of very unhelpful fake situations. Second, he instill his belief heavily into his class and he would ask students who came to his office office what they want him to pray for which is uncomfortable for me. Very hard exams.

Professor Piletz is a genuinely really nice guy. He wants nothing more than to see his students succeed. I came to office hours in search of help on a subject, and we ended up talking about life and he helped me reduce my stress. He makes a 105 minute lecture enjoyable and really helps make a class that lacks exciting content, exciting. Great guy.

If you want to go to class to socialize for an 1:45 minutes take this class. Class was used to test our knowledge on the videos we had to watch outside of class. The exams were pretty hard even though the concepts seemed easy. He was a nice professor I just do not care about marketing and wish the class was a little easier bc its just a core class.

He is just unhelpful. His lectures were not helpful for the exam, and he deliberately is vague about the exams so the grades were low. It's just more work with the weekly readings and video lectures than any other class, especially for a core class. When I went to his office hours he prayed over me before I left, which made me super uncomfortable.

He is a very nice guy and the lectures are very engaging but I hated them. Somehow he knows everyones name and makes us talk to our neighbor for 2 hours straight. He makes good lectures but still makes you read the textbook which is annoying. Still one of the best professors you can get here. Class is relatively easy for Fisher.

Andrew is great as a person and as a lecturer. He genuinely cares about all of his students and makes everyone want to be in lecture. His lecture videos are engaging and his in person lectures are super applicable to the real world. Great human being and person. The world needs more professors and people like him.

Andrew is a very great professor. His lectures are great and you can tell he knows what he is talking about from his industry experience that he references often. The readings in the textbook take a lot of time, plus all the lecture videos. He is not clear at all about what he expects of you on the exams or quizzes, and they are very difficult.

Andrew is one of the best professors I will have in college. He truly cares about each and every student, and memorized all his student's names even though he has 800 students in total. Very interactive during lectures to help you understand, not to make you seem dumb. Watch videos, read, and come to class, and Andrew Makes it worthwhile!

Genuinely one of the greatest professors I've ever had. Lectures, both pre-recorded and in-preson, were entertaining, and in class discussions were thought provoking. Andrew made learning feel fun. Anyone who has ANYTHING bad to say about this man doesn't know him at all or just wants an effortless A. Don't miss the opportunity to take his class.

Piletz is probably one of the best professors in Fisher. He genuinely cares about his students. I attended his office hours and he talked to me just about life in general. The exams can be tricky, but if you show up and actually read the chapters, you will do fine. I ended up with 100% on all the quizzes, so just make sure you read the chapters

The best professor who is patient and kind. His lecture is interesting and uses examples to help us understand easily. He cares and always helps all students. In addition to his lecture, he tells us about case competition opportunities and invites marketing-related workers to classroom discussions.

Great Professor all around, genuinely enjoyed his course. Have to say I respect the fact that he stands for 2 hours each class lecturing and making the course appealing for the students. He also listened to students complaints about exams and quizzes and simplified everything we needed to understand down to a single PDF.
Very enthusiastic & kind towards students. Tests aren't too bad in my opinion, but you do need to study. The simulations were useless.

One of the best professors I have ever had. He is different than the majority of professors as he loves what he does and cares about his students. These are big lectures and very long, but that's out of his control and he does a great job navigating this situation. Would recommend to anyone looking to take principles of marketing.

Took this class in the fall and looked forward to it every week! Piletz gives very well-explained pre-recorded lectures and is even more fun and interactive in person. He also invites in interesting guest speakers a couple times. One time I expressed interest in a company he was familiar with and connected me with someone he knew there. 10/10

Andrew Piletz is the best professor I have ever had. Great teacher who cares about all of his students. The weekly quizzes are tough but if you actually do the reading and watch the videos you should be fine. Exams are tough too because they are all application but if you study hard you will be fine. No homework really. You will learn a ton.

I seriously wish I could take every college class with this professor. He is so upbeat and really tries to connect with college kids. The exams can be a little tough because they're application based but if you truly give it your best during lectures and prepare, they're totally fair. He is super funny and makes the class really engaging.

Andrew is a great guy that really cares about his students. His exams can be tough, but he will help you. He has great intentions and wants all of his students to succeed. He may be the best professor that I have had.

Andrew is a great guy who loves teaching and cares about his students. You do have to learn the content to succeed so be prepared to put in some work but it isn't bad. Only thing is the first exam he kind of intentionally doesn't tell you a lot so the grades are low. He helps you out for the next two so grades increase a lot. Great Professor.

I had him for BUSML 4203. I truly do not recommend him for this course. Overall, he gave us pretty easy assignments, however, he barely taught us useful information. This class has you do a semester-long simulation with a group, and he did not give any good instruction to be successful with this assignment. Disappointed with end result.

Andrew is one of the best professors in Fisher- he is clearly passionate about marketing and cares about all of his students. I took the online version and he did an incredible job engaging us and I actually enjoyed the break out room tasks! Take 3250 with him- you won't regret it!

This was my favorite class in the business core so far! Andrew is super laid back and is genuinely a great guy. He's the type that cares that you take away something from his class, rather than focus on grades. However, the exams were tough (class average was usually a C). Take marketing with Professor Piletz.

Andrew clearly loves to teach & wants his students to succeed. He makes sure to apply this class to all majors (not just marketing ones) and it really great at explaining concepts by incorporating his corporate background. Be sure to read the textbook & watch his pre-lecture videos or else you won't do well on the quizzes or exams (both proctored)

Andrew is a phenomenal person. He makes class enjoyable and teaches in a way that is very easy to understand. This class is conceptually heavy so it is important to keep up on readings and lectures. If you decide to take his course you will definitely have fun.

Professor Piletz is very passionate about his teaching. He obviously spends a lot of time preparing for lectures and really has students' best interest in mind. As long as you keep up with the material, you will do fine in this class.
Andrew is good tests are hard all around.

He is literally the worst and I do not recommend at all. He is full of himself and wastes your time. He is a try hard for no reason. Not a fan of him at all. Lectures are pointless as he repeats everything he says in his lecture videos.
Professor Piletz kind of seems full of himself. I didn't really learn anything from him that I couldn't have gotten from the book. I'd suggest taking someone else.

Cannot recommend him enough!!! Incredible guy. Extremely caring and accessible outside of class. Go to his office hours - I promise you will benefit!!! Overall, the actual class isn't too tough. Exam average was a bit low (70s I think) but he offers some extra credit (5% on your overall grade). Totally doable to get a good grade.

This course was conducted online, and both attendance and participation are mandatory. The course is graded on SmartBook activities, mini-simulations, quizzes, a midterm, and a final. All quizzes and exams were closed-noted and proctored via Proctorio. The final was not cumulative. Andrew cares deeply about this class, and keeps it interesting.

Probably one of the best professors Ive had so far, really cares about the job he does and his students success. Most of the content is textbook based, but his lectures are amazing. He also gave a ton of extra credit opportunities, about a 5% overall curve if you did them all.
Sherry's course is easy to understand and she pay much patient for student. You can ask question and go to her office hour, she also reply email quickly. I learned a lot in her class!!
She is definitely my favorite professor so far. She is really nice and kind, not a hard grader, and as long as you attend lectures and do your homework, there is a great chance that you can get an A.

Sherry is one of my fav professors at Fisher. She is very knowledgeable. Her class content is straightforward, easy to follow, and quite clear to me personally. She is also always willing to answer students' questions and always gives clear answers. I highly recommend taking her class, my fav marketing class so far.

Sherry is amazing so understanding and kind. She truly wants her students to succeed. There is a lot of group work involved and statistics, but if you put in the time it is doable. Overall a decent class and an amazing professor. TAKE 4202 WITH SHERRY
He is so monotone and unbearable class. Just skip class and study the slide.

Professor Weiner is nice and answers questions, but his lectures are hard to follow since he assumes students have trade desk experience. He doesn't always explain projects or exam expectations, and the lack of a lockdown browser leads to cheating. I wouldn't take Investments with him again.

Professor W. is decent, but I wish he provided more resources, such as lecture notes, a detailed study guide, and additional practice exams. So far (before Midterm 1), this class hasn't taught me anything—I don't need student loans, and I already understand how credit cards work. Studying their history doesn't seem particularly useful to me.

Professor seems like a great guy but he really cannot teach. I understand this is generally taken by upperclassmen and they assume that we can teach ourselves but little more structure will help. He seemed to go around in circles and didn't really solidify any concepts. I had to study hard for exams with plenty of notes taken during lectures.

This class is foundations of finance- professor needs to assume that students have never studied finance ever before and provide any sort of baseline information for his content. Both in person lectures and video lectures do not cover content in exams.

Made it to my last semester of college and this will be my first C, if that means anything to you. Lectures are just so boring and exams are somehow difficult. I well on the midterm and the final dropped my grade over 10% when I studied significantly more for it. So much material and I think its just based on luck of if you study the right things.

Professor Weiner was okay. His lectures didn't cover anything, so get ready to read the slides and chapters outside of class to get the whole picture. Go to class and take the WSJ quizzes, all easy 100%'s to boost your grade.

Content isn't difficult but exams are impossible. To do well on exams take really good notes, most questions are over random things he says within the lecture. Exam questions are rarely supported by slides or past quizzes and are sometimes irrelevant to mastery of the subject. He seems like a nice and really smart guy but is an awful professor.

The content in the lecture slides does not align with the exam content. He does not teach any math during the lectures, then puts equations on the exams expecting you to know how to solve them. Never posts assignments on time.

For his exams, you should know:
- The PowerPoints
- All the stuff he randomly says in the lectures which aren't posted anywhere
- The book which includes info not in the PowerPoints
- The lecture videos he uploads on Carmen

No matter how much you study he'll find a random sentence you glossed over to test you on. Worst professor I've ever had.

Lectures do not go into depth on meaning of vocab words or how to use equations you need to know for exams. Exams were difficult even though questions were supposed to come from previous quizzes and items we were told to "Write down". read your textbook as much as possible if you want to do decent.

Test only cover 6-7 questions from quizzes given every week. When lecturing he does not go into depth on subject matters, what they are used for, and what they correspond with. He is a great guy but could go into depth better.

He is an overall good professor, in his lectures you use a slide show made from the book but does not go into depth of how items work or what they go with. He states that most multiple choice questions from the quizes go straight onto the test but only 5-6 questions actually do.

Professor Weiner means well but is not a good teacher. His exams reflect obscure concepts that get talked about briefly in class during a random lecture throughout the unit. Studying for exams is difficult as little guidance is provided regarding its content. Exams are written poorly and averages are always low. Does not set students up for success

was not good at lecturing at all would talk about random stuff in class and expected us to know what he was saying. his exams are so unfair and cover none of the content he has in lecture so if you can avoid him then do it. not worth it. would rather drop my business minor than take this class.

He is a super nice guy but his class is super unorganized and he is not good at teaching the material. He will talk about random stuff most of class instead of teaching, exams are mostly made up of the random stuff he mentioned once for five seconds so no one does good, doesn't offer an extra credit/curve, and exams make up most of grade. AVOID!

Ronnie is a nice, but his exams are not reflecting of class at all. Material itself is easy, you can prepare a week ahead for exams and still fail, which is the average anyways. All study materials are nothing like the exams and I think that's why people do poorly. Material is not bad, but exams are unfair and the downfall of the class.

Professor Weiner is a nice guy who means well. He lectures from the textbook-provided PowerPoint and is very dry. He tries to make his classes enjoyable but mostly falls flat. His quizzes and exams make up most of the grade and are very easy. He usually has a semester-long group project, which can be quite draining and overly complicated.

Professor Weiner is a nice guy, but a horrible professor. His class is super disorganized. He took feedback halfway through the semester and thought adding two presentations during class was what students wanted. Syllabus did not match class and schedule was constantly changing. Written parts of exams graded harshly. Nice guy, but unprofessional.
I can feel his passion and eager of teaching, warm and knowledgeable.

The setup is inefficient, hindering learning as we focus on raising hands and competing for participation credit. He does not explain content well or hear people out without it seeming forced/condescending. Also he didn't correct our final grades (graded x/20 instead of x/10).

This teacher was extremely strict in grading, much more difficult than the professor who took this course at the same time. In the classes of other professors, all of them got a, and in our class, there were a lot of bc. And the teacher is very concerned about his grade, every day in class to ask his students whether they speak well.

Professor Wang should not be employed at OSU or any college that takes itself seriously. Classes are vague and do not relate to any of the course material outlined in the syllabus. Grades are put in without reason at the last minute and will not respond to students, basically screwing them over. AVOID AT ALL COSTS
Early boring ho really very boring

Professor Wang cannot digest constructive criticism. He goes through reviews on rate my professor and flags the bad reviews. He always mentioned how he expects high ratings and brought in coffee and cookies to incentivize SEI. He does not believe in his own abilities if you know you are a good prof no need to be scared of students opinions.

This suppose to be an easy class, and it was easy during the class, before his grading for those assignments, I had a 99% on the grade, but then even I participated in class he and attended to most of the class, he still gave me low grade for that! Also I asked him to curve us because I had almost reached A- but he refused to curve us as well!

Prof Wang is image-conscious and does not provide feedback on assignments like the paper that was 20% of the grade, he randomly assigns grades. He is full of himself he does not even allow comments on the SEI and told the class he tries to grade easy and expects us to give him good ratings. Grading is absurd. Nice person, and okay of a professor.

Dr. Wang cares about his students and always brings a positive attitude to class. His lectures were interactive and required us to think differently about business strategy. If you are interested in strategy and/or platforms, then I'd recommend taking this course.
Lloyd calls himself a great teacher many times throughout the semester, but he is nothing more than a robot of the system. Nothing he says is worth listening to. His section was a waste of my time.

Good teacher, very much cares about the class. Somewhat overbearing trying to require positive feedback but easy to get a great grade if you show up to class and complete the group projects. Nothing too challenging or tricky. Does not grade til end of semester but only a couple assignments and are graded fairly easily. Would take again

Professor Wang is an excellent professor who really cares about his students and wants to see them do well. He was extremely accommodating during the Covid crisis and made the transition to online coursework very manageable. I would definitely recommend taking his course.
Professor Wang is awesome! He wants to see he students succeed and will do anything to help them understand the material. As long as you put in the effort, you will do well.
Alex was one of my favorite professors at OSU and makes a pretty boring class fun! He is hilarious and is very knowledgeable!

Up-and-coming professor. Very hard worker, which shows up in the carefully curated course content, lectures, and projects. Asked students to master the strategy theory and then apply it to real work, recent, cases. Very personable and friendly. Responsive. Kind. Probably one of my Top 10 professors of all time. Probably too good to stay at OSU....

Professor Wang took, in my opinion, one of the most relevant courses in my MBA curriculum. He makes you think and look beyond the mere business model of companies. The cases discussed in the course are very relevant and it was fun learning about companies that you are familiar with but have no idea about. A solid course with a learned Professor!

Great professor to lead the 4490 recitation - synthesizes the cases and goes more in-depth on the strategic management theories and gives great feedback to the presenting case group. As long as you show up and participate every once in a while you should be fine!

Professor Wang was caring for his students even during the COVID-19 period, he would answer your questions quickly and effectively. Overall an easy class to get an A if you prepare for the exams and projects.

Professor Wang cares about his students learning and tries to create an environment that makes students want to learn. For the recitation, you will have a group presentation, group paper, and solo paper which he grades extremely fairly and is willing to help at any point. Attendance is taken for a grade but you get a few skips for the semester.

Professor Wang was amazing! He tried to make class fun and interactive and was also very knowledgeable about the material. As long as you make an effort to participate in class you will gain a lot and a good grade.

Professor Yangzhi Wang was a great professor! He, undoubtedly, cared for his students and was willing to help out in anyway he could to ensure students got a good grade. He also grades participation and presentations fairly! I would definitely take him again.

Have to read long cases before each recitation and have quizzes on them. Also have to make comments which are graded by a TA who isnt present in the class. I get 0s on participation because the TA didnt think their comment was good enough.

Yongzhi (known informally as Alex) was an excellent professor. He adds enormous value to the class discussion (giving much information not in the textbook and relating information to current and historical events). VERY intelligent. A+++

Fantastic professor. Teaches the material in an informative and interesting way. Homework and textbook reading is not bad at all and if you do the class right, the exams aren't bad at all. Some of the best lectures I have had at Fisher, would definitely take another class with him.

Ivan Smith is an incredible person and instructor. His lectures are very engaging and he cares about his students. For the exams, he'll tell you exactly what you need to study. A lot of vocab but as long as you attend lecture you will be fine. Gave us extra credit for attending an osu basketball game. I learned a lot from this class! 10/10

This man is amazinggg probs the best lecturer here tbh. He gives helpful examples to almost everything so that you'll understand the topics. Reading the book def does help and he's extremely approachable too and genuinely wants to help you understand. This is one of the few classes where I will actually remember what I learned bc he taught so well
my glorious king

Prof. Smith is 10/10. The examples he gives are really helpful and he tells you exactly what you need to study for exams. Class was very engaging and I feel as though I learned a lot from it. Only downside is that the only grades are the chapter hw (1 point each) and the exams (40pts and 45pts). Other than that, love the class and Prof. Smith!!

Didn't know much about law going into this class (was kind of nervous because its notorious for being a hard half semester class) Ivan was so awesome and engaging every lecture. Super easy to talk to and approachable when you have questions. As long as you pay attention and read the book the exams aren't bad either.

Gives great examples to everything and cares about students doing well, will direct you on exactly what to study on test so it gives you alot of answers. Just lots of vocab but if you study you will do good and he is very helpful

My favorite class/professor so far in college. Really engaging, loves the material he's teaching, and makes it relatable to students. If you do the work, you are in a great spot to succeed. Sneaky good sense of humor in lectures as well if you pay attention.

I would willingly take his class again if I could. It is very clear that he enjoys teaching and cares about his students. He gives lots of extra credit opportunities. If you complete & study the textbook assignments and study his lectures (go to class and take notes!), you will get an A on both tests.

I took 3500 and 4510 with Professor Smith and loved them. His passion and commitment made challenging material engaging. Unlike other classes, success required full attention, which inspired me. I value the practical knowledge gained and believe Professor Smith embodies what great teaching should be.

This class is difficult only because it is so much information crammed into half a semester. Ivan is a great guy who cares a lot about the topic. He offered SO much extra credit, it was just time consuming stuff and I was just too lazy to do any of it. He even offered us extra credit if we attended a basketball game!

Nice dude, kind of awkward at times but very genuine. There were only two exams and one quiz that was 85%, attendance and homework was 10% of the grade. I thought the exams weren't too hard and it was fine as long as you paid attention to the lectures. I looked forward to going to this class and would take it again :)

I never rate professors. I literally made this account so i could rate this guy because I gotta give him his flowers. Such a good guy, cares about the material and his students. His lectures are engaging. He's a family man and just a down to earth person. the tests are hard and I didn't get the best grade but goddamn I enjoyed each lecture.

Professor Smith does not help students understand the material and gives no assistance for preparing for tests. The class is based off of two tests and meaningless homework that only is 5% of the grade total. The two tests make up 85% of the grade. If you are looking for a professor to help you prepare for the tests and the material, its not him.
Professor Smith's class was very tedious. I never felt like I learned walking out of there. The exams were very difficult. I wish there was more opportunity for extra credit.

The class is super organized and easy to follow as long as you watch the videos and use them for reference. The exams are based on the material in the slides and he also hosts two review sessions during the midterm and final to tell you exactly what to study and how.
Maybe I'm just bad at logistics but it was like he was speaking a foreign language watching these lecture videos. Very tough exam, make sure to study.

The class was run incredibly well, the lectures were always pretty streamlined and the exam review sessions were incredibly helpful. Out of class assignments weren't too bad at all. The exams themselves are on the harder side, so definitely study a good amount for them. Would take another class with Professor Pritchard again for sure.

I am not fond of 1.5 hr classes. This class was all memorization and the exams (2) are worth 40% each. The exams consist of true/false questions with specific details from lectures. I struggled with this class and I'm glad it's over. The content was interesting however, I strongly disliked the exam layout. He also responds super late to emails.
Great professor, great course! Everything is organized on Carmen and exams aren't bad if you go to the review sessions and study what he tells you to.

Took this class online. Lectures were incredibly boring. Exams were pretty difficult and he asks very specific questions about material that he glosses over in lecture. Overall, not a hard class to get a B+ or A- in.
Just go to lecture and listen and you will be fine. There is extra credit available for both exams and he gives you a pretty good expectation about what you will be tested on.

This was my favorite class I have taken so far, and I have no interest in logistics. Dr. Pritchard is a really good professor, he is very clear and knowledgeable, and you can tell that he actually enjoys teaching. The homework's are very easy, and as long as you study and follow his exam study guide you will get an A.
One of the nicest professors at OSU. Truly cares about students. Go to class, especially exam review days.

Fantastic professor. Tries to teach his material in the clearest way possible without any unnecessary assignments or overlong lectures. He cares a lot about his students and is always accessible for questions and help. I don't think he could have structured or taught the class any better.

Dr. Pritchard was a great professor for 3380. His class was very straightforward and the exams were pretty easy if you showed up to class and studied the material he tells you to study! If I had to take this class again, I would definitely take it with him.
Great professor. He actually helps you understand the material and does an excellent job preparing your for exams. Awesome guy
I love this man so much, he actually taught everything in a highly sophisticated and engaging way i would take every class he teaches w no hesitation :)
Great professor

If I could take every class in the Logistics dept with Dr. Pritchard I would with zero hesitation. He is SO kind and genuinely cares about what he is teaching. 1 big group project (graded super leniently), 3 homework assignments (2/3 can be done with a partner), and 1 exam. He was super accessible outside of class and legit my favorite professor

Favorite professor of the semester. His class is super straightforward on what he expects and makes it really easy for us. I took it online so could go back to the lectures. Gives you a study guide for the exam which is really helpful when studying  would recommend him 200% for logistics.

Alan is a nice person, the cea and discussion posts give little to no instruction but as long as you put in effort on them you will get an A. Offers a few opportunities for extra credit which is nice. Pretty easy class.

Professor Pritchard is one of the best professors I have met at OSU. You can tell from his lecture that he truly loves logistics. I am not in his major, but his class makes me reconsider double major options. Class is mostly lecture based with several exams and homework.
The tests make you think a little bit but not that much. Do all the homework and projects and you'll get a good grade.
Clear grading criteria, very friendly and genuinely caring person, no surprises on exams, and a class that is relevant to today's world. Can't ask for much more! Would highly recommend Dr. Pritchard.

Prof. Pritchard was a great professor, I know he's new here at OSU but he's definitely making a positive impact IMO. Interesting content, it's fresh content too since logistics is dynamic. Would take again and would've taken even if it wasn't required and worth 3 credit hours. Fair grader too. Take him.
Awesome class. You will learn alot and alot of the learnings made me think outside of the box.

Alan Pritchard is great. The class is very straightforward and easy to understand. He offers extra credit and makes exams directly based on course material. He also helps you stay engaged with his light humor and interesting topics. If you have the opportunity to take his course, you definitely should.

(BUSML) Awesome, would definitely take again. Lectures are very straightforward. Exams were simple, he gives us a study guide with clear criteria on what to know. Will give extra points and exam questions sometimes. Graded on discussion posts, current event assignments, 2 exams (30% each). Easy grader, just include all required info on assignments.

This class is inherently difficult because of the large amount of content and often times confusing legal terms. Professor Helmreich uses TV shows or movie clips to explain a lot of the concepts and also gives good examples to clarify confusing terms. She did a great job teaching the class but you need to study and read quite a bit to do well.
Best professor ever for this class I recommend you take her!!

Dr. Helmreich is a great professor. She makes the class interesting by using examples of law from famous movies which did the job of keeping me engaged. However, the hour 35 minute lectures were difficult to sit through. She does have videos to view if needed. She offers extra credit which helps due to the exams being very tricky.

I'm so glad I had Helmreich! The class is very fair in terms of grading and workload. Just of a couple of assignments out of the McGraw hill textbook per week, a midterm, and a final. The tests are very predictable , but you'll have to do a good bit of studying to do well. She's great at lecturing and plays lots of TV clips to explain things

Julia is one of the best professors at Fisher. Her lectures are entertaining and easy to follow and she provides a generous extra credit opportunity before the final exam. The exams are challenging but not difficult at all as long as you pay attention in lecture.
