Julia is the best professor for business law (BUSFIN 3500)!! She makes her lectures really fun and engaging, which helped me learn more! There aren't many grades in the class, but she makes it easier to get a good grade on the exams by making you do a vocab review assignments before the midterm and final. Take her!!!

If you do well on the exams, it's a very easy A. Homework is a completion grade and attendance is mandatory but it helps your grade a ton. Go to lecture, almost all the exam is from class examples, reading the textbook isn't necessary except key terms. Julia is super friendly, couldn't recommend a better professor, super under-rated within fisher!
Extremely hard exam! 54 questions with 45 mins.....

Professor Helmreich is a great professor. She knows the subject matter extremely well and does a great job at connecting the ideas to real world scenarios that can help you outside of class. The weekly quizzes are easy and so is participation. The exams are very fair as long as you use the online lectures to study. One of my favorite classes!
Great professor! You have to know your stuff to do well on the exams, but everything is clear and the examples she uses are interesting.

Prof Helmreich has the perfect amount of work for a 1.5 credit class. I never felt overwhelmed with this class and it really only took maximum 2 hours/ week to pass with an A (1.5 hours of lecture about and 0.5 hours of just doing a quiz or survey). Plus, the lectures are prerecorded so you never have to go to a zoom session if you do not want to!!

This was a pretty tough class in general, but Professor Helmreich did a really good job of conveying difficult legal concepts so that things were less confusing. It is very important to read the textbook and take good notes. Quizzes are easy. Do not wait till last minute to do legal terms because they take forever but easy points.

I expected this class to be easy but it was actually a lot harder than Id hoped it would be. The midterm and the final were very difficult as they required you to be able to apply the different laws and rules we learned in class. Just know going in that you need to read the textbook and youll probably be ok, its not an easy class though

Overall, Julia Helmreich is a great professor. The class is not difficult at all and she explains the topics easily. Participation matters but you only need to participate like once or twice per class. The tests are scenario based, but not too difficult. She also gives extra credit opportunities. I would definitely recommend her.

Lectures twice a week, participation and attendance count for a good amount of the grade. She's very approachable and knowledgeable about the topic, and makes the 80 minute lectures very bearable. She also offers extra credit and there aren't a lot of assignments.
Highly recommend taking BUSFIN3500 with her. She is definitely someone to look up to! The class is not hard if you pay attention. She gave a lot of extra credit at the end.

Easily dryest lectures I've needed to go through for Fisher. Sits there with the Powerpoint's and instead of just teaching it has people answer in a lecture hall to give credit and everybody just reads right from her slides. 2 exams were 70+% and were all application based which made them super tough to study for. B law tough all profs though

If you're wondering who to take for Business Law, take her class! Graded off of participation (answer one or two questions each class), a few Carmen quizzes, and a midterm & final that were easy as long as you took decent notes. Prof Helmreich is kind, helpful, and wants to see you succeed unlike the other business law professors.

She is the ONLY Business Law professor at OSU worth considering - the others have terrible reputations and students rarely do well in their classes. Miss Helmreich, on the other hand, is a fantastic lecturer and sets students up for success. I truly enjoyed her class and learned a lot from her, and received an A without much trouble at all.
she was very friendly to our class and excited about the material, although pretty dry. didn't make it overly difficult. really enjoyed her as a professor

Just a guy that wants you to learn. He's clearly been doing this for a while and knows how to get the most out of his students. Had him multiple times and would take more courses from him if I got the chance.
Wonderful professor! Very much recommend

Awesome professor. You will have to pay for the tophat textbook for this class but its a breeze. Just show up and participate and you're good. He even gives gift cards for to discussion posts on Packback.

Steve is a good guy class is pretty much taking notes as he reads them off the board. One big group project that you have to present to the class but overall not bad. Final exam a 50 question multiple choice. I would take this guy he's not bad at all compared to other professors i've had a fisher.

Took him for 4386, and I'm convinced that he is the best professor in Fisher! He is hilarious, and his lectures are filled with relevant material to today's business world. Professor DeNunzio actually gets you excited for a career in Logistics, and is more than happy to answer any questions pertaining to the logistics field.
I've taken 3 classes with DeNunzio - he's a great prof and is excited to teach. All his classes have a pretty similar structure, he grades fairly, and presents straightforward exams.

He is very clear about what he asks for on the exam, just follow his study guide and its an easy A. He has a sense of humor. Be ready for one or two group projects but he is not a tough grader, fair prof overall. Wished I could have taken more classes with him.
Hands down the best Logistic professor at OSU. Very understanding. Always make corny dad jokes in class. Exams are literally everything from study guides he gave.
He's a great teacher. Very knowledgable and super nice. Loved his class. Quite easy. He gives out a ton of bonus. You will need the book for the exams, but  not much else.
Great guy, knows a lot about what he's teaching. Class is pretty easy, if you read the textbook and pay attention it should be an easy A

Dr. Lee is a enthusiastic professor who cares about his students. Unfortunately, the praise ends there. The assignments are arbitrary. The class itself has no meaningful content. For an MBA course, I expected to be challenged and discuss complex topics, however the content was so meaningless, there was no intellectual discussions to be generated.

The expectations far exceed a 1.5CR course - there are several papers (ranging from 2-8 pages) plus a major research project and presentation. The feedback on assignments is very general and not at all helpful for improvement and understanding. The syllabus was not clear and asking questions didn't produce useful answers.

This class was a 1.5 credit hour class however the work load was much more than expected out of a 1.5. The feedback on the grading was very general instead of giving direct feedback on the papers so the students would have an opportunity to learn to improve their grade. 
Nice professor though!

The expectations of this course far exceeds the 1.5CR hours.  The syllabus isn't detailed on the required assignments (2 minor papers, 2 major papers, and a recorded 15-20 minute presentation).  There were also required meetings outside of class with a randomly assigned group to discuss final project topics and progress.
Horrible professor. Doesn't really teach and gives assignments without actually teaching what's  on the assignment. Take the other guy
Gives out assignments without teaching concepts. is super dry and lectures are useless but attendance is mandatory. Slides have not been updated in years

Very knowledgeable if you go to for help or ask questions. Otherwise, lectures are long and dry, often spent a lot of time repeating information from last class period. Exams are tough but fair - study the slides and reading and if you can actually understand the concepts instead of strictly memorizing arbitrary info, then you can do well.

One of the most straightforward professors I've ever had. The lectures can be long and dry, but the material (and the slides) are all easily understandable. There is only 1 midterm and a final project instead of a final exam. The quizzes are relatively easy if you just look over the slides, and the case studies are graded fairly.

While I feel like Professor Izzo is an extremely nice and caring person, that does not always translate well into teaching. The class is extremely unorganized and the slide-decks are almost incomprehensible. The exams are easy enough if you study, but other than that you are better off teaching yourself the material from a second-hand textbook.

She is a very nice and sweet person, but she is difficult to understand. Her classes were unorganized. There was sometimes 10-20 minutes of awkward silence during class. More importantly, I learned almost nothing from the class. The skills required for the assignments were not taught in class, so it's a self-learning class.

She is good person and she might had been a good professional, but she is not a good teacher. Her explanations are difficult understand. At first you might think that she is going to grade good to everyone but she will not. If you like the consulting and finance world it would be better if you spend the time reading or on other class.

You can tell when a professor actually cares about what they're talking about and that's exactly what this guy brings to the table, he cares about the material and his passion is contagious, which in turn makes the material easier to remember. 10/10 prof

Dr. Inks is my favorite professor at Ohio State. I've never had a professor that cares so much about their students and is so knowledgeable. His classes go by super fast because he is very interesting and also just an all around great guy. I didn't the tests were that bad as long as you read the book. 10/10 professor and person.

I don't understand why people are giving him bad ratings, Larry is a great professor who cares about his students very much. The exams are fair (I got 100% on both Exam 1 and 2, they aren't as hard as you'd think), and he curves them if needed. Your grade is only basically consisted of the 3 exams tho. My only complaint is that he tends to ramble.

You can tell he really enjoys teaching and cares about his students. Lectures aren't required but go! Out of 320 points, 20 are the 4 writing assignments and 300 are the 3 exams. As long as you attend lectures, take notes, READ THE BOOK, and follow his study guide you will do good. A lot of test questions involve applying the concepts and terms.

Every week there is at least two long chapters in the TWO required textbooks and (for me) prerecorded lectures and zoom lectures. He rambles on about nonsense, but it doesn't matter because the exams aren't on the content he teaches anyways. His exams suck and they are the only grades except for three 5-point assignments. He is pretty funny tho
Professor Inks is a cool guy, but the class can be tough. Lots of reading and exams are the main grades. Unstuck study was helpful for studying key concepts.
Dude only grades 3 exams and they're hard for what

He is a very interesting guy with engaging lectures but sometimes he gets off track. The class is based on tests only so if you grind the concepts you should be alright, it is a lot of memorization. Personally thought the first test was the hardest.
He is a great person and his lectures are pretty interesting. However, the class is based on exams and they are super difficult even if you study hard.

Professor Inks is a great guy, cares about students way more than the average professor. The class concepts are fairly easy to grasp, but he prides himself on "not teaching for exams", so studying 7-8 chapters at once with little to go off of can be difficult. Read the textbook and attend online/in person lectures!

He is a really cool guy who is pretty fun in my opinion, but not the best teacher. The tests are pretty difficult and the entire grade is just 3 tests. This makes it pretty hard to get a good grade. He requires a lot of reading as well which sucks. Just grind for the tests and you should be good. No attendance for lectures either.
Great guy, tough class

Super down to earth cool guy. Sometimes professors feel like just that, but its nice when a professor can be personable and make you feel like more than just a student. Unfortunately the exams are hard and those are basically all you are graded on. He doesn't necessarily teach to the exam so you have to do a lot of reading in the textbook.

I have never sat through more boring lectures of my life. I'm trying so hard to listen to the lectures but Inks just never gets to the point, he spent such a LONG way of explaining terms and concepts that I'm lost by the time he finish. I rewatched all his lectures at least three times over for his extremely subjective exams and it's not enough.

Professor Inks is a good guy.  He had good lectures that were interesting most of the time and often tried to tie in some current events as well.  The only downfall was that the only assignments were three exams that were worth I believe close to 80% of the grade which seemed kinda high.  Study lots of definitions for the exam.

No matter how much you study this course it is extremely difficult to do even average on exams. He does not "teach for exams" yet exams are basically the only grade and the averages are in the 60% range. Very great professor for what he teaches but the class is not a learning environment where you can succeed which is unfortunate.

Covers only half the material in online lectures that are posted every week, and is very definition based. Only had 3 in person classes over the whole semester, 1-2 weeks before the exam which was proctored online. Average for the first exam was only a 67% and didn't improve much on the second one. Only take if you have great time management skills
Screw this guy. Studied my ass off for test and half of questions were subjective. A lot of which is least false like wtf kind of technique even is that. Dont take this clown

Professor Inks is a very good guy, was very engaging. But the exams...... one of the hardest classes I have taken at OSU. The exams are pretty much the only grade in this class (besides the writing assignments), so if you do bad on one or two, you're screwed! Study everything in this class and still struggled on the exams, very misleading.

Dr. Inks is the best professor I've had at Ohio State. Great lectures, even on Zoom, covering really important material for anyone in the business school. Exams are challenging but fair, especially as he provides considerable study materials to help you. Writing assignments may take a bit but the questions are worth thinking about.

I loved Dr. Inks. He creates a very welcoming environment even on Zoom and he obviously cares about his students a lot. Gives lots of great advice. But the exams are hard. He's very upfront about how he grades and what type of things will be on the exam. If you don't study for the exam, watch the lectures, or read the textbooks, you'll struggle.

Absolute worst professor I have ever had. You can go to lecture and read the textbook all you want but it won't help at all. The exams are so objective to his own perspective and contain questions that ask impossible things like "Which one is the LEAST TRUE". LIKE EXCUSE ME WHAT?!?!?! I went to his office hours too and he was incredibly demeaning.

Easily one of the best professors I have had at Ohio State. Genuinely cares for all of his students' wellbeing and success. Navigated online learning with grace and transparency. I am so thankful to have had a professor that made a lasting impact on me and also taught me so much about HR, which is my specialization!

If you take this class seriously, I believe it's one of the most beneficial classes you can take, especially out of the business core. In addition, Dr. Inks is easily the most caring professor I've had. Such a great guy. Definitely attend/watch every lecture! For exams, he gives a great study guide and make sure you know every definition. Loved him

Dr. Inks is an amazing guy. He makes his lectures easy and explains the content exactly how you need to understand it for the exam. He really cares about his students and was really understanding about the new online format and COVID. Overall great professor.

Really nice and genuine guy, but he mentions repeatedly that he does not teach to the exam (AKA his lectures are relatively not helpful for exams- you have to read the textbook). Although he is nice, the exams are practically your only grade so if you cant read the textbook you will not excel here.

Prof Inks is a very caring but tough professor, I dont understand why the exams are so difficult. You can prepare in advance all you want, but it is hard to feel actually ready for the exam. Highly recommend staying away from this class.

Inks is a phenomenal guy. However, do not take him for orgs. You need to study too much material for the tests which makes it nearly impossible to remember everything for the exam. My buddy takes the other professor and is killing it doing way less work than I am. The other professor is open note for the exams if you are taking it online

Larry is a great lecturer and I enjoyed attending the review sessions for the online section. I think the importance of reading the book is under-emphasized in this class. He tells you to read it but the recorded lectures are what is really encouraged, but they don't provide the specific content of the book. Would recommend taking in person.

expected this class to be a cake walk, it could've been and should've been but Larry likes to make his own tests very long winded and harder than they should be. It's probably not his fault that the material is some of the most boring but he does a very bad job of making this class bearable. Larry is a nice guy but a bad teacher.

Dr. Inks is very passionate and caring professor with deep knowledge in the area of consulting. A lot of the course material is self-explanatory, sometimes dry or interesting. I found it to be an easy A. 3 exams, 3 self-occasional reflections. Watch his modules online, study a little before exams and you will be fine! Great professor.

By far the best Professor I have ever had. He shows more of a passion for our future as individuals than anything. His lectures were not required, but I looked forward to attending because of the stories he would tell. He is an inspirational teacher that cares most about what you take away from the class that can help you in life. Amazing prof.

The online session is slightly harder than in person so be careful. All you have to do for this class is take notes on all the modules (or lecture if in person) and read all the bolded words in the readings assigned with some skimming. There are maybe 3-6 questions about the readings in the tests, so don't prioritize the readings, but its not bad.

Professor Inks is a great lecturer and he tries to make his material engaging. You need to get the textbooks and know the vocab from it for exams. The exams are very difficult but they are fair if you study and pay attention. He gives extra credit opportunities and he curves the class too. Overall a good class and a great professor

Larry Inks is one of the best professors Ive ever had. Yes, his exams are difficult, but do yourself a favor and take this class in person and actually go to class. Larry Inks does a great job teaching the material, and he genuinely cares about his students. Also, be sure to read the book because he asks questions directly from it.

Larry is a cool guy, someone you'd have a beer with, but his tests are way to hard for what the class should be. Many of the terms and graphs make sense in class, but once the test is in front of you, you become confused with the scenarios he throws out. He has a decent curve at the end, but it's not worth taking. Take the other guy instead.

DO NOT TAKE INKS. His exams are ridiculous and he will ask extremely obscure questions that are from the fine print of the text or the online lectures. You will learn NOTHING because the information is extremely surface level. Get ready to memorize meaningless lists of information without actually understanding what they mean.

The fact that I'm done with this class gives me more joy than anything. This is a horrible class with dumb stuff that you will never need in life. Coming in thinking everything is just HR and common sense. But I left every exam felt like an idiot.

Ha ha ha. This is the worst class with the worst professor I've ever taken at OSU. The materials were extremely irrelevant with you learn nothing from going to lecture. Inks' exams are the worst. They're abstract and don't make any sense. You can't use common sense for his class. He should just stick with teaching grad students.

If you look at this class through an overall life lens, rather than "business only," you'll realize that Inks teaches you a lot of things that will make you a better person in the future. The class itself isn't too bad if you read the textbook and keep up on lectures. Inks may have a reputation as a hardo, but he cares about all his students.

It's an embarrassment to our education system that this is a class. You can sit through hours of online lecture videos and get NOTHING of useful content. It's a pseudo-science course created purely by academics, and Prof makes the class unnecessarily difficult. Seems like a nice guy, but if you're forced to take HR, take it with another professor.

Took the online version of HR... eh probably going to get a C since I have done very average in the course. Watch the videos at speed 1.5x the normal speed and Larry talks at a normal speed. Very insightful professor and I wish I could have had him in an in-person class. Don't read the book/watch videos 3 days before exam. Stay on top of things.
Save yourself Inks is a very nice professor but not worth the heartache.

A AWESOME professor, but super difficult for the undergraduate level. He is mainly a graduate level professor and that is how he teaches. His tests are extremely difficult, but his lectures are fantastic. Has great knowledge from all of his experience, but get ready to READ! Everything taught pertains to you, and your future career.

He's a great lecturer with plenty of experience to make the things you are learning practical. He teaches you soft skills which are vital to success in the business world, and he truly cares about your success not only in the class but in life. Plus his curve is great.
favorite professor I've had at OSU, but makes you work for your grade. Don't skip lectures and don't fall behind on the readings. This guy truly cares about his students.

Dr. Inks is an awesome guy. He is the probably the most caring and willing-to-help professor I have had at Ohio State. He really does care about his students, and he treats each individual as a person rather than just a number. Unfortunately, basically the only thing that is graded are three very detailed and convoluted exams. A's are rare.

Inks is an extremely frustrating professor to have. His exams are ridiculously and unfairly specific and hard. He is very hypocritical by constantly saying that he doesn't really believe in exams and hates giving them so he makes them very easy. The exam averages end up being C's. He promises to curve the class but only gave me a 1% curve.

Larry is a super awesome guy; he genuinely cares and is pretty funny. But the course is JUST 3 exams and he makes them dummy hard. Not too difficult to get a B if you put in work, impossible to get an A. It's only reading 2 textbooks and watching videos. I'd take other guy for easiness, but Larry is still way cool

Crappy class don't take it unless your toby from the office and have a passion for HR. Class is extremely hard for concepts that will not help you in your career what so ever. News flash buddy HR is extremely easy in real life no one needs to know who created what motivation model.
Great professor. You need to budget a lot of time for his class because there's a lot to it. He's a great guy and a great teacher though. Every student wanted to meet him in person.

This class was easy but that could be because I'm genuinely interested. Inks is funny in his lectures and genuinely wants you to not only learn the material but learn about yourself and who you are as a leader. He is very good at what he does and I hope I get to take a class with him again soon!

He is a good guy but he is the one who holds the most difficult exams ever. His lecture only covers a small part of textbooks which means you have to work harder on your own. If you want to get a good grade, don't choose him. If you want to learn from the lecture, don't choose him. If you want to check your independent learning ability, choose him!

Professor Inks is one of the best professors Fisher has to offer. He is incredibly kind and caring, but also expects a lot from his students (in a good way). I am inclined to go to class because of the actual knowledge I receive from his lectures, not because of an upcoming exam, my grades, etc. You will regret not taking him.

The content Larry teaches is the most useful content you will get in college. You must go to his class to do well, but his lectures are fun to go to. I loved his class and it was probably my favorite class at OSU

Really does well making dry material more palatable, keeps things light and is genuinely interested in helping his students to be successful He says you need to read the books as the class goes along to pass, this isn't true, he will ask questions from the text on the exam but if you read the chapters quickly a few days before the tests you're fine
He's a good guy and inspirational in class, but his exams are way unreasonably difficult for the content he's teaching. There's no reason for the exams to be that hard.

Larry is a great guy and will share a lot of useful real life information. That being said, I've had him for 2 classes and he makes it very difficult to get a good grade in them with his unnecessarily difficult exams that he doesn't help prepare you for at all.

HR is the MOST boring class you'll ever take. Larry is a really nice guy but bad professor and unhelpful when it comes to preparing for exams; I asked many questions about what was important and all he ever said was "you need to know it all." 3 exams, SO UNREASONABLY DIFFICULT. My study guides were 27 pages per exam and I still only got Bs

The only grades in this class were 2 midterms and a final (none were cumulative). Since this was an online class, we only saw Inks in person was for the "mandatory" review sessions the week prior to each exam and during each exam. The review sessions were not helpful because they weren't structured, he only took student questions. Lots of reading.

90% of grade is 3 exams, other 10% is "reflections" throughout the semester (on the first day he tells you when all the reflections will be). Lectures aren't too bad- he has a lot of hands one experience that keeps it somewhat interesting. Tests can be very tough unless you know the right way to study (which he tells you on the first day).
His classes feel about 2x longer than they actually are. He tells the same story at least 4 times. I don't know if I've taken a more boring class with a more boring professor.

Professor Inks is great. He really cares about his students and will help you if need be. Tests are pretty easy if you find the secret to them. I'm glad I had two classes with him in my college career. Great teacher and a great guy.

Dr. Inks makes an otherwise dry subject very interesting. He has great stories and life experience and weaves these seamlessly into his passion for teaching. Class is fairly easy - know the PPTs and bold terms in the book and you will get an A.

There are only three test that account for 90% of your grade. The class is pure memorization. The lectures are boring, but he tries to make them less boring. Only need the book to memorizes vocab words. Even though class is boring just go to class a pay attention and don't read the book until two days before test to look at vocab words

Inks was a great professor.   Lectures were engaging and he has a lot of real-world experience.  Textbook is necessary, but all you really need to do is know the vocab terms in the readings.   Download the powerpoints, go to lecture, take notes, and read the vocab terms, and you'll be fine.

This class brings a whole new meaning to the word "boring." 3 non-cumulative exams, each covering about 7,000 slides with novels of useless information on every single one.  Asks the most specific questions possible on exams. Over emphasizes the importance of each subject in class, when in reality I'm sure he knows it is all useless. Stay far away
An amazing professor who really cares about his students. If you have any problems, absolutely go see him and you'll understand. Cannot recommend him enough.

Professor Inks is the single best professor I have ever had. It is extremely obvious that he truly cares about his students. He wants his students to take away real world knowledge, not just answers for his exams. If you put forward decent effort, it is not difficult to earn at least a solid B  or higher in his class. Highly recommended.

A very intelligent guy.  I learned more practical and useful information in this class than I have in any other Business GE Course.  His tests are tough and I studied an average of 8-10 hours for them and got an A in the class.  They are pure memorization from his slides and the definitions in the textbooks.

Dr. Inks my absolute favorite professor at OSU.  I had him for 3200 and 4324.  He is extremely knowledgeable (real world application, not just the textbook stuff).   He genuinely cares about his students and teaches you for life, not just for the course.  Exams are tough (multiple choice though), but if you prepare you'll be just fine.
Awesome person

Class is pretty tough especially since almost no one in the class is an HR major. Inks is a cool guy but lectures are boring and the readings are very long. HR stuff seems like common sense, but exams are a little tough.

Overall this class really teaches you what its supposed to, and he makes a boring topic as interesting as possible. There is no homework or anything except three mandatory days you have in class assignments. The only problem with this class is the exams are a bit difficult. But if you do all the readings you can get a decent grade.

Fantastic professor and you will get a lot from this class if you are even somewhat interested in it, so fantastic for HR majors.  As mentioned, has 3 exams 100 points each and 3 pre-announced, easy in-class exercises for 5 points each.  For exams, just know the key concepts study guide and bolded terms in the book and you'll do well.

cool guy but the test are ridiculously hard, he forgets most of us aren't HR majors. Strict memorization all multiple choice, very annoying and overly complicated class. You have to remember a lot of arbitrary charts and diagrams, it would be much better with written tests.

Larry is an awesome guy, but his lectures barely cover test material. His tests are really tough. If you are an HR major I highly recommend taking this class with him because he would be a great resource for life, otherwise I would take this course with another professor where it will be much easier.

Great professor overall. You don't have to show up for lectures or buy the books but of course your grade would be better if you did. He is very clear in lecture and entertaining to listen to. There are 5 mandatory days; 2 test days and 3 "classwork" days.

Tests are very difficult. Everything sounds so obvious in class then the exams are so detailed. Good guy, terrible professor. I'd go to him with questions in real life HR, but he doesn't get that most of us aren't majors in HR. Way too hard for what it should be.
He makes easy material sound difficult.  All memorization and tests are hard.  Hardest Prof for HR

This is a very hard class, don't get me wrong, but Dr. Inks is the best professor I've had at Fisher. Always willing to meet with students and is very interesting to talk to. He is a useful source to find out how corporate HR departments work and what they want in a employee when you are looking for an internship or job.
Hardest professor in Fisher. Avoid him if you can. His exams are extremely hard.

I dont know what everyone is talking about. If you go to class and read the text book you can easily get a good grade in the class. Lots of memorization but he doesn't get to tricky on the exams. You either will know the material or wont.

Pretty much everything that needs to be said has been said. He's a great lecturer, very engaging. Quite a decent person, approachable and willing to help students. Just be prepared for a lot of memorization, some exam questions come directly from the book which I didn't buy, but I still got through. Not a bad class overall, go Larry!

If you have a high gpa, take this class in your last semester because the grade you earn won't be factored into latin honors. This class is abhorrent to the ideals of higher education - pure memorization of pp slides and textbook definitions that are not applicable to the real world, unless you're majoring in hr...

I took this class as a distance learning class from the Newark campus. Dr. Inks is a excellent instructor and really cares about helping his students understand and apply the material.To get an A, you have to do well with the take-aways, memorize ALL of the slides, and know the definitions from the book. This was a great class!

He is a great professor and keeps the class engaged during lectures. His tests are pure memorization from the lecture notes. The only reason you need the textbook is for the vocabulary terms, which he will ask about on the exam. There are opportunities to earn extra credit. Go to class because he will ask questions on the exam straight from lecture
Great teacher, but tough class. Read the book!!! The exam is all memorization, which is difficult to do with how boring some of this material is. But larry does a great job in lecture

He is a hot silver fox that is genuinely interested in helping students. 3 exams based on memorizing charts and highlighted terms in the textbooks as well as 3 "takeways" which he tells you the dates of ahead of time. They are easy opinion questions. There is no reason to not do well, the notes are online and we had the chance to get extra credit.

unnecessary make the class hard.dont take it if u don't need to.exams are hard and tricky...professor is nice and helpful but the class is all memorization.So,if u can memorize A to Z than its worth taking otherwise not.watch out for the 2nd exam.

Larry is the best prof I have had yet at this school.  He made me want to attend lecture and he is really knowledgable.  Down to Earth guy that shows clips and things that keeps students interested.  His tests ar not easy by any means.  Must know the material very well to get an A

There's a few things to know about this class. for one, larry is a good guy. however, his tests are utterly pointless. in most classes you can learn the material and be fine for a test. with him, it's all memorization. you have to memorize the 5 points of a start in clockwise order... come on larry. plus, his jokes are rehearsed (dr. fear)

Dr. Inks is a good teacher.  He teaches you a lot of useful information that is helpful for interviewing and working.  However, his tests are very hard.  It's pretty much all memorization for 3 50 question tests.  So if you can memorize everything you read and he says, then you're good.  Not the easiest.

Basically the best teacher I have ever had. Makes the two hour class go by very fast and is very engaging. Never once fell asleep in class, he keeps you awake the whole time. Only reason you need the book is for the bold definition terms.. which is awesome. Tests aren't too bad if you attend class.
easy class if youre good at memorizing a lot of information, but he is a great teacher. the material is fairly boring, but he made it interesting. would recommend and would take again if possible

This is a class of memorizing other's opinions. Do NOT take it as a class you don't need to study for--it will not work out well for you. We received a total of 8 bonus points and a 1% curve, but just make sure you don't blow it off.

Dr Inks is basically THE MAN. If you approach this is just another requirement you'll dislike it, but if you just give it a shot and consider the implications of what you're studying and what he says, you'll be so much better for it. He's a great teacher, really surprised me. Take this with him.

3 (multiple choice) non-cumulative exams make up your grade. Really friendly, funny, and helpful (if you go to office hours). Course is easy if you read the 2 textbooks, and memorize lecture slides. Easy B or A-, really has to work for an A.

Redundant course. Not really practical. Basically a test of "how good is your memory?". Tonnes of material, out-of-the-book questions on exam, little focus on real issues. Exams are hard, material is easy relatively.

There's not a ton of material in this class. Inks enjoys talking about his experiences in business rather than the general theories listed in the text. Most of the material is something we'll have to experience rather than memorize, so I found the class pretty squishy and worthless. HR701's better title is "The Life of Larry Inks"
Dr. Inks is a great teacher.  His lectures are very helpful for once you graduate school.  Know the powerpoints and the definitions from the book and you should at least get a B.

one of the best professors i had in FCOB, makes class interesting , shows clips and movies, loves teaching , and is very easy to talk to. just dont be an idiot , pay attention and try to apply some of it to your own life. thats all he is asking. great class. but imo way too many models.
Larry Inks is the man! One of the coolest professors in the entire Fisher College. Great outside of class and pretty effective inside the classroom as well.

If I was new to a firm and Dr. Inks was my boss, I would stay as long as possible!  An excellent professor, he made an 8:30 AM lecture much easier to get through.  In my own opinion (Larry, I know you're reading this and disagree), a lot of the material is common sense broken down into models.  Nonetheless, this stuff is very important to know

Absolutely love him!! He covered a lot of materials in class and some of the topics weren't that exciting, but Larry made things much better. Extremely willing to help and want students to do well. Easy to get A-, hard to get A.

The material for this class was sometimes interesting, and sometimes really boring.  Fortunately, Inks knows this and does a very good job keeping things moving at a good pace.  Mixes things up by showing us some good videos.  I would recommend both going to class, and doing the reading.  I slacked on both a bit and got an A- in this easy class.

Great! Would recommend to anyone! Very clear, knowledgeable, willing to help when asked. Never makes anyone feel stupid. Keeps lectures interesting with clips and great examples! Really seems to enjoy teaching!

Awesome Professor!! His lectures are far from boring and he shows tons of clips from The Office & movies to keep you interested. He is very funny too! He sticks to his lectures when it comes to tests. 3 tests worth 100 each and 3 "takeaways" worth 5 each. Go to class and you'll be just fine for the tests!! EASY A and Dr Inks is such a cool guy!
Awesome, knows what I need.  Easy....yet hard.

Larry will show you clips from various tv shows, documentaries and movies that are super entertaining. He is always to the point and his tangents almost relate back to the topic at hand. He is as nice out of class as he is in class. You will fly through this class with Larry.

He is a bit in your face at first, but he is awesome. Knows how to engage students and his course is very interesting and helpful. Get to know him on a personal basis; he can give great advice on interviewing, salary negotiation, internship/job search, etc. Definitely a top 3 professor Ive had at OSU.
Made class entertaining. One of if not the best professor I've had. I really enjoyed the class.

I genuinely enjoyed each of his classes.  One of my favorite professors at Fisher so far.  Asked for a lot of participation & introspection, making the class take on a more personal feel.  Showed clips from movies/TV shows almost every class.  Easy exams & takeaways.  "If you're going to be here, be here.  Use your computer for notes and not IMs."

Extremely interesting professor.  He's able to relate topics to his real world experience and also pop culture to keep people interested.  He's by far the best lecture professor I had and would highly recommend him.

I think this class is harder than people give it credit for. Still, he is a fantastic educator - best teacher I've had for a giant lecture class, that's for sure. He's pretty funny and engaging. Also, he's very helpful in office hours and willing to talk to you about random career stuff (interview advice, salary negotiations, etc.)
Best Professor I've had in college.  If he is teaching a course I suggest you schedule it.

Dr. Inks is a great professor.  He really enjoys teaching, which with the material as boring as it is, helps in the class. Very willing to help students, wants them to succeed.  He figures out his own grading scale, which is nice, because it's based on the class performance.  Would recommend getting the books, he does have exam Q's from them.
Very funny. Kept class entertaining.

This guy can be pretty boring. The material is easy, but you have to go to class and read the book. I have to force myself to stay awake every day and there are only 3 multiple choice exams with options A-E. The questions can be tricky. He means well and tries to keep you engaged and also shows a lot of video clips.

Dr. Inks is by far the best professor I've had at OSU.  He is a great teacher who genuinely cares about his students and has a terrific personality as well.  He is a lot of fun and attempts to make even the most boring of topics interesting.  His breadth of experience and wealth of knowledge regarding OB also shines through in his lectures.

The best professor I have had at Fisher! He gets you engaged in class, and he uses "real world" examples that help you understand and remember concepts. I never read the book and ended up with an A.  Just study his lecture notes, and make sure you write down details mentioned in class. He also plays funny clips from the Office in class :0)

Dr. Inks is a genius! He really knows how to teach boring stuff in a fun way. I had no interest in HR before taking his class, but now I am acutually thinking to change my major to HR. He is also a very nice person and cares about his students a lot. His exams are all multiple choices and easy. Go to every lecture to receive "giveaway pts."
Best teacher I have had at Fisher. He actually cares more about the students than the pay check unlike most teachers here.
definitely a great professor. highly recommend taking his class if you want to learn in a fun and entertaining way.
probably the best prof ive had.  makes boring material interesting, shows funny movie clips.  only terms in bold from book are on test.  great review sheet

Awesome Prof...Interesting lectures...Uses humor...Funny guy...Exams are not too bad if you read the material and attend lectures...I like his use of movie clips relating to topics...Has experience...One of the best at Fisher

Great professor.  Keeps class interesting with movie clips.  However, I found the exams to be rather hard.  I studied his review sheet and knew it front and back but was only able to pull off a B in the class.  Make sure you understand concepts. However, I do feel that it would be hard to get any grade lower than a C unless you didn't try at all.
Very professional, dedicated and inspirational in his delivery!

Great professor, is a very good person to get to know for future reference.  He has lots of experience.  Communicates class topics well.  Tests are not very difficult.  Go to class!  Study the review sheet.  averages were around 80% .  He makes class very fun, is great teacher
This class was so easy, it was boring. Inks was great though. He tried to make it interesting and relevant. Take this class when you're a senior, because you won't have to put much effort into it.
Best teacher I've had at OSU hands down...e'nuff said
I LOVE THIS MAN!!! Best professor by far. He didn't even apply for the job, he's a businessman.. Fisher college just asked him to teach because they know how awsome he is!!! TAKE HIS CLASS!!

Tries hard to keep the class interested by using video and asking questions, does very well at it I thought.  Uses "The Office" clips a lot, giving a nice break during lectures , but they aren't that neccessary due to the fact that he is one of the best speakers/lecturerers I've had at OSU.

Really nice guy.  He keeps the class interesting by showing video clips from TV shows and movies.  Attendence is taken 5 times throughout the quarter as "takeaways" which count towards your final grade.  Prof. Inks has a very nice grading scale, in which he averages the top 5 scores in the class and that score becomes the new 100%.  Recommended.
Great Professor!  He's clear, concise, fair, and interesting.  The only negative aspect of the class was the length.  He mostly goes the whole time every day.
By far the best professor I have ever had.  He is so interesting and knowledgable- you will learn a ton of stuff that you can actually use in real life.  Pretty easy to get an A too!

Easy A, however attendance is required, don't bother buying the book I didn't open it once and still got an A, Just Study his study sheet because everything you need to know is on that, highly recommend. Also generous curve at the end even though you wont need it

GO TO CLASS.  Kind of a Napolean like guy, every question on the test starts with "As discussed in class", has to have the reassurence that people are actaully paying attention.  Super nice, but you just want to hit him after the test.
this class is really easy, and its actually pretty interesting for the most part.  just go to class and look over the notes.
Dr. Inks is a good lecturer.  He has significant real world experience and puts the information in context.  I learned a lot in this course.  I would gladly take another class with Dr. Inks.

Man this class was so easy.  But then again I'm an ECE major so I'm used to having to work.  This guy is an outstanding lecturer and makes things interesting with movie clips and such.  Read the book for a while then realized that the exams are straight from the powerpoint slides.  Go to class though!

Quality professor!  Study his lecture notes and you will do great!  He goes straight off of those notes!  One of the best profs I have had here!  Funny guy too with a lot of movie clips!  This is what a professor should be like so take Inks if you can!  Go to class and study his lectures and you will get an A!
No Comments

Class was horrible, but it was spring quarter so def didnt want to be there in the first place. He is def willing to help. Dont take things as common sense and make sure you read and know the termonology well.

Dr. Inks has been one of the best professors I've had at OSU. He's a great lecturer who gives plenty of real world examples. He is more than willing to accomodate students outside of class and is anxious to give insight into the HR field. Tests are very straight forward. Attend class and do the reading and you're set.
Very good prof always willing to help. Definatly a class worth taking with him. Does the best he can with the material and brings in video's and real world examples.

I thought the exams were extremely easy and required very little studying. Even though he tends to keep you the whole time, he definitely isn't monotone and he does produce a lot of interesting facts and examples (ie movie clips), which does help getting through the class.

Very exciting class-love the content & presentation! Nice to have different formats (lecture/charts/video/radio)to break up 1-3/4 hrs. Nice try at interacting/students (7:30PM?). EXCEPTIONAL sharing of broad MHR experience. I find this class to be every bit as engaging as I hope my "dream" job will be! First exam was challenging, but fairly written
Tests are easy if you study his notes, which he puts on-line. Class is incredibly boring...he will keep you the entire time NOT MATTER WHAT
god he's boring... keeps you every frikken minute of class... even when he tries to let us out early. his exams suck too

I don't usually post on this website but I had to because he should easily be a 5/5. The energy Dr. Inks puts out is second to none at tOSU. It is not easy to find professors that genuinely seem to enjoy their job and help others get better like he does. As for the material, it is powerful enough to change your personal life outside of class.

It's very clear that Dr. Inks has a passion for teaching his students and genuinely wants to see them succeed. He always does his best to make lecture engaging, even if it is online. Definitely make sure to keep up with the readings and lecture videos, they can pile up very quickly for this class. Exams are straightforward and he curves nicely.

Pretty surprised to see all the disdain. He's very engaging, gives fair exams and practically no homework. Sure, the content can be a bit nebulous and too definitional but he's a solid, funny professor.

I do not understand why he gets a lot of hate. He is very clear with how much we need to know for our exams and goes into a lot of detail in the lectures. Plus he is super nice and really cares about his students. I wish I could take him for another class because I actually enjoyed his personality. Exams do make up most of your grade though.

Larry is such a sweet guy. You can tell he cares for his students and is interested in teaching the subject. He is very knowledgeable. However, he brags about the fact that he does not teach for the exams. You have no idea what to expect when going into the exams, and they are very tricky and worth over 95% of your grade. He just rambles in lecture

I can't believe this guy is still a teacher here, I'm pretty sure he helped sign the Declaration of Independence. The lectures do not help at all. If I had a dollar every time he said something of relevance in his lectures, I would be living on the street because I'd have no money and no knowledge. Mark Smith could teach this class better.

This guy is not good. I would not recommend taking this dude. It's almost like he is talking latin to us, it makes not sense. I could go to every class but I would still not do good. This guy thinks he is the king of Ohio State but really he is the person that sleeps under a bridge.

This is by far the hardest class I have taken their is no need for HR management to be taught in such a rigorous format. The format of the class is the worst I've every seen the professor says grades don't matter and demonstrates his belief by giving you 3 exams with "none of the above" as a choice for each question. Terrible class do not take Inks

He has no clue what he is talking about. He always says he talks to Executives about the HR stuff but I do not believe it for one second. This guy says that he does not teach for the test. He knows that we will not remember anything he says. He in fact does not "Stand on Business" he in fact "Stands on Quicksand" because his class is a sinking ship

He is one of my favorite professors I have ever had! The class is definitely one of my least favorite subjects, but he is so friendly and makes it clear is cares about his students (even in big lectures). You have to read the textbook or else you will not pass. I also highly recommend actually going to class because he does not share lectures.

Prof. Inks is a very engaging person. Outside exams you'll have 4 short homework assignments, and 2 extra credit opportunities. Exams are largely application based opposed to comprehension. Lectures are comprehension based which means in order to get a solid grade on the exams, you must READ THE TEXTBOOK where it has application based examples.

He is a really cool guy who is pretty fun in my opinion, but not the best teacher. The tests are pretty difficult and the entire grade is just 3 tests. This makes it pretty hard to get a good grade. He requires a lot of reading as well which sucks. Just grind for the tests and you should be good. No attendance for lectures either.

This guy does nothing besides talk about his past job experience and draw circles on the board. He seems like a nice and caring person, which could be true, but he acts like his class is all fun and easy when he asks questions like "which of the following is most true?" Teaches nothing and only grades off 3 exams. Save your mental health dont take.

Saying he is the worst "professor" at OSU is doing him justice. This guy has a napoleon complex and in return makes him exams next to impossible to pass. If you want to enjoy your semester and actually enjoy going to class I recommend picking another HR professor even if if messes up your schedule.

Professor Inks talks about how the course content is so important then spends half of his lectures gloating about his past careers. He is very passionate about teaching and his students but his exams are designed to give you a low grade in the class. I'd take this class with another professor if I could.

Tried to like this guy so hard, but just can't. Comes across as this caring, nonchalant, chill professor yet absolutely ruins students grades on his exams. Claims he doesn't try to trick students on exams yet asks questions like "which of the following is the least false" and also will try to trick students within answer choices. Do not recommend.

One of those professors that goes off topic and rambles about his life every lecture. This class is self-taught. To succeed: get the easy writing assignments done. Every chapter he assigns write down terms and learn the concepts. Pray for a 65 or higher on exams. Dont bother with lectures, serious waste of time.

Impossible to grasp understanding of material. Too much material to learn with a bad teacher teaching it. Only grades are exams. Exam questions make no sense with no clear answer. Overall, this class was a nightmare to take, i went to ever lecture and took notes on everything, got tutored and all just to end up with a D. Avoid Larry. Miserable.
Dr. Inks was a great professor. His exams are tough, but if you attend lecture and study for the exams an A is definitely possible. He is very open about what he is putting on the exam.

I am typically an A student but I can not stress this enough, Do not take this course with professor Inks. Three incredible hard exams that even the lectures do not prepare you for. Even reading each week did not help prepare me for his ridiculously difficult and subjective exams.

Professor Inks is a really great guy for a passion for what he teaches. He makes the content interesting and the topics cover will matter for the rest of your life. The grade is primarily based on the three exams throughout the semester, however, none are cumulative.

This class was awful. I signed up for an online course but he decided to put everything online despite the university opening from COVID. Your grade will be built entirely around 3 HARD exams. There is not a good way to study for them because the information is easy but the way he asks his exam questions are so hard.

Great speaker and gives good advice, but class is centered around taking what should be common sense and complicating it into complex theories and terms that you have to memorize to just apply the common sense concept on his exam. 3 exams are majority of grade and are very difficult. Makes you rely on a curve which is never good.

Grade is mostly based on 3 very difficult exams. Specifically need to study from the textbook even whats not covered in class. Make sure to do any extra credit assignments. Curve at the end of the semester.
Terrible Professor if youre there for the grade. Doesnt teach towards the exam and clearly says that multiple times. HR is a joke. Dont take him

While this class definitely takes some effort & you need to put work into it, Professor Inks is an extremely involved professor who cares so much about the content & his students. I don't think I have had a professor here at Ohio State that has cared this much. If you put in the work you will be fine, and honestly him as a person makes it worth it

He claims to teach for "life and not the exam," but just uses that as an excuse to never prepare you for tests. This is an HR class and this guy needs to take himself less seriously. Material is easy and understandable, but he finds ways to over complicate it during exams. HR is a joke of a subject and this man is a joke of a professor.
He's the man. One of the professors that I build a relationship with over time. Definitely take class with him.

Jesse is a wonderful professor. He wants all his students to do the best they can. Exams are difficult but he offers extremely generous curves. Group projects are a lot and graded pretty tough so make sure you have a good group. Fun fact this man was in a successful rock band back in the day and sued Logan Paul for ripping off one of his songs.
He cares so much about his students and is a great lecturer!

One of the best professors at Fisher. Prof Walker made his classroom such a fun place to be, absolutely loved his class. Teaches by using many examples which makes learning the material easy and fun!! Awesome sense of humor and genuinely wants every student to do their best in his class. Take Professor Walker!!

This was my favorite class in Fisher so far! Prof Walker is a genuinely kind person, gives super interesting lectures, and leads great discussions. There's very little homework other than studying for exams, and the homework we do get really helped me learn the material. Fun fact: he was also in a pretty successful rock band back in the day.

Boyer is the man. I had him for service ops and sustainable projects.  Projects is three hours long and it is the only class I'm excited to attend every week.  If you're an ops major take this professor.  (service ops and sustainable projects)
The lecture is not helpful, learning materials are useless, but exams are difficult. we don't know what he is teaching in class. He always makes mistakes, and he is even confused on solving problems.

Boyer is a terrible cannot figure out the example problems clearly Leanred nothing from him. I advice you to not take him, makes class very boring is not helpful. Spends more time saying  hes not going to go over things than he actually does teach. Worst professor I have ever encountered and would avoid him at all cost. VERY RUDE.

Ken Boyer is the ONLY BUSMGT 630 teacher that will properly prepare you for the tests.  He gives a few relatively easy quizzes and drops the lowest one.  The cases aren't that hard as long as you put in the work.  And he does a lot of in class practice to help you prepare for the mid term and final.  Much better than the other 630 profs.

Boyer is a good prof, you can tell he has a deep knowledge about the material and can usually communicate it clearly.  He likes to joke around with students and uses a lot of real life examples, which made an 8:30am class bareable! Read the book and pay special attention to the powerpoints.

Had decent expectations for this class that were dashed by some of the most deficient teaching skills that I've ever encountered. This class was a snoozefest of epic proportions. I really was looking forward to a fertile learning environment, instead I was trying to stay awake. Decent guy, but teaching skills that need to be taken to the woodshed.
This lecture…I can't.

One of the best professors in Fisher. Made the class very interesting and applicable to all majors. Just do what she tells you to do to prepare for her exams, and you will get at least a B on the exams. Highly recommend and have fun with her, she really tries to make the classroom a fun place to learn.

This is for Maneesh Ajjuguttu. When I signed up for this class I signed up for Newsome, came in the first day and didn't have her. I attribute 80% of my failures to lecture, I learned nothing, it was hard to read his writing and to understand most of what he was talking about. Just fell too far behind to climb out of the hole later in the semester.

Honestly, so many of the Fisher core classes are way too packed to provide a good learning environment but she tries her best to do so. I wished she could just focus on more important concepts instead because a lot of the challenging calculations and concepts are at the end of her slides and she runs out of time a lot.

Avoid, completely wastes your time in lecture going over the least demanding concepts and then will run out of time for the more intensive problems and concepts. Gives out a lot of busy work. You would be better off to not show up to class and just read the textbook on your own. Exam questions are worded to trip you up to keep a low class average.

This class wasn't terrible. Some of the material is out of date (warehouse productivity video from the early 90's) so it can be hard to convert that information into today's world. The 3 exams are not awful, you're allowed a cheat sheet with formulas/notes on exams. If you go to class and listen you will understand the material enough to pass.

Lots of algebra and math with the different processes in Newsom's class. Sometimes could get confusing but overall it was understandable. In-person lecture quizzes and 3 exams during the year. 1 exam was insanely difficult and other 2 not bad. You are allowed a page, front and back, for a cheat sheet on the exams. I recommend taking her for Ops.

There were weekly readings and assignments to do. Lecture material usually did not match up with recitation topics and both would be on exams. Exams were somewhat difficult and there was a lot of material to study.

Lectures were kinda all over the place. Not too much work for this class though, only homework due every week and 3 exams. The exams were tricky and heavily math-based but she gives you a cheat sheet to use. Go to her office hours if you are confused, she is a very nice person but not the best lecturer.

Best choice for Ops! You can tell she loves what she does and she communicates her lecture material easily. Recitations help a lot as well so definitely go to them. Exams are fair and you get a front and back cheat sheet which is nice. Some homework, but not bad at all. Would definitely recommend Newsom any day, really a great professor!

Personally did not enjoy Newsom's class- typical Fisher GE. Content is 99% common sense, very disconnected from the real world, and the exams carry a ton of weight. Allowed 1 page formula sheet for exams which is great, but doesn't make up for the lecture we watched a 45min video from the early 90's about "process improvement".
Love her! Her class is tough, but if you visit her in office hours, she's very helpful. Best ops professor :)

This class gives you plenty of opportunities to make the grade you want. She drops 7 of the homeworks and the content is relatively easy. Her lectures are actually pretty interesting and shes very well versed on the topic. Exams are also pretty easy so you can easily focus on learning.
I would definitely recommend going to lecture and recitation. Not going to them will hurt your grade. The class is not hard though. I think she's a great professor to take it with.

Newsom is a great professor for Operations Management. She keeps the lectures interesting, and recitations as well. She allows a page of notes for each exam, which I really appreciated. The class wasn't bad at all. I recommend her greatly.

Can be sort of "Mommy-Like" teacher at times, but other than that she is a very good professor. Final was kind of tough, but the Midterm and rest of the class aren't bad, so I had a 99.5 before the Final. I'd recommend not missing that many lectures, because the problems don't have solutions on Carmen.

30 percent of the grade is attendance. 30 PERCENT. In addition, Of the three hw types, one you get five shots at and the other is rounded up to 100 if you break 70 so 45% of points are free. Get a B+ on the exams you get an A, not A-, an A. INSANE

a GREAT professor to take into to ops with! Lectures and recitations are clear and you get points just for attending class. Midterm is very straightforward, final is a bit more challenging but she offers a ton of help and makes herself very accessible should you need her. Makes a potentially boring/hard class fun and very do-able.

Professor Newsom was one of the best professors I've had in Fisher. She is very knowledgeable and her lectures were very interesting. You have to attend class for lecture attendance points and in-class group work. If you take need to take intro to operations, try and take the class with Newsom!

Newsom is one of the nicest professors I have ever had! This is also the easiest class I have ever taken. You have to come to class to get your points but once you get to a certain point you no longer have to come. She gives great feedback and really cares about her students! I would highly recommend her!!
Took Intro to Ops(3230) with Newsom and she was amazing. Explains everything so well and prepares you for the exams. Easiest class I've taken. 10/10, would recommend.

As a transfer student from CSCC I knew this was gonna be one of the classes I had to take my first year at Ohio State. Its def a tough class and you have to study A LOT! However, Newsom was definitely a life-saver and was always available for office hours and responded quickly to e-mail. I ended up with an A- and give a lot of credit to Newsom.

4group projects.3exams (cumm.).5 in-class participation activities (will give points if answers are incorrect).She's super nice, helpful, & clear.Gave us 5pt. xtra credit b/c our 1st exam's avg. was so low. 3rd exam was easy (compared to other 330 instructors). No need txtbook. If you make errors on exams, she's very GIVING of partial/full credits.

She is one of the best professors I've ever had!!Don't need to buy textbook, she will give all the notes on Carmen. She grade really easy, as what she said, she grade very reasonable. You can even get full credit if you get the answer wrong but do all the correct work. Take her!

Heard horror stories about this class before taking it, but Newsom is a life-saver. She's extremely intelligent and loves to teach. She's very organized and clear and is ALWAYS willing to help. Exams are pretty straight-forward. Just study her lecture notes and do the practice exams and you'll be fine. I highly recommend her!!

Dr. Newsom is great! She lets you know exactly what she wants you to learn and how she is going to evaluate you. She is so easy to talk to and is always willing to help. She wants everyone to do well in the class. I highly recommend her!

BM 330 is a hard class no matter who your professor is. But Ms Newsom is great, she is very helpful. She wants her students to succeed. She is very flexible with office hours and is extremely helpful. Again BM 330 is hard but Ms Newsom is fair and a great teacher

Susan's online lectures are hit or miss, but the textbook and recitation sessions are essential. Lean on study resources like unstuck AI to supplement the course material. Exams are tough, so stay on top of the work. Overall, a challenging but manageable class.

Terrible professor. The online textbook is horrible. Tests are auto-generated by MindTap. No in-person lectures. Instead, old COVID-19 era videos where the audio only comes out of one headphone. She outsources all the work she could possibly do as an educator. Why become a professor at this point, Susan?

Susan knows the content and is probably helpful if you need her, but her lecture videos are kinda useless. If you have good recitation people who give out study guides and can explain the content well, then you're set. Not much you can do to control that, though.
You'll be better off ignoring all the lecture videos and reading the textbook. The TA's were the only reason I was able to get by. She's retiring so maybe a blessing in disguise
Susan is an absolutely terrible lecturer and the tests are a lot harder than the recitation problems. Overall this class is very tricky and I would avoid her if you could.

No in-person lectures and the video lectures she posted did not help at all. Basically had to teach yourself the material, which is unfair for a core class. Highest exam grade from the two times I took this class was a 70%. Unfairly drops some HW and attendance which hurts most people. AVOID HER IF YOU CAN.
Fully online lectures and in-person recitations. The online lectures are totally a mess, I couldn't learn anything from her videos. Textbook and recitations are much helpful.

Online lectures are useless. Reading the textbook and going to recitation will save you. Only graded by attendance, weekly quizzes and exams. Even if you get 100% on all of the quizzes and attendance, you can still only get 2 questions wrong per exam (4 exams) to get an A.
I really enjoyed this course. Prof Clark did a great job explaining concepts in the videos and I was prepared for exams from the recitation problems and textbook problems.

Never met Susan because her lectures are online. Lots of homework. Recommend reading textbook over her lecture videos if you are going to choose one. Recitation TA's made everything much easier to understand, and the TA's in the tutor room help just as much. Definitely read the textbook and utilize the resources you are given.

Susan teaches everyone intro to finance the way Ty teaches everyone business presentations... though lecture videos. Overall her lectures are so confusing the first time you watch them SO GO TO EVERY RECITATION!!! I would rewatch her videos to study and I found that helpful. Overall she is okay just make sure you don't fall behind!

professor clark is a very nice teacher and definitely cares a lot about her students. the class can be difficult as it covers a lot in a short time, but with practice you can easily understand the math and concepts. the tests are fair and a good portion of the grade is determined by homework.

Never met Susan and her online lectures were unhelpful. TAs are the only saving grace, but even they were limited in that they only went over practice problems. Content was essentially self-taught and there were no grade curves. Some exam questions were extremely picky details from the textbook not highlighted in lecture/recitation.

class is horrible. online lectures and only recitations for actual learning. will mostly be learning on your own. exams can be difficult too. Susan Clark is a nice lady though who will help you but the class does suck

Horribly run class, especially for a core business course like this. Susan basically does nothing, the only time I saw her the whole semester was through a computer screen on her awful lecture videos that look they were recorded circa 2007. The whole course is taught through your TA, who also presented the material horribly.

Susan doesn't really do anything. Her lecture videos are short and barely gloss over how to do problems. She does not give averages on Carmen for exams which is suspicious in itself. The course is basically run by her TAs.
Her lectures are very poorly structured and require a lot of textbook reading. The class is also weighted 70% on 4 exams and the only other grades are homework.

Absolute joke of a class. Didn't see Susan once throughout the entire semester because of her only using pre-recorded lectures as course material. I met more times per week for a 1 credit hour elective class than I did for this 3 credit hour mandatory business class. Hopefully you have good TA's because they are the only people you will see.
Useless lectures that she just reads off the slides. Hopefully your TA can help because she won't.
Horribly lazy lecture videos. Entirely self taught with zero help except from TA's. She does not care about you or your grade.
there was no teaching, all self taught.

Horrid class structure. Don't expect a curve, she is lazy professor using covid recordings as her lecture. Tests are stupid, math is easy but the conceptual questions are stupidly wordy and difficult. Good luck.

Far and wide my class experience ever. Susan legitimately did not do anything but shove an online textbook in our faces at the beginning of the semester and say good luck. Honestly have no clue what she contributed to the class besides her lecture videos that covered ~1/3 of the exam content. Despised it from the start. Extremely unorganized class.

Horrible Professor. Taught NOTHING. Lecture videos are confusing and pointless. I would study HOURS for exams and do bad due to confusing questions not mentioned in the lecture or recitation. I pretty much had to teach myself this entire class. No extra credit or curves. She did not open her SEIs at the end because she knew we would rip her apart.

Her grading policy is simply illogical. It punishes hard working students by dropping 3 homework assignments. If you do well on the homework assignments, dropping 3 actually hurts your grade as it did with me. Also, lecture videos are borderline useless. She just regurgitates the textbook. I learned more from my TAs than I did from her videos

You have to read the textbook in order to do well because her lecture videos are really short and barely help. Go to the recitations because they do help, but to reiterate, you basically have to teach yourself. The exams are pretty difficult and each question is worth 4 points, so you can't miss too many questions or you'll do terrible.
Horrible professor. Make your own review sheets, look at TA reviews, less repetition. The only good thing I got from this class is a job referral to J.P.Morgan from one of her TAs.

The pre-recorded lectures and the recitations are nothing like what you expect on the exams. She just reads of the slides, and you essentially have to teach the course to yourself. There is no curve for this class either and she's the only professor who teaches the class and this class is basically designed to just fail you.

Her very brief, pre-recorded lectures do not prepare you for the difficulty of her exams whatsoever. She is also dishonest about class averages in order to avoid curving the class. I would suggest taking the class with another professor but unfortunately, she is the only lecturer. More annoying class than 2320, 2200, and 2300.
I only met her once, she seemed nice but she taught me nothing. The lectures barely touch anything on the exams and you quite literally have to each yourself the entire course.

The online videos give you minimal information and it feels as though professor Clark is just reading off the screen. To succeed you need to put in lots of effort on your own time by reading the book and taking detailed notes. I scored significantly above average on every exam and still only had a B+.

Susan practically does nothing. Pre recorded lectures for each section and she holds office hours one day a week for a total of 2 hours. Have a class during her office hours? You will never see her the entire semester. Class is essentially TA taught. It would be really nice if she could provide a paper of formulas for each chapter, or a study guide
She doesn't care about her students and its very clear. Went to office hours and she literally told me she probably confused me even more.

She is a nice lady but absolutely horrible. She never explained anything in lectures so everyone was confused. TAs were clueless and constantly made so many mistakes. The tests were also super unnecessarily hard and weighted extremely heavily using Proctorio. Unfortunately she is the only one that teaches this course so you are stuck with her.

Literally taught by her TAs. I came to the 1pm office hour and one of the TAs had 1 summary slide she gave to her recitation that basically sums up the entirety of class (>30 slides). She explained the concept really well and gave it context from outside of class.

Not a good professor AT ALL. She really does not care about her students and her exams are unnecessarily hard. Very unfortunate that she is the only one that teaches this course. Her TA's are very inexperienced and her lectures were very pointless. I had to teach myself with the textbook. Glad I never have to worry about this class again.

Class is difficult, lectures do not teach you what you need to know on exams. The amount of time needed for each exam question will little time to take the exam is nearly impossible. You will be teaching yourself finance. Recitations just work through problems that the TA's already know and understand.

Extremely difficult course. 75% of the grade is based on exams (3 midterms, 1 final). The final is cumulative.  Exams are very tough and she barely covers any material in the lectures. Exam questions cover things that were never went over in class. Unfair class and exams

Most difficult professor I have had. The TA's even complain that most of her exams are very unfair and cover not even half of the material she talks about in her lectures. They told me to really study off of Mindtap because the questions come from there. There's only 3 exams (not 4 anymore) with one final, but all very brutal.
Best professor at fisher! Very passionate in finance and inspired me to do more in the realm!
Tests are difficult, but there are other opportunities to get a good grade.

Really organized class and is not time-consuming. The lectures are very clear and she explains things well. There are like 6 exams in this class which was annoying but you get to drop one. She focuses heavily on the math problems so you have to read the book to understand the concepts for the exam. Nice professor.
Really good professor, helps explain things really clearly, and was super helpful at essentially explaining everything that you needed to know for exams.

Pretty straightforward professor. Watch the lectures and video modules and do the homework and the class won't be bad at all. Some of the exams were a little bit difficult but that is expected in any class. I recommend.
very straight forward and clear, all you have to do really is practice the recitation problems and review the concepts and the tests are an easy A
5 midterms and a final is unnecessary. Exams were very difficult. Not structured very well. Didnt like this class at all

5 exams + a final was just awful, not too much homework, but this was pretty unbearable at times. She would just post the lectures with examples and you have to watch them. It was pretty easy for it being 100% online. If you put in the work, you will get a good grade.

Professor Clark does not know how to teach an intro-level finance course. The class is very exam-heavy and I hated how we had exams every two weeks 5 exams plus a final which is insane.
