I never had to take that many exams for any of my other classes. She thinks her class is the only class students are taking, put in the effort you will pass.

Susan is by far one of the laziest professors I've ever had. Her lectures skip over at least half of the material she puts on her exams, and doesn't even let you see your old exams to study from. You basically have to teach yourself the class. Really, the entire class is taught by mindtap, not Susan. Also, 75% of your grade is based off the tests!!

Do not try to rely on her lectures because they only cover half of the material on the exams and homework. She likes to think that we know every basic term she uses and skims over everything. This class is also very test heavy and you will need to use the book to teach yourself everything. I do not recommend this professor.

It is hard to understand the concepts because she doesn't seem to get that this is the first finance class the a lot of students are taking. She teaches like we already have a basic knowledge of the subject. She seems like a nice lady and class is manageable, but kind frustrating if you actually want to learn.

Professor Clark is a great professor. She is very knowledgeable on finance and knows how to teach that to students. She definitely cares for her students and wants them to learn. If you study for exams and do practice problems, you'll do great.

Professor Clark was not good at explaining any concepts and half of the exam consists of conceptual questions. Her lectures are not helpful at all and she reads from the slides. It did not feel like an introductory finance class. Her exams were nothing like her lectures. I wish Marc Smith taught this class he actually knows how to explain things!

Professor Clark did not spend enough time covering the conceptual questions that were on each of the exams. All of her lectures are not helpful for the tests. Be prepared to spend a lot of time studying and reading the book/doing practice problems. Overall, do not take her for this class unless you have to do it.

This class is forgiving with hw + several tests but you have to put in the effort. Susan tends to vaguely gloss over things as if she's refreshing the memory of business executives instead of college students learning this material for the first time. She's much better in recitation but she only covers about 50% of the test. You'll need the book

Professor Clark is one of the better professors. To be honest the class mostly depends on your own desire to learn. The homework grade is an easy A, but the class is very test-heavy. She drops one of them, but make sure you study. If you put in the work that is required you will do fine. Overall if I had to take a class with her again I would.

Susan is by far the worst Professor I have ever had. She is not approachable at all. She does not teach and all she does is read off the slides. The slides and book have like nothing in common. Do not take this class with her unless she is the only option left. She will make you hate your life. You have to teach yourself in this class.

I didn't learn anything concept-wise because she merely reads off the slides and doesn't explain anything in lecture. Exams are 25 questions so if you miss 2 you're already at an A-. Quizzes and homework are easy points. I also don't understand why exams are scheduled at 9pm. Doable class but she's not that great at teaching and exams are annoying.
tough class and her lectures are very boring. exams were so so difficult but ended w a b because there was so much homework and discussion posts weekly
Very difficult tests and not willing to make accommodations about exam times.
Hard class, shes not the best at explaining clearly. way to much work fr.

She's nice when you ask her a question about the material, and will help you. The class itself isn't that hard, but I felt she made it hard by being so disorganized and unwilling to listen if you had a problem that led you to perform poorly on a test/assignment.
Professor Clark is a great professor. She somehow manages to keep an introductory finance class kind of engaging so kudos for that. I would definitely recommend taking her class.

Susan Clark is a great lecturer and it's a straightforward class. If you attend lecture and recitation and study for the exams you will be fine. You need to understand the conceptual information and not just the quantitative side to do well.

Be prepared to learn by yourself. She doesn't know how to teach finance at this level. Tough grader for the case, because she graded it based on the "accuracy". If you have other opinion which deviate from the answer sheet she got for the case, you gonna screwed in this one. Basically, she teaches this class by using others teaching materials.
great class structure

Very good and caring teacher, the subject material is just hard to grasp and the exams aren't cumulative but they build on each other. So make sure to stay on track and learn all the concepts as they are introduced before you fall behind. You can show up to any lecture and recitation you want, so it's nice to be able to choose your favorite prof.

Susan is definitely in my top 5 favorite professors at Ohio State. She gives me the "cool grandma" vibe and is so funny and knowledgeable. She knows what she's talking about and she knows exactly how to prepare thousands of people to take her exams. I love love love her and would recommend her for everyone

Despite having 1200 students, Susan is very organized and her class runs smoothly. She puts everything you might need on the website (videos, slides, quizzes, etc.). Reading the text is important for the exams. Asks a lot of theory-based questions in addition to the finance problems. Tests are only 20 questions so the margin of error is small.

Lecture not necessarily needed with online recitations and lots of in-person available really helping students. Gives manageable online quizzes and then 3 exams that if you do her suggested problems you do well in the class. One of those profs who is there for the students and enjoys it.
Amazing professor. Very helpful and willing to go out of way to help a student pass.

Susan is a great teacher. She helped me a lot when I ever had questions with the material. Class is not too bad. Watch the videos, go to lecture, and go to recitation. And please do the practice exams, they were very similar to the actual exams.

I thought she was a good lecturer, until I figured her tests had nothing to do with what she taught during class: lectures were too easy. I felt all my work was wasted. I tried to read textbook myself for final and that worked better.

Susan is really nice, pretty funny, and is a solid lecturer. Finance is extremely dry, but she does her best to make it fun. I do think she overcomplicates some things, but with some self-study you should be okay. I'd recommend NOT enrolling in the online recitation; I didn't put the work in, and being required to go to an in-class would've helped.

Clark was very helpful in lecture and wants to make sure you actually know the material. Clark and Wellman post online recitation videos, but going to the in-person recitations helped me more because they explain more. Reading the textbook helps you understand conceptual questions. The exams are similar to the recitation problems & practice exams.

Susan is very nice and explains things well, however class consisted of 4-5 examples and some powerpoint and lectures which didn't help much when it came to harder material. Its a lot of self studying, class did not help much.

Susan makes learning relatively difficult material extremely easy.  She is there before and after class if you need her and is always willing to help.  The class itself is not hard at all.  If you just watch the videos, go to lecture, and recitation then its easy A.  Would take another class with Susan in a heartbeat

Amazing teacher. The course is extremely manageable. She isn't one of those .... who tries to get you with sneaky trick questions. Her class is very straightforward and to the point. She is always there to help you if you need it, too. I highly recommend taking her class if you need it. 11/10

Attendance not mandatory, you can go to whichever lectures and recitations you want even with different profs. Final grade determined by a few problem sets and the exams. Tough class bc it's easy to push off material and fall behind. Attend classes and do practice problems! Barely curved the exams. Didn't use textbook

Professor Clark is probably the best professor I have ever had! Her lectures are super clear, she goes above and beyond to help you learn the material, and she is just an awesome person. I highly recommend her!

Oh my god is this class easy, and Professor Clark does her best to make sure the whole group does well. All you have to do is go to lecture, go to recitation, and study recitation problems / lecture materials to get a good grade. It's an intro level finance course, and god bless Professor Clark for teaching us the material because it's so simple

Great professor. Has a setup similar to Marc Smith's intro to accounting classes. Not quite as good, but I like the fact that there are clear things to do for review, I really appreciate when professors lay that out for you.
One of the best professors at Fisher. Really works to make everything easy to understand and help out in anyway.

She is awesome! Tough class, but if you do the practice problems and work at it, you'll be fine. She is the nicest lady ever, super chill, and just a Bro.  If you do poorly in this class, it won't be because of her. Susan is the bee's knees.
She is an angel. So Nice
Teaches way too fast

Great professor, very helpful, case studies aren't that difficult. She grades fairly, gives good exam reviews, and is willing to help anyone individually who asks for it. Class isn't super exciting but you learn a lot if you pay attention and attend. Also, people aren't lying, she is a very attractive woman. Highly recommend Susan

I only had her for recitation, but she was very friendly and enthusiastic (but not overly), which made an 8 AM class bearable. She genuinely wants to help and wants everyone to do well. Her teaching is very straight forward and clear.
Good prof. She writes really quickly on the board, like that matters. Exams are fairly simple, average is in the 80's. Cases are so so.

Susan is a great teacher, she teaches you what you need to know without making you learn a bunch of useless stuff. The tests are fairly easy, the work problems are similar to the practice ones. I would take her again for any finance class, she makes it enjoyable. I definitely recommend her.

I loved the class and she was a great teacher for it. She made it really interesting and fun to go to class and learn the material. I thought it was pretty easy, I highly recommend her and will be taking her again in the future.

I was very interested in the subject matter before I came into the class. However, even if you aren't I highly recommend Prof. Clark, she is a great teacher! If you go over the assigned problems, you'll have no problem doing well in the class. If you have the opportunity to take any class with her I highly recommend it.

I love this kind of stuff so i thought the class was easy, but she is a great teacher! she made it very interesting, she told great stories in class. if you do the practice problems and go to class you should be fine on the exams.
Super easy! Take her!!
Not as easy as shes made out to be. She doesnt cover all the info you need in class so make sure you READ THE BOOK and do the problems in the book.

Susan is a great professor. Her notes are simple and clear and she moves fast, but is happy to slow down to explain stuff in more detail if you ask. Exams were fairly easy (averages were 84,85,89) but there's no curve in the class. Quizzes weren't too difficult either, but be prepared for a pop quiz or two.

GREAt tEAChER! She gives you study guides for all of the midterms/final which are non-cumm. Gives 6 quizzes and lowest one is dropped (2 were take home, 2 were open note, 1 was hinted to study for, and 1 was a total surprise). NOt bAd! She is soo helpful and answers any questions. dEfiNitELY tAkE hER!

Very good instructor and she is great to talk to. Fairly straight-forward tests and I feel like this is one of the best classes I took in Fisher. Only complaint are the sometimes unannounced, closed-book quizzes

Not bad, but not as easy as everyone makes it out to be. She would be a much better professor if she used online quizzes, like other 721 isntructors, instead of unannounced, closed book quizzes at 8:30 AM. Very attractive

She is great! Easy class. Lets you use notes on some of the quizzes. Gives a study guide before the tests, and the tests only cover material on the study guide. She is easy to understand, and is a good teacher.  She's kind of hot in an older woman way, but yea, def take her if you can! Not much work compared to 620
Good teacher!  Tests are straight forward and based on what she goes over in lecture.  If you are taking finance 521, I would recommend taking her class.
The course isn't anything absurd and you can succeed if you work hard. However the professor is an old as dirt, and very rude to students. His attitude is unacceptable to be teaching students.

Lectures are useless, he gives minimal materials, and the entire class circles around one singular textbook that is unorganized and written entirely by him. Very nice and caring guy, but I cannot believe this course not only exists but is a business req. Tests are horribly made and make up well over 2/3rds of your grade. No one even shows up. Bad.

His class can be boring, but he seems like a genuine professor. I recommend understanding his book. The book is easy to understand. Memorize the cases and their results. He goes over the material in class. Because class was in the evening many students didn't show up (including myself).

He may know what he is talking about, but he is not able to explain it concisely or thoroughly at all. The course structure is set up to make you struggle. I studied so much, went to every lecture, and still got a 60 on the final. The wording is meant to trick you. Basically, do everything you can not to take this class if you want an A.

prof. blackburn is SO kind and cares so much about his students. i spoke to him after probably every single class, and he had so much advice to offer. HOWEVER... this class sucks lol. he really doesn't actually teach you anything during lecture, so you'd be fine just reading the textbook and studying that.

Clueless class. If I weren't a law nerd, it'd have been tough. The professor rambles about his daughter and nonsense. I only attended the midterm and final—finished both in under 10 minutes (20 & 30 questions). His book is free online. Thought I was on Punk'd after the first lecture.

His lectures are incredibly useless, don't bother showing up to class, all he does is ramble on about randomness. He makes the exams way harder than needed. If you have him and it's still possible I would drop and get a different professor if you care about your GPA at all. Not a bad guy, seems to care about his students but he is a bad professor.

Professor Blackburn's BUSFIN3500 class is a relatively easy one, with weekly writing assignments and open-note exams. While his lectures can be dry, the textbook is helpful. Unstuck study was a great study tool alongside the course materials.
Great professor and person who is very accomplished and qualified. Cares about his students.

He is a very nice guy, but he is very old and doesn't do a great job explaining the content. You basically have to read the entire book but it is probably the easiest textbook I've had to read. The class is based on only tests and a few quizzes so if you get a few questions wrong youre screwed. The test are hard too. Did curve the grade 5% though.

His class is literally impossible. He expects you to read the textbook consistently & listen attentively in lectures, because many times his lectures will contradict the text. Studying does virtually nothing because the exam questions are so open-ended, & there is never a clear answer. He added 5% to everyones grade because we all did so poorly.
All exam based questions are impossible and he doesn't know how to teach at all. He talks very slow and doesnt care about his students at all.
Exams are impossible. Had an A going into the final and finished with a B-.

Course was fine. Only graded by quizzes (which he gives answers for during class) and exams. You need to purchase one of his physical textbooks to succeed. I went to all the lectures but would have been perfectly fine if  I didn't. Course was fine, just boring.
Fairest class participation grading system I ever encountered
Don't bother going to lecture because you won't learn anything. Grade is based off a few exams and you get no material to study so good luck

Professor Blackburn was a really nice guy, and his lectures were cool but he does go off-topic sometimes. His quizzes and tests are directly pulled from the textbook, and they were all so easy, as long as you read the textbook. However, the final was a mess :( and was not representative of what we learned at all IMO.

This class was so stressful simply because his tests and quizzes were designed to trick you. Pay attention to every word in the question. Dont bother going to class, his lectures dont help because he always goes off track and rambles. Entire grade is made up of a few quizzes and two exams- no extra credit.
Lectures were monotonous and uncaptivating. Quiz questions were subjective. Hard to get good feedback or clarification. Entire grade determined quizzes and exams.

Pretty straightforward and easy class format. If you give an effort on the papers, you'll get 100%. Textbook is helpful for exams, but I didn't read it completely nor attend lecture/recordings. I've heard that he will restructure this class in the future because the grades are too high and this was used during COVID.

Short writing assignments every week that he gives 100% for if you give any effort. Strongly suggest reading the textbook and highlighting it because his in-person sessions are focused on discussion more than direct teaching. Open book exams were nice as well.

Took this during Fall of 2021. This class was an easy A. He gave 100% on each of the papers you write, and I learned about the current situation with law due to that you know. He sometimes wanders off track from the content, and will ramble a bit about his lawyer days, but since the material so easy I don't mind.

Pretty easy class. One weekly written assignment that everyone gets full credit for. Open note mid term and final exams. Lectures are recorded, and also has in person discussions which arent as useful imo. Great guy, a little dry. Do everything and youll be fine

Professor Blackburn made our grades simple to complete and was very lenient with due dates. He is a great professor who really knows what he is talking about. Take his online section if you're able to!

John is by far the best professor at Ohio State! He actually cares about the material and his students. Only gave 7 writing assignments so it was a nice break from all the other businesses courses. By far the best class I have taken! Please take him for BUSFIN3500 he is definitely the best option.

Professor Blackburn is a gem. He is such a kind person. His class was very easy he graded based on seven short written assignments worth 14 points each. He responds to email quickly if you ever have a question and he is super understanding. He is very down to earth! If you have a chance take legal environment with him.

Lectures not required during COVID semesters, all you have to do is write 200-400 word responses each week. Most of the responses are opinion pieces so you don't really have to even watch the lecture videos. Seemed like a nice guy, super easy class, exactly the "break" we all needed during such a stressful semester.
Easy grader. Not many assignments, and no exams. I so enjoyed the difficulty of this class, especially during COVID when it seemed like all my classes got substantially harder.

Had him online because of COVID. Only grades in class: 7 short ( each 200-400 words, worth 14 pts) essays, 1 due every week, and 1 Get-to-Know-You assignment for 2 pts. I got an A just by reading from the book. Good prof to take for 3500 if you're not looking to become a lawyer - teaches you the stuff you should be aware of without pressure.

Attendance to lectures and participation are the only things you get graded on, so make it a point to attend. Read and take good notes of his book, because even though it's participation, he often looks for specific answers. Don't let your points get docked for missing conceptual questions he throws out during class!
funny professor. 50% showing up to class 50% final. as long as you read the assigned readings and answer the questions that go with them, the test will be extremely easy.

Quite a bad professor, doesn't let you take notes by computer and look at you phone. Lecture is quite boring, makes class time quite a struggle to pass through. If you caught using your phone, he will unhesitatingly pick you out and put you to shame in the entire class while deducting a letter grade from your 50% worth participation grade

So far as you done the reading and go to class, you will be fine for most of the time. Quite a good teacher in terms of lecture. Just be careful he can be quite strict with using phones. You have been warned guys

He's such a sweet professor & means well. His class isn't that difficult it's pretty straight and to the point but you have to pay attention in class cause he pulls stuff directly from class for the exam. But study the stuff from the book and in class and you'll pass.

He is such a sweet professor - loves the subject matter and while it can be dry at times, he is randomly hilarious and the class is easy. Mostly common sense. Only one final exam and it was also super easy, just make sure you keep up on your readings and youll be fine. Come to class!
He is an interesting guy and tries to make his lectures more fun. Tests can be difficult, but if you read the book and pay attention to his examples in lecture they're not that bad.

He refuses to use Canvas, so that makes things just so convenient (not). Occasionally spends over half the class telling a story that doesn't even clearly answer the question that was asked. One of the exams had 6 questions all based on one single line of the text that we did not focus on in class. Overall, avoid this prof.
ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE PROFESSOR. WORST CLASS I HAVE EVER TAKEN IN OSU
Dr. Blackburn is such a great guy! He cares about his students and tells funny stories in class. However, there is a lot of material shoved into 7 weeks. Overall, I would take him again.
He is so dry and rambly 4 tests in seven weeks so about the most minute of details and all cumulative No new info between third and fourth for some reason Ca real pain
John Blackburn was and is one of the great Professors at The Ohio State University. He kept you engaged and made Business Law intriguing, which I believe is very hard to do.

Professor Blackburn is the most easy going professor in the fisher college of business. If you look over the notes he emails to you, you will pass all the exams. Have fun and enjoy. Everyone usually gets A in his class. This one is a breeze.

Blackburn is probably your best option when it comes to taking law at OSU. This semester he did 4 exams, all worth 25%, including a cumulative final. Getting his book is a necessity, but he tells you what to read for each class so there isn't too much reading if you keep up with it. Lectures are boring but he randomly called on people occasionally.

Blackburn is an oldie, but a goodie. He follows an old-fashioned form of teaching (ex. No canvas), but his material is not difficult to learn and apply. Of course the class is over business law, but his character and stories make the lectures enjoyable. Not much reading to do, but make sure to actually study for exams because material can overlap.

The reason I did bad in this class is because I didn't want to buy the $50 book for a 1.5 credit half semester class. You will not do well with out the book. His lectures are examples from his experiences related to what the content in the book is. 95% of the exam is from the book, not lecture. Also, the only two grades are the midterm and final.
Lots of reading. Read his textbook over and over again to prepare for his tests.

John Blackburn is a pleasant person to talk to but is not good when it comes to teaching. When I took the class, the whole thing was graded on just two exams so if you fail both, well you're done for class. To me, lecture wasn't very helpful as he just went over what was written in the textbook. The two exams were challenging as well.

People leave bad reviews on here, but if you put a little bit of effort into the class, you will be fine. Blackburn has done this his whole life and co-wrote the book, so he knows what he is talking about. Listen to him in class as he will go over scenarios that will be test questions. Read the book and outline it for the exams and you'll be fine.

I'm a junior and have never gotten less than an A in any class at Ohio State, but this is the one class that challenged me. I skipped class, but shouldn't have because listening to his rambles still helped. And you should try on the midterm even thought the final can be your only grade. basically memorize the textbook from front to back and notes!
Horrible. Grades solely depend on the two exams. Riskyyyyy

This dude is a character & I loved him somewhat. Takes his time to get to class & talks about somewhat relevant stuff but it's hard to pay attention. 3 exams. If u do well on 1st 2  u wont have to take final. You'll probably take final. Entire class showed up to final. Cram 8 chapter book before final. My final  exam was C- & was bumped to a B-

His class is simply POINTLESS! Lectures are 100% not needed, & about 10% of the class will show up. Exams are 100% of your grade and T/F & MC only. Almost everyone in our section got 50-75% on exams. Take another professor and save yourself the time and effort studying for his ridiculous exams. You'll teach yourself more about law than he ever will

Blackburn is a character. just sortof rambles on in lecture about what he feels (some of this stuff ends up on exams).  Grade was two midterms and an optional final, where the final can replace one or both midterms if it is higher.  Read the textbook well and pay close attention to T/F questions.  No office hours by appointment. Go to class

Professor Blackburn is a nice man and he shared personal experiences with the class that I enjoyed. That being said, he was not a very good teacher. From previous reviews of his class, it seems as if he has changed the formatting every semester. My debate and essay final was new this semester, and possibly unsuccessful. Late, ill-prepared, etc.

Overall, I cannot complain. He mumbles and bumbles during lecture about random bs, but he was kind enough to put out a book, realized Pearson was making it too expensive, cancelled the contract and sold it for 200 dollars less. I respect him for that.

Didn't find the lecture helpful. He doesn't really talk about things that were exam related. Mainly talks about his opinions on law but test questions that were worded archaically and very standardized test like. I was one question away from a half a letter grade up. Going over test questions in class doesn't really help, I'd recommend office hours

Blackburn is by far the most entertaining and cooky professor I've had at Ohio State. We had two exams and an optional final. All were pretty tough but you can get by pretty well if you study his textbook. His lectures are a treat. Don't be afraid to ask about some of his questions/answers on exams, he gave our class back points for doing so.

He's okay. Tends to ramble in lecture. Make sure you read and understand the book. Grades consisted only of two midterms, which can be tricky, and an optional final. The final can only help in that it will replace any and all scores you did better on it  than both midterms. I got a B on both midterms, but got an A on the final and for the course.

The entire grade is based on a few exams (which are short multiple choice tests). If you don't like to read and are not good at memorizing text, then you will struggle. I did well by just reading the chapters over and over again before the exams. Reading  the book is all you need to do to get a good grade; you don't  have to pay attention in class.

This class was very unorganized. He sent out a one page syllabus via email because he did not open Carmen until after the first exam.  The only material you get to help study is the textbook.  The only grades are exams. Exams are very specific questions from the text.  His lectures are long, confusing, and not really over the content of the class.

Professor Blackburn changes up the way he runs the class every semester. This semester, there was 2 midterms and an optional final. To do well on them, you basically have to know business law like the back of your hand by reading the book very carefully (which he wrote). The lectures weren't mandatory and he basically rambles the whole time.

The tests are kind of tricky, but keep in mind that there is a curve and the dude understands that we're college students. In short, the grade you work for is the one you'll get. He's fair and knows what he is doing. Just show up on time and go to class and you'll do fine.

The lectures are lengthy and he tends to ramble so there's little point in attending. The class consisted of 5 quizzes worth 20 points each for a total of 100 points. Each point missed is 1% off your grade. A very difficult bonus quiz for 20 points is given at the end though which can help, but be ready to read quite a bit.
Super cool guy and definitely makes you think. The class isn't easy but it is very doable if you put the work into it and study for his quizzes. Go to class and read the book for sure.
The class is not helpful, but the exam is easy if you read the book.

Chapters are 40 pages long, each exam covers one chapter. You have to read through it very well or you won't do well. Each exam consists of 16 questions, there is only 3 exams, do mhe in more than one and you may be getting a B. He is a good guy, and gives extra credit opportunity. If you are smart or work hard you will get an A for sure
Only grades in the class were weekly quizzes, followed by a tricky bonus quiz.

Think of Walter White before he "broke bad" with a better sense of humor and you have John Blackburn. The dude is a legend. We received a bonus point for each class we attended (adds to 15 bonus points) and the class is only out of 60 points, so I ended up with over a 100% in the class. Without the bonus points the class would be kind of tough.

The set up of this class changes every session so don't be surprised when it's different than when your friend took it. He's very clear and has a dry sense of humor but kept you engaged .  Rambles a lot. Attending lecture will help your grade and all the questions come from the textbook which he explains in lecture. Overall very good.
He is very dry and boring; did not give my class much extra credit so I ended up with an A-. If you go to class and do the readings, theres no reason you shouldn't get at least a B+

Prof Blackburn was awesome. His lectures are slow, but his 'tests' that are just quizzes are easy. Most of the ViaResponse questions given in class are on the quiz. If you get under a 13 on any of the quizzes, just do the extra credit assignment. It can increase your grade by 10%. Also, he's got a sense of humor. A weird one, but he's good hearted.

I got a C on all three quizzes because they're out of fifteen points (though they come straight from lecture - hard to interpret answer during class sometimes).  Went to every class (credit for attendance) and wrote extra credit paper (five pages, choice topic, really easy) and got a 94.  You go John.

reading is really a big deal for business law, and you have to truly understand the reading in order to get a good grade. I did poorly on all three quiz and got a B- at last. But i am actually satisfied, because i thought i will fail this class. So B- is much better than D. Blacki gave full point of extra credit, but its a 10 pages long paper.
final grade is 3 exams each 15 questions that are rather confusing and meant to trick you up. very nice guy though just hard to understand
nice guy

"Blacki" is a very good teacher who clearly outlines what is important for the class.  Class consists of 3 quizzes all MC worth 15 pts each, 5 pts participation, and a 10 point extra credit paper. As long as you read, pay attention in lecture, and do the extra credit, it will be the easiest A you've ever had in Fisher.
His 3 exams are non cumulative and consist of 15 MC questions. There are usually a couple tricky ones but if you read the book (which he wrote) and pay attention in class they are super easy.

â€œBlacki" is a funny guy and nice enough to record attendance even for those who're late. grade is entirely based on 3 quizzes (15 mc question each,not cumulative).Not too hard to pass the average grade. Attendance is taken using viaresponse every class. You'll only need to read 3 chapters in total for 7 wks, which is not bad at all.

The first session received extra credit; whereas, in our second session, none was given.  The class is reformatted to 3 quizzes, a daily online attendance tracker, and questions (Viaresponse).  You have to have the book (online ebook is cheapest).
He is energetic and invested in his lectures. His quizzes are generally easy as long as you've read. Gave out extra credit at the end of the session.

I was expecting this class to be very boring but "Blacki" made it interesting. He incorporates current events and examples in his lectures. He is a very decent and approachable guy. You are expected to have read the text before each class and he takes attendance using viaresponse. 3 quizzes determine your grade. Not difficult, I would recommend!

Must attend lecture and read the book. There is no practice final or midterm and it is hard to get a good understanding of what will be on his tests. After putting in a lot of effort, I ended with a C+. Take the other professor who offers an easier class and extra credit.

Entire grade is basically out of one 25 question multiple choice final. I studied unbelievably hard, read every chapter multiple times, attended every lecture and some how ended up with a C. Have fun with this one...

COMPLETELY NON-INTERACTIVE! Lecture is almost pointless because he goes step by step with the book (he wrote it).  NEED the book in order to pass and if you don't attend then you will need to read to have a shot in the class. Only two exams

Class is completely non-interactive. Prof doesn't even give you a reason to want to ever come to class besides taking the midterm and final. HOWEVER, if you do want to pass the class, you definitely need the book. You will FAIL without it. Other than that, don't sweat going :)
Some people consider him tough, but all you need to do is attend class and participate.  He will be fair and helpful.

I actually liked this class. Blackburn is not bad at all. Yes he talks slow but is really helpful. He gives hints about the final. Only stress a little about that. Practice exams are key. Go to them. Yes you need to read. If you show up to class your name might get called. If absent, points off. his book is way too pricey. You'll survive...barely.

he talks a little too slow, but he tells jokes and sings, and play law songs. stopped going to class after the third week. read the book. went to the last class. took all the practice exams and read all the cases in book just to learn the language. one week to study for it. and got an A. PS. drawing diagram is what i thought really helped.

This is a tough class; and the final is everything. Go to every practice exam or at least you ask him for sample essay of that practice exam. They are very helpful. Go to the last class, he will give some key points which he would test on. It's very challenging class.

This class is all about the final.  I did not learn one thing from this man, and was still able to get a B+.  90% of the time his lectures are not relevant to the class.  If you are looking for one hard week of class(finals) and nine easy ones take him. If you don't test well I advise taking someone else.

I went into this class very apprenhensively but after going to class, doing ALL of the practice problems and asking him a lot of questions, the class was more than tolerable. The cases are very interesting, Blackburn focuses on just the right stuff and the practice exams were just like the real deal. He's the man.

Blackburn is the man. He is a good professor and he makes lectures interesting because he is a funny guy. He does however call on people randomly from his attendance list so thats annoying. The class is based only on 1 final, but on the last class he practically told us what was gonna be on the final, so it was pretty easy. must read the book

Whole grade is based on one eassay final. No lecture, just discussion. So unless people ask questions about the material, you won't learn much in class. You could skip every class and as long as you know the 3 chapters in the book inside and out, you could do well on the essays. He tends to favor people to talk in class a lot.

Hard to get a hold of, grades based on keywords in your essay.  Learn the chapters well and do your exam the same way the practice exam 1 solution shows.  Any less and your grade will suffer.  Only 1 final, just memorize the 3 chapter in the book.  Always check if you got a grade lower than you thought you should have.  He spends 30s per exam so...

Seems like a nice enough guy.  You must buy the book as he really doesn't lecture...more like a Q & A session (and he will call on you randomly in class).  Don't miss the first day and last day performances.  I didn't really start doing any work in the class until about 3 days before the final and still got an A...

It all depends on whether or not you want to take a class where your sole grade is the final. If you do, then by all means take Blackburn. If not, then you are better off taking the class with Irvine or Weinstock. No reason to go to class except for the practice exams. If you memorize the 3 textbook chapters for the final, you should do well on it.

Just read the textbook and know the 3 Chapters inside and out.  (Contracts, Torts, & Equal Employment).  The final is basically 2 questions that are exactly like the practice exams, but its not too bad.  Just make sure you know the 3 chapters well and you will do fine.

Blacky is the man. I will admit that you have to work but he is extremely intelligent and you can learn a lot from him. My favorite business class i took at osu. He is hilarious and highly entertaining. Amazing class amazing prof.
You will learn a great deal from him if you attend class

I will admit this was a very stressful, yet important class. I hardly went to class, even got called out by him for not coming to class, didn't buy the book until there were about 2 weeks left in the quarter, didn't even open the book until 4 days before the final, was more nervous then I've probably ever been before the test, and I still got an A!
Avoid this teacher at all cost, he is nice but he makes you study real hard at the end coz ur whole grade depends on the final. not worth it, find any other teacher

He was very intimidating at first, but ended up not being too bad. It is crucial that you read the material and understand it. I recommend going to class so you know what he wants on the final exam. All of your grade is based solely on the final so you really need to study for it throughout the whole quarter. Participate in class.

He's a great professor teaching a class that will be helpful to anyone considering law school. You can make the class what you want it to be, but he'll be there to help; he is very upfront about his expectations. I think of him as a funny grandfather-figure that has interesting stories to share. Don't worry if you haven't taken business classes.

I thought he was really a pretty interesting professor.  He is one of the smartest professors i've had and makes the material intesting and sometimes funny.  He gives you an expectation of what the final will be like and if you know the material, you will definitely do well.  Our final was 3 of the homework problems he assigned--DO YOUR HOMEWORK.

I thought he was a great professor! You really have to go to class and participate. Read the book CAREFULLY and remeber all the law tests!! His in class examples really helped. I studied really hard for the final (which is the only grade in the class) and got a well deserved A. He was really nice and willing to help if you didn't understand.

You have no reason to ever attend class. Just go to the practice tests and start studying from the book a couple weeks prior to the final, which is written and your complete grade but is easy. He tells you what to focus on if you attend the final practice exam. I never attended class and studied for 4 days prior to the exam and ended up with a B.

I thought this was a very interesting class. The final being 100% of the grade was very intimidating, but ended up not being so bad. He will work with you if you need help, very nice guy. If you read the book and just reread and make your own notes on all of the cases you will be fine for the final.

he is among the worst professors i have studied under. people might like him, but he makes no sense in class. The guy talks apples and oranges while explaining law. at times he will spend an entire class explaining one irrelevant point and then the chapter is done. this is a self-study class and he is of no help. take anyone else if you care

Where attendance is useful:  He spends 10 weeks training you how to think and how to read the law, or, specifically, how to study for the one exam you will take to get your final grade.  The answer:  "Whether" -- if you see WHETHER, just add that to your OUTLINE (start this early).  Each law has a test & these legal "tests" are preceded by whether.
Not as bad as ppl say...although having the final as the only grade is very stressful. study material on the practice exams in depth and know everything else in the book. Don't bother going to class.

Seemed like a nice guy... wouldn't really know because I only attended 2 lectures.  Final was 100% of grade, which is scary.  I studied 2-3 days before the exam and got a B.  If the prospect of an all-or-nothing final scares you, look elsewhere.

One final and it's 100% of your grade.  All essay final, grades really hard I thought.  I knew the material in and out and I still got a B- in his class.  Rambles on when you ask him a question and easily talks for one hour straight about nothing.

This guy is an ***hole.  Read every chapter and new all the laws but still got a C and my friend got a D.  He plays MAJOR favorites.  I would definitely take weinstock if you can.  Avoid this jerk, typical pompous ***.

I found it somewhat interesting just b/c it was a law class, but the format is awful.  Having only 1 grade, an all ESSAY final, just sucks.  Classes are pointless b/c if someone asks a question he will give a 30 minute explanation, that could have been narrowed down to 10.

Grade is 100% of the final. This guy does not teach anything and plays favorites. I studied my butt off for the final attended every class and got a B. My freind got an A and never went to class. This guy is really something...and then he tries to win you over by giving a dumb speech before the final...what a jerk!!!
I don't suggest international students to take this class. The grading and teaching style of the class might be totally out of your sense.
Whole grade is the final, but it's not bad. I skipped class all the time and still did very well. READ all of the chapters and you will be fine

Just like the others it is 1 final 100% of you grade.  I knew the material very well but studied hours and hours to learn it.  Dont fall behind.  If you memorize the laws and stuff it is ok but it takes lots of time.
Just read the book and take notes and you'll be fine. The final is the whole ground, but ours wasn't too bad.

what a bunch of ****, I went to every class and studied for the final and still got a C because the final is all that counts, so you have no idea how he's going to grade or what he's looking for.  Nice enough guy, but a****ty way of grading.

Blackburn has an awesome teaching style.  He's funny, witty, and very helpful.  The only thing is that your grade is dependent exclusively on the final, which is 2 essay questions that tie into very specific laws and/or case precedents, so 90% of the stuff you learn, you are never tested on.  Fun teacher, fun class; just pray you get a good final.
It was a while since I've taken his class, but he is the best lecturer I've ever had.  The huge auditorium was always jammed packed for his lectures because they were so interesting.
100% of the grade is based on the final exam. Just pray for an easy case on the exam maybe your prayers will be heard. Good Luck:)

pretty much i got a B- and i really think i deserved a better grade. there is only one grade - the final - and its an essay. i just think a more conventional grading system is more fair. he's a walking joke.

I probably wouldn't take him again.  His grading style is hard.  Lots of memorization for the final.. i would have rather had more time for other classes.  I would recomend weinstock where there are midterms so the work is spread out throughout the qtr.  Easy to get screwed by blackburn at the end

Interesting material, and a very unconventional way of teaching. Your final makes up your whole grade. If you know the principals (and case law) behind the previous cases, the final is not to hard. Just put what you know...i got an A- without too much work
His teaching style is not conventional.. works for some and not for others. I got an A not because I understood, but because I memorized and quite a few people had the same thing to say. MEMORIZE!
Great prof, fun
awesome prof. lot of fun. very knowledgable and entertaining. made class easy and let you learn if you wanted to, and if not, you could just cram for the final and do just fine

He's a good prof, but when he answers questions he is very unclear as to what the correct answer is. The final was 2 questions that we hadn't seen before, but if you memorize the 4 chapters he covers you'll do fine.

The "legal" environment should be interesting, also reading the chapters isnt necessary.Practice questions are for chumps, and Sample exams is how we roll.If those po po's take me in cause of my toasters on the floor, i'm call up Blackburn to he
best prof i eve had. made class interesting.  didnt have to go and could still get an A, just study Spamming and central hudson electric for the final and your in.

Entertaining at first.  Not a thourough teaching style.  Works for some, but not for others.  I had to teach myself too much.  If you're looking for a non-standard, really a non-lecture, this is the class. Groups. Your final grade = grade for the class.
sings "eat the breakfast" song the first day of class! don't miss it!  one final exam determines grade! a great teacher who tries to help everyone all the time, genuine, cares, fun

John Blackburn (AKA Blackie) is a great teacher. He was always willing to help you when you needed help, and he was usually pretty clear in class. He is a very off the wall type of guy, and b/c of this his class was fun and noone everfell asleep in class.
good
you can miss every lecture and still get an A in the class. he tries to entertain the class, kinda weird, but good guy.
No Comments
No Comments
tough class b/c whole grade is based on final, but really good prof
Actually learned something, and only fell asleep half the time...

Quinn has been one of my favorite lecturers in Fisher. The first test caught me off guard, so definitely study everything he gives you, as it's more so memorizing the terms than common sense. Every other assignment is an easy A+. He makes his lecture's super interesting too. Class is a very easy B and an attainable A with some effort.

Jon Quinn is one of my favorite professors in Fisher. He has a great personality and really cares about our learning. Definitely go to office hours and get to know him, ask questions, or even talk careers. He is extremely knowledgeable and experienced and wants his students to succeed. Go to class and participate in lecture. Super helpful and kind

Jon is such an engaging and nice professor but this class is trash. Similar to international business and logistics this class has you do a lot of work on Pearson and take 2 exams. As a student with almost a perfect gpa this class will be my first B at fisher. You should def study but when taking the exam I thought the questions were strange.
I've had Jon for several classes at OSU and he is by far my favorite professor i've had

Prof. Quinn definitely cares about teaching this class and kept the online video lectures interesting using various real life examples. Exams weren't that hard even if you only just skimmed the textbook readings. All other grades were easy As with multiple attempts to score better.
Cares a lot about participation but has very interesting and engaging lectures that go along with the course material. One of my favorite professors at Fisher.

Professor Quinn is really good. He cares about his students and loves to teach. He is kind to offer help and shows respect toward me. He also gave me snacks and participation credit when my teammates answered questions. He called me to answer questions every time I raised my hand. He was nice!

Easy class with guaranteed 100% on quizzes and assignments. Watch all of his lectures and review his slides before the exams and you'll be fine. Make sure to do the extra credit because it helps a lot.

I think objectively he is a good professor. He is passionate about what he teaches and his lectures are super relevant and interesting for anyone. However, exams are tough and some questions on it should not be not fair game because they are never found anywhere in text or lecture. Quite frustrating when you study for so long.

His exams do not cover what is in his lectures. You could read through everything on his lectures/textbook, & you'll still get exam questions that ask about something that wasn't taught. His final includes questions from old chapters even though it's "not cumulative". Confusing wording to throw you off. Lectures consist of photos that don't help.

Buddy made the final exam that he explicitly said was non-cumulative cumulative. His exam questions do not cover his lectures. Take another professor unless you are looking for someone to mess up your GPA with a useless common core class.

I took 3250 over the summer synchronously (6 weeks).  Can find answers to quizzes and homeworks in the textbook or outside of class.  You get the A is on Exams - proctorio and questions not in the notes or online, mostly reference examples from lectures.  I watched all lectures for an exam (only 2 weeks) at 2x speed before each exam and did fine.

I think he's such an engaging professor and genuinely cares about his students. He's always talking about his real world experience and has made many Superbowl commercials. It's hard to pay attention for 2 hours, but he makes it pretty enjoyable.
Take anyone else for marketing. Or don't take marketing. Seriously why are all the professors so bad at teaching marketing?

He is a good lecturer but the only big problem with 3250 marketing is that it was one, two-hour lecture a week and then some outside of class, I feel like it could be separated into two, one and half hour classes. Overall he is a good lecturer but I am not a fan of marketing, too much memorization. Also, three big exams that make up your grade.
Low stress class but you'll still learn a ton. Super engaging lectures. Would recommend him for any marketing classes.

This has been one of my favorite professors at Fisher! He seems to really care about the content of his lectures and his students as well. It is not a super difficult course, but participation and group work is a large part of this. The class is pretty conversational, so if you actively participate you should have no issue with this course.
One of the greatest to ever do it. He really cares about his students and the content. If you participate and put in work to learn you will be great!!! He is up there with the greats at Fisher.

Had him for 4381 and 4386 and got A- and an A. He's a good guy and really values participation and case studies. There's a group project for both classes so make sure you get a good group. You do spend some money on simulation games so be prepared for that. Overall, his class is very manageable and isn't over the top.

Took him for 5381 and was an easy class. Pretty much the whole class was group work. Luckily I had a good group. I liked him as a professor and a person. If you take him for 5381 my best advice would be to make sure you are in a group that pulls their weight. Peer review at the end, but you will likely hate this class if you have a bad group.

Class is pretty straightforward. Do what he says and you should be totally fine. Some of the games are confusing but youll figure them out. Lots of packback and fair quizzes. Final assignment that takes some time so be sure to stay on top of that. Fair professor and cares about his students. Still dont have my grade but Im sure he will get to it

This is the worst professor at the Ohio state university. The online class, he makes carmen a mess. He didn't put anything on carmen and sending you an email. That is ridiculous, it is not an in-person class, it is an online class and you don't put anything on carmen? Do not choose his class, he didn't teach anything, his class is a joke.

Professor Sodero's class is a joke, but not in an easy way. There are games and case studies that are freshman level stuff. No textbook used. I feel like i haven't learned anything this semester. Huge group project on Big Data that has nothing to do with the class or logistics and only pertains to his research. Overall would not suggest. AVOID!!!!!

Great professor! Class was discussion based and he did a great job of giving students the opportunity to speak. He might push back on your answers but his main goal is to make you think so don't worry about it. Definitely a professor that cares about his students and their growth!
Such a good teacher he is so inspirational
He gave us all suckers cause we were all good students
Really fun teacher Always gave help to the people in help flexible learning programs

He was very adaptable and flexible toward situations like if we have family members that we need to talk about and we have no time to do the homework he will give us extra time. And I always know what is a good for people.
He was one of my fav teachers and he taught us well

Honestly I like it when he would help me with my homework and me and him new each other from him being a good coach to me during high school football season and we all loved him by far 1 of the best teachers.
Very good professor and he's kind great integrity and he has great communication skills I would love to take his class again

Charles Buchanan shows outstanding grit and exceptional levels of heroism (my hero). Lots (and I do mean A LOT) of out of class extra credit, take advantage and this class will be a breeze and amazing. Brings great amount of energy during and after class. You will have an awesome time with Charles Buchanan. Go Buckeyes!!!
Really good teacher has really great integrity
Really great professor especially in the good way
This teacher has good communication skills and is really good, helpful, and inspiring to say the least
This teacher is very fun really easy teacher he cares about your well-being
Charles Buchanan is one of the best teachers he always gave us extra credit and he respected all of us he's funny and overall a really great teacher.
Really great professor. Really fun. Really smart. Really good person to be taught by. He might be a little rough on you sometimes, but he's a really good person. Just give him a chance
He was my favorite professor and he was very funny and I would love to take this class again.
Great class easy on work and I had very fun in this class if you do take this class have fun.

This class was taken as a summer course for the SMBA program and I really liked his teaching style. Really low stress class and if you do the assignments, you'll be fine. I don't have anything bad to say.

Leadership Class.
Charles did NOT respond to multiple emails or Canvas messages and posted grades 3-4 weeks after assignments were submitted. Given that the course was only 6 weeks long, this left little room to implement any feedback.

A majority of the class was spent reading HBR articles and writing papers. Why would anyone pay for that?

Leadership and Character has been one of my favorite classes at OSU. Charles is a great guy, you can tell that he is passionate about what he is teaching and he wants to see his students succeed. Work load is totally manageable and he gives like 2 weeks for the final (open note extended response) and essay. I definitely recommend this class!

Took his class in leadership (course code not available here). 
I would never take another class from him. He was unresponsive to emails and graded things about 3-4 weeks after they were submitted. Our course was only 7 weeks long, which left no room for improvement after receiving said grades.

Pros: cool guy, cancels class sometimes, easy exams with resources online, easy homework, ends class early every day, gives some exam questions, like 16 points of extra credit, motivational, and great intro class for HR, no required participation
Cons: online text book fees, no study guides
Will cancel class to watch a football game yet has no compassion for students that incurred an emergency. Does not check and will not respond to your emails if he does not want to.
3 exams, lots of extra credit and very short lectures that he gives answers for on top hat

I would not recommend taking this class as the 6 week session in the summer. It was a lot of reading and key terms that we needed to know to apply for a midterm every 2 weeks. Luckily exams were not that terrible. Professor Buchanan's videos are somewhat outdated and it was hard to pay attention at times.

Awesome class! I thoroughly enjoyed his lectures and our class discussions. Attendance was mandatory for our class session. This is one of those courses that you can really take away a lot if you take it seriously.

Class was amazing! Attendance is mandatory but not at 8am knock on wood. If you go, you will definitely get more out of class than you expect. I learned way more than I expected and would instantly take again in a heartbeat!

This was one of my favorite business core classes as I found the material to be applicable to the real world. Although it was an 8 am class and attendance is optional, I would still recommend going for your own benefit. Exams are tricky, but if you study the lecture sliders they're completely reasonable. Take this class with Buchanan.

Professor Buchanan teaches the material well and his exams are fair. That is not to say they are easy. Study all the lecture videos in order to do well on the exam. Most of the grade comes solely from exams with the rest coming from easy homework assignments. It was just hard for me to get motivated for this class as I found it to be pointless.

This was a really great course and Professor Buchanan is the best. It's an easy A and he really pushes you to get the most out of the course. Very inspirational and I would definitely take this course or one of his other classes again.

I took Leadership and Character not expecting much, but I got much more out of the course than expected. Attendance is not mandatory, but he appreciates it when you attend. The class is discussion based, and the only assignments are weekly journals and two papers that are not graded very harshly. You get out what you put into this class.
This class was not bad but the amount of reading you have to do is insane. Exams were not bad and some of the questions were from tophat.
This class was very easy, and Prof Buchanan is fair and straight forward.

You will get an A, but feels like pulling your fingernails off in the process. There isn't a lot of outside work, but there are completely unclear expectations. Prof Buchanan tries to do these powerful lectures, but they always fall short and don't connect to the larger course so the time feels wasted. Don't take this if you want to learn a lot.

His exams are not like the lecture slides. They are not clear and the answers to a significant portion of his exam questions are subjective. His copy and paste, reading straight from the slide, textbook style, of teaching is just lazy. Good luck learning something of value from this class.
I would take this class again in a heartbeat. Really good professor and he cares about you wanting to be successful.

I have never respected a professor more than Prof Buchanan. He is so knowledgable and wise about many different topics. Brings in amazing speakers. Really helps you hone in on your personal values and leadership skills. Lots of class discussion, easy assignments. You get what you put into this class, and I would highly recommend taking it

Professor Buchanan is way over prepared for his job. Hes served in the military and owns several companies, very interesting guy! His class is extremely lecture heavy but he posts notes online as well. If you go to class he gives you extra credit (participation) and exam questions through top hat. Exams are the biggest part of your grade.

I meanCharles is a great teacher but nearly 10 chapters each exam really kill me. Our midterm content already covers other professor's final term. Review it during space-time, don't left until the night before exam

This class is straightforward and easy. On Mondays, we worked with our Capsim groups (online business simulation). On Wednesdays, we had more of a lecture format. Fridays were a lot of team practical exercises. The weekly journal reflection entries were tedious but overall beneficial. The best part of class was discussions.

So much extra credit. Went into the final with about 7% point curve. Attendance is all extra credit if you want to go for it (offers 8 am class usually), but we had a ton of other extra credit offered didn't need it. Online hw and simulations super easy essentially completion based and then 3 exams that repeat a ton of TopHat from in class. TAK

Easiest class in Fisher. Charles gives extra credit for attending class and provides some of the exam questions via Top Hat. He is passionate about the subject and wants to prepare his students to be strong leaders. Loves participation. He wants all his students to earn A's and it's almost hard not to if you attend class and put in a little effort.

Prof. Buchanan is so laid-back and tries to make a dry topic more interesting. He gives out a good amount of bonus points, even for attending class. If you go to class, then you probably don't need to study as much as someone who doesn't attend. His tests shouldn't be hard at all if you study the slides. Truly a great professor.

Professor Buchanan was awesome for BUSMHR 4235, Leadership Through Practical Exercises. Mondays were interesting lectures about goal-setting/values/leadership, Wednesday was a team day (you have a team for the semester where you run an online company), and Fridays were exercises in which the class practiced leadership skills. All very fun, all easy
Pretty Straight forward class. Exams aren't bad imo. There is a lot of Extra Credit available for those who don't do well on them though. Don't waste money on the textbooks.

His tests are an average difficulty. There are some trick questions. My advice would be to attend every lecture (I got 10 bonus points just for showing up to 90% of classes), basically memorize his powerpoints (including notes under the slides), and do any extra credit available. Charles cares and is easy on the eyes, but you do need to put work in

Great professor, super likable. Lecture material is dry, but he makes it as tolerable as possible. Can probably get away with no textbooks, but I used mine to recap for tests (downloaded a PDF online) Go to class, the tophat questions are important to know for the exams. Do the extra credit, significant to grade. Very engaging.

Lectures are very dry and all the slides are posted online after lecture. Attendance is extra credit. Tests are pretty easy/straightforward. Only grades in the class are 3 exams. The class would be a lot more enjoyable if it were more interactive. Overall decent class.

Dr. Buchanan is the best professor I have had at OSU. Despite his lecture being at 8:40 PM, the class is engaging, funny, and extremely informative. The content is more closely aligned to psychology than business, making it great for a GPA-boost for those who struggle with some of the more technical core classes.

Buchanan is the bomb. Lectures are interesting and engaging, good sense of humor, very fair assessments, learned a lot from him, show up to class and study the powerpoints and you will do well in his class! 10/10 would take his class again.

Class is poorly organized at times and can be extremely confusing for no reason whatsoever randomly. Also forces you to learn how to solve things online and by hand and shows solutions for practice problems with the online method. But that is useless for exams so half the review content isn't even usable for the exams which are also difficult.
Talke is a really nice guy and all. But when you go to his recitations ad lectures it is hard to follow along. The course work itself is already hard but with his thick accent its not good at all.

Talke is kind and really tries to teach us the material. However, due to his thick accent and the difficult course material, his lectures are often unhelpful. I do think the class sets him up in a bad way and he tries to do his best, but it's still extremely difficult. Office hours are PACKED during group cases and exam week, so try to go earlier.

Talke is nice but an awful teacher. His lectures are confusing and his exams are impossible even with cheat sheets. No one gets 100% and the averages were D's and he won't curve. By far the worst class I have taken at Ohio State. Group projects are graded way too harshly and the class as a whole is just miserable. Be prepared to teach yourself.

Please don't let my grade fool you. He is an old school professor, expect long lectures, strict grading, and to teach yourself the material. Your grade is based on attendance, cases, quizzes, and the final exam. Some work is collaborative though. This class is really stressful because he could be all over place.

All of the TAs grade the group projects differently so you either get an amazing grade or terrible. Talke was my recitation leader and he does not know how to teach the course material. He expects everyone to be a professional at stats.

I don't know why everyone is hating on Talke. Sure he has an Indian accent but his lectures are very straightforward and he seems so sweet. Personally business stats is probably the hardest class you will take at fisher so most people are just angry about that. Overall if you pay attention and actually study then you will probs get a B+ or higher.

I honestly wish I could give this teacher a 0/5. He is singularly the worst professor I've ever had. In order to get a good grade in this class, you need to teach yourself the content on your own. He is not clear during lecture and fails to answer questions with any form of meaningful response. By any means necessary, take a different teacher.

If I could give this guy a 0/5 on here I would.  He is genuinely horrible.  Not only can you never understand him, but half the time he explains material WRONG.    After going to Talke's lectures became way more confused on the topic than when I watched the lecture videos.  Please do not take this teacher he shouldn't even have a job.

Professor Talke can't clearly communicate with his students, grades harshly, and is so timid in lectures that you can't hear him. He barely understands the concepts he is teaching and the language barrier makes it hard to have meaningful conversations. He's old-fashioned, stuck in his ways, and has no resources for students. Avoid if you can.

Talke is a nice guy, but he's definitely not a good teacher or lecturer. On top of that, the midterms are difficult and the course videos and material aren't helpful. My first midterm had a D average. Avoid this class in general if you can.

Group projects take forever and the grading is HARSH. We spent days doing the first project and got so many points off for every little thing. Class is awful no matter who you take it with, so this review could probably go for all professors for this course. Don't fall behind! It'll be hard to catch up once you have to take the exams. Good luck
No.

I had Talke as both a lecturer and recitation leader for this class, and recommend taking anyone else if possible. He wasn't able to explain the class material in a clear way, and just read off slides. He didn't record the video lectures for his class, so the material in class was not explained in the same way and sometimes contradicted the videos.

The negative reviews about Talke and this class are vastly overblown. Very manageable with a lot of extra credit. I only studied before the midterm and final (without studying consistently throughout the semester) and I did well. Make sure you have a solid foundation from 1430 because it'll make your life a lot easier.

Honestly the best option for this class.  Although attendance was mandatory and group projects were time consuming, the class was very manageable.  Dr. Talke is extremely passionate and wants students to succeed.  Lectures may be confusing at times, but he is always happy to help during office hours and offers lots of extra credit for the course.

I think Dr. Talke cares? But overall this class is terrible. Nothing in the lecture prep and lectures makes sense. You have to teach yourself every week or you won't do well. Our midterm was a low D average, yet it's the student's fault.

This guy's terrible. Worst instructor I've had, ever. Woefully unhelpful lectures coupled with poor explanation of concepts, surprised when a class of 300 people can't answer questions b/c nobody knows what he's talking about. Distant, unforgiving, rude. The A I have is from the hours of prep I do on my own, no thanks to Talke. Avoid at all costs.

Dr. Talke cares about his students but this class is awful. I took calc 1151 and I'm honestly trying to decide which is harder. The lectures/pre lecture videos make no sense. This class is taught in the most complicated way possible. I highly suggest going to the TA help center and doing all the extra credit you can because you will 100% need it.

Plain and simple a bad professor. Poorly explained lectures coupled with unhelpful office hours. But I also think too many people blame their bad grades on solely him. Put in the time and the extra effort to teach yourself knowing you won't get much from him. If you put in your own work, he's fine as a professor, but take someone else if you can.

This class basically expects you to teach yourself advanced statistics in itself but Talke and the TA i had made the course impossible. I am a 3.7+ and likely will not pass this course, There is mandatory attendance, 3 group cases, and weekly homework done on statcrunch whereas you can't use the statcrunch on the exam so they are not helpful. T
Professor Talke is a great guy- he responds to emails quickly and is also super nice and helpful if you attend his office hours. The course is difficult and boring but he does try his best.

Had him as a sub today for Draper and he called us all disrespectful then stopped class on 4 different occasions because students stepped out to use the bathroom/leave early, etc. He said "This is my classroom, not your house, you cant leave." Not that nice of a guy. Love Draper though, if he's an option, take him.

Dr. Talke is very easy to communicate with and wants what's best for his students. The class is fairly challenging, but if you take advantage of the extra credit opportunities and class resources, it can be somewhat enjoyable.
Do any extra credit you can and every single practice problem. The professors and TAs likely won't help you and will just expect you to know everything. This one's on you to teach yourself.
I am 95% confident that Dr. Talke has no idea what hes doing
Dont take

Professor Talke seems nice, but clueless. He reads off of lecture slides and gives examples that he messes up. Students end up correcting his work. The is also a bit of a language barrier that difficultes things even more. The exams were also very hard and not much time. If Kliner is an option for this class, take him.

Talke is not good at time management. He goes over the lecture time pretty much every lecture, and they are BORING. TA's try their best to help, but all of them are so different in their sense of grading. But sometimes a TA will tell me I got 100% on a project, then another TA will grade it and give me a 50%. He is the best out the 3 other options.

Absolute worst professor I have ever had. During lectures, he would mute all of the students so you could not ask a question if you had one. Very unhelpful and unaccessible outside of class. Although there were many office hours, the TA's would not always show up for them. Do not take this professor.

Tons of work in this class along with mandatory lectures and recitations. However, you can easily pass this class with a great grade if you stay on top of your work. Dr. Talke isn't the best professor but you can tell he is trying and cares.
Tough to understand, assigned far too many projects and it felt more like a 5 credit class rather than a 3 credit class. I would not suggest taking this class with Dr. Talke.

The most disorganized class I ever had, professor is awful doesn't seem like anyone learns anything. When the average exam score is a 65% across hundreds of students, maybe its not the students who are the problem.

definitely a hard class but Talke cares about his students I think. He responds to emails so fast, like within 10 minutes fast and gives well thought out responses. The group cases are hard and a lot of work. This class is def a lot of work and hard subject material, but he's a cool dude. If you have to take this class, he's not a bad professor.

Thoroughly gets through material and is very passionate about what he teaches. Assignments and exams are manageable as long as you study the lecture slides and do the practice problems (which I should have done).

Professor Klinker is a very straightforward and knowledgeable professor. The assignments and quizzes are very straightforward. The exams can sometimes be a little more challenging, but overall very straightforward and fair. Extra credit is given based on attendance to lectures and recitations, but can be easily acheived.

He isn't a bad guy, but did not love his teaching style. The PowerPoint presentations did not always line up with the lectures, and he was impossible to reach outside of class. The exams were not awful if you were prepared but challenging. Overall, I would see if you could have another lecturer for this course.

You will waste a lot of time figuring out what horrible directions mean, and you have to spend $100+ on a textbook you will never use so you can take quizzes and watch his youtube videos (yes he puts quizzes and lecture vids behind a paywall).

Very bad directions on model building exercises, for how long this course has existed these should be organized, waste a lot of time figuring out bad directions. Also forces you to to buy a useless textbook (that I never used) so you can watch his youtube videos and take quizzes. (Yes he puts quizzes and lectures vids behind a paywall)

Class was disorganized and Terry came off as arrogant. I didn't find him helpful at all in lecture. Videos are the only thing that helped. Exams aren't hard content wise, but he'll frame questions on the test in a way that is completely foreign to example problems. Just make sure you use common sense. Do every easy assignment to cushion your grade.

Quite possibly the worst course I have ever taken at any level of my education. The homework had typos and errors ever week. Klinker did not submit grades on time and took several days after the hard deadline to post them, JUST TO GET THEM WRONG and email every student that he needs an EXTRA WEEK to fix them. We pay 35 thousand a year for this bs?

This class is an absolute disaster. Almost every model building exercise had errors in the instructions, completely forgot to post a quiz to the textbook publisher, and awful communication to students on due dates or guidelines. All the course content is reused yearly (Lecture videos from 2015), how is this class so disorganized? Waste of tuition.

This class is really just an applied algebra 2 class, but with how disorganized this course is it feels like everyone is rooting against you. Like 6-7 times a TA would announce a day before a hw was due that there were 3 errors in the instructions that we had to fix. The exams and group project really arent as hard as people say though.

Klinker is hands down the worst professor I have ever had. Every assignment he sent out had SO many typos. They make you buy a textbook that you only use to click youtube links that Klinker recorded himself. So, essentially, you're buying youtube links. Nothing was ever clear in this class, lectures were unhelpful, and the group project was a mess.

Klinker is a good guy and cares about his students, but it's hard to get anything out of his teaching style. The lectures are online videos with the powerpoints, however, they are unorganized on the modules and the powerpoints don't always match up. The class in person is not really helpful. Exams are difficult as it's hard to know what to study.

Klinker was good. He wasn't too accessible from email but the feedback I'd get from him in person was great. He's an old fashioned military guy, so some in the class didn't like his style. If you've ever had a tough boss at an internship, Klinker is that tough boss. Overall, he's smart and a good professor. He truly cares about your success too.

Klinker himself is a good guy and the class is pretty easy to follow if you attend lectures recitation. However, this class is the least oranized class I have taken. Due dates are always wrong on slides, incorrect directions on weekly assignments and quizzes with the wrong answers. Should not be this bad when he's taught this course for so long.

Klinker is the course coordinator for BusOBA2321 and the course is structured horribly.
