All MBE instructions were posted late and always had many typos and incorrect instructions so I ended up going to office hours solely to ask the TAs what the directions were actually supposed to say. Would not recommend if you aren't required to take.

Professor Klinker's teaching style takes some getting used to, but the structured format and helpful prerecorded videos make studying more manageable. unstuck ai complemented the course materials well for exam prep.
Rude, makes very distasteful jokes about women, disorganized

Although the class material is not hard, the teaching style makes it way harder. Lectures are extremely hard to follow, and the material skips from class to class. For a 1.5-credit-hour class, you will easily do more than that. Instructions on assignments are always wrong, and then points will be marked off, would not recommend.

Worst professor and class I have ever had. Spends half of the class berating his students. Makes mistakes on the instructions for virtually every assignment posted. Gives students no leniency but doesn't hold himself to the same standards. The actual content is easy to understand but he seems to enjoy making it intentionally more difficult.

Klinker is simply the worst. Wish I had more space but; Extremely rude, harsh grader, unorganized (mistakes on every assignment), 2 exams are 60% of your grade, Payed for a textbook just to watch youtube videos HE MADE, Feedback is vague and not helpful. Klinkler seems like a guy who has is out for his students. Would give a 0 if possible.

What an awful professor LOL. Vague grading criteria and no willingness to help. Not responsive at all. What a disgusting class. The group project had no clear criteria or assistance with difficulty, so prepare for sub 50% grades on that. No info on the exam yet as I have yet to take it, but wow. What a horrible course.

He's okay overall. his classes can be entertaining, but honestly, he's a little too full of himself. This isn't much of a problem, but dealing with a professor w this personality, means don't expect much leniency. also, its funny that he complained about us having to buy the book because we dont use it, but come to find out it's his book lol.

His grading criteria on the assignments is very vague and he takes points off for ridiculous things. The homework we're assigned barely pertains to what is going to be on the midterm and final, and doesn't help much at all. He's not approachable and doesn't seem to want to actually help his students.

He is very stern and just not a nice guy in general which makes the content even harder to process. It is a lot of work for a 1.5 hour class. The group project is extremely difficult as well. Still, he's the better option of him and Bonnie. He does not care about his students outside of class whatsoever.

Screamed at us on the first day of class for people wearing hats or sweatpants to class. Everytime you talk to him he makes sure that he has power over you. You think he would be nicer to the students that pay his $120,000 salary! He is also profits off his job because you have to buy the book he then I found out HE WRITES THE BOOK!!! Like Really!

He makes a lot of mistakes for homework and quizzes. It is pretty annoying for someone like me who gets work done as soon as they're open. There is no other professor to take this class other than Bonnie, who still uses Klinker's materials and the exams are the same.

Acts as if he is above all of his students and needs to baby us through college when in reality, he is the worst professor I have had. Always goes on tangents in class and is extremely bad at explaining concepts. Not to mentions he makes countless typos and his preparation material for exams is close to useless.
Bro makes you pay for a textbook for his class, the textbook is written by him...

The professor is okay but class it self is really bad. Exams are close to impossible no matter how much you study. Huge disconnect between the study guide, exams, and class. The final is cumulative and the average is super low.

Not exactly a hard course, just much more work than 1.5 credit hours. 8 short quizzes, 8 model building exercises using excel, one midterm, one big group project, and a cumulative final. Group project was frustrating since it was assigned at the end of the semester right before finals. Klinker was fine, just came across as cocky IMO.

Overall, not a bad professor or class. He just makes far too many mistakes when writing his assignments. Directions on the MBE's could've been a little clearer. He also no longer gives practice exams because "Students were complaining that the practice exam wasn't similar to the exam".

Professor Klinker is a very structured guy and so is his class. The model building exercises have detailed instructions and there is almost nothing that you have to infer yourself. The midterm and final exam are exactly what are in all of his problem-solving videos.

Terry gets a bad rep. The lectures are a bit intimidating and he comes off as pretty strict with his military background. But, he wants everyone to succeed. Once the class really gets going he's actually a pretty funny and like-able guy with some pretty interesting stories/life-experience. JUST DON'T WEAR A HAT.

This class was pretty straightforward with each lecture building off the last. The content wasn't too difficult, but you should definitely treat it like a regular class and not 1.5 credit hours. Klinker himself can come off a bit much at first with his military background and mannerisms, but he is helpful and presents the pre-lecture videos.

Klinker is really scary on day one, but he is such a kind person whenever I had to talk to him during office hours. Super intelligent guy and his past work experience is really fascinating to listen to. Treat this class like a 3 credit course because it is a lot of material. Truly one of my favorite professors in Fisher!

I thoroughly enjoyed this class. It made you think but still was straightforward. Terry Klinker has great lectures and the recitations really helped you back up your knowledge. My favorite class I've taken in college so far.

Terry Kilnker was an efficient professor. Personally this class should not be offered online and should be mandatory in person. The in person section allowed for us to basically do our group assignments together. The best way to succeed in this class is to show up. Final was easy. Overall, only downside is the class only has 91 possible points.

This class is not hard but that does not mean that you cannot not put any work into the class. Watch the pre-lecture videos, go to lecture, go to recitation, do the extra practice questions, and you'll be fine. Klinker isn't always the best at explaining things (personally I think Rakesh is better).

Professor Klinker is an amazing professor. He seems like a tough/scary professor to some but if you visit him during office hours he is so kind and helpful. His pre-lecture videos are great, the course material is very well laid out. He provides tons of extra practice that helps prepare for tests. I highly recommend taking analytics with Klinker.

Professor Klinker is great at teaching and his lectures are easy to follow. My biggest issue with this class is that grades are rarely updated. You will likely go into the final exam not knowing how you did on any assignment after the midterm, which is incredibly frustrating.

his zoom lectures were all over the place and not helpful. lecture slides were filled with useless information. expects you to memorize nity gritty details for this class. it was an online class but midterm/final were in-person which was odd. horrible at responding to emails and tough grader

Professor Klinker is by far the best professor I have had in my college career. He's very old school, has high expectations, and is very approachable with help on course work or any course issue in general.  Attendance is not mandatory but is kept track of for extra credit at the end of the semester. 100% recommend taking him!

Has a lot of typos and wont let you redo the work you submit if its based off that typo, sometimes he says he wont take points off too if you resubmit (when he does let you) and youll still end up with a 50%. Doesnt enter grades and when he does it doesnt affect your actual score so you have to calculate it yourself.   Easy class for most part tho

This was the most disorganized class Ive ever been in. Almost every quiz and assignment has typos or mistakes that make it nearly impossible to complete. Almost all my MBEs I have had to redo because there was a typo in the instructions. All the profs and TAs for this class were not on the same page and there was a lot of miscommunication

Terribly unorganized. Not very hard material, prelecture videos are critical, along with recitation. 3 group projects, very important and you must get a good grade on them. Attendance is extra credit. Lots of work for a 1.5 credit hour class. Lecture is useless.

It is an interesting class, but it is unfortunate to get a disorganized class. Don't take his class. He relied everything on the TA, and some TAs are not even very helpful. There is always something going on along with his excuses. Material is not hard, but impossible to get a good grade. Point deduction for every little thing.

Klinkers group projects are tough but if you start early and go into office hours you will be fine. Lectures feel pointless and sometimes hard to understand and most of the learning comes from recitation, and its luck of the draw if youll have a good TA teaching it. The grading scale is very forgiving, but its is a lot of work for 1.5 credits.

Completely unorganized this class could be interesting and we could learn but he is by far the worst professor Ive had and makes you use an external website that barely even lines up with his schedule too much work for a 1.5 credit hour class

By far analytics was the hardest class I have taken at Fisher. I thought I would not pass the class despite studying for hours and doing everything I possibly could do to master the material. Thank god I made it, Professor Klinker is such a gem and I was fortunate enough to learn analytics from him. Good luck fellow fisher students! You got this!

He never even puts your grades in Carmen so you'll never know how you're doing. He teaches analytics but has to get help from TA's on anything tech related. Taking this class is like asking your grandpa how to use powerpoint

Klinker is a great teacher and truly knows the content he teaches, but his course is horribly organized. The external site he uses for class content, Great River, is a nightmare. He also has typos on projects, assignments, and even exams. HOWEVER, given all the options for profs for this class, Klinker is the best and is a good dude.

Funny guy, but a little unorganized. However, if a due date was wrong or something he would give everyone full credit for the assignment. It's difficult material, but Klinker is really helpful and wants everyone to succeed.

Klinker is nice and gives off grandpa vibes but his class is challenging. It was not as terrible as I expected for online though, I just recommend really practicing the material and you should be fine.

Group projects are absolutely terrible and the exams are so hard. Final exam had so many typos and barely covered the material we did at the end. So frustrating to have to work so hard for a 1.5 credit hour class. He makes you buy the textbook to take the quizzes but the textbook is the most useless thing ever - not helpful at all.

The material is not hard but it is impossible to get a good grade on a final when there are typos on 5 out of the 34 questions. Students shouldn't suffer because a teacher can't double check his work.
Absurd that he even is a professor here. His video lectures are just him rambling about random crap. His final exam had ten typos. His videos for the final were complete garbage.

Horrible class. Did okay at the beginning of the course, but once everything went online due to COVID, all went bad. Its not easy to do an analytics project when all of your group members arent with you. This course in general is pointless and OSU needs to restructure it. Totally unfair to pay for a 1.5 credit hr class w 3 credit hrs of work.

Great professor. Acts tough to students but only because he really cares. He pushes his students to do well and does it in a respectful manner, but may come off as a bit intimidating at first. Do the work and understand the materials given. The exams were completely comprehensible and not at all hard if you have a grasp of the material.

Don't take klinker if you have a choice. exams are way harder than needed. he'll never ever answer his emails, he puts up wrong assignments and doesn't tell the class til last minute, and super harsh grader. some assignments if youre columns are .1 wider than specified, you'll literally get 50% even if the formulas and math are correct.

He enjoys intimidating students, but his TA's don't grade quite as hard as he threatens they will. If you study the lecture videos you should do well on the exams. Strongly encourage doing all parts of group projects because you'll be tested over them. Know how to do the PE's, don't just copy someone else's. You don't need to read the book.

Klinker is a great professor! The class has a lot of homework but keeping up with it allows you to learn the material for the exams. The exams are fair and the homework is generally easy. There are three group projects that aren't too hard. You have to buy the textbook for the quizzes and videos but you don't need to read it.

If you had to choose between dropping the Business minor and being forced to take Klinker's class, I would just drop the minor. Was extremely unorganized and never responded to emails. Forced you to buy the online textbook, which was full of grammatical errors. Every quiz had errors but he never fixed them.

Very unorganized. Posts lecture slides but then doesn't cover all of the slides in his videos. Often posts the wrong lecture materials under the wrong chapters. Different due dates on Carmen and on his online textbook. Does not answer emails. "Online class" but makes you meet in person.

Syllabus uploaded on Carmen was for another class. Wrong lectures put up, often late. Quiz questions wrong. Inaccessible by email (answered 1 of 10 emails so far). The online class has an in-person element. Finally puts grades in Carmen with 2.5 weeks left in the semester. Basically fails at every single component for being an online professor

Instructions on most things suck. ie. projects, tests, quizes. Treats students like soldiers. If something was his fault then its actually your fault. Also told our class that his textbook isn't written by him when in fact it is.

Nice guy, cares a lot about his students. The tests had too many formatting errors to the point where it felt unfair that it was up to the students to fix the exam questions. His exams are not equivalent to the practice; I just didn't click with the way he tested. However, there are enough points in the class that I was able to work my way back up.

TONS of work for a 1.5 credit hour class. Easily the most work for any class I've had. Tests are very specific, he focuses on trivial things which you would skip over when studying because they aren't important. Cares way too much about silly things, like wearing hats in class and for exams. Not a fan, even though you probably won't have a choice.

He may seem tough in lecture but he is actually a good guy and good professor, super nice when you have any questions. Lecture and recitation are not mandatory but lecture is quite funny but has same content as video. Pay attention to detail and the exam is not bad.

Formatting "errors" lower your grade even if the answers are right. He seems intense in lecture but is helpful and nice in office hours. Does an annoying thing where he makes assignments due at noon and not midnight - take note of this, I missed a few assignments due to it. Not a hard class but has way too much work to be only 1.5 credit hours

Very serious guy... runs his class like the military (no hats, phones, etc). Was incredibly disorganized when I had him last year, but curved the class to make up for his mistakes. Go to lecture as it is incredibly helpful, the examples from class/videos will show up on exams again.

Terry is a good guy in office hours, he genuinely wants you to do well. That being said, he's the most unorganized professor I've seen in fisher. The quizzes don't line up with the content, the group projects are graded more on "did you indent correctly" rather than did you do the problem correctly. It's not a hard class, just a lot of busywork

He's there for the students and wants you to succeed giving homework and easy quizzes to help boost grades. He even tries to aim lectures to apply to everyone w/ finance/marketing/HR example problems etc.. As long as you stay up and do all the work and review for exams doing all additional practice you should get a good grade.
Very hard class, very hard grader. That being said if you follow the directions closely and go to office hours he is very helpful and willing to help you out if you put in the effort.
Easy content but a horrible experience about unorganized course arrangement

Prof Klinker seems like an okay guy- but the class is setup extremely poorly. Quizzes don't line up with lectures for the week, assignments are super vague, oh and you can go from an A to a B on a project if your indent was an extra space too many. Lectures and material isn't challenging, but the class is one of the most poorly run classes at OSU.

Material isn't terribly difficult if you keep up with the lectures and videos. My biggest gripe is that the grading on assignments is terribly inconsistent and at times, unfair. Minus 50% because of an incredibly minor formatting error on an assignment that yielded the correct solution? Good luck with this class.

He is the only professor teaching 2321. The videos posted online are very organized, and the lecture is a recap of those videos. He teaches well, but not very organized on assignments and quizzes. But in all, he is a great professor.

This class wasn't as difficult as I thought it'd be. Some concepts that made you think outside the box, but it was not that bad. To pass the exams, watch the videos & do the modules extra practice (these are VERY similar questions on the exams). Go to class because there's things he doesn't have videos over. Go to office hours if you're confused
The professor is really resiponsible

Professor Klinker is a very good teacher in terms of lectures. He does have some work to do with his organization and the structure of the class, as well as communication, but nonetheless he is a good teacher. Get ready to do more work than expected for a 1.5 credit hour class. Pay attention, watch the videos, and you should be good.

Terry is an alright professor. He is able to teach the material well, but is very VERY unorganized. On the day of one of our exams he did not bring enough exams, so half the class had to wait around while everyone else was taking the exam.

Klinker was unorganized but he's a nice man and made up for it by giving full credit to all students for canceled assignments. It is more work than you'd expect for a 1.5 credit hour class, but an A is completely doable if you watch the videos, go to class (lecture and recitation) and do practice problems before exams.

He seems like a good guy, but he has no clue how to run a class. Assignment due dates are never clearly communicated, many assignments are never posted and can not be completed, and his tests are full of mistakes. Overall, the entire class was a semester of confusion trying to figure out what was going on and what was due when.

Terry is a funny and cool guy, but the course was a disaster. We didn't have Canvas for the first two weeks, and then after the midterm he stopped posting any videos or supplemental material. Terry is very smart and knows the subject matter well, it just isn't presented/organized very well.

I genuinely think he's a good guy and he's intelligent on the subject, but as others have said, he can't keep organized and the entire semester was a train wreck. Though, he admitted to it and understands he messed up. On the bright side, he does provide you with an adequate amount of study resources. Overall, a huge headache for 1.5 credits
Klinker is a cool guy, but this is by far the worst class i have taken before. Just very unorganized and hard to follow. Class involves lots of stats so that makes it worse

Terry Klinker gets a lot of crap, but I really think he's a good professor. He is unorganized which can get frustrating, but he always makes it up to the students. His classes are not easy and you will definitely have to study a lot. He is always willing to help his students and really wants his students to do well.
Very disorganized and the worst professor I have ever met.

Had a very unorganized and chaotic semester with this prof. Both he and the class setup need a lot of improvements but he apologized for it at the end and I feel that it was sincere. He also stated ways he is going to fix the class, so hopefully this class is better for future students.

I think people rate him too harsh and he doesn't deserve this rating. Frankly, he messes up some things but he compensated students by giving full credits on assignments. He apologized several times at the end of the semester, saying it was impossible for him to correct things when the semester began. Overall, he's caring and his class is interesti

Easily the most unorganized professor I've ever had. Always hard to figure out when assignments are due. Takes about 6 weeks just to see your midterm grade. Expects students to be professional but week after week is a disaster. Spend more time figuring out what's going on than actually studying.

Klinker is the most unorganized professor I have ever had. This buffoon preaches that his class be "professional" to the point of not wearing hats in class, yet every week is a train wreck in which assignments are cancelled, new assignments are created, all with a complete lack of communication.

Professor is, for lack of a better word, completely incompetent. No grades were inputted after the first midterm until after the final; lectures are completely useless; entire class is just a mess. Must buy his online code for $75 even though there is no textbook. Videos take an hour to explain what could be explained in 2 minutes.

Professor Klinker is a nice guy and a great teacher, but his class was nothing less than a trainwreck. The class was incredibly disorganized and assignments were littered with typos and mistakes. The factors mentioned above made the class far harder than it should have been. This could be a great class if Prof. Klinker was more organized.
Slow grader. A lot of cancelled assingments.

The most hypocritical professor I have ever had. Expects students to make minimal mistakes on assignments but then the course is littered with mistakes. On the first midterm there was a typo on every single page on the 7 page exam. Horrendous at organization and communication. Easily the worst professor I have had. No idea how he is still employed.

Echo what everyone else said. I knew about all these before taking this class but i still had to since its a required course. THANK GOD it is now over because I might go insane if I have to deal with him any longer. material is not hard. but IT IS because he is so irresponsible & disorganized its crazy. hard to believe a college like OSU hire him

This is the worst class I have ever taken. I never missed a lecture and I still think his assignments were difficult simply because of the lack of instruction. He holds students to an unreasonable standard then does not hold himself to the same. On the day of the final I still was missing grades for 8 of my assignments including the second midterm.

Terry Klinker provided me the most unorganized class I have taken since the 3rd grade. He was consistently inconsistent posting and grading assignments. His terrible teaching makes the class frustrating, however it isn't that difficult of a class. I wouldn't trust this man to deliver a pizza on the same day it was ordered.

I went to the lectures and recitations and did fine. The material is easy if you pay attention, the exams are decently easy but you never know what's going to be on them. There was a lot of work, the group projects were terrible, and Klinker is super unorganized but a good guy. Lectures were mainly meetings for everyone to get on the same page.

Honestly the worst professor I have had in Fisher. The course is extremely unorganized and he is terrible with communication. He is very hypocritical; demanding perfection on certain projects and then he makes countless errors when writing exams and projects. I really don't understand how this man still is employed.

Very difficult to reach or communicate with. Class is very unorganized. Several group projects that take time and though with limited directions. Exams are not very hard if you keep up to date on the material.

I have high respect for Prof. Klinker, but the class was a mess. The class was unorganized and group projects were very confusing. You might leave lecture confused, but he has numerous practice problems online, which are very similar to exam questions. Make friends in the class because it will make studying and projects a whole lot easier.

Good professor, better man.  Very helpful if you go to office hours and, if you do what he says, the class isn't very hard. It gets easier as it goes on, I got a C on the first exam and A's on the next two. A lot of the poor reviews here are because the class was poorly organized at times which frustrated a lot of people including myself.

The worst professor I had thus far when it comes to teaching.  This course is disorganized and an unpleasant learning experience. The publisher website and book, which he made us buy, was absolutely worthless.  Prior to lecture, he orders you to watch the videos but his lectures are the same material.  This course needs restructured.

He has 10 quizzes and 10 small individual projects.  There's also 4 large projects each worth 10% of the final grade, and 2 midterms and a final.  As long as you keep up with the videos and make sure to do well on the big projects you will be fine.
good dude man

Professor Klinker is great. If you actually go to lecture and put in some effort then you will be fine. People who graded him poorly probably just skipped recitation because that's where a lot of test material comes from. He is a genuine guy and I really enjoyed his lectures and talking to him individually.

The test includes material that was never taught. His syllabus specifically says his class isn't for teaching the material, it's for discussing real life applications. Exams are impossible, and he is 100% unreachable unless you're face to face. Klinker won't answer emails or phone calls and is never prepared or organized.

Funny guy, teaches via powerpoint. Exams are somewhat difficult. Not knowing what will be on them. Gives you some hints that it may have to do with "this" or "that" but the actual questions will be very specific on tiny details. Other questions will be a total surprise on something he never taught in lecture but you should've read. A "B" is doable

He's a pretty hilarious dude but this style didn't work for me. When I take a test, I assume that I've seen the stuff by reading the book and looking through my notes. That's not how it really works in this class. When he says somethings on the test, focus on everything tied to it. Read what he tells you to read, and nothing more than that.

Most disorganized class I've ever been apart of. Students have no clue what's expected of them until they receive exam grades back. Nice guy, terrible management. Would suggest self educating via the practice problems and going to lecture.

By far the worst class I've ever taken at OSU. The course is extremely unorganized and grades take several weeks to get posted. Practical exercises constituting 40% of the grade require extensive knowledge of material barely covered in lecture. I never imagined that a 1.5 credit business course would cause me this much stress. Absolutely terrible.

While he is a good lecturer with a good sense of humor and is fairly accessible, unfortunately his class was the most poorly managed one I have ever taken. Preposterous wait times for grades, he expects perfection despite not giving it himself, and he tends to talk down as well. I'm learning from him, but he is frustrating me in the process.

His lectures and handout materials are out of order which basically leaves you stranded during the lecture. He says this material is easy, which to an extent it is,  but it can become extremely difficult when the professor does not address every aspect to it. I relied more on tutors than I did him on understanding the material. Be prepared!

Professor Klinker, while very knowledgeable, is very disorganized which made the class very hard to follow . There are several extensive papers throughout the semester, with the option to work with others.  For a 1.5 credit hr class the work load was heavy. It is also very hard to reach him through email, but he is approachable in class.
Klinker is an ok professor. His lectures aren't too bad, he is a good speaker. However He's very controlling and unorganized. The class is soooo much work for being 1.5 credit hours.

Before I say anything, this class is hard. Not because of anything wrong with Prof Klinker but the material is a little hard to grasp and the harder assignments are worth more. BUT, Prof Klinker is an amazing professor and he treats students as the adults we are. He is funny, knowledgable and approachable in class and out of class. 10/10
Klinker is an ex Army Colonel, anti-government, neo-libertarian. Probably voted for Trump.  Good guy who knows his stuff though. Class was hard though.

I am rating the professor, not the awful class he teaches.  Klinker is a great guy who cares that you do well in his class. He made going to lecture enjoyable just by his little funny comments he would throw in.  With this being first semester of moving from Carmen to Canvas, he was very unorganized with the whole move, and apologized to all of us.

This has been the worst experience I have ever had taking a class in all of my years of education. Treat this class like its worth 4 credit hrs. Assignments were never clear, extremely long and tedious, and almost always had typos that messed up your final answer. I wish I had more characters because I could write pages of why this class is AWFUL!

Quite a few of the assignments were posted late or not at all. Practical exercises require using things not taught, which is extremely difficult with 4 of them comprising 40% of the grade. Tests are manually solving problems, while recitations are basically just being shown briefly how to use excel. Seems like a great guy, but the class is awful.

He is going to make you put effort into not looking like a slob for his class and he comes off as a jerk at first but he is really nice and super helpful if you go to his office hours. He wants his students to succeed and gives you a fair chance with assignments and if something is wrong on his part he doesn't hold it against you. Watch the videos!

Klinker was incredibly unclear with assignments, had large amounts of typos in instructions which would dramatically change answers, but of course expected perfection. With the change to a full semester class he absolutely dropped the ball. He can be respectable at times but he was an absolute let down this semester due to his cockiness and disorg.

Horrible professor. He constantly forgets to update his students on assignments he has either cancelled or changed the due dates on. He has no attention to detail with countless mistakes in his online quizzes and power points. His assignments are unbelievably long and cover information we have not learned. Good luck.

Great guy, but this is the most unorganized class I have ever taken. Weekly quizzes  and model building exercises won't be posted online. You never know what you should be looking before the next lecture. You get little to no practice with the concepts.  Interesting material, just wish the class was way more organized. Go to recitation!

Professor Klinker was a colonel in the US Army, so he's strict for a reason. Do not let this be a hindrance. Show up on time, and be ready to be challenged. Do not be intimidated by his strict demeanor. If you have questions go to his office hours and he will help you! Great professor.

Professor Klinker is a nice professor. Class are interesting but sometimes long. Have 5PEs and 2 exams (midterm&final). I have to say exams are not easy because he won't give you study guide. When you read PPT you will find some context he won't mention in the class. Don't worried! You will have a big curve on your final grade.

Klinker is an excellent instructor! He gets a bad rap for being strict, but just do what he expects of you. Going to class is essential in passing. If he sees you are actually trying he is more than willing to help. I did well on the Practical exercises but tests are a bit tough. Funny guy, one of my favorite instructors in Fisher.

This class is very tough. He starts off his class by letting you know his expectations. Take these seriously. He comes off as strict but I found that if you show him your are putting in the effort then he will help you succeed. His class is hard but, if you follow his directions and try you will pass. Also, go above and beyond on group projects.

This is my favorite professor in Fisher. He is definitely going to challenge you and make you work, but if you meet him halfway he is happy to help you in understanding the material. He does a great job of  introducing the concepts and then reinforcing them with concrete examples that he walks you through.

Very tough professor.  I wouldn't take a course with him again.  He is very knowledgeable about the material, but extremely lacks in helping students and being able to connect with them so they can understand the material.

The class seems fine at first, the problems are not horrible in lecture, but the test is on steroids, no partial credit given, the excel assignments are also extremely difficult, there is hardly any direction given to how to work the excel problems, i had to go see a TA of each assignment and still got bad grades when even they checked my problems

Klinker was a hard teacher and could be a little abrasive but the dude knows what he is doing. Great sense of humor and is an expert in his field. Very organized and really helps you to learn the material. Uses a great simulation the last few weeks of class to pull everything together. Wish I could take another one of his classes! Recommend highly.

Terry Klinker is one of my favorite Fisher professors. He comes off very intelligent and teaches the material very well. I would recommend him, just be ready to do some work. It isn't a blow-off class, but if you put in the work, you should get a decent grade. Overall, I really enjoyed having Professor Klinker and hope to have him again.

Klinker is strict, but a super nice dude. Is a little intimidating at first, but you'll warm up to him. Awesome teacher - way better than Christobek.  Makes the material very easy to understand. He's there for you if you need help, but you have to put in the work. Great professor!

If you have to take Operations Management, TAKE KLINKER. You are not allowed to use any  electronics in class but he keeps your attention anyway. He is far better than the rest of the professors for this class and gives you powerpoint slides that really help you ace the exams the other teachers do not give you.

Klinker is honestly the best teacher in Fisher. I had him for analytics with Christobek and for Ops. Ops is a smaller class usually full of juniors and seniors and he is really cool inside the classroom. He's strict, but if you follow his rules (don't use your phone) he's the man. His powerpoints are really useful come test time and he won't BS you

The class is tough but also extremely useful. Klinker and Christobek teach it together but if you can avoid chistobek you should. Prof. Klinker was fair and always made adjustments based on our feedback. I barely used the book but going to class is a must. Very fast paced. Slight curve

Class rules may seem strict, but I think it makes the learning environment better. Managed to keep a dry subject as interesting as possible. Tests can be tough if you don't practice, but they are fair for the most part. I would take him for another class if that's an option.
Good luck.

Textbook is not needed,  attending class is ESSENTIAL. Klinker is a great professor. Funny, engaging, and helpful. The man takes a boring class and makes it interesting. The case studies are very tough

Dude is one of the best profs at OSU. The early BUSMGT classes he teaches are difficult and there is no way around that. What makes him a great teacher is that he teaches with enthusiasm and adds humor to lectures. I reached the point of giving up in his class, but he noticed and didn't give up on me. Dude teaches for the students, not a paycheck

One of my favorite teachers in the business school.  I would definitely recommend him for OPS.  Made a boring and tough subject as interesting as he could.  He was honest, helpful, and fair.  Definitely would take him for another class.

I was confused about one point and went to his office hours to get some help before the exam. It was about somethings simple but he started insulting me because I didn't understand this simple thing! He started saying "You'll fail the exam and the class and bla bla bla" .. However he still helped me, so this is the kind of person he is.

If you are respectful and professional in class, you will have no issues with his demeanor. Multiple group projects that aren't difficult but the final is super difficult. Don't skip recitation if you want a decent grade at all. The king of dry humor.
very strict but will help you concentrate on the lecture. Makes a lot of jokes, and hate when someone is late to class.

Fast paced class - one of the few 7 week courses at Fisher - made managable due to Prof. Klinker's notes and ability to hold your attention.  Really did not look forward to the class but Klinker caught my interest early and by the end I wished there was an advanced course.  Klinker's class rules are strict, but really improve the experience.

I recommend going to every lecture and recitation because it helps with the cases. The first day he is strict but going to class was enjoyable because he is hilarious. I recommend taking it first session so you don't have his final exam during true finals week. Finally, no one I know used the text book so only do so if you plan on skipping lecture.

One of the better professors at OSU. Exams are not difficult if you study the material. The conceptual sections are difficult: because they aren't taught and the book doesn't help in this area. You have to figure that out on your own. Do well on the case studies and do all the myomlab homework and all extra credit and you will get a good grade.

The first day he comes off very strict (which he is) but after a couple lectures you'll figure out he's really a good guy. He cracks jokes all the time, the powerpoint he provides couldn't be more helpful, his lectures are super clear, and he's very approachable if you need further help. Best professor I've had in Fisher so far

Professor Klinker is very straight forward with his expectations of his students from day one(do not walk in late, fall asleep, or wear a hat, I am saving you from the embarrassment now) . Attendance is mandatory but he makes the lectures and recitations engaging. There is only one exam and he does not curve so be prepared.

Love him! Funny in a snarky way. May come off as mean but hes just joking. Tells you exactly what to do and common ways students mess up so you know what to look out for. He is tough though; don't come to class late or fall asleep - he wont take well to that. Answers questions well but slow via email. overall a good professor.
He comes off as a mean guy he will tell you how you will screw up (you probably will). He is a great guy, go into his office hours and he will help as much as he can.

Class was a bit tough, but totally fair. He tells you what you will slip up on, then you still seem to do it anyway. Keeps the lectures light hearted, which helps keep you engaged. Very knowledgable on the subject matter and super helpful during office hours. Highly recommend the book, super helpful.

He is a very respectable person. At first, he does make it seem like the class will be rough, however, it is only a persona. He is very helpful, and yes, there IS a curve in the class. He just does it at the end, so do not worry. I was at a flat B, and got bumped up to a B+. He does not directly read off the slides which is great as well.

Excellent professor.  If you have the option, take it with him.  Very organized, clear, details exactly what is expected and what one needs to do to succeed in the class.  Funny guy, but if you are a lazy person you will not do well.  Everyone thinks he's so tough, but just do the work and you'll be fine.  Imagine that-- lazy people don't do well.

Seems tough at 1st but actually very nice. Great lectures! very nice with grades. Participate in group case study and will get all the points for participation. for 2321 I was at a B for the class he bumped me up to B+ without asking, same for 3230, got A- but gave me an A. Test can be hard but do practice prob and review and you'll be fine.

Very organized!! He is very clear in what he wants and expects.  Put the work in and he will take care of you. Have had him for two different classes and have had two positive experiences.  Fair in grading but tests are pretty rigorous. I would recommend him.

This is my second class with Klinker and I picked my major because of him.  He has a great personality as well as a great teacher.  The class is difficult but if you attend class and study you should have no problem.  The simulation is fun and Klinker is very good about helping and giving second chances.  Favorite teacher of college.

the class is not very easy but Terry is one of my favorite teachers in fisher!!! he is humor and funny and he is super nice though sometimes he is mean but he is just trying to be humor lol well Klinker style humor. I LOVE HIM!!!!!  really hope he can teach me other courses in the futher! CHOOSE HIM!!!!

His lectures were very unclear mostly because he made frequent calculation errors and referred to incorrect terms, values or cell references when explaining problems in class. Half of the time I did not know if the material was actually challenging or if it was just poorly explained. If and when you are confused see the tutors in Fisher 009.
Vivid lecture and interesting examples!

He tries to come off very strict but is actually very helpful if you go to office hours. Class is challenging and requires effort. Case studies are the worst part and tests are not a walk in the park.

Had him for 330 as well...Both classes pretty similar in difficulty. He's a nice guy and sort of helpful in office hours but overall this guy does not explain anything well. He makes mistakes as he goes along so the whole problems ends up being confusing and wrong. He says correct him but a lot of time people don't know to. Makes things complicated
Tricky exams but material is not that hard if you attend all classes. Not as bad as expected but you have to put time and effort in to receive a good grade

Nice teacher, but seems to take a lot of points off for the most minor things. I got a bad participation points too even though I came to every class, office hours, and did well on quizzes. Doesn't really clarify things well when I am confused on certain problems as well. Need to come to every class
He deserves a chili pepper.

This teacher is extremely hard! hes a nice person only outside of class or if you go to his office hrs the material is hard to begin with & he makes it harder DON'T BE LATE TO HIS CLASS OR HE LL FLIP ON YOU in front of everyone. no cells phones in class. The class average was 60% on the midterm & he wouldn't curve.stay away if u care about your gpa
Took BUSMGT 330 class this winter. The class itself took a lot of work but Professor Klinker made it very enjoyable and rewards the people who take advantage of his office hours and who work hard.

Terry's class was pretty enjoyable. He's a funny guy and teaches the material very well. Goes at a fast pace and is willing to throw pop quizzes everyday so you have to be on top of your work. His exams are difficult but the practice exams definitely help. I would recommend him for this course but be prepared to work for a good grade
Took Terry's class this winter. It required some work (not mandatory) but it def helped out a lot when it came time for the exams.
Took Terry's class. Class was somewhat difficult but his jokes and willingness to always help with problems made it all the better.

Terry is by far the best professor in the college of business at Ohio State. He takes boring material and makes it bearable and even funny at times with his life stories. I didn't do extremely well in class (got a C), but having him as my professor made it all the better. I would take him for any class he teaches

Colonel Klinker is the man. He is strict but fun and a nice man. He cracks jokes that are better than the ones most other teachers do. He moves through the slides a little quickly so if you miss something don't be afraid to let him know, he'll wait. Gives solid explanations and keeps your attention.

He is really nice guy. He is funny in class and helpful in his office hour. Take an advantage of his office hour. As long as you try hard, you can get an A! The more time you spend, the better grade you will get!

Overall good teacher, does a good job explaining material and making it understandable.  Comes across as intimidating at first, but generally personable after you get to know him. Kinda strict because of his military background, but still a good guy.

Very understanding of students situations. He's a little unorganized and forgetful, but understands that and gives additional time to turn in assignments he has assigned. Very approachable & prepared for the lectures ahead of time.I'd say one of the best professors I've had because of how understanding he is & how much he's willing to help students

nice person, always smile not so tough as he try to be, but overall overrated, take both 330 and 331 with him this quarter, he mess things up and not very organized. didn't feel he explain things really well on 330, people got confused, 331 case can be fun but takes a while, he randomly assign people, nice thing is his final not hard

Demands a lot from his students but genuinely wants them to understand the material. Incredibly helpful if you go to his office hours, just be ready for pop quizzes and rigorous course work. If you do everything he asks of you the material isn't terrible, just keep up and enjoy one of the best professors in the business school!

Best Professor on campus. Dedicated and extremely helpful if you've any questions outside the classroom. The material itself is not that easy, but Professor Klinker makes it easy to understand. Cracks jokes in class to keep everyone awake. I wish all professors were like him!

He is a very good guy. He demands a lot of respect and has a lot of rules but is a really nice guy. He makes sure everyone understands the material and will reteach things if he needs to. Nice cure on all the exams as well. Just do the practice exams and you'll be fine. He doesn't grade case studies anymore either.
Fantastic instructor. Much better than the rest of the 330 group. He holds your attention, keeps it interesting and cuts you a lot of slack on exams and projects.
He can come off at first as very intense, but if you respect him, youll be fine. Practice exams help a lot.

The subject material for this class is not the easiest, but Terry made it more than manageable.  He takes time to clarify in class and is willing to schedule appointments if you can't make it to office hours.  His tests are fair and you will know what to expect if you do the practice exams.  Be respectful and follow his rules and you'll do well.
Terry's a fun guy that commands a lot of respect. He's very helpful, very understanding and he does very well at communicating the intricacies and nuances of the course.

Professor Klinker always says he's "a nice guy," and he really is.  Pretty easy class if you pay attention, do your assignments, and study for exams using the practice tests.  Make sure you get a good group for the case studies too.  Don't buy the book!

Mr. Klinker overall is a great teacher. He is a fair grader and takes the time to answer questions. I visted him at office hours on more than a couple occasions and he was great at taking the time to and answering questions.

Kept class fun and conveyed the material pretty clearly. Exams are fair, just do all of the practice exams that are given (there's like 7 in all). Case studies were a little tough, but he was there to help if you had questions. Overall a pretty good professor.

Took the time to actually ANSWER questions!  Comes from the business and management sector, and readily relates the course material to real world applications.  Expects you to know the material, but makes it worth learning.  Fair grading scale; low grade was a C+.  I didn't want to take the class but ended up loving it!  Take with him if you can!

He is a great professor. He loves what he is teaching and his job. He is not the type of teacher that just reads some slides, we practice with tools that are used in the marketing companies world. He cares a lot for his students and grades. Would definitely take his class again!
Amazing professor. Such a great guy who cares about his students. Loved going to his class he was the best!!

Do not take this class everyone gets a B no matter what, never experienced this kind of structure before, best grade in the class was an A-, worst class I have ever taken by far, don't try to work hard it almost certainly will not matter with the test structure.

Worst lectures I've ever had to sit through. Lasted the full 1hr20min and he would just read 40-70 slides of pure text or complex diagrams. Feels like he's purposefully trying to confuse you with content. Insisted the exams were not memorization-based & that he spent "hours making them easier" but the entire class would still do horrible. Curved.
This teacher's class is boring and uninteresting. There are few students who pay attention in class. If you want to get a good grade, you should take another teacher's class.

Worst professor in Fisher, this class is a waste of your time and money. If you want a pretty easy B, take 3600 with Bruce. But if you're willing to work for an A, take ANY other teacher. You cannot work for an A in this class. Plus, he's rude and must really love the sound of his own voice. We get it you were a CIO! I'm not impressed Bruce.

This class is genuinely funny. Bruce teaches this class in an attempt to pass his "expertise" down the ladder to tomorrow's leaders. He lecturers the entire class about how to be an executive. The thing is though, he teaches no content. It's all about his personal opinions on leadership style. He is not knowledgeable at all about ANY technology.

This class has absolutely no flow to it. Almost done with the course and I feel like I haven't learned a thing. Nothing really to take away from the course and Bruce is pretty good at talking long enough to avoid answering your question. Avoid this class if possible.

I like professor Barnes because of his passion in teaching and he sharing his experience in the field. I enjoyed the guest speakers that he brought in to the class who are experts in IT field. This class does require effort and is challenging. However, he is more than happy to help out with questions.

The subject matter is definitely relevant and useful for being an IT leader in the future, but the way it is presented and the class structure is very frustrating. Bruce loves the sound of his own voice. He is a subjective grader. If things are not written from his perspective, points are removed. He lies. Points were removed from "final grade", et

Participation is not only a requirement, it is expected for every class. Participation is 30% of the final grade and if you don't say something in EVERY class then don't expect to get an easy A. He knocked down participation points for most students a week after the final because of a "grading error." Insane amount of reading. Misleading exams.

Relevant content, subpar teaching. He flat out told us (multiple times) not to memorize the slides for the exams because they would be based on the "big" concepts and not "small details." Well turns out every question asked us to "list the 5 things about a concept" which requires PURE MEMORIZATION. Also he is obsessive about participation.
Professor Wen is great, she is always there to help you if you need it. Go to class, she recognizes effort. She was very accommodating and accessible outside of class.
Good professor. Class is so disorganized, but their mistakes helped my grade. I suggest doing the homeworks to ensure you are on right track. Exams are easy. Group project graded easily.

Doctor Mallipeddi was a great lecturer and was always available for questions. The class itself was run pretty poorly, with nearly every MBE and the group project having errors, but he isn't the one creating those assignments so I don't hold it against him. Exams were pretty tough with a lot of theoretical questions but overall very good professor.
exams were easier than the homework, good teacher, fair grader

Professor Mallipeddi's lectures were pretty straightforward, he explains the concepts fairly well. The course itself was very disorganized during the semester, especially the group project. The midterm and final included material never covered in class or recitation which was frustrating.

Mallipeddi was fine. He was clear when teaching the material so it was not too hard to understand the topics. The reason why I gave a low rating was because of how many problems there were with the course. There were problems in the instructions in every assignment, which unacceptable and I have spent HOURS extra working on things just b/c of this.

One of the best professors I have had here, great lecturer who communicates topics clearly. Workload isn't that heavy, maybe three homework assignments and a group project. The programming and excel skills in this class are also super applicable for jobs in the future. Highly recommend him as a professor.
Great teacher that knows what is talking about. BUSOBA 3331 is not for you if you don't like Excel or hate programming. Some homework and projects, but really interesting and educational.

I took him for BUSOBA7250 (course code did not list this as an option)

I actually enjoyed Professor Rakesh greatly. I took him as part of the SMBA program and it was one of the easier classes for the program. You will have fun in his class if you show up and participate.

Rakesh was a great professor for this class. He knew what he was talking about, and he tried his best to make it as easy for us to understand as he could. He even changed the standardized course slides a bit to accommodate for his teaching methods. I learned a lot from him. Lectures and recitation attendance just replace lowest quiz and HW scores.

Mallipeddi is a great choice if you can't get Klinker for analytics. He is very straight forward and has a small Indian accent which did not bug me at all. Teaches very similar to Prof. Talke if you had him for stats. Overall I thought he was a good teacher!
THE GOAT !!

So far, the best prof I've had. You don't need to spend extra time; you just need to keep up with him in class, and all your questions will be answered, and you'll perform well on exams. He is a very attentive and logical person. If you go to his office hours, you won't be disappointed. The assignments and exams are consistent with the class.

Sean did a great job in a complex and math–heavy elective to make it easy to understand and be successful. Sometimes classes like this are a challenge as the professor flies through the material leaving you confused, but the complex equations were walked through, explained and he made sure we understood the process and purpose of the work.
Sean is a great instructor, cares about his students, assigns challenging yet reasonable work and is very prepared for class.  I am glad I have had this experience.
This Professor is a hidden gem. If you don't take care of him at Fisher I will be very disappointed.
Don't hesitate!! just take his class!!!!
Dr. Wan is the kindest professor that I've had in Fisher. You can tell he really cares about his students and wants them to learn the material. Would definitely recommend for any class!
Dr. Wan was very helpful, it feels like he want everyone do well in his class!

Sean is one of the better professors at Fisher who enjoys helping students understand the material and his class was easy as long as you paid attention. You are only graded on four items, so be sure to take it serious and let him know if you do end up falling behind. I wish he would implement a participation grade, but overall I can't complain!
Best Professor in Fisher!! Love him!!!

LOVES kahoot. such a chill guy. He explains the material clearly. Had a few laughs in his class. Fun fact: He loves Chipotle. I would say to understand the material conceptually because on the exams, there were a few definition questions, but you have to know what you are doing for the others. Loved the TAs. Not hard just practice.

This teacher is by far the most compassionate business teacher I've taken! He works very hard to make himself available for office hours and at your convenience if necessary to help you succeed. He is super easy to talk to and work with and will gladly fix any grade miscalculations for you. Allows full front-back cheat sheet for exams too.

Especially for a first-year senior lecturer, he seems very well versed with the content. Occasionally misspeaks in the lectures but will either correct himself or will have it be addressed in the recitiation. 1 page of notes for exams, just pay attention and you should be fine.

Very kind professor! Each class is explained in a very logical manner and questions asked by students are answered in detail to ensure understanding. The exams are a bit difficult, but with careful listening and reviewing the PowerPoint, you can master the knowledge to a great extent！

Best professor, gave us toys and played chess with us in the last class.
But seriously prof Leiblein cares about his students and his course, and makes it fun.

Only had him on lectures for BUSMHR 4490. Is not an interesting subject for a big class lecture and he doesn't try to make it. His online tests are easy of read the chapter and slides before hand, but he is a tough grader. Really difficult to get an A

If I am being honest, this is probably the worst professor I have ever had at OSU. I am not saying this because he is tough; I am saying this because I learned absolutely nothing from him, and it is sad that I had to pay money for his class. To put simply, he is not meant for academia.

No. Don't take him. Most boring lectures ever and does not know how to effectively teach. He just talks, talks, and talks for an hour and a half but does not TEACH. He does not know how to teach or how to make lecture content interesting for students. Please do me a favor and don't take his class so that he learns that his way of teaching is bad.

This guy is a hero. Worst class I have taken at Ohio State. He uses 3 quizzes to determine 60% of your grade. Thank God for having recitation with more ways to be graded. If you can take another professor, take them. If you can transfer before having to take him, do it. I have not been more disappointed in a professor in my time here.

Two quizzes, a bunch of Pearson hw and simulations that are pretty hard. The two 'quizzes' are REALLY hard and impossible even if you read the book and watch his online lectures. He's also such a tough grader. Take heidi instead. I would not recommend him at all.

Lecture and recitation are two completely different classes. Kluppel is not the best lecturer...the lectures are super dry and boring. Exams are pretty difficult but not enough to worry too much about it considering the lecture portion is worth 40% of your final grade. Found it was more worth my time to read the book on my own than go to lectures.

This professor is awful. Avoid taking this class with him at all costs. Weekly modules are posted sporadically through the week making it difficult to plan for. The tests are impossible to study for and structured horribly. If it was not for the recitation half of the class with a different setup and professor, the course would be a total waste.

I just took my first quiz with Professor Kluppel, and I'm feeling pretty disappointed. I tried hard, but it didn't seem to pay off. The way he teaches in class is not engaging, and the quiz was way too hard. I'm confused why he's still teaching the same way and not changing overtime. I agree on the listed rating 100%.

Similar experience as others. His tests are nearly impossible to study for. Yet, they are weighted for 75% of the lecture grade. He reads off slides, and the book is somewhat helpful if you don't understand material, again good luck on his tests. This course needs to change.

He an overall lazy professor who uses McGraw-Hill and Packback to carry his content. The only component he has any hand in are the lectures, which are a healthy combination of poor handwriting, pacing, and jumbled topics.

I am not sure how he has continued to be mediocre for hundreds of students these last 4 years. I'm hoping he can still change.

Professor Kluppel was ok. His class consisted of exercises through connect, packback, simulations, and exams. The exams are difficult, but he curves these. Packback is annoying but it is really easy to earn an A on these. The simulations are terrible but account for a small portion of the grade. Felt like I learned nothing of value with this class.

Really awful. Lectures are terribly boring and there is no possible way to prepare for the exams and do well. He does curve the exams, that is the only good thing to say about him. Did not learn anything, due to a lack of quality teaching. Avoid like the plague!

Kluppel is the worst instructor I had while at OSU. Reads directly off slides, doesn't help his students, & shows no enthusiasm when teaching. Reached out a few times during the semester & didn't receive a single response. Class is basically 3 exams which are virtually impossible to study for bc the course content doesn't prepare you

This class was a lot of just him reading off the slides. No examples were given and he made the exams impossible to pass. It was sometimes hard to even understand him. I felt that I had to teach myself and it was really hard to understand any of the terms without references.

Exams reference content that was never learned and the exams are 20 questions in 25 minutes so there's very little time to even make an educated guess on the questions that he pulled out of thin air. Lectures are prerecorded and just him reading over a very basic slideshow. Fisher needs to read these posts and understand that this class is unfair!

The lectures, lecture slides, and book only cover very basic concepts. The exams are much more in-depth, which means regardless of how much you study, you'll find the exams to be extremely difficult. It's super discouraging to open up the exam and feel like you haven't studied a single bit. That's how exams feel.

Exams for this class are incredibly hard even if you study the textbook and watch the lectures. Uses packback which is super annoying. Lectures are not stimulating at all. Do not feel like I really learned anything from this course.

NEVER reply to your email, be careful. 
He only posted some PPTs and videos recorded previously on Carmen, and no other efforts I can see.
He just read out contents in PPTs and gave few explanations and even examples. I would like to study by PPTs only by myself, rather than listening to his slow, boring recorded videos. 
Exams are difficult!

If you read the book you will do fine on the exam. It is a proctored and closed book, so you have to read the book or watch his lectures. The exams arent that bad, the second one was a bit harder with less time, but he curved it. Overall a great professor.

His lectures aren't very helpful in terms of learning the material, and his exams are pretty brutal. He does have accent so be aware of that, but it's not difficult to understand what he is saying. He's seems to be one of those professor's that is trying to prove his worth by making things unnecessarily difficult.

He has conscious bias syndrome. He keeps grudges, tend to grade you poorly when you sort for clarification and that is very unprofessional. He is new to the field of strategy but rather not embrace constructive correction or criticism. people with conscious bias syndrome should not be allowed to lecture.

He seems like a very nice and cool dude, but his exams are impossible. They are WAY more in-depth than the book or his lectures, so even after studying I felt like I was in the dark and confused. Again, very nice guy but cannot effectively teach. I will forget everything about this class in a week. Just busy work, not very useful.

She's not Excellent nor Awful teacher, as you can read on other's opinion. Her class content is not super fun but she make's it entertaining and easy. Be prepared to attend class and group presentation. She is a good person but politically biased sometimes.

Heidi is definitely the best option for capstone lecturers! Her exams are not that hard, and the averages were pretty high. She acknowledges that we are graduating seniors, so she doesn't make it too hard on us. The lecture portion grade is made up of homework (completion grade) & 2 exams (neither are cumulative). She's great!

I took BUSADM 3642 with her and wasn't impressed. Big group project and lots of guest speakers but it didn't feel useful for EEDS majors unless you want to be a sustainability coordinator for a huge publicly traded company. If you don't show up to a few classes you'll get a B, and the rest of your grades are based on a couple midterms and projects.

Had her for 3640.02 & 3642.02. She is a nice person but her teaching style isn't good. 1st sem exam was weighted way more than the project we worked on the entire sem, which really destroyed some grades. Terrible way of organizing a course. 2nd sem wasn't as bad. If you have to take her- do well on EVERY assignment bc you are graded by so little.
Awful, unqualified and lack of professionalism
awful
This class is way harder than it needs to be. Problems are all application based (thats code for im going to try and ask you trick questions). Professor seems loopy.
She is great.

Heidi is a great professor; she is genuinely interested in seeing you engage with the material. I did not love the course content, but she was always so engaging that I looked forward to class. Great 4490 professor to close out your senior year - highly recommend.
Heidi is so genuine and truly seems like she wants to help students. This is one of the few classes I actually enjoyed attending because she was so caring and made class as good as it could be.

I had prof Shull for both the lecture and recitation side of 4490 and enjoyed having her! She's so nice and seems to really care about her students. Recitation is mostly group presentations and a group term paper. Lecture is watching videos and doing textbook homework assignments. Exams are fair.

A truly incredible professor. She is very passionate and understanding, she is always available to help and genuinely cares about her students. The classes are mostly group presentations, but in the end she always talks a little about the topic and has an activity for everyone. Most of your grade comes from the group presentation

Heidi is a great choice for recitation. She grades fairly easily and she tries to have the class be fairly interesting. Group Projects (Paper and Presentation) and individual small paper are main grades with a few other small surveys included too. DO NOT BUY ALL THE CASES! Just yours and the one you are asking questions for! She is really nice!
This class feels unnecessarily difficult. The professor struggles with effective lecturing, and much of what we cover in class doesn't even appear on the exams. Take Prof Newsom if you can.
Lousy, uptight professor that doesn't care about her students. Class is easy but she finds a way to make it needlessly difficult so that you get screwed over no matter what.

She gets paid to do nothing her responses are short. She pretty much will email you back and tell you how to do what you asked her to do in the first place. It's sad to know my tuition goes to such an unhelpful individual. She was set as my advisor sophmore year and never reached out our first conversation was almost a year and a half after.
Was very rude and unhelpful

I don't know what these other reviews are talking about. She was my advisor after I transferred to OSU, and still is. She responds to emails fast, answers all questions in depth, and makes sure you are set up graduate! She is so kind and has helped me throughout my time at OSU and I finish my last year here :)
Worst advisor at Fisher. Extremely condescending, rude, maybe racist, and does not care for her students at all.
One of the worst prof at OSU. avoid at all cost!!

If you think you've hit rock bottom, you haven't. Unless you're taking his class. This guy is nice, but he is the worst teacher I have ever had. Read the other reviews. 16 years of education and I would rather have my kindergarten teacher help me learn the material. He makes tons of mistakes and blames the students for not correcting him. Traumatic
He is super nice and very smart, but he cannot portray thoughts at all. He is the worst teacher, and somehow makes the content in the book more confusing each time he covers it.
Avoid if possible!
Worst professor ever at OSU. Grading not clear at all. Awful Awful Awful

Doesn't grade with any clear system. Material not covered in class that is on the exam. Very poor writing skills, hard to read on the board. Possibly the worst professor I've ever taken with 121 credit hours at OSU.

Worst professor I ever had. Took calls in the middle of our class, called students out all the time, tested and gave us cases on things he did not even cover in class (cases took 4-8 hours), and only graded students by how much he liked you (he didnt even enter in grades on Carmen so I have no idea how I did on tests or projects). Take anyone else.

He is the worst professor I have ever had in my three years at Ohio State. All he does is read directly off the slides that have little to no information relating to the material on the exams. He also assigns cases pretty much every week that require a large amount of your time, but it barely counts for any part of your grade. Avoid at all costs.
Tough Class. Definitely go to office hours and do as many problems as possible before the test. The tests get easier as you go along.
Terrible teacher. Just rambles on an won't answer questions

This is the only time in my college career where Ive been 100% confident that the professor doesnt know his own material. The course is based off his horribly written textbook littered with errors. He is unable to answer question, do his own problems correctly, or reply/make time for students. The final grade is completely subjective.

This has been the single most frustrating class I have taken at OSU. Dr. Benton consistently came unprepared for problems in lecture, frequently failed to respond to emails, showed a lack of respect towards his students by acting rude and dismissive, & seemingly struggled to teach the textbook he wrote. Do everything you can to avoid Dr. Benton.

Benton is the most worthless professor I have ever taken. He is cocky, grades with his opinion of you in mind, and teaches so poorly. Exams are extremely difficult and are too long to finish in the decreased time window. Don't disagree with his opinions and do not challenge any of his ideas. Take with any other professor and you'll do fine.

Probably the worst professor at the school. Gives a lot of work and teaches very little. His book is riddled with typos and mistakes. Key to the class is getting everyone together to study for exams. Also, he offered 7% extra credit on exams to join his club PSMA for $25 dollars. Do whatever it takes to get the other professor for this course.
Professor Benton is a brilliant Professor with an extensive resume. His class is very difficult, but he respects hard work. Get on his good side, show that you care, and you can get an A.

WC Benton is the real deal. Want a grade on a transcript - DO NOT TAKE this class - like the bunch of whiners who complain about him. If you want real world hands-on "this is for real" education, Dr. Benton delivers - Just as he served in the Army in Viet Nam - he now serves his students. Be prepared to show up and WORK! Dr. WC Benton is the best.

He does not teach in class, you have to learn from HIS book doing the homework except the book is TERRIBLE + doesn't teach you. He goes over the homework in class and then you go home and try to teach yourself the next section. His grading is so subjective + you won't know what you are getting. Condescending + won't make time to meet with you

By far the worst professor I had in Fisher. Has a great deal of business knowledge but just a terrible professor. Very disorganized, his tests are ridiculous as most multiple choice questions have multiple correct answers, seems clueless when conducting lecture, and has shown rude tendencies throughout the semester towards students. don't take.

A great professor who has a wealth of knowledge he shares with his students.  He has a keen interest in having his students succeed.  But you have to WORK for an exceptional grade.  Don't think you can get an "A" while presenting "D" work.
A professor like him should be fired. Please Please Please don't take his lecture. He is going to ruin your life.

Lacks Clarity. Grades Inconsistently. Exams directly from his textbook andthe assigned readings. Midterm and Final are 35 multiple choice questions with of 3-4 viable answers -- so phrasing is key. 3-4 short answer questions as well. Quarter project and case write-ups lack clarity, and graded inconsistenly.

Just b/c your successful in the real world, does not mean you can teach! And that is how I describe Benton.  Is very vauge on what material will be on the test, has fill in the blank notes, changes the syllabus on a whim.  If you have the chance to take this class with another Professor, DO IT!
Awful professor.  Today was the best day though, I dropped the class!!! Do not take either of his classes if you can avoid!!
He is incredibly difficult to reach via email. If this class is not required DO NOT TAKE IT! He assigns homework before teaching material in class.  NOT GOOD!!!

Easily the WORST professor I've ever had the misfortune of knowing. His lectures consisted of him talking about how successful he was in the real world. Hence no idea what to expect on the tests. He gives you notes online but over half of them are blank, so you have to read the book very carefully if you want your notes filled in. Dont take Benton.
350 characters is not even close to enough to explain all the reasons why this professor is awful. avoid his classes.
Worst prof I've ever had. This is the only class I have ever had to drop. He's terrible
The difficulty level of the tests did not reflect the ease of the lectures. He would tell you that you were doing fine in the class, and then you would end up with a low grade.

This class is no where near as hard as he makes it if he would just take the time and effort to teach the material to you.  You are paying tuition to teach yourself this class, and the homework he requires, in addition to having to spend extra time teaching yourself, takes even more hours.  He showes favoritism and lacks organization. Bad Prof.

This is definetely a hard class. But with time and effort it's do-able. Benton definetely rewards those who attempt their homework and go back to correct mistakes. Attendance is very important. Pay attention. His tests are difficult, but what really counts are the homeworks and group case study. Go to PSMA meetings for extra credit!
after 37 college level courses, he is no doubt the most worthless of any.  DO NOT TAKE THIS PERSON'S CLASS!

Must go to class no matter how boring cuz that's where you learn and he give out additional homework. Must do homework cuz some questions are similar on the midterm. But he rarely reply emails and availability is scarce. Show favoritism. If you have other option(s), dont go for his. good luck!
No Comments

His homeworks take hours to complete because he does not teach you the material until after they are due. Questions on his exams are not always covered in class (exam q's more in depth).  Do not take him, I studied more for his class than all the other 3 classes I was taking that quarter combined and got a C, while getting an A in every other clas
Very good professor with a vast knowledge of the information.  Was always very helpful at office hours and would clarify any misunderstanding in class.  One of the best professors at OSU.

The material in this class is very difficult.  Compounded with Benton's horrible writing, organizational skills, lack of clarity, and expectancy for students to automatically understand all brand new material will make for an extremely challenging quarter.  He does reward those who make an honest effort and is a little better during office hours.
Horrible!  Very unclear, gets upsest at students when they ask questions he thinks they should already know the answer to, one of the worst professors I have had.
The best professor in the college of business.  He is sharp.
The only thing worse than the class is HIM. Avoid him at any cost. You're gonna fail the class.
Very challenging!

Go to each and every class of his. ITS A VERY VERY HARD CLASS. The average on his first exam will be around 64% with a curve. Final exam is even tougher. Do all your homework. Go to his office hours. But remember one thing, dont count on him for everything. He is very disorganized.
Good Professor
GO TO CLASS, GO TO OFFICE HOURS, DO YOUR WORK. SHOW HIM YOU CARE ABOUT HIS CLASS. ITS A HARD CLASS BUT WITH EFFORT YOU CAN PASS.
Caring professor. Class involves assignments and group projects. Not much busy work. Fair grader.
The absolute goat for 4380 and 4383. You are in good hands if you take her classes.
I don't like this professor. Because she asks you to answer questions in class. I didn't know this percentage was significant until the end of the semester.
