- truly challenging - pushes us beyond comfort zones, inspiring to explore new ideas & approaches.

- extraordinary depth of knowledge in their field 

- lectures are intellectually stimulating, thought-provoking and incorporate real-world examples, which brings the subject matter to life.

-challenging students to think critically and analytically
Agreed one of the nicest teachers I have ever had! So willing to help you with anything :)
Good professor, willing to help and offers help. Quizzes and exams were somewhat hard.
worst instructor I ever met at osu. She left me with bad memories!

Dr. Ren really cares about her students. If you have any questions, you can just send her a message, and she'll schedule a meeting to help you. Some group projects, but not too much work to do if you're in a good team. Exams are closed-book but not hard either if you go to review session. I learned lots of professional terms in these two courses.

Professor Ren is great! The class was a little weird since we were online because of COVID and she had never taught this class online before. She is very open to responding to questions. We only did a few cases, two tests, and a team project.

I would avoid taking another class with Erin again. She is extremely detailed and asks for VERY specific styles with her assignments. Also uses an online proctor that locks down your computer and feels invasive of privacy. She is sweet, and available outside of class if you need help, but I learn more efficiently with other teaching styles.
Solid coverage of ops management
Great professor!
Nice professor who really cares about her students. Will work with you extensively 1 on 1 during office hours.

It seemed as though it was her first time teaching this course. The topics covered in this class shouldve been much easier than how they were presented- it was a struggle at times to get through basic example problems. Also be prepared to have last minute cancellations, not very respectful of our time as working professionals.
Great professor! Learned a lot about sustainability throughout the semester!!

I had McKie for core ops. Some assignments are challenging. However, If you put in the work, youll do well and learn a lot. She is more than willing to help students who are struggling via office hours. Most students made an A or B on the first exam. Additionally, she does attend & proctor her exams via Proctorio. Overall great professor & class.

Fall of 2021 marked Professor McKie's first time teaching a graduate level operations management class -- and it showed. Be prepared to teach yourself the course material, as she makes many mistakes during the in-class examples. Be prepared to use proctorio as well, as she doesn't like to proctor her own exams. Many run out of time on tests.

If you pay attention, read the textbook and study, you will be very good. You do need to put in the work and do what youre supposed to but its really fair. Grading and expectations of what you need do know are really clear. In addition, she responds to emails really quickly and seems to be really helpful!
Not a bad professor, but exams are way harder than it should be. There are a lot of things on the exam that she doesn't even talk about. Good luck taking this class

Dr. McKie is knowledgeable on the subject matter and helpful. The class has become pretty standardized across all the professors for this course but she definitely made sure to prepare you well for exams and for applying these topics in the real world. Recitations typically ended early but lectures would run late with learning catalytics.

Dr. Erin is very caring and helpful, she is very knowledgeable in the subject, willing to help outside of office hours, gives nice reviews before the exams. enjoyed her class and recommend taking her class 100% .

Good professor. She can seem a little nervous in lecture and makes some mistakes, but she is a lot more personable as the semester goes on, especially in recitation. She is really good and helpful in office hours as well. Caution: Midterm is super easy (I got an A) snd Final is really hard (I got a C-). Do not need the textbook, just online Pearson

I enjoyed Dr. McKie. She is very willing to help you outside of class if you're struggling with the material. Attendance taken every class period through Learning Catalytics. 2 Tests that count for 50%. Other 50% of grade determined by in and out of class assignments. Lowest homework score dropped.

Dry, but nice professor. Not a bad lecturer, but she explains things too slowly and messes up often, and doesnt fix. Same exam as other lecturers. 1 midterm (35 MC Q), 1 final (cumulative). Online access needed for quizzes, simulations and HW. Again, not hard or bad, just boring and inexperienced. Attendance required, learning catalytics used.

Not recommended 

He doesn't know how to communicate about his homework or assignments.

Very confusing and disorganized 

He is the worst instructor when it comes to grading and explaining things.

Won't answer any technical questions,  and refer you to the lecture notes.

Dr. HALL is not clear on his assignments and doesn't post grades on time. 

Very unorganized and very ridged. 

Not good answering questions with real work examples.
He memorize his text and assignment where it is very boring class.

Not recommended at all.

One final (open book), 2 Team case write ups and in 2 cases, 1 case presentation (doesn't matter how many team members present the case ). Final was straight forward.  Attendance is mandatory. Easy to get good grade if you do the homework (which is not required for submission)
i liked the course and liked the prof.  workload was fair.  material was interesting.

If you try at all, you'll get an A.  The book is almost worthless; don't bother buying it for his class.  I think I paid like $70 to page through it three times. You must go to lectures, or else you won't pass.  He pretty much lays it out for you in class.

had to take this guy because the other class was full. hes an okay guy, his test and hwk policy is really good though, best 3 out of 4. though hes hard to understand sometimes and is really bad at answering questions. my g.f. asked him about how carmen does your score/total to find ur %, and his response was: i dont know what ur talking about.

Pretty boring class. The book is pretty much useless.. I think I may have used it twice. I loved the grading policy: best 3 out of 4 exams and best 3 out of 4 for HW. He has a bit of an accent, so he is sometimes hard to understand... Pretty boring material, but despite that he did a decent job at keeping my attention.
3/4 exams and homework what more could you ask for. The material is very easy compared to 330 and he does a good job of explaining. Would advise anyone who can to take this class with prof. Hall.
Hall is somewhat disinterested in teaching and his exams are challenging but somewhat fair. You drop your lowest exam and homework grade so the options for a good grade are high

He is an okay teacher but he really doesn't teach the subject matter well. He makes you feel like a two year old in class and then puts difficult questions on the test. If you put some work in to it you will be fine.
it seems like a very easy class on the first day, but the homework and exams are extremely hard. The material is easy but he just like to make verything difficult

Prof. Hall is a very good teacher.  He explains the subject matter really well to be sure you know what is going to be on the exams.  Homeworks however are pretty tough and he really stresses that he does NOT want us working with other people when it is impossible not to.

He's the biggest jerk I've ever known. He doesn't even try to help you with your questions. I had a question for him and he told me that he didn't have a lot of time to talk when it was 5pm and the class was suppose to end at 5:18pm. I HATE HIM.
Horrible class! Take this class, tons of work will blow you

Really easy class. I hardly did anything and got a B+ Didn't bother taking the final or completing the last homework because he only counts 3/4 exams and homework. Only downer is that the class is super boring and the homeworks took a long time to do.

The material in the class is easy and he does a pretty good job of explaining it. Best 3 of 4 exams. I studied for every exam the day before and I got an A. Shouldn't be too hard for anyone to make at least a B.

Some of the material is hard.  Some of it is extremely easy.  Prof. Hall does a good job of recognizing what's tougher and spends more time on that stuff.  He tries to be funny at times (sometimes he's really not; sometimes he is).  Overall an interesting professor for a course that's just a bunch of number crunching.

okay in lecture, homeworks take a lot of time, tests are not too bad if you prepare, very boring material, testing policy is very nice ( cheat sheet, best 3/4) homework policy is ludicrous (can't work together AT ALL) The text packet is somewhat confusing.

He is an okay teacher, nothing great. Kinda goes fast. Really strict about Academic Misconduct. Not hard to get a B if you do all the work. Tests and HW are best 3/4. Not the easiest class, tests are tricky, def. requires studying

The class is not easy, you really have to study the material.  He is not a bad lecturer, but the exams are hard as hell if you don't prepare well in advance, use a cheat sheet.  Homeworks are best 3 out of 4, each are one problem.  Do not work together, he's extremely anal about academic misconduct.

Very ambiguous grading system. Class is easy, but he gives extra credit and then adjusts the number of total points for it(which defeats the purpose of extra credit). Then he said that 137 and above would be an A, I got an A- with 142.TAs grade very hard, they cling to your every word.Unfair grading
The lecture is boring, but if you can stay awake, you'll understand the lesson right away. Nice grading system, best 3 exams out of 4. Exams are well related to the lesson in class.

Class is not so challenging.  But it is very difficult to obtain an A.  There was always vagueness in the exams, which is why I suffered a bit.  Class was just ok.  Professor knew what he was talking about.  I just did not like some of the ambiguity on the exams.
asset to osu.  highest recommendation for mr. hall.  go to class =  "A"
I felt like the class was easy to get a good grade but he wasn't the greatest teacher.

Class not so hard, and the example test were good predictors of our tests, how ever profs communication skills leave something to be desired. Doesn't really explain why you get points off on HW, and only knows what the answer should be, if you need further clairification go to the TAs

Awesome professor!  Very open to questions and clarifications... had lecture in SB 105 and there were many open discussions and questions asked even from the back rows.  Tests are very straight-forward.  Old exams he gives you in coursepack are very helpful.  Highly recommended!
Hard work is strongly rewarded in this class. Tests are very fair.
Great

The professor distributes copies of all exams from the previous quarter. This is really helpful since it tells you if you are studying OK. Lectures are very detailed, but if you concentrate you can learn a lor. I use this material in my job! Top professor!

The course was challenging, but the prof was extremely organized and helpful, as well as being really an expert on the subject. That's what I pay tuition for. Great coursepack! 12 hours of help from TAs each week!
Excellent professor teaching tough material
No Comments
It is the Simon Cowel or Business.  I don't find him to be a bad teacher or person at all.
grades homework like a nazi and it is 1/3 of your grade.  Got straight A's that quarter except for a C in his class.  Exams are tricky compared to his sample problems.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
worst professor i have ever had.  if you dont have to, dont take his class
No Comments

Not as bad as the people below make him out to be....I didn't like him at first but started to warm up to him during the quarter.  Not a great professor, but he explains things well enough to be able to understand it.
Horrible!!!!!!!!!!!!
Totally unclear, cut's sutdents off when they ask questions. Midterms and Exams are Hard. not very helpful

I don't think I can tell you what I learned in this class at all. He has a heavy accent and is hard to understand. Just go to class everyday and he will pass you. He also doesn't use carmen so whatever grade you get will be a surprise.

So full honesty Im here because I think Walter needs some love. Hes a genuine guy and really cares about logistics . Plus hes super easy to talk to outside of class. I wish people would talk to him more the guys human.

Really amazing teacher who makes sure you understand all of the material. Class is only graded by a few group projects but he's a super easy grader. There's only one exam which is the midterm and a group paper & video assignment. Not too bad but overall great professor and really only focuses on relevant material.

Walter Zinn is a teacher I'd like to have for all of my classes. Took 4380 at a regional campus. In the half semester course, your grade is composed of weekly quizzes (4 of 6 count) and one final exam. Extra credit given for good performance on quizzes. Extremely nice teacher who helps anyway he can. Truly wish he had more Logistics courses offered

Very interesting professor and a genuinely nice guy, but is not very clear on guidelines. Exams are essay based and he provides no study guide. The book is not helpful. I would recommend writing down EVERYTHING he says in class, because that's where the bulk of exam questions come from. Also, his notes are not helpful and very minimal in detail

Audrey is a fountain of knowledge and BUSADM 2601 is great to take as a freshman, sophomore, and junior. You learn many things that will help your prepare for internships and job offers. This class also offers ample opportunity to network with alumni and professionals!

Professor Esper did a great job of making a half-semester class worthwhile and interesting. The exams were really easy and a lot of the expected knowledge for them was pre-recognized by the professor. I do not think it is necessary to go into the in-person lectures to succeed. The information is taught in the recordings and built upon in lecture.
Great professor, great course! As long as you watch the pre-lecture videos and pay attention in class, you will do very well!

Overall, Terry was entertaining, but the lectures tended to drag. He posts videos online so attending lectures is not necessary. I would still recommend sticking it out through the lectures though. Very few assignments, so little room for error. Some questions on exams are very specific, but, if you put a decent amount of effort in you'll be okay.

I have had the pleasure of taking Professor Esper's class and while it was online, it was a breath of fresh air listening to someone speak with such professionalism and enthusiasm. The Quizzes are very fair, everything is based on his lectures and his exams are fair as well. Professor Esper is also willing to help students in need.

Absolutely loved this class and Dr. Esper! He makes learning logistics so interesting and explained topics in such an understandable way. Only downside: there are only a couple of assignments and screwing up in an area can really mess your grade up. Exams were extremely easy. Case analysis was the hardest assignment.

Esper is very knowledgeable and communicates the material clearly, he also posts lectures online so you don't really have to go to class. Tests were pretty simple but since it is only a half semester if you mess up once it can ruin your grade. Overall one of the top professors at Fisher.

Terry wasn't all that bad. The class just didn't have much to it. In total it was 5 assignments and if you wanted an A you had essentially no room for error. I missed one question on most assignments including exams and finished with a B+.

He is just so... humble. In fact, he is so humble he will at least once per lecture remind you how humble he is of the many many accolades he holds. Other than him just injecting himself in every lecture the class is super easy.

Terry is really passionate about Logistics and his students. He routinely posts lectures, video updates, review sessions, and other information online. While I admire his passion, it's pretty difficult to get an A in his class. With only 20-24 questions on each exam, there's almost no room for error. Some of the questions are incredibly random too.

Terry Esper was an absolutely amazing professor, and it is very evident how passionate he is about logistics as I loved his lectures. There is a weekly pack back for participation. This class was super flipping easy, 2 quizzes, 2 tests, and one case analysis. Just watch the lectures, take notes, and you'll be perfectly fine I promise!!

Prof Esper is a great person to talk to about the logistics field. He has a lot of experience which helped me understand the concepts better. I will say, this class is based on very few assignments which can really affect your grade. Like the other reviews, his final is super math based. As long as you know the formulas, it is not that difficult.

You could tell Dr. Esper was very passionate about the logistics field, and I did learn a lot from this class, the only problem I had was that the final was very difficult and seemed to contain some things we didn't learn. Once again, I really liked him as a person and his lectures were informative, just study really hard for the final exam

Professor Esper may be the worst professor I've ever had. He is a prime example of the saying "Words were spoken, but nothing was said". What I mean is that his lectures are long and he talks a lot but rarely does he say anything of importance. I recommend taking the class with another professor.
Actually terrible. Told us packback would be graded by a certain number of points, then lied and gave less credit than what was written. Final test is nothing like what he teaches.

Dr. Esper was passionate about the field of logistics and was a cool guy, but the course's organization was lazy. The final exam is worth 40% of your grade and covers material that we did not go over in class. Make sure to complete all assignments so you have a cushion for the final because it is tough.
The final is worth 60% of your grade and is very difficult, if you can avoid terry esper do. He also does not reply to emails and does not care.
Itâ€™s been 3 weeks since heâ€™s graded an impossible final and no one has their grades yet. Limited work, but the final makes the class horrible. Avoid

This class was horribly organized. While Dr. Esper does hold passion within this industry, he does not hold that same passion towards his students. Lazy to respond and we still haven't gotten our final exam grade back after 3 WEEKS! Final was extremely problem-solving-heavy when the rest of class didn't focus on this. Poorly created course.

It's a no for me. I was extremely excited to take Terry Esper's class as he is clearly passionate & knowledgeable in the Logistics industry. Unfortunately, that passion does not transfer to how he manages this course. The final exam expectation is unrealistic & doesn't accurately reflect what was taught. He doesn't respond to emails & overall lazy.
Videos aren't useful for quizzes except the problem solving ones. Barely have any grades. Just overall lazy professor

Terry seems super nice and fuuny. His final exam was hard over some we did not cover in class. The tophat instructions were very unclear. I do all of my work and did what many other students interpreted as correct, to find out we HAD to have a certain curiosity score or above for our actual grade and not bonus. That hurt my grade badly in the end.

I was not a big fan of Dr. Esper. His tests did not give enough time. There were barely any points available, therefore if you missed an assignment it was almost a guaranteed B. He needs to have a much better system for studying for the final. I pulled an A in the class, however I felt his exam was unfairly difficult for a 1.5 credit hour class

Terry seems like a nice guy and knows his stuff, but wastes too much time for a 1.5-hour class. Lectures are 2x as long as they should be. Every announcement he makes is a recorded video instead of a quick memo. Part of the grade is based on Packback score (NOT extra credit btw), and the final is disproportionately mathematical. Essays are easy.

We had weekly quizzes and pack backs which were pretty easy and manageable and then the final was so unbelievably hard. I studied a lot and watched all of the lectures and the math was so hard. I ran out of time with 6 more calculation questions.

Okay class. He's a good teacher but him and the TA never respond to emails. 6 minutes for the 5-question quizzes can be difficult and I still don't understand the reasoning behind that. Packback is busy work but it does provide extra credit. I'm scared for the final because I heard it's math heavy and he hasn't put much emphasis on calculations.

Esper is very intelligent and always eager to answer questions during office hours, but will NOT respond to emails. There is a quiz every week, two papers, and a final worth 40% of final grade. Its a challenging course but able to be accomplished if you study and ask him questions. Know the math problems and the final won't be as horrible.

Dr. Esper overall was good with explaining the whole concept of logistics. It does seem like he care a lot about it and I did learn a lot about logistics. There were 5 quizzes, 2 papers, and a final. The time given for the quizzes were very short which made it difficult and the final was the hardest part. He did take 2 weeks to to grade our exam.

This class was pretty easy up until the final exam. Overall, it was pretty easy aside from the final so nothing to stress over too much. It was annoying that he took 2 weeks to grade our exam, but overall he was a nice dude and a solid professor

His lectures are very engaging and he makes the material interesting to learn. He seems like a great guy however, the tests and quizzes are intense. Quizzes are 5 questions, 6 minutes and the final test was very difficult. Mainly math-based which was hard because he didn't give us many practice problems or examples prior to the exam.

The class was very easy and manageable up until the final. The final is extremely difficult and nothing will prepare you for it. I did everything I possibly could do to study for the final, but I bombed it. You will be disappointed at the end, also this man does not reply to emails. He is a great person, but the final he wrote for us was horrible.

His class was really fair up until the final exam. The class isn't math-heavy until you get to the exam, and stuff you've only seen once is being thrown at you for 60% of your final grade. There is no way I could have been prepared for that exam. I watched every lecture, studied hours, etc. but I still did poorly.

Dr. Esper is one of the best professors in Fisher. Highly recommend taking his class online so you will get a chance to watch the video pause and take notes. If you take good notes every week and digest the chapter by utilizing the packback discussion you will do pretty well in his exam. Be aware of that he tests you things he taught in lecture.

The lectures are overall fun and durable though it is long. However, the tests are awfully hard. The options are very confusing and he would give no curve at all. The course is graded by very few things, so a very slight curve might have save people's grades. I don't understand why he's being so harsh on students. This really upsets me.

I really enjoyed Terry. He took a class that could potentially be insanely boring and found ways to make lecture enjoyable. He has a lot of great experience, and shares his personal take often. Really learned a lot and found getting an A not too difficult. Definitely recommended!

Hands down one of the best professors Ive had! Before the midterm and final he held separate zoom sessions outside of class to answer questions. You can tell he wants to see his students do well on the exam! You need to study for the exam but Esper gives you all the materials needed to know what to look for! Take him for logistics! I recommend!

Dr. Esper is absolutely awesome, he only teaches in the spring and I highly recommend taking logistics in the spring just so you can have him. He gives clear criteria for the PackBack questions and the exams are straightforward as long as you watch all the lectures and supplemental videos. I didn't buy the textbook and I did well.

Dr. Esper is great! I changed my major to logistics management after taking him. 2 exams (not too bad, in-person) & 5 online quizzes (easy), and that's it. Didn't use book at all, only need to watch lectures and videos. Doesn't respond to emails but that shouldn't be too much of a problem. Very interesting course, and not difficult.

Dr. Esper is indeed a good professor, he understands the content and delivers it well. However, the course is heavily weighted on midterm and final, where there are several questions not on his slides which can potentially sabotage some points away. Just be careful and you'll have no problem on passing

Class (online version) is extremely unorganized and class structure is confusing, but Esper is a good lecturer/nice/funny guy. Content itself is basic business core & not difficult. Do NOT buy the book, and exams are slightly more difficult than what you'd expect. Entire grade is packback discussions + midterm and a final.

graded on 2 exams and 4 online quizzes. Pretty much an online class, you just have to show up for exams. Don't buy the book unless you need to take the second logistics class. Never responds to emails.

Professor Esper was the coolest professor I've had at Ohio State. I took his online course for logistics and it was very straight forward. He records his in-person lectures every week so you don't miss anything, plus you have many other resources. He is a super nice guy and used personal examples to explain things, which helps a lot

Professor Esper is a great guy! Very interesting lectures and well spoken. He includes his own personal experiences which makes the lectures much more Interesting. Tough grader but class is not too bad as long as you study hard and watch the lectures. Professor Esper is a cool man, he seems like a guy who listens to smooth jazz on a Sunday night.

Dr. Esper is quite possibly the best professor I have had during my time at Ohio State. He is unbelievably knowledgeable in the Logistics field and is very clear about what you will be graded on. He is a very fair professor, tells you what is on the tests and gets grades back very quickly. You do have to study and I would recommend going to lecture
Great lecturer, really cares about the subject and makes it interesting. Graded on 2 exams and 2 quizzes which are relatively easy, just pay attention and study a normal amount and you will be fine.

Esper is the best choice for 3380. He is very passionate about the subject and it shows in his lectures. Responds to email quickly and is helpful in office hours. Five online, timed quizzes (10 % each) and the final (50 %). Exam is harder than the quizzes, involves a lot of math, and requires detailed knowledge of the material. Book not necessary.

Dr. Esper is a fantastic logistics professor. He makes the material fun to learn, and is very charismatic. The quizzes and exam had a few tough questions, but I believe it was all fair. Highly recommend!

Mr esper is a good lecturer and you will learn a lot about the thought processes behind logistic decisions. One con about his class is that he posted all the videos of lecture material one week before exams started. There was no way to watch them in great detail and take notes. So you should go to class. Final exam is pretty tough, know your stuff

Professor Esper is a really good professor. He makes the learning material really interesting and is really funny in his lectures. The material is pretty dry, but he makes it fun to learn. The final exam is way harder than any of the quizzes so make sure you study.

Terry Esper was a very solid professor. You have 6 quizzes and the lowest is dropped. The exam is more difficult it is math based for the most part. One easy assignment for extra credit. Esper speaks very clear overall easy class and good professor
He seems easy, but HE IS NOT. The exam is too hard for a freakin online class. Six online quiz and you get to drop one of them. Your grade is solely depend on those quiz and the exam.

Class was my favorite so far in the business core classes. Great professor who really teaches the material well and includes many of his personal experiences and knowledge throughout the course. 6, 15 Q MC quizzes every week over lecture material on Carmen - 1 is dropped, 50% of grade. 2 Day Final Exam, MC, 50% of grade. Book not necessary.
Good luck...

Respectfully, I find it very difficult to understand what she is saying due to her strong accent. Lectures are all straight from powerpoint and exams are difficult and heavy on your grade. Her grading is unrealistically difficult and the material is tough. Be prepared to do a lot of stats. 10/10 don't recommend.

I would try other professors. Her thick accent is so hard to understand let alone her lectures. It is hard to focus in her class with no guided path in the class. The first half and the second half of the semester are different as well. Prepare yourself to work with statistics.

She is the worst.. I cannot stand her 1-hour lectures via PowerPoint. She doesn't explain anything other than reading the PowerPoint. Her grading is also a problem. She expects you to understand everything in course lecture even if she didn't go over it. She has 2 midterms that cover your 50% of the grade and rest is Labs and group projects. Avoid
Horrible teacher he is the male version of Bonnie Schroeder so i'm just warning you guys now. Just suffer through this class and graduate.

Not a good professor teaches material that is unneeded for jobs after graduating. Races through powerpoint slides during class and especially on lab days. Overall I would not take him again. Really bad teacher avoid at all costs.

Probably one of my favorite Professors. He cares about the material he teaches, and you learn applicable material and programs that you can apply in Logistics. I highly recommend his course. Only advise I'd give to others is to brush up on stats, because a lot of the material will make more sense if you do.

Jurriaan was a good lecturer. He was very passionate about ops. Sometimes he got off topic but his examples were pretty helpful. The class is not set up in an ideal way and is mostly graded on exams. This is not his decision however. As a professor, he is willing to work with you outside of class and provide good feedback.

Quite boring course set up. Learned more in rec than in lec. Prof De Jong is a knowledgeable and caring person who wants his students to do well, but his lectures are not the greatest. Awful handwriting. Seemed unprepared when looking at the slides sometimes and would get somewhat off topic in trying to explain concepts. Very nice and helpful tho.

I feel like ops is the most average class at Fisher. It was pretty organized and as long as you pay attention in class, you should be okay with some practice. The exams were tough, average was usually around a 70-75%. I wanted to like this class more, but although de Jong was passionate about ops, his lectures were slow and he felt unprepared.

Fulton's 4620 was an easy class with easy-medium effort.

Just focus on having the highest grade before the final exam by doing the quizzes and book reports properly as they are very easy and can cushion you for the final exam. 

Final exam isn't too bad if you read all the slides throroughly.

I personally never attended the lectures

Michael is awesome. He works in the industry and cares alot about his students. The class is really what you make of it. There are book reports, weekly quizzes and a final exam, and guest speakers. You can potentially learn alot if you put in the work, read the book, and ask questions regularly.

Elena is a professor who runs the recitation portion of capstone. She understands that her students are graduating & have senioritis, so she does give grace in her grading. Be sure to read all the case studies before class, participate 1-2x per class, and put effort into the presentation & paper. Elena is great, you just need to put in the work!
Top Notch!

I highly recommend taking good notes during the lecture as the majority of questions on the final exam could not be answered just by referencing published lecture PPTs and supporting material.  Her grading is very clear and the expectations aligned with what I anticipated with a 1.5CR class.

Professor Menon has a genuine passion for the psycology of decision making. Class is highly engaging and interactive. I'm pretty sure she knew all 50+ students names by the end of day one. Reasonable expectations for grading and really gives you the control over your grade through optional assignments. Class will give you tools to improve yourself.
Amazing lectures. Accessible outside class.  Engaging teaching style that gets entire class involved.

Truly one of the most useless classes I have ever taken in my life. Not only were her lectures endless ramblings of incoherent psycho-babble, but it was also unclear whether anything was related to the class's supposed subject--organizational behavior. At one point she said she didn't care about our evaluations because she had tenure. Awesome.

Professor Makhija is great! Participation is super important but even if you don't do the reading and have it up on your device during the discussion you can usually contribute from that. You can tell she is genuinely interested in the material covered and just wants students to learn. Easy exams as long as you go to class and do the readings.

Professor Makhija is very knowledgeable and wants all her students to succeed. Sometimes her expectations are hard to understand as they can be vague. Quizzes and projects arent to challenging if you put the effort in.

The worst professor I have ever met at OSU. She didn't like AND can't accept her student to correct her mistake in her lectures. Very rude at replying email. Force you to speak during the class, if not, she will not give you the full participation point for that week. Please avoid her or choose another professor.
Very sweet but not personable. Exams have very specific details in the questions.

If you want an A in this class, watch ALL of the video lectures. She asks really random questions on the tests. Every time she says "I want you to remember this" in a lecture that means it will be on the test, so write down whatever she says. Also you have to read the articles because she asks random stuff about that too

Professor Makhija's class is heavily focused on lectures. 100 points total, 4 hw assignments worth 5 points, and 2 - 40 point exams. The exams are oddly specific. Watch her online lectures, and read what she tells you on the reading guide. She also says incorrect statements a lot in her lectures

The class is not that hard, but her exams are very-detailed oriented instead of testing your overall knowledge of the material. I'm surprised I got an A. Makes you buy a textbook that you don't need save for a few case studies. I would split the cost with a few people and share it. Only 100 points in the class, so their is little margin for error.

The exams are very hard for a 1.5 Credit hour class. I studied more for this class than I did most of my 3 Credit hour classes and did poorly. You basically have to memorize very specific details to do well on the exam. Try your best to not take this course with her. Other profs in this course make it an easy A

Memorization is key. It is crucial that you dont just read the articles, but memorize the seemingly unimportant details, because they will be tested over. Also, understand the general outline of each lecture.

The course materials are not that hard but lots of reading. Exams are pretty fair based 60% lecture and 40% textbooks. She will curve the whole class and average B. Moreover, quiz can be done unlimited time so there are nearly 30% free grades.

Terrible professor, studied so hard for exams and didnt do well. Straight A student before this stupid class. Easy content but makes exam questions so specific. Talks down to you when visiting in office hours. Dont take this class with her.
Exams were based on non-conceptual details from the readings like the names of countries or people.

Attending the lectures are a must! if you cannot attend make sure that you write down the details that she talks about in the video lectures. Her exam questions are mostly over specific topics and she does not do a good job of testing for overall knowledge of the material. HW is hard to get 100% in but she does give extra credit and curves exams

Dr. Makhija suffers from the idea that knowledge is based on memorization of facts that most people brush off. it wasn't uncommon to see exam questions that asked for specific names or numbers that are not really important to a student's comprehension of the material. She is nice enough to help you if needed, but the exams really need to be redone.

This is by far the toughest class I have EVER taken!! The homework can be very tricky at times the exams are the worst. She expects you to know every LITTLE DETAIL. Memorize EVERYTHING She is also rude and will talk down to you if you have a question, and don't bother trying to correct her if she made a mistake because she "doesn't make mistakes."

This class is really not an easy class. Got a C- on the First exam and A on the Final. You have to work really hard, knowing all the details of the newspaper article, the graphs, the cases, especially the countries. Her exam questions are very detailed.

Not a great teacher, but she gets a bad wrap in these comments.  Her videos are vague and boring, but the concepts themselves are beneficial.  Need self-motivation to do well in class because you won't get much from her.  Offers easy bonus, so do that and take notes on all the online lectures and you'll do fine.   Didn't find reading necessary.
The exams are poorly written and way too specific. I did all the assignments and studied hard for each exam and still did poorly in the class. BEWARE OF THE FINAL!

Beware. She's the only 2000 prof at Fisher I know of. Lectures were confusing. Exams covered a lot of material and seemed to focus on some of the lesser important details rather than the major concepts she kept emphasizing in class. For someone who has visited 17 countries throughout my life, I was very disappointed in this class.
Worst professor in Fisher. She is unclear on topics covered in her lectures and videos so basically try and know everything going into a test. She also isn't any help if you ask questions. good luck.
Oh, no. Oh, God, NO! Run as FAST as you CAN.

Mona is the worst professor I've ever had. The exam has nothing to do with the material taught in class. At all. If you have questions you will not receive help and you will be talked down to. I was a straight A student until now. Please. don't take this class. Figure out a way to avoid it. I wish I had.

Unbelievably difficult class. The exam review covers completely every chapter we are supposed to read on our own.  She doesn't teach us the material, we teach us the material. The first exam had a class average of 63%. The questions were the most random, irrelevant, unintelligible questions ever written. Good luck preparing for this self taught cla

She is the worst teacher I have ever had a Fisher. Basically just tells students that if they read endless pages and stories from the book the will be fine on the exam.. Little did we know, the majority of exam questions turn out to be extremely random and have nothing to do with the material. If possible I would avoid her at all cost.

Terrible "teacher" her review guide for the midterm consisted of telling us to read every page of the 6 chapters we have gone over so far, instead of her actually teaching the material to us. So i do this, get to the exam and the questions turn out to have nothing to do with the review, they are all specific pointless questions.  CLASS AVERAGE: 63%

One of the worst classes I have ever taken here at OSU. Her tests don't make sense half the time and she asks the most irrelevant questions. The textbook and her slides are also completely different. She makes you spend $40 for extra credit where you can't even get a full mark on. There are also 2 tests (50% each) and she doesn't curve.

The class is an easy A if you put forth effort. Your grade is based on 2 exams, the midterm being much easier than the final. She offers extra credit, but the questions are completely irrelevant to the video you watch and its almost impossible to get full credit. Overall not a bad class or teacher.

Her exams are not consistent at all. Got over 100% on the midterm and a C- on the final because she asked randomly specific questions. I studied exactly the same way for both and went to all the lecturesdid the readings. Only thing that saved me was the extra credit that she lets you do online. She's pretty boring overall.

Mona may be the worst professor I have ever had. She is extremely unclear and her exams are very poorly worded. Many of the test questions are not even based on actual material relevant to international business. Also, she is extremely unclear and runs exams very poorly.

Mona is by far the worst professor in Fisher. You can do all the assigned readings, study all the lecture slides, attend every single class, take quality notes, and yet you will still do poorly on exams. Her exams truly consist of trivia questions like asking what music video we saw in class shows a specific instrument. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!

Your grade consists of two exams and whatever fractional extra credit you can earn. You have to purchase the connect code to access the extra credit and will be lucky to walk away with a handful of points (each assignment is only worth 1 point, of which you'll never earn in it's entirety). Her thoughtswording is unclear and she's asks trivial ?'s

Class was fairly straight forward.  She has this everything's fair game attitude where she will test you on anything she says ever.  Very annoying but material is easy to study.  Lectures are sort of boring.

Do not take this class with Mona. Outside of what's on the slides, it seems she has no idea what she is talking about. Useless when it comes to asking for help on using the online site she uses for extra credit -- she does offer extra credit, but it's impossible to get a full point. Tests were about the most minute details.
Asks such specific questions on tests.  Online extra credit is nearly impossible to get all the points.  Would NOT recommend taking!

Mona is a nice enough lady, but asks the most ridiculous/specific questions on topics that just aren't important. She'll skip important topics to nail you on laughably unimportant nonsense. Be prepared to read the text for the most minute of details. Take advantage of every point of extra credit she offers.

Mona is a very sweet professor,who tries to keep class engaging by encouraging class participation and showing culture videos. Most who complained about this class never come to class or talk the entire time. Do the extra credit, actually read and study for the tests and you should get at least an A-

She gives extra credit like she doesn't mean it. We were supposed to watch a video for each extra credit and answer the questions. However, the videos don't even have the answer to the questions. What the video is talking about and what the questions asked are totally different things. Impossible to get even a full 1 point. Horrible!

This was the single easiest class I have ever taken. I only went to class to turn in extra credit; studied slides on Carmen and read over book vocab. Got over 100% in the class without paying attention at all. Make sure you watch the carmen videos/read the articles. I wouldn't say the book is needed, maybe helps get one question right per test.

Her tests are written like someone who learned English as a second language. She asks totally arbitrary questions on the test, like what language someone spoke from a random music video. It's a really awful class to sit through but not hard to get an A. There are equally easy 555 teachers that won't bore/frustrate you to death. Take them.

She's obviously a nice professor, but kind of boring during her lectures. Tests are easy enough, Multiple Choice Questions. I don't know why some people dont do well on her tests. Gives extra credit opportunities as well.

her lectures are almost painful. she's a very nice lady, but the content and her way of presenting it is so awfully dry. also, her tests are ridiculous. (name the third highest country on x list) avoid her at all costs. going to class is such a waste of time.

Total waste of time to go to class she reads directly from the powerpoint and posts them for you anyway, the videos she shows have nothing to do with the topic most of the time. She tries to run a 200 person lecture like a 30 person recitation. She will wait for answers from people. I'd say avoid her if possible.

Worst teacher in fisher,went to class,took notes,read the book, studied/made note cards, did all the extra credit and still got a bad grade,very boring,do not take this class, trust me, not worth it,going to class and paying attention and studying everything doesnt help,asks questions on a random things, like what people were wearing in a music vid

Her lectures are boring, but if you go and pay attention you will get an A in this class. Also helps if you take notes and study the powerpoint slides. Questions are random but if you pay attention it is possible to do well. I'm sure all of these people leaving negative comments skipped class. If you can breathe you can get an A. DON'T BUY THE BOOK

Please Dont not take her Class and try to avoid her.I am sorry to say but she is the Worst teacher ever. You wont understand her lectures at all so do her tests questions.I dont know how Fisher College still let her teach the class.

Honestly cannot believe that Fisher lets her teach a class with this many students in it. People will tell you that 555 is something you can take along side other hard classes, but with her teaching that is not true. Exam questions are random and poorly worded, much like her lectures. This is why Fisher's faculty rating is Business Week is a C.

She is absolutely terrible.  Reads straight from the powerpoint and even then she still doesn't know what she's talking about.  Talks like she's teaching a middle school class.  Test questions are extremely wordy and at times difficult to understand.  Tests on the most insignificant details.  Highly recommend to avoid her if possible.

I don't think even she understands what she's teaching. Several times during the quarter, she had to be corrected by students on stuff she's supposed to know. The exam questions are horrendous. Your grade on the exam does not show how well you knew the material. Just how lucky you got in interpreting her thought process for each question.

Lectures are awful- she tries to hold them as discussion sessions in a 300+ class. Exams are so specific like mentioned before, and she asks questions on details so minute that you would not even think to remember such a useless fact. This class could be interesting but she made it extremely boring. Avoid her.

I don't get her.  She gets so specific in a class that is supposed to be a "gimme" for Fisher students.  There is no reason that she should ask such specific question on a chart she randomly pulled up in a lecture 2 weeks before the exam.  The class is supposed to be a fluff class to take alongside other tough classes, someone please tell her!

The class itself is pretty easy, just go to class and read the book and you'll get an A. Luckily I'm interested in the topics, because she's just useless and irresponsible, esp. during the final exam. I don't think she's even willing to help students.

Class is worthless.  Requires hardly any work if you know what to study.  Lecture is pointless, find the videos online, and read the opening and closing cases in the book.  I learned nothing all quarter.

She makes TOO many generalizations about countries. A student corrected her about one of them (on his OWN country!) and she turned it around to make him look wrong. Tests can be tricky just because the material is so dumbed down, dont over-think it.

This is one of the easiest classes at Fisher and one of the most useless classes. Lectures are pointless. You can learn everything from the book and review guides. I went to a total of 3 classes and got an A. Do the extra credits and you'll be fine.

Easy class. It is not difficult at all to achieve a perfect 100% in the class. There are extra credit assignments and four free bonus questions on each exam. Don't really need the book except for some of the opening and closing cases. Go to class, listen to what she says, watch the videos, read lecture notes. Should get 100%.
If you can't get an A in this class you have no business being in Fisher.

She was a pretty good professor.  The tests can be pretty tricky, so you should study prior to a couple days before the exam to make sure you understand the concepts.  The review sheet is helpful for other questions that will show up on the exam.  I would recommend her, I hear the other teachers suck.

Pretty good professor, teaches you what you need to know and actually goes along with the book somewhat.  Combination of lecture and book readings on the tests which are pretty straightforward, the final was definately the toughest however.
Overall very boring, but easy A.  I only stayed in class long enough to watch the video clips because there will be questions about them on the exam, then I would leave.
I loved this class. Multiple choice tests, and extra credit opportunities. She was very personable. Recommended
The class itself was pretty boring and she came off like a used car salesman trying to get you to buy into international business. Very easy A though.
Awesome teacher. She is knowledgeable and overall a good teacher! Tests aren't too bad if you study, and there are 3 opportunities for extra credit. Interesting class and she rocks!
worst teacher. talks as if we were in middle school "ok? all clear". annoying and boring class. however, indeed it is easy to get an A. so its worth it to an extent.

This is the easiest 500-level class I have ever taken. The review sheet tells you what sections of the book to read for the exam.  I got a 100 without the extra credit assignments.  There are 3 non-cumulative, multiple choice exams with 37 questions, but she only takes it out of 33, so there's another 4 bonus points on each exam. Highly recommended
Read the powerpoint slides, watch the videos and fill out the review sheet and it's such an easy class.  She is damn boring, but hey it's worth it for an A.
Very easy but very boring.
very annonying and hard to follow in class
BORING teacher. The class itself is really easy, and with her grading scale, it makes it easier.

I read everything and went to every class, but didn't do well.  I felt like I had to memorize the book to do well and my studying was inversely proportional to my grade; the more I studied, the worse I did.  The extra credit is important, though, I wish I would have done them.

Worst teacher. I don't know what the others are talking about.  I read, went to every lecture, and still didn't do well.  There wasn't ONE thing on the review sheet on the test.  I went to see her after class one time where I felt she only mocked me and called me naive. Avoid her.
She is very lenient and patient. Its not difficult to get a perfect score of 100

Class was easy if you spent time learning the review sheet provided before exams. Do the extra assignment, then you will definitely get an A. Dont have to go to any of the classes if you read the book. Be sure to watch the Video.

Class was easy if you spent time learning the review sheet provided before exams.  Many, b ut difficult opportunities for extra credit.  Dont have to go to any of the classes if you read the book, and know the information provided through her power point slides provided online.  Be sure to watch the
She's a very nice lady.  It's not a hard class if you do the readings, look over the PowerPoint slides, and pay attention to the review sheet.

She is a decent, but boring teacher. You need not go to class to do well, just memorize her powerpoints and learn what is listed on the exam review handouts. Very easy A if you follow my instructions. Also, make sure you watch the movies on the course website.

What else can I say bad teacher had him for the summer term all he does is post slides on carmen and expects you to know very specific questions. Avoid if you can. Crazy how osu keeps such bad teachers and pay them so well.
Knemeyer said the textbook was optional, but then gives you exam questions over textbook materials. He seems like a nice enough guy, but is a terrible professor. Takes a long time to get grades back.

This class should be so much easier than it looks. I took online 6 week session in 2023, watched all the lectures and took notes, when it all seems like common sense. All test questions were specific and difficult. Dont take this class unless you have plenty of free time

Professor Knemeyer's class is NOT that bad. I also think that he is a good Professor, nice guy. There is a lot of content to remember, so definitely do not fall behind. The exams make up a huge chunk of your grade and they are both Proctorio, closed-note. The content itself isn't hard, it's hard because there's a lot of terminology to remember.

Professor Knemeyer is by far the worst professor I have had in college. He does not care about students at all. When you email him, he asks the TA to respond to you rather than answering the question himself. The class is mostly memorizing tiny details off of slides and there's 500 slides per exam. I had to study 4 hours a day to achieve this.
Exams make up large portion of grade, very specific questions.

horrible professor. each week is a quiz with 5 questions in 6 minutes and the quizzes can be from everything in the semester that far. 1.5-2 hr lecture each week, long book. final is very hard and 40% of grade and is very specific minute details from book and lecture. if you don't read your'e screwed. final is also proctorio.
Most frustrating class I have ever taken at Ohio State. His exam uses the most minuscule details from his 90 page lectures. Avoid this professor at all costs.

Final is worth 40% of your entire course grade and the provided study guide is pretty useless. Packback professor, so you just know the class is awful. Quizzes were meh, some people think they were harder (understandably) than I did. Avoid him at all costs. Entire course is about memorizing little specific details from the almost 500 slides.

Weekly quizzes are borderline impossible so you'd expect the final to be somewhat easier. That's where you'd be wrong. Good luck getting an A without the curve. But hey at least you get free points from packback busywork!

I made an account specifically to rate this class. Do not take BUSML3380 with this professor. There are unfair cumulative quizzes weekly that are 5 questions and 6 minutes long, and there aren't many grades to make up for it. Will be my first class not getting an A. The only redeeming quality is that the professor seems to care about the content.

Any professor that uses packback is a bad one. Nothing is gained from using this software that the student has to pay extra for. Its not learning, its busywork. Class is lecture heavy and there is way too much filler in the course lectures that they read like a textbook (meaning that they don't give you info in the quickest and most effective way)

Terrible class in my opinion. I haven't received a B in my life until I took this class. The quizzes are 6 minutes with 5 questions about irrelevant content read in the book. Not only is that annoying, but the weekly quizzes contain material from everything you learned before that. So the last quiz of the semester was from about 1000 slides

This is far and away the worst class I've ever taken. The 25 question final is worth 50% of the grade, with about half of the questions on that final being from something random. Avoid this professor at all costs.

Has a great passion for logistics and is always willing to help out. That being said, it is the most difficult class I have ever taken. Quizzes every week with 6 minutes for 5 questions. Midterm and final are tricky too. Up until this class I have received all A's and one B+ in courses. Very hard class, take another professor.
has a love for logisitics for sure but gives hard exams. lots of discussion posts and weekly quizzes that were hard but his lectures werent too boring

The first class I've ever failed. Warning for other Fisher students: 5 question quizzes are timed for 6 minutes and a difficult final that will hurt your GPA. Other professors were very understanding of remote learning difficulties, in logistics I had to teach myself an abundance of information in half of one semester. Choose another professor.
The final was much harder than expected based on the difficulty of everything else in the course. He's kind of an oddball, but he's a good guy who is helpful.

His online lectures are excruciatingly painful to watch. Dryest lectures ever and a dread doing this class every week. No quizzes or tests are the open note and he uses proctorial on the final in the middle of an ongoing pandemic. He's not very sympathetic and is a very awkward man in his lectures. Do what you can to avoid his classes.

Would not recommend for anyone who is even slightly challenged with online classes. So much work for a 1.5 credit hour class. I somehow failed the final exam but got an A on every other assignment... terrible set up and way too much work for such a mediocre class.
The lectures are extremely boring and I felt like I didn't learn anything from them. My advice would be to read the book and do the practice questions.

6 minutes for a quiz with 5 questions, 40 minutes for an exam with 30 questions. And all of them are very difficult. Don't choose it if you do not want to ruin your GPA, your semester and your university life.

So much content to learn in only half of a semester, it is crazy. The lectures were extremely boring and it is impossible to pay attention. Final exam is so difficult, and never enough time for the quizzes. What a frustrating class.
Too much for a half semester class. Only get 5 minutes to complete quizzes with material of over 450 slides. You get 40 mins in the final exam to answer 30 questions.

Lectures were dry in my opinion, but then again, it might've been because I had Professor Knemeyer for a 2 hour lecture every week... Packback responses were the main parts of the grade and only one exam at the end of the class which was an easy pass as long as you read the book if you zone out during lectures.

Professor Knemeyer is a good professor with a lot of experience, but should not be teaching. The class is based off 2 exams. The highest score on the midterm exam did not even receive a perfect grade. In a course with 400 students, there should have been at least one person in the class to get perfect. Don't study, I studied for hours and got 32/50

Professor Knemeyer is great. He is very knowledgeable about the course material & makes it easy to learn. In order to succeed, it is important that you read the book & listen to his lectures. Engagement is the course is neccessary. He is also a very nice guy who is great at accommodating for individual needs.

can't believe it is 1.5 credits class since I spent as many and even more time as my 3 credits stats class. discussions are tough, you should write more than 700 words each week and finally get 3/5 on average
The grading is ridiculously hard and makes no sense. This class is just BSing you way through it...

Thom is a kind guy that evidently cares about helping students succeed, but he's an unreasonably hard grader that doesn't seem to really evaluate your submission. Don't get on his bad side; two very similar assignments will get different grades if he doesn't like your team. He does genuinely care, it just feels like his grading isn't impartial.

Thom is such a good professor and really teaches you what ISE is like outside of school. He is very easy to get ahold of and helps advocate for your project. I dont understand his rating on here because he was one of my favorite professors!!

Thom was a great teacher and mentor. He was hands-off on the capstone until you need him to help. He has a lot of resources and answered any questions our group had. Definitely would connect with for future questions.

Unclear grading criteria, unreasonable grade deduction, said, "It's about the experience not grade, don't focus so much on your grade" and gave you a failing grade during the problem definition phase. For a good professor, working hard to get a good grade means focusing on the course; for him, it's not.

Unclear, subjective grading criteria Poor planning resulted in the class having to learn the last 2 lectures on our own and half the class's presentations turn into papers Didn't really cover the application or how to use the concepts taught
Easily the best.

I feel very lucky to have Hannah as my advisor, and she is great in this class. She does a great job of teaching you the things you need to know as a first-year business student, and is very caring and wants you to understand the topics. She always encourages you to ask any questions you have throughout all four years of college.
Super helpful

Per any survey class, all you really need to do is show up to pass. Hannah, however, does her best to break down the barrier and create a welcoming environment that lets students feel comfortable visiting her for advising appointments in the future. Quizzes and final are open note

Jim is an incredible wealth of knowledge. He really cares about his students' success. The class is entirely lecture based without a textbook. You must take good notes in this class because the slides are essentially just the barest bones of what you need to know. You may not do well on the exams but the other assignments keep your grade afloat.

The most boring professor and lectures that I have ever been a part of. He is very caring and a great guy, but don't take his class for real estate minor-related reasons. It is not required anymore, so find a different class that is more exciting. The tests are pretty hard, and the average is low, but he curves it. Not impossible, but not easy.
Great professor! If you can, definitely take his course.
Everyone loved professor Campbell. He taught in a way that everyone understood.
He is the best person ever loved him so much

Even in an accelerated course the content as taught by Professor Campbell made the class engaging and fun! I never thought I would enjoy it as much as I did - and learned so much in the process. He teaches in a way that helps you understand all the small details and then rolls them up into a lightbulb moment where you see how it all fits together.

Take Ben seriously when he says this class is front-loaded. Do the reading and stay up to date, and you'll be fine. Truly inspiring discussions about why business matters and is good for society. Be ready to work. Excellent foundation for beginning your MBA.

Lots of work outside class but it pays off. The structure of the lectures allows students to get the most out of class and have many aha moments throughout the course. Professor Campbell does a great job at moderating discussion and keeping things on track.
Easily one of the best professors I've ever had. He's a great human and professor. He is imminently qualified and incredibly prepared. Class was always interesting. I really enjoyed it.

Great professor! She really cares for her students and wants them to succeed. The whole class is basically 1 group project and a few smaller assignments. 1 final exam that is take home and open note. The grading guidelines are clear, grading is lenient (a lot is based off of peer evaluation). Would definitely recommend this course and professor.

I am beyond thankful to have Mr. Printup as my Academic Advisor and Teacher. He cares so much about his students' success and wellbeing at the university. He is very passionate about his class and makes his classroom a fun learning environment (most notably by sharing his love for Beyonce)! All the instruction and assignments are very clear.
Great professor, incredibly caring and provides excellent feedback, has a lot of great situational practice opportunities for sales.

This is one of the most caring professors I have ever had at OSU. Although he is a harsh grader and it is easy to fall behind, he cares about the success of each of his students. You have to attend class to do well. I fell behind a bit in the beginning of the semester and Eddie's willingness to help is what got me through.

Greg is AMAZING. He is extremely kind and caring, I wish all my classes were with Greg honestly. I looked forward to going to his class every week because it was actually fun and informative. 10/10 recommend taking him

Mr. Zunkiewicz was probably the nicest professor and human I had ever met in my time at Ohio State. He deeply cares about the content being taught and helping students prepare their business knowledge before entering the work force. The class was easy and I thoroughly enjoyed going to lectures.
Do not take.

She is mid and boring. If you want to fall asleep, take this class. I took the over on the word "Uhm" being used in this class. Line was set at 1005.05 times. The over was absolutely smashed. In short words, she just reads off the slides.

She is nice and gives out approximately 30 points extra credit when you show up to class or participate in a research study. Your grade is ONLY made up of the 3 midterms you take, which is why there's a lot of extra credit. But the midterms r very straightforward, but you need to memorize basically everything on the lecture slides.

Choi gives out a ton of extra credit and you do not need to read the textbook for her tests unlike inks. YOU NEED TO STUDY A LOT. The entire exams are very easy if you need to memorize every single thing on her slides word or word. Besides that it's pretty straightforward. Go to class to get extra credit points. Just study and don't be lazy.

The course is exam heavy but they are doable. The first exam average was low so she started providing example questions which helped a lot. A lot of the content is also common sense. As long as you study the slides and do her practice problems you will be prepared. She also provides extra credit opportunities which help boost your grade.

Very boring class. Reads right off the slides and doesn't know to give clear definitions. 95% test based where the average is a 60%. Test questions are confusing and changes the definitions for the exam. I don't think she really understands the material herself. Very nice person but choose a different professor.

Class is super boring so be ready. She just reads off the slides and doesn't give any natural input, so the class is really hard to keep going to for the whole hour and 20 minutes. But she does sometimes have pop quizzes that you must attend. Unfortunately, the class is 90% test based and the average is always a low C with no curve.
Professor Choi is nice and cares about her students. She teaches in a straightforward way and her grading is fair. I enjoyed her class!

Loved Professor Choi. I believe this was her first-semester teaching but I could be wrong. As long as you listen and participate in lectures, make notecards/Quizlet for the lecture slides, and study 2-3 hours for the exams you will get a good grade.
Woohee Choi tries hard to be a good professor, but sadly just presents the material in the most vanilla form possible, providing nothing to the course itself.

The assignments always go ahead of the lectures. We need to figure out how to solve the problem by ourselves.  It is a self-study course!!!! If the homework is not used to consolidate the knowledge learned, I don't know what its score can represent in this class.

Great guy, but terrible delivery of the material and did not explain things very well or in depth. His tests were extremely hard and pulled mainly from material outside of class. We did not cover how to do about 20-25 questions (out of 50 questions) on the final. It seems like he was kinda winging the whole class the whole semester. WOULD NOT TAKE

One of the best teachers I have ever had. Took the time to make sure you understood the topics. Helped you understand what was going on in the market and how to evaluate stocks. Highly recommend taking this teacher.

really nice guy but does not know how to teach. He was all over the place with his lectures. He would tell use things would not be on the quiz, then they would still should up on the quiz. Quizzes and exams were super hard. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS.

This professor is friendly and knowledgeable and has done lots of research. It's hard to understand some of the SPSS procedures in class. He goes through them quickly. However, he will give you kind and clear feedback if you ask in class/email. Plus, It's a little bit boring...
Only have a final and 12 quizzes. Ee law is hard but this professor is so good at teaching. He makes law interesting. Please have more professors like him at OSU!
Great professor who works HR for Wendys! Lectures were interesting and he's an easy grader. He really cared about his students and their grades. Would take him again!!

Great lecturer, really knows his stuff. Runs HR at Wendy's, so he has a lot of real-world experience to talk about. My only complaints are that he assigns you groups, and you have to do a midterm and final with them, and you have to buy a textbook AND pay for case studies. A bunch of students in my class got sent to COAM, but it was deserved.

Professor Blanco expects a lot from students and is a tough grader on exams and group assignments, but I appreciate his positive, upbeat attitude during lectures and his flexibility with completion dates on exams.

Professor Blanco is great! He is always patient in understanding your questions and trying his best to help you to find the solution. His class is always interesting because he shares his experience with us. And he gives extra credit. I recommend his course.

Christian is very upbeat and makes lectures interesting. You can also tell he cares about his students performance. Exam 1 and 3 are easier than 2. Overall keep your dates straight for the quizzes and hw and you should get a decent grade. Also would recommend Newsom because I dont think Blanco is teaching this class again.

Christian always brings so much energy and humor to his lectures. He really enjoys answering students' individual questions, which is not always common in a large lecture, and it is clear he knows the material backwards and forwards. Highly recommend!

Blanco is quirky, but genuinely cares about the material and his students. He sometimes gets flustered while lecturing, but the material is not bad to learn outside of class. Do ALL homeworks and quizzes available, and attend as much lecture as possible. Had I done one more homework assignment, I would have had an A :/
Lots of work and effort needed to pass. That being said Prof Blanco is very nice easy to meet up with and extremely helpful if you need it.

Christian is a great person, and cares about his students passing. He will go over a problem 100x until you get it. But it might take 100x to understand it because sometimes he gets a little flustered and has to erase things and do it over again. This is only his 2nd time teaching, he isn't used to it, but sometimes it takes a little to get it

Do not take it with Steve. He just rambles in the lecture and does not even know whats on the lecture quiz that's supposed to be taken during the lecture. This course is the same for all professors but I would not take it with him. The exams are also brutal and the average have been pretty low compared to other Fisher courses. So far no curve.

If you actually want to learn, get someone else. He doesn't prepare the lecture materials so half of the time he seems lost in the lecture. When it comes to the math portion of the class, he relies on pre-written notes also doesn't use Ipad or any technology so good luck reading his handwriting from the back. It is hard to study for exams.

He is extremely passionate about class content. However, be aware that practice problems, lecture quizzes, and other materials are known to have mistakes in their answers and explanations. As a student using this material to study for exams, I had to figure out the mistake on my own and the TAs and profs failed to fix the issues before the exam.

Professor Lundregan is great choice for operations. Honestly the course is the same for all professors with 3 exams, weekly lectures and weekly recitations.  Most of the material needed comes from the recitations. Professor Steve stands out because he does an amazing job of connected the material to real world scenarios.  Study well for exams!

Steve is a good lecturer but he wastes time with stories that arent relevant to the class and then rushes through what needs to be learned to pass the class. He wastes time in lecture answering the same questions

Steve is the hidden gem of Fisher! Any chance you get to take one of his courses, do it. He structures his lectures around discussion and real-world application, not just teaching the material needed to pass an exam. Definitely my favorite course and professor I have had in my four years at Fisher. All around great guy, I can't say enough! 10/10

Its not Steves fault but this class as a whole just really sucks. One major thing I have to complain about is that he answers way to many questions at the beginning of lecture so he never actually finishes the lecture and then we get tested on the stuff he doesnt teach. I would recommend taking another professor for this class.

A really great and caring professor. This class overall was not too bad if you went to class and recitation and paid attention, but the exams were pretty tough. Sometimes they asked for super specific details. You get to take one page of notes and formulas to take the exam. Exams on proctorio
One of my favorite professors I've had in Fisher. Definitely one of the nicest. He genuinely cares about his students and the topics he teaches. An easy class although mostly group projects.

Seems like a nice guy, but just pray that you get decent TA's. I know online learning is new for everyone but it seemed like he just did not know how to help students this semester. Go to lectures but most importantly talk to your TA's and go to every recitation! That is how you will do well in the class

I was not even in Steve's section, but I attended his class because I loved his lectures so much better. He explains topics in unique ways that help you understand it using his past professional experience. He really cares about his students and cares that his students are understanding the material, unlike most Fisher professors

Steve is the homie! Really enjoyed his engaging lectures on interesting technological topics. He really cares about his students and always tries to keep the class engaged. Do the homework and you don't have to take the exams! Group projects were fun. Could have skipped class but decided to come every day. Great Ops professor and guy overall!

He's an awesome and caring teacher. The class is basically a free pass if you do the out-of-class assignments. Exams are heavily math-based after Exam 1, so practice a lot with the recitation problems and homework. 1 page cheat sheet is basically a security blanket if you do all the work and show up for class.

Steve was a great professor, his lectures are kinda hard to pay attention to but the material that is important is clear and he tries hard to prepare you well for the exams. Three exams are 60% of the grade and 40% is accuracy and participation in lecture and recitation and homework. Go to class and study and you'll be fine.

Steve is one of the most genuinely caring and helpful professors at Fisher. Will stay after class to help you understand the material, or just to talk about life. If you do the credit assignments, it will replace exams which was awesome. Highly respect this man, truly an amazing professor.

Steve is super nice and it is easy to listen/understand him in lecture. You should get a 100% on the hw, quizzes, simulations, recitation/lecture work. The only hard part are the exams. You get a cheat sheet front and back. Take good notes and you'll be fine. I read the chapters for exam 1 and found that they were not much help so I stopped.

Steve is one of the most positive people you will encounter and passionate about what he teaches. Almost half the grade is free from attendance, homework, etc. Get B's on the exams and you get an A in the class. Don't blow off the class because the exams are tricky though and very math-based. Take good notes in class and do practice problems.

Professor Lundregan is one of the most genuinely caring and interactive teachers at Fisher. He does a really good job of keeping the class relevant with examples of his experience, as well as other real world examples. Definitely recommend taking him if you have the chance.

Never rated a professor before but had to after taking 4240 with Steve. He is (in my opinion) the best professor at Fisher. He is super laid back, knows what he is talking about, and very accommodating for his students. This is one of the easiest, yet most rewarding classes I have ever taken, and highly recommend taking 4240 if you get the chance.

Professor Steve was the best professor I've ever had. He is super nice and really cares about helping his students, making you think, and wanting you to succeed. He makes a class that can be tough really entertaining and inspires you to do well because of his great attitude. His parting words were also inspirational, as others noted.

Super nice guy that really wants you to succeed. Cares about his students and is very approachable. Most of the class is just showing up, but the exams can be a bit tough. Really enjoyed the class overall

Steve was a great instructor. While the class was fairly easy (50% of the grade is basically free points if you participate), I still enjoyed learning from him. He is caring and you can tell passionate about the material he teaches.

Steve is one of the most caring and truly dedicated professors at Ohio State.  He has a genuine desire to teach and is passionate about operations.  He wants to see his students succeed, and I was glad I could have him as a lecturer in a smaller class setting.  He shares his parting words of wisdom in the last class and it was really inspirational.
