Professor Lundregan is one of the best professors in OSU. Take him, you won't regret. As a student, it's hard to have a professor who did great on teaching, caring students a lot and not hard class. His lecture is very interesting and useful based on his business experience. He will prepare lots of material to help you study for the exams. Take him
I would highly recommend Prof Lundregan. He's not an easy A, but you wouldn't want that in a class like his because he makes you think in a very enjoyable way. Best professor I've had at OSU.

He makes this course very interesting. He provides great examples for each concepts that help students to understand the material better. Most importantly, he is very nice and patient! if you have questions and need to ask him, he will try to explain the problems thoroughly until you understand them. Highly recommended  professor for this course

Lundregan is an EXCELLENT professor. Lots of experience in industry and is extremely interested in creating future professionals. He is interested in the examples students bring to the class and does a fabulous job of connecting the material to industry. You can tell that he enjoys his work and wants to be teaching. Taking another class of his.
Care for students. Steve is a great guy. All of my classmates loved him. He gives us his experience to explain concepts. Very Clear. I would take any class he has in OSU.
Very approachable. 1st exam is easy but the final is a bit difficult. Cases are time killing, especially the 2nd one. A fair grader. One of the nicest professor at OSU.

The BEST professor in Fisher , no debate! Graduating senior that made the best decision taking him and this class! Class is very beneficial and he is the most understanding and experienced professor I've had in my time at OSU. Take this class and professor whenever possible!!!

Graduating senior who has never rated a professor, but I had to leave a rating for Steve because he is by far the best professor I have ever had at Ohio State.  He genuinely cares about his students and understands what is most important to seniors.  I have learned a lot and loved the class.  Do everything in your power to  take him.

Easily one of the best professors in Fisher. He's one of the nicest, most approachable and friendly teachers you will ever meet. The class itself is pretty difficult, but it's not because of the teacher. Great teacher, very willing to help; always energetic during class and has a passion for the class and for making students succeed.

Steve is by far my favorite professor in Fisher. He truly cares about his students and loves teaching. He knew I was an ops major and went out of his way to give me useful tips for my major and career path. He is very passionate and truly loves what he is doing. I highly recommend taking him and utilizing his office hours. You will learn a ton

Really nice guy. Let's you work in groups for quizzes and goes over answers before turn in. Gives 4 HW assignments in semester, will go over those too. 2 cases which are labor intensive. Grades fairly though. Midterm and Final are both relatively difficult, but  manageable
Steve's a good Lecturer and really cares about his students succeeding.  Very kind and mild mannered.  He provides the help needed when asked.  Take him if you can.

Steve's the man. You learn to develop core competencies and strengthen your process design. It's not an easy course at all, though, but try to keep everything in control. He likes to teach activities that add value; there's not really any waste or downtime during class. You've got to study if you want an A - the cases and finals are hard projects!
A great teacher inside and out. He should receive a gold star and teach every class at Fisher. I'm so glad I took him and would not recommend taking anyone else!

Probably the best professor I have ever had between Community College and OSU.  If the class lectures get boring, he goes into group work and tries to incorporate the teachings into exercises.  If you pay attention in class there is no reason not to get an A in this class. As far as the department goes, our class averaged higher than any other prof

Somebody give this man a medal. This was one of the most enjoyable classes I took at fisher because i learned about business functions both theoretically and in the real world. Steve is really nice and willing to help students out as much as possible. You get what you put in to this course. Take the material seriously you'll do fine.

Among the best professor at OSU.  He has a passion for teaching and shows true interest on their students.  Everyone is important to him. There are no dumb questions.  If you really want to learn and ensure a good grade choose this Prof. Lundregan.  Very likeable professor.

Steve is a very energetic professor who genuinely wants to teach students. He is very organized, info is clear, and while most people feel the subject area is boring, he does his best to keep you entertained. I recommend going to class if you want better than an 75%

Steve is great! I haven't had the exams yet, but he is very good at explaining things- much better than the book. He's really enthusiastic, and one of the best professors I have had so far. He's really interested in teaching, and cares a lot about his students. He also teaches by explaining situations how they would be in the real world.

Just like most college courses you take, attendence is not mandatory but if you want a good grade I would highly recommend going.  This guy is an adjunct professor and is very thorough. There is 1 midterm and 1 final and 2 group case studies with an optional presentation over a case for extra credit.

The class was easier than Bmgt330/331, but you must put forth the effort study a good amount of time to pass the course. I took him in Spring Q 2011. If you are looking for a good to great professor, I recommend taking this class with him.
Please take a different professor as it will be much easier.
He's a good guy.  Class isn't too bad just the tests were a bit difficult.  All other assignments were easy.

Terrible professor. Two heavily weighted very difficult exams using proctorio. Basically have to memorize every word in his 100 slide lecture PowerPoints and insanely long textbook. Also uses Packback which is just a waste of money and time. Take this class with somebody else.

This guy is dead awful. His class the worst you'll take at OSU. He posts 16-20 video modules a week + textbook work. The exam questions are pinpointed off of very small details in the textbook and lectures. Not to mention, the final was nearly two weeks ago (online) and he is STILL not too lazy to post the grades. AVOID

I don't get the hate on this prof, he's chill. Lectures are straightforward. Assignments are really engaging rather than just busy work. Feel like I got a lot out of the class. His extra videos are funny. Main complaint: PackBack is hella expensive. Split it with others to help with that. Tests were hard, do the practice questions and you'll be ok.

When I say this is the WORST teacher in Fisher, I mean it (even worse than Bonnie Schroder). This teacher does NOT CARE about his students at all. He gives you very few assignments and grades them so toughly, even in the first week when you have learned nothing. His exams are long, readings are even longer, AVOID HIM AT ALL COSTS FOR YOUR SANITY!

Great class, not too hard. Essential to show up to class to do well on tests. However, you don't have to study too much for tests. He is exceptionally accessible outside of class and cares mainly about his students and their success.

Worst class I've ever taken. Each question on the final is worth 2% of the grade and some of them are the most random questions. Also check the name August Knemeyer on here because that is him too. Avoid this class at all costs.

He also goes by August on here, so check out those ratings too. I had him during covid, so it was entirely online. His lectures were WAY too long and he wanted us to watch a bunch of additional videos outside of lecture. And he didn't cover everything in the book, but your ONE test in the class asks about stuff in the book, so make sure you read it

Lecture are boring because he reads off the slides in a really quiet voice. The length of the lectures are insanely long for a 1.5 credit class. Quizzes and participation are easy points. Final exam is most of your grade so if you grind out studying at the end of the semester youll be fine. Overall, I dont recommend unless you have to take him.

He also goes by "August" it's the same professor! Both terrible. Thank god this class is only 1.5 credits bc it'll wreck your GPA. I'm a great student but this class was unbearable - 6 min for quizzes, 40 min for 30 questions final and he uses Proctorio. I went from a B+ to a D from the Final. Avoid this professor at all costs. Lectures are so dry

YEA........ This class sucks. Dudes lectures are like watching paint dry and there are hours of them each week. says uh every other word while whispering into the mic. way too much work for a 1.5 hr course, 90-100 slide powerpoints every week (ridiculous). Not interesting, not engaging, not recommended.

I attended Mike's online class this semester. His video lecture is not logical and clear at all. All I depend on is the e-book which costs $60 outside your tuition, but it is much clearer than the video lectures. I got pretty low score on the buckeye essay for both initial and the final even I met the word count and other requirements. Don't take!

Online lectures were incredibly boring, but Between Two Pallets is great. This class gave me so much unnecessary stress (4-6 hrs/wk) during summer semester, but at least he significantly cut down the content for the final. I had many complications with the course that he didn't help with. Otherwise, he seems generous with extra credit and curves.

Lectures are boring and long but he posts the notes, discussions and a couple of easy assignments, tests are hard. Tricky and misleading. Study the textbook!!! Great guy and cares, huge curve at the end

Mike is a really nice guy and super interesting to listen to. However, his exams are a huge weight of your grade and are super hard. There are 2 exams noncumulative that have 30 multiple choice questions that are super specific. On top of that he has discussion boards that are hard to get 100 on. There was a generous curve that he added at the end.

Prof Knemeyer is a good guy and I am sure his in class courses are better, but the online course is a mess. The modules are so unorganized and his review sheets for exams are not clear at all. I would try to take a different professor. Not that the class is hard, but I think he needs to restructure the way he teaches his online course.

can't believe it is 1.5 credits class since I spent as many and even more time as my 3 credits stats class. discussions are tough, you should write more than 700 words each week and finally get 3/5 on average

The exam questions were tricky, so make sure to study up. Book helped clarify concepts. Don't skip the discussion boards. Curve for final grades was very nice. Like someone else said, lectures weren't helpful b/c his teaching style didn't work for me either. He responds to emails very quickly, though. Very caring prof but not an easy class.
Hes a good guy but not the best lecturer. The class has many components so read syllabus carefully.

Professor Knemeyer is by far the worst professor I have had at OSU. This man does not know how to teach what so ever. Lectures are so boring and he drags the lecture until the last minute. Exams are tough so do a lot of studying. He has his corny talk show that you have to watch. Lots of reading, get ready for a boring session if you take him !

Probably the most boring class I have ever taken here and I think Knemeyer had alot to do with it. The video lectures are super dry and his between two pallet videos that you are supposed to watch are cringe-worthy. Not a super hard class but one of those classes that also isn't all that easy to study for

He's a nice guy who lectures pretty well. But the overall learning in the class is minimal. It's very fast paced because it's only 7 weeks. He tries his best to teach some moderately difficult concepts, but I just never connected to his teaching style.

Knemeyer cares a lot about his students, but he's a tough grader. He didn't take attendance every day only sometimes. He makes lectures exciting with side stories that will keep you awake. He'll also call on you for answer.

Hard to leave a bad review on such a nice guy, but I'm still going to. The workload for the online section is absolutely ridiculous. There are 8-10 video lecture modules per week that are each an average of 15 mins long, probably a few interviews (20 mins), his cringy between two pallets episodes (20 mins) & extremely involved discussion boards too

Easy class, and he's a nice guy, but way too overbearing. He tries to involve all the students during every lecture which makes class absolutely unbearable. He is constantly walking around the room, making it difficult to do non-lecture work such as email, or anything else you usually do. I would never enroll in a class with this teacher.

I personally did not learn very much from his class. I went to all the lectures, read the book, did the practice problems but it didn't help. He's a funny guy, and cares a lot about his students, I just did not learn from his teaching style.

Probably one of the best professors that I've had at Fisher. He cares a lot about his students. Online version of class was a lot of work, wish I would've taken it in class. Switched my major after this course. If you read the book and do practice problems, you should get an A! His weekly videos are hilarious.

The online course is SOO much work. There is an unreasonable amount of assignments. The exams are really detail-oriented so you have to make sure you study really hard so you don't miss one tiny detail he'll test you on. In order to get a 5/5 on course engagement, you have to go to 8 or more activities outside of class just in 1/2 a semester.

Skimmed the textbook a little, but mostly used the in-text quizzes for participation. Michael is witty and makes the dry material more interesting. A midterm, a final, and some discussion boards on canvas (make sure you reply to a lot of your peers for full credit). Great class, decently easy

Very approachable and genuine professor. He definitely goes above and beyond for his students and tries to make the material interesting. I took this class online and wish I would've put a little more effort in it because tests are not difficult. Highly recommend taking the class with him!

Professor Knemeyer is a dope boy. His class is easy if you read the textbook, attend lecture, and do the assigned homework on Canvas. The material is very dry, but he finds a way to bring in his personal experience and industry knowledge to keep the class entertained. His class is 7 weeks long, and flies by. So don't fall behind !

DO NOT TAKE THIS ONLINE!!! He seems like a nice guy but way too much content on the online version.  Majority of material is absolutely pointless.  Tests were easy if you have any background in logistics.  DONT TAKE IT ONLINE!!

Mike is a great guy- he cares a lot about his students and is very approachable. The class was difficult, though, and the grading criteria/expectations weren't clear. He expects you to read the textbook and you have to work hard in this class to get an A. It's difficult to know how you're doing in the class at any point in time.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS ONLINE. As if the new "Carmen" wasn't difficult enough to sift through already, this new online version of Logistics had WAY too much content to get through. Very disorganized, which is a shame because Professor Knemeyer is an awesome and helpful professor. Really needs to trim down on the content. Just take class in person.

Such a great professor. Cares so much for an intro class in which many of us aren't studying logistics. Has a video series that helps your learn about logistics outside of class. Funny in lecture. Always willing to help you. Overall: Great professor, wish there were more like him.
Don't need to go to class.  Got an A by reading the book and lectures.  3 quizzes, one is dropped, and a final. Gives extra credit and ended up curving the class. Take with this professor

Tries his best to make the class more interesting with real examples. Don't really need to go to class if you look over lectures and read a bit. I never read and just went to lecture and did fine. Willing to help if you want it. 3 quizzes (lowest dropped), final & 3 extra credit chances. I'd say the class was pretty average for a core req.

Really great guy and makes lecture on the topic somewhat interesting. You don't really have to go to lecture though to get a decent grade, he posts the powerpoints he read off of online. Test questions are the SMALLEST details from the reading and powerpoints. Great resource for logistics, but not a good teacher if you want an easy A
He did not give a good demonstration in class. I don't even know what I get from the course. No homework. Tests are so-ooooo hard!!! Take care to take his class.

This is an extremely difficult class compared to most intro logistic courses. His quizzes are extremely specific on slides, and on the reading from the text. Easy to fail if you do not go to class either since he asks questions about videos he shows during lecture. Although attendence is not mandatory, you should go. This class took my GPA down.
quizzes are rough. Not worth taking it with him and getting a B when you could take it with another prof and get an easy A

Quizzes are extremely specific. Lectures are very boring; he just reads off of his slides most of the time which have 100 words on each of them. He does bring in good examples but not that are relevant to quizzes. Lots of diagrams that you never have to learn for quizzes. Take with someone else if at all possible. Worst class in Fisher I've taken

DO NOT TAKE HIM FOR THE INTRO BUSML 3380.  The other profs make the quizzes online and the tests are a replica of the review but he makes them hard in person & the final isn't easy. He's clear in lecture and engaging, but doesn't emphasis what's important or what parts of the book matter-you MUST read the book.  Take 3380 with someone else.
Very good teacher however quizzes are extremely specific and difficult.  Requires attending in class lectures along with reading the specifics in the text book to do well.

Nice guy who is genuinely interested in helping students. The subject material is hard but relevant to other classes. There are 3 quizzes and an exam (lowest quiz score is dropped). I got an 84% which he curved up to a B+. I would recommend him as a teacher, just be ready to study because it is easy to fall behind.

The class is pretty tough. he definitely knows what he's talking about and brings in good examples. There is just a lot of information to be covered for a 7 week class. Make sure you read the book AND pay attention in lecture. He asks specific questions from each. Nice guy, interesting class, you learn a lot, but it is tough.
Quiz is tough. You have to read book carefully.
Quizzes are extremely specific
Very specific quiz questions. Covers similar topics to the operations class.

Easy class.  Study slides and know the bold words / italicized things in the textbook.  You do need the book to do good in the class.  Asks VERY specific questions on the quizzes, but the cumulative final is much more broad and general.

He's kinda boring, but nice sometimes funny. If you read or skim through the book and go over the slides you should do well on the quizzes and the final I would say just follow the study guide and know the bigger picture of each chapter.
Good guy.  tests are manageable.  curves if class does poorly.  some group projects (2 papers and a presentation).  not a bad work load.  come to class for quizzes
Very helpful professor, honestly cared about his students.  I would definitely take another class from him.

I thought he was a lot of fun.  If you haven't had any other logistics classes yet it will take you a few weeks to catch up because he teaches as though you have experience.  But I was able to catch up and get an A.  He is definitely the best of the options for this class.

Dr K is awesome. He is one of the few teachers at Fisher who cares about the success of his students. Class is very interesting. You get to compete in a simulation relevant to logistics (1Million times better then 499 crap), project, midterm, final, and participation.  If you put in the work, you will be fine.  Great experience, TAKE with DR K!!!!!
Easy to talk to. Replys to email fast.
Great professor, made the class very interesting.
hard dude

Although I got an A, he is horrible. 3 projects that have vague requirements and no real life application. Grading is very subjective. Lecture notes focus more on pictures than content. Only has 30% of your final grade back to you before your final.

practical assignments.  Three major projects in quarter.  Most of the grades towards end.  Helpful.  Asks for lots of class input in begining of quarter about how students want class run.  Competitive grading for group projects
great teacher, easy going and has concern for the student.
Very helpful and makes the lectures interesting

Prof Hipple is one of the best professors at OSU. He is so knowledgeable about the business world and gives great real-world advice. This class is the perfect balance of quizzes, lectures, and real-world experience as we helped source for a small business in Cbus. Def worth waking up at 8 am!
One of the best courses I've taken, the semester-long project is great and challenging, anyone who wants to have an insight into this industry should definitely take this class.

Prof. Hipple gave a ton of useful information that is applicable in just about any field. No cumulative final, but there are 6 quizzes that require reviewing lectures. This was one of the most beneficial classes in my major, even though it was an elective. The term project was sourcing with a real company, so that was pretty cool. Highly recommend!
Prof. Hipple is a great professor! Must take his class!
Avoid
Although I got a C+ in this class this is still the best professor I have ever had at this school. Very knowledgeable. The class is pretty hard though.

By far the best teacher I have had at Ohio State. Karen is extremely knowledgeable for finance majors. Its the first time where I was actually learning information that would help me towards my career. Not only do you learn the fundamentals but Karen breaks down why they matter and when they will be applied in your career. Best at fisher!

A very smart individual. If you like finance, you can really learn a ton from her. Personality wise, pretty decent. She is willing to help and adds a ton of outside informaiton to the class. A solid choice but be prepared to put in some effort. Her exams can be tough and she requires a lot of weekly time.

Best Corporate Finance teacher available if you want to put in the work and actually learn something. Assignments during quarantine were heavy to make sure you are watching the lectures and retaining some of the info but usually, just show up to lectures and take notes and you'll get by. Work on the cases with friends or they take forever.
Great and challenging class. Prepares you for your job.

Don't know why Karen got so much bad rep. She is very willing to help and also is encouraging to lesser students. Her class is case-based and she induces lots of insightful ideas in M&A. Tough grader, but great class.
Karen is fun and teaches MBA courses as they should be (primarily with cases). I highly recommend this professor.

Excellent & demanding teacher.  Willing to throw students under bus for sake of her career.  Will not stand up for things she claims to believe in as it relates to school policies and career services department
Her high expectations lead to high performance.
Professor Wruck is great teacher and very bright person! She is also great at teaching cases.
No Comments
One of the worst in the business school...thinks too much of herself and never helps students when they need it most...clearly doesn't deserve the position she presently has.
No Comments
Very good prof.  Keeps you on your toes.  Clearly cares about the students, but you need to have intelligent comments.  One of the best first year MBA profs.
His class is truly aspiring. His way to deliver grades, however, could be confusing. The tasks you will do are sometimes confusing if you don't pay attention in class and even if you did,

I wish all professors were like him. He teaches his classes based on the most important things you need to know if you work in the industry. When you take his class, you're not simply showing up to get a good grade, but you learn APPLICABLE real-world knowledge that will help you in your career. He's an amazing professor.

Assigns a monumental professional-level project without even teaching you how to complete it or how to approach it. Therefore, when you take this class, keep in mind he expects you to already be a professional in the field of Supply Chain Sustainability.

One of the most caring, nice, and accessible professors I have ever had. He is here to teach, and he tells his students that all the time. He is here for the students and wants them to do well as he offers valuable industry experience. Fisher is lucky to have him.

Super disorganized and doesn't know how to work Carmen. For the half-semester course, the only grades we got back before submitting the paper and taking the final were quizzes, which were poorly formatted and average grades were Cs for everyone, but he said "don't worry about your grades" and didn't offer any help. "Scenario exam" had no scenario.

He's kind and seems to care about his students; I was excited to have him after hearing rave reviews. He changed the class structure and I hated it. It was reading a textbook on your own time with no lectures (not in person, but not advertised as online class), then a case. I felt like I taught myself. Hopefully he changes a lot for next semester.

He is easy to reach and gives good feedback when you need help. He is nice and not tough on grading. Half of the semester is lecturing and need to be there as some questions on quizzes are mentioned in class but not on ppts. The other half is doing group projects, and they are not hard, but attendance required for this half semester.

Hendrickson is a fantastic professor with much industry experience. He is a funny guy, so the lectures are very enjoyable. The second half of the course consists of a practical group exercise and exam, and he makes it very clear on what he expects from his students. This was my favorite class here at OSU, and I highly recommend him!

I loved this class and the professor. He cares a lot about his students and he makes his lectures so interesting and exciting based on his real experiences. The one final was very simple and easy, and the last half of the class is a project that counts for your final grade. It wasn't too easy, but he was always there if you had any questions!

Great guy. Took him for 2 courses and would take another if I could. He's got so much industry experience and his projects are some of the most realistic experience I've gotten in school. He designs them and they're quite challenging but he knows that and grades them accordingly so don't sweat your grade. There's 3 projects, an exam, and 3 quizzes.
Professor Hendrickson was awesome! His class was relatively easy, contained relevant material, and his lectures were very enjoyable. I would highly recommend him!

He has a lot of industry experience and business knowledge which he passes on to you in lectures. His quizzes/tests are pretty specific sometimes which can be hard. He definitely knows his stuff, but sometimes explains things in a way that can confuse you.

He was a really good professor. He really cares about how the students are doing in his class and offered our class extra credit in return for feedback for him on the class. Some online reading assignments with quizzes, a midterm and a final made up your grade. Lectures were interesting and he has a lot of real world experience to share.

He really is a very genuine and warm guy. His lectures were clear and interesting, and his knowledge of the field is exceptional. This was the first time he taught this level of logistics, and he could improve the writing of his quiz questions. But I'm confident he will. Take him for logistics, you'll love it!

Makes Transportation lectures seem like 12 weeks of watching Fast and Furious.   Interesting, funny, down-to-earth, and he more knowledge than someone could absorb even if they spent all 4 years in his classroom. Great professor to learn from academically, and an even better person to go ask for professional/life advice. Best professor in Fisher.
Great professor. Thorough understanding of the field.

I personally learned so much from this class, and I still feel like I should take it again bc Professor Hendrickson has a wealth of experience/info to share. He's a genuine student advocate, always wanting to help and not hinder or punish. Easily made it to my top 3 favorite professors at OSU. Also, his advice on life in general is spot on.

If you want a professor who is engaging, funny, practical, and intelligent take any of Jim Hendrickson's classes. He has a consistent record of being one of the best subject matter experts in the logistics major at OSU and is well respected by students. His tests go off the PPT slides and basic common sense. No book needed either!

One of my favorite professors, had him for this and 4385 and he really is great. Easy quizzes, few assignments only take 2-3 hours to complete and exams were simple, especially since he follows the study guide. Highly recommend not only because it's easy but because he is an amazing lecturer with great experience and incredibly helpful.

Class consisted of lectures for the first half of the half semester and the rest was 2 group projects. Very easy & did show a lot about sustainability. Instead of a final there was a final paper, which was easy enough that I finished it within an hour. He might add in another group project but either way the class is well worth it. Fav professor

The exams are difficult and the class only consists of 3 quizzes, 3 exams, and attendance. The attendance grade helped so much, but expect mid 60-70s for the average exam grades. Study every bulletin on powerpoints because he uses small details and read/ skim your textbook. Super caring professor and overall a very nice guy who loves his fam.

Great professor who notices your hard work, GO TO OFFICE HOURS!! He will help you pass his extremely hard exams because he KNOWS they are hard. He gives bonus points for attendance which really helped my grade, and rounded up my grade tremendously because he recognized my hard work and communication/concerns.

Lots of memorization in this class and tests questions are so specific that you may not do well if you don't read everything. Lectures just go over chapters in the textbook and are dry. George often goes on rambles and loses track of what he is actually teaching. Tough class.

The worst teacher I have ever met in fisher. The grade is only composed of test, participation, and in class quiz, which are all averaged of 65-75%. His class is 2 thing: reading ppt and making strange joke which no one understand. Also he randomly calling ppl to answer questions in class and this count as participation!!!

This course is a tough one to teach for people wanting to get into the insurance industry. There are so many little details to pick up on, but Professor Krempley does a great job of making the lectures interesting and being available in office hours to explain certain concepts. He loves insurance and will help you if you reach out.
great teacher

While attendance at lectures is for credit, he literally just reads exactly what the slides say without adding anything to the conversation. The averages for the exams were around a 70% because the questions were incredibly difficult. He curved final grades by like 8% because grades were so bad.

Easily the worst professor at Fisher. Exams and quizzes were very specific to small details in lecture/reading. Discussions were also graded very tough. Material was easy, he's just a really bad teacher and rambles a lot. If you're comfortable learning on your own you'll pass.

Lectures are dry but go, you have 4 skips. Just read the book, they give amazing examples to solidify the info. He does thorough reviews for tests, pay attention, he will say many things on the test. It's not the easiest class but not as hard as people think. Reading the textbook was key, it sucked, but its worth it. No homework at all u can do it

The class isn't THAT bad. It's just memorizing a bunch of facts, with a tiny bit of 6th-grade level math. The hardest part about the class is filtering out the important stuff form everything else. George does ramble a lot, and he liked to tell stories. However, he covers all the material and gives good answers when you ask him a question.

I would 100% say the worst teacher I have ever had. The tests cover an insane amount of material that he expects you to know down to the smallest detail. He is boring and thinks he is funny. Overall a wierd guy with a horrible teaching style and the most boring and difficult class of my life.

Just fun if you take this class. Worst class I have ever taken. Krempley is the worst teacher and the class is the hardest and most boring material ever. I never have felt so upset took a class in my life.

This is one of the hardest classes I've ever taken BUT Prof Krempley makes time to help students who are struggling. GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS! I was failing and waited until the final exam to seek help from him. He worked with me for hours and gave me practice questions not given in class. I got an A on the final. He truly cares about his students.
Avoid this class at all costs. Cool guy but very dry material and long boring lectures. Exams are hard and ends up curving them. Expects us to know every little thing about insurance. AVOID

Prof. K is awesome. His lectures can feel long but he tries really hard to make them fun and likes to tell funny stories! Very approachable. To get an A(+): -MUST go to class (attendance graded) -MUST read textbook. The slides do not cover all relevant info. Luckily the book is available at Thompson and is easy to read.

Took into to insurance and risk. Hardest class Ive taken in fisher. Graded by only 3 midterms. Midterm averages were a D. Gives extra credit for attendance, but his lectures could get boring. Knows a lot about insurance though and is a nice guy. Ended up bumping up our final grade by 12 percentage points at end of class.
An absolutely brilliant man.

Class was hard because Krempley does not teach ANYTHING. You Need the textbook or else you won't pass but you could probably teach yourself the information better. He did not teach anything! Could not even answer many of the questions asked. Sorry, cool guy, horrible professor.

Andrea is such a gentleman both in and outside class! Very organized class and he put in every effort to create the most inclusive environment where everybody can speak up freely. A lot of guest speakers and most of them are really amazing with tons of experience. The best class ever!!

Dr Contigiani is a real gem. The class is entirely free. Many guest speakers to solidify the weekly readings. Easy presentations and an easy final. Plenty of opportunities for extra credit. Overall, he is a great professor.

Jeff is a great professor that brings a lot of professional and personal experience to this class. The class is straightforward and the tests are open book but timed so that you don't have time to look everything up. It's how exams in college should be, with original questions that force you to apply theories rather than memorizing definitions.

Easy grader, show up to class, and take good notes, a lot of the stuff he says is on the exams. The exams are the majority of your grade which is kind of annoying but I highly recommend reading the book as well because a lot of the test questions are pulled from it. Midterm, final, and one easy paper.

Being a 1.5 credit hour course, we only had like 5 classes. Grade was based on two EASY exams and an easy sample contract paper. Read the chapters, have a basic understanding of everything and you will do fine. Averages on both exams were high B's/low A's.

As fake as they come. I'm not really sure I learned much from Prof. Bailey, except that he really tries to ramp up enthusiasm. I get the feeling that he really enjoys being the bully in a classroom. Economics could be a lot more interesting.

Top 5 professors/teachers I've ever had! To keep within character limit: Pros: - Teaching method emphasizes intuition > memorization - Sooo much content but optimally interweaved - Clear expectations and instructions - Not easiest class; however, easiness should be irrelevant bc content is worth it Cons: - Sometimes too easy on MBAs.
Definitely one of the best professors at Fisher. The class was very useful and interesting.

Rodger is a great marketing teacher and knows so much about marketing research and how to teach hard statistics. However, this class is extremely fast paced and difficult. He's very strict on grading and participation is a huge part of the grade. If you don't understand anything he loves to help and clarify, office hours are great with him.

A lot of grades are based on the one semester long group project so try to get a good team. He's very open and passionate about the subject and wants everyone to enjoy the class. He jokes but still conveys the info. He's willing to go above and beyond for his students.

This is the core econ class for the MBA and it covers a ton of material very quickly. so brace yourself. Now, most econ classes look like that Ben Stien lecture in Ferris Bueller's Day Off.  Not Professor Bailey's class! He is the most engaging teacher I've ever had. I will take another one of his classes because he is one of Ohio State's best.

He is the greatest professor you will have at the Fisher College of Business.  He cares about the students and is very passionate about market research.  The group project is manageable and he gives feedback throughout the semester,  The exams are a little difficult but he does a great job of making them fair and over the class material.

Awesome professor. Very detailed class, very stats heavy, but even for a student who didn't do well in their Intro to Stats class (like me) he makes it understandable and I'm now able to use and interpret statistical analysis in a meaningful way. And he's hilarious, very entertaining lectures, impossible to fall asleep during. Great professor!

Roger is awesome, the class material is inherently difficult and he understands that and does his best to help you out.  He knows that the material he lectures on is terribly boring, but spices up class with tales from his rodeo past.  He makes you work for your grade but is always willing to go the extra mile for you if you just ask.

Professor Dickstein is an okay choice for analytics. To be honest his online prerecorded lectures were very hard to stay awake during. I am not a fan of courses that make their exams difficult so they can throw hundreds of curves at you. He seems like a really nice guy and is willing to help if you reach out. Easy cases, just study for exams!

I never interacted with him, but the online lectures are terrible. The quality is not good and is barely watchable. It is also not comprehensive so you will have to spend a lot of time reading the book. He didn't put much effort into the class. Only good part is lots of extra credit, but not a guaranteed A.

You won't interact with this professor very much in an online setting. Used recorded lectures from a previous semester and assigned weekly reading assignments, sometimes multiple chapters. Open-note exams that are difficult but plenty of extra credit offered during the exam. Easy A if you don't fall behind on material.
His lectures are pretty solid, explains the math parts of the course well, plus he offers tons of extra credit opportunities. He also responds to emails pretty quickly.

Content and structure of the class is somewhat disorganized, but he knows what hes talking about. Class content isnt too difficult. Tons of room for extra credit from tests; plus open note tests. A couple cases with groups which are easy.

Do not take this class of it is online. There is a lot more math than advertised and there is supposed to be a recitation. When the class is online, he neglects to have a recitation. Good luck teaching the math to yourself.

This class was so ridiculously disorganized. I was learning different things in pre-lecture, lecture, and recitations, and had no idea how to study for exams. There needs to be more communication between TAs and the professor and they should all have access to materials on Carmen. The content itself wasn't hard but the class was painfully confusing

I'm not really sure why this class is mandatory and very underlooked. The class needs restructuring, didnt learn a whole lot. If you take an analytics class, you would expect to have useful homework or practice problems that help you towards the exam/projects, which wasnt the case. This class is very difficult.

Overall, I liked him. Not as much work as you would have taking Klinker, which I appreciated. Exams are pretty specific, so definitely watch his lectures and attend recitation. The two group projects weren't too difficult, just start them early. The five quizzes were all very easy and two attempts. He's a fine choice, just study well for exams!

Took this class online. Lectures are boring and slow paced. I ended up watching the lectures in the online textbook. Attending recitations helped. I also never read any of the online textbook chapters. There are 5 quizzes that are pretty easy imo. 2 group project cases that are easy if you watch the textbook videos. Take Klinker if possible.

Steven seems like a super nice guy, & I wish I couldve had him in person, bc his online lectures were not helpful at all. His internet connection was awful so it was hard to understand what he was saying bc of the bad connection. However, its still possible to get a good grade bc of the extra credit. I have no idea whats going on but I have A-

Im not going to lie this guy isnt good to be honest. The guy doesnt know how to teach let alone communicate, hes disrespectful and thinks its okay to overload us with work. Which wasnt a problem to be honest. Its the fact that none of your assignments dates on McGrawhill correlate with anything he assigns you through Carmen. Not a single one

He is great, the best out of the 2321 professors! Very responsive and caring. Straightforward and organized class and lectures are very helpful. Graded by 5 quizzes (pretty easy), 2 group cases (challenging, but doable), and 2 exams (have to study for, but manageable). Slight curve is applied. Take him!

I took the class online so I did not have a lot of interaction, but he seems like a decent guy. The exams are not easy to take but he offers a good chunk of extra credit on each so they are easy to get a good grade on. Get good case groups. Do the work and its an easy A.
this class sucked and wouldn't take it unless u had to

Awesome guy. Really funny at times. But very old school and can be quite picky. Overall he's just a good dude and a pretty good teacher. Be ready to read a lot and talk a lot in class. Participation kinda sucks and is nearly impossible if you choose not to read.

Class was "hybrid learning" so lots of reading outside of class w/ a weekly recitation. Makes grading criteria very clear and lots of opportunities for extra credit, both on exams and other assignments. Lectures are kind of dry but I do feel like I learned a lot overall. Exam difficulty is on par with that of other business minor courses at OSU.
Steve is an old school prof. Lots of reading (three 4-page articles per class, with the biweekly "case study" that may be upwards of 30 pages). Classes are based completely off the reading.

Really funny guy. Explains the material well. I always had trouble connecting recitation and lecture material, but I think its more of a miscommunication between the professor and the TAs. Class is much easier than a lot of people make it out to be

I have had Steve for two classes, and both I have only lost points for not showing up. If you attend almost every class, you should have no problem passing the class. There is only one exam, which is super easy and has tons of extra credit. The group projects are not terrible, either. Just try to read the articles before class and participate.

If you have more options , do not take his class ! The participation point is awful. The total is 15 but each participate only gets 0.5. You need to read cases before class so that you can answer his questions. His scored unfairly for group projects and group presentations . He do not care how much information you put, he only care decision tree!

He really cares about how much you get out of this class and tried really hard to make it interesting with songs and food. Very nice guy who really cares about his students and gives you crazy curves for exams. Grades pretty fairly but wont give you 100 for doing nothing.

Honestly I don't know how he has a job here. He basically just throws out tons of information at you and says its all fair game (even the OPINION based video and case questions). I literally don't bother going to class. There is no point like youll fall asleep. Exams are curved crazily. Should have no issue getting an A. Get good case groups

There's group cases that are a big part of your final grade, so make sure you have reliable people. The tests are curved heavily. He doesn't explain the math applications of in-depth concepts, so prepare for mostly self-teaching.
Lectures are very boring. All material taught is free game on exams.
Professor is super boring. Lectures for an hour and a half and doesn't even cover all the material on the exams. So hard to be motivated for this class.

The class is easy because tests are graded out of 100 with 140-150 possible points. However, the PowerPoints are unorganized and jump around randomly. Group project wording is often ambiguous. He uses archaic supplemental articles & videos that are never even close to current (early 2000s). If you want an easy A & not really learn, take his class.

Very monotone lectures. Rarely stayed awake. Group projects aren't too bad as long as you have a reliable group. TONS of extra credit on exams. Midterm had 130 points possible out of 100. Final had 150 possible out of 100. Second half of the course is very math-based. Barely learned anything after the midterm and still got an A.

Boring lectures, monotone voice puts you to sleep. You have to buy an article book that is $120 that cannot be re-sold because he makes creates a new one every semester. He is super picky as to how you answer the long answers in the exam and takes points off for stupid reasons. Participation is 15% of the grade so be ready to talk. He is rude also

He leads class discussion and lectures without slides, expects class participation and gives 2 participation quizzes. 1 individual casual presentation along with 2 group presentations. 1 midterm with no study guide. His grading criteria is not clear, and he is not clear when asked to clarify.

He is nice and tries to make it fun by singing in class and even passed out fortune cookies before the midterm. However, he is very monotoned, which makes for long lectures. Group projects are also tough (especially if you are in a bad group) and make up a decent amount of your final grade as he uses his own final grade calculation method.

The quizzes are impossible and the exams never stick to the study guide. STUDY THE PPTS FOR EXAMS. Even the stuff he says isn't important on the slides; exam questions come straight from the slides, ALL the slides. Go to class on days he reviews answers to cases and supplements/articles because he never posts the answers and they're on the exam.

The best part of this course is that he offers around 40 extra credit points on the two tests. His lectures are monotonous and unclear. The subject matter is useful, but his ability to convey it is weak. He spends little time on the math, and the problems are written confusingly, purposely tricky.  Keep up with the out of class work!

Quite honestly the worst professor I've had during my time at Ohio State. The entire course needs to be restructured, not to mention his attitude and approach toward his students. While he seemed nice initially, he was the least helpful, rudest, most inconsiderate instructor I've encountered.

This class is an easy A because he gives so much extra credit. The group work is  tedious, and his lectures are boring, but as long as you stay on top of the stuff you need to know, its not so bad. The tests are ridiculously difficult, but because he gives up to 30 points extra credit on them, you should still manage to get decent grades on them.

One of the worst professors I have ever had. This class should be much easier than it is. The material is not difficult, but his exams in no way match up to the study guides. Midterm was manageable, but the final was incredibly difficult. Lectures are so boring that it is hard to pay attention, and cases covered info not gone over well in class.

Definitively not good. -Lectures are long, not particularly helpful, and delivered in monotone. -Cases can be bad if you are in a bad group -Most importantly, the difficulty of the quizzes and exams are in no way representative of the problems that are gone over in class.  Exams in particular are much, much harder than the practice problems.

Prof is such a nice guy. He can get a little monotone and boring sometimes, but he's pretty funny when he wants to be and you can tell he cares about his students. I'm glad I took him for this class! It helps to go to class but there are a ton of quizlets online that tell you basically everything you need to know.

This guy is hilarious. Would sing full length personal renditions of songs to us in class. Very helpful and understands that we're college students just working for the GPA. His lectures can sometimes get mundane and boring... so if you fall asleep like I did frequently, just skim the book. Unless you actually don't care at all... you'll get an A.

Basic business management. You have to do two group cases during the semester, but they are straightforward. The class itself was easy. Numerous amounts of extra credit on the exams, and the final is not cumulative. Should be an easy A.

Decent professor. Didn't give out a curve but put built in extra credit on the exams (ex: the final had 140 total points but was only graded out of 100), so even though the exams were hard, it was pretty easy to get an A on them. The only in-class component is an optional recitation once a week. Overall had a good experience.

Recitation once a week and the rest of the content is online. Doesn't use PPT much, just talks to the class so recitation can be boring at times. Class is out of 240 points, but he gives extra questions on the midterm/final. Midterm was manageable, final was extremely difficult! There's group work, but it's fine as long as your group doesn't suck.

Lectures are very slow. Buying the book is a MUST. It's an article pack that changes every year. Group work with a final presentation at the end of the year. Essay midterm. Fair grading. Not a bad class.

Such a caring and wonderful professor! He always goes out of his way to make class interesting, even sang us a song once. As long as you go to class and pay attention the tests and cases are pretty easy.

He is a great professor and very interested in his job. Quizzes are super easy. Exams are easy too as long as you read the book and have common sense. The cases aren't bad, just don't get stuck with a bad group. Don't even have to attend lecture or watch online modules to get an A
Steven explains the subject pretty well. And he also makes the class a lot easier. Cases are relatively easy so are the exams. The best in teaching modeling.
He's biased and subjective. Awful as a teacher!

Thought this class should have been easier than it was. The final was way too hard for a business minor class and although it was not cumulative, it contained questions from the first half of the class. The study guide did not match up with the exam content. Questions were written to trick the students. Overall, not happy.

Not an interactive class. Expects a lot of discussion, but the questions he asks are aimed at grad students, so we simply did not know what to say at times. Great guy and interesting projects and lecture, but like I said, many times lecture just consisted of him talking for the whole class period.
A really nice teacher! He makes the material as easy as possible. Pay attention in lecture and you will not need to study. Slides alone are not very helpful

Easy, easy class. It's hard not to get an A on the cases since he is so lenient grading them (most of the time), and the finals have five bonus questions. Book not needed. Just pay attention to his slides and make sure you understand everything that the problems convey. To me, it was a very easy A. Professor D's a nice guy. For the most part.
Awful. The exams are impossible and take the entire time to finish. You need to go to all of the classes to know the material that he does not post online (on purpose).

A class like this should not be taught online. Hes a cool guy,likes to sing & give treats to those who talk and does well on exam. he offers TONS of extra credit on exams.the material isnt too harsh, but this class is not a slacker one. dont buy textbook or connect($40). just go to thompson, rent textbook, and do the problems that he suggest
Very easy and laid back professor. Cases aren't hard at all and the exams aren't that bad either as long as you TAKE THE TIME TO STUDY

he is one of the best professors at fisher college. he made this course as easy as he could. there were 5 easy case studies. the exams were quite manageable as well. i reccomend everyone to take 331 with him.

Very interesting teacher; boring subject matter. Half of the quarter was devoted to solver. Ughhhh. He ended class early a lot and there are five EASY case studies. The exams require you to know the material, but the material is pretty easy. He is extremely well dressed and gives things out as prizes in class.

Easiest teacher at Fisher. I don't know that I really learned anything, fell asleep in every lecture, and still pulled off an A with no problem. The class is structured so that everyone gets an A. This material is not going to be enjoyable no matter who you take, so take Dickstein.
Boring lectures, easy exams. Tests have built in extra credit, if you can breathe you can get an A in this class.
Good teacher.

Avoid. He's a nice guy and all. But his exam questions are ridiculous and if you don't go to class. the lecture slides won't make any sense. only good thing about each exam is that he gives you 20 pts you can miss before it starts deducting from your grade, you will need them.
Not a boring teacher, knows his stuff so class is a pleasure to go to. Easy grader. Best dressed teacher at FCOB. To get a good test grade, just read the cases and go to class. Easy!
He tries, but the class is boring especially  at 830 in the morning study the slides that you are able to buy at the beginning of the quarter bounded, don't buy the textbook, and you should be good

Not too bad a guy...likes to give out random prizes to students who answer questions or did really well on the exams. No need to but the book, just the course packet. Study the packet before exams and get a good group for the case studies and you'll do just fine.

Pretty good professor. Explained things fairly clearly and the course is helpful. To get the full participation points (20% of the grade), only 20 out of 32 points need to be earned. DON'T SLEEP IN CLASS! The average for my class on the midterm was in the mid 80s, so students understood what he taught.

Easy class to begin with, but extra credit on tests is awesome.  great teacher, keeps things fun.  buy the class notes but not the book and study the night before the exams.  I would definitely take another class from him.

Crazy guy, but made class fun. Does alot of singing in class. Attendance not that necessary, but must get notes from a friend in class for more clarity for exams. Gave a large curve after final. Textbook not necessary. I went to about half the lectures and got a B+ so it is a great possibility that you can get an A.

Fun professor, *clearly* made an effort to make the (uninteresting) content come alive. The course was easy. As someone who almost always buys the books for classes, though, buying this textbook was a waste of money--$140 and you don't need anything from it, only the course packet/powerpoint slide notes.

Excellent Teacher. One of the most innovative and clear instructors I have had. Lots of extra credit available, nearly 20 points on each exam. A down-to-earth student oriented guy. As he says, he really will "Add value to the class for you the 'student consumer'." I would take a course from him in a heartbeat.

Pretty cool guy.  Gave a ton of extra credit on the final, the average ended up being something ridiculous like 112% so 3/4 of the class got A's.  Likes to swear a lot and gives out random prizes in class that'll make you laugh.  Didn't really learn anything and ended up with an A, so that says something about his easiness.

Likeable guy.  Material was boring but not too difficult.  ALways gave tons of bonus on tests.  3 group cases which were pretty easy.  Does NOT look or talk like Bush...? Sorta cute for an older guy and had a fun personality...gave out prizes for answering questions. Someone in my class got tickets to something but I never found out what..

Class material was kinda boring but he always had interesting examples/stories. He'd sing us songs and give us gifts for answering questions so that was pretty sweet. EXTREMELY LIKEABLE GUY. Study your notes for the exam and you'll be fine. 2 case studies but if you divide up the work in your group its not bad at all.
looks like george bush. talks like george bush. gives fortune cookies & sings in class. lots of extra credits in exams.
Great Professor.  Class was very interesting, always had a story to tell.  Just read the cases and articles and participate in class.  The best class and professor I've had so far.

One midterm, one final both worth 100 points, 2 case studies worth 15 pts each.  Need to go to class to understand the material.  He does not stray from his notes.  The book is never used don't buy it, it's $140.  Study his review sheet.  Final has a large curve to it.  Harder material, just review it one week before test. I got an A not impossible

Class was tough.  2 case studies worth 30% total, 1 midterm worth 35% and 1 final worth 35%.  He scales the final and it is the only curve in the class, but it is pretty generous.   He attempts to make it fun, but operations just was not interesting.  Need to go to lecture for example math problems because they are worth a lot on the exams.

Very easy graders for tests and cases.  But his policy on participation poinds blows.  You would have to a ton of extra work to come anywhere close to getting it all.  I would avoid this guy in taking this class.  He's sort of a jerk as well.
Horrible professor/class enough said!
Awful professor, insults students and makes them feel dumb if they ask a bad question.  unclear and disorganized.  participation points too hard to get.
This teacher got on my last nerve, he wasted so much time in class doing stupid things.  Half of the time I got up and left because he was trying to be funny and I had better things to do.
Haha, funny guy. Subject matter is really boring but the instructor has unique methods to keep the student interested. You'll see what I mean when you take a class from him.
Class was great, teacher was awsome. Actaully wanted to go to class at 530 at night! Made it fun, rewarded with food. Really willing to help.
Class was a challenge. He made the class interesting and was one of the better professors I have had at Ohio State.
The class was somewhat tricky, and he did a good job at explaining the concepts.  He has kind of odd ways of making the class interesting, but overall he was a great professor.
This guy would be the man if he weren't from Boston, but, he still rocks nonetheless. Tough but fair teacher; Probably the finest OSU has to offer.
Very interesting and intellectual stimulated class!  Great professor!!  He does give away interesting prizes to students

Very helpful and entertaining.  Gives away prizes to keep class interesting.  If you need help, he will definatly help you.  Very good teacher and keeps it interesting even though its an extremely boring class.

I had professor Li during the covid outbreak semester, he is the smartest professor I ever met at Fisher. I like his courses in general and he is super helpful and accessible outside of the class. His quiz and exam are very complicated. If you look for a easy A, should go pick someone else, solid industry and academy knowledge, this guy is the GOAT

Your grade depends solely on two midterms and a final so it is important to study a lot for them. Lectures can sometimes drag but they really go in to depth on the topics. If you can complete all the practice problems he gives you, then you will do well on the exams. The format of the exams and concepts on them was predictable.
She is the worst professor I have ever seen. I would not recommend.

You would think when you sign up for this class that you would have live lectures but nope he just posted them online. There are only 3 grades. 2 midterms worth 25% and a final worth 50%. Only 10-12 multiple choice questions so one wrong answer on the final and your grade drops 5%. By far the laziest professor I have had at Ohio State.

Honestly, it's my senior year and I can say worst prof. I've ever had. He actively chooses to upload lecture videos rather than have lectures at his scheduled time. His videos are super fast-paced and not very detailed. There are only 3 grades in the entire class. Midterm, midterm, exam. Have fun getting any productive feedback on them.

Professor Li was one of the best professors I have had. I am assuming the reason he is getting such bad scores is because people didn't go to class. It was myself and two other kids who showed up everyday. If you put in effort and ask for help you will get it. Overall he is a great guy and super successful, defiantly someone I would recommend!

Yelled for a decent portion during quizzes if someone didn't have their cameras on. I get it but it was hard to concentrate. Took the average of your 4 highest quiz grades so different quizzes had different weights even if you missed one question you better wish it was on a x/5 quiz than a x/3 quiz or get 100 on all of them. I used youtube instead.

I have never felt obligated in the past to rate any teacher until I had Ye Li. In the most respectful way possible, this man has no business "teaching" this class. He offers no guidance for any of the weekly quizzes that are somehow 30% of your grade. Does it make sense for a student who has gotten 100% on every exam to end the class with a B or C?

I was one of the people who previously gave him a 1 out of 5 rating. I changed my mind on him and he become much better over the second half of the course. He gave much better feedback for the 2nd midterm and final than for the first midterm. The test review problems helped so much for the final and 2nd midterm. only grades are tests and quiz.

Class is unorganized. 3 question quizzes count for around 8 percent of your grade each time. Avoid this class and take it with another professor. It is simply to difficult to follow at the undergraduate level.

Taking this professor was a mistake. Lectures are long and wordy and examples are usually excel sheets and nothing like the MC on quizzes or exams. He clearly doesnt care for teaching. The worst part is quizzes are only 3-5 questions and the first exam was only 10 so theres no room for error. I have a 3.8 and am struggling in this class.

Few grades are taken and on top of that very few questions are on the exams and quizzes. Often there are only 4 questions on quizzes and if you miss one question, it goes in the grade book as a 75%. First midterm only had ten questions. Lectures are confusing and unclear as to what will be on quizzes and tests. Recommend looking elsewhere for 4211.

I would not recommend taking him unless you truly need the credit and there are no other options for this class. Seems like more of a graduate level professor. Grade is based on 5 quizzes and 3 exams that are cumulative. I am a 3.9 student and I have struggled to understand what is going to be on quizzes and exams.
unorganized !! ... class should be easy but made it so complicated! examples in excel but exams/quizzes MC. Hard to follow up with his recorded lecture! I wouldn't recommend it!
Very funny and very clear lectures. Recommend taking this teacher.
NIce person and funny class. The exam is not easy but its really similar to the sample.

This class was HARD. For context, one quiz might have 3 MC but counts for 10% of your grade. I am a 4.0 student and really struggled to follow his thought process and study for what would ACTUALLY be on the exams versus what was taught in class. You can tell he has a PhD because he fails to teach his class at an appropriate level of difficulty.

Ye is a really smart guy and knows what he is talking about. Unfortunately, he can be a but wordy and overcomplicate things for the class. Some of his quiz/test questions can be a little confusing to understand, but for the most part they are pretty easy. He is very willing to try and help students in his office hours.
Great professor cares about students. An easy A for sure.

This course is graded on weekly online assignments, and three non-cumulative exams. All exams are closed-note and proctored via Proctorio. Dr. Sullivan is passionate about the field of HR, and offers lots of personal stories to back the class material. Plenty of extra credit opportunities are available, and the class itself is not at all difficult.
Likes to hear himself talk. Don't purchase the course material. Really basic stuff if you need an easy A but would not recommend to anyone.

Professor Sullivan was a really genuine professor. The class was pretty straightforward (a lot of common sense) and he gives you a study guide to help guide your studying. Offers an insane amount of extra credit so the level of effort in this class is pretty minimal... interesting topics though if you pay attention!
Mark Sullivan is a great guy who is passionate about the course material. The exams and assignments were not difficult. This was an interesting class!
Dr. Sullivan really cares about the success of his students and it shows. The class material was easy but relevant and Dr. Sullivan does not try to over-complicate it. Low-stress class and an easy A
Easy material, easy A.

Honestly didnt go to class just because i am in very hard courses this semester and tried balancing a lot of grad school/job apps and TAing but still was able to get a extremely high A in the course. Didnt have time for the extra credit. Dr. Sullivan though is teaching the course to help students. His office hours for career help too

Honestly I wish I had him for a more difficult, interesting, and smaller class. He is a great professor and clearly cares about his students and their well-being. It made me sad how easy the class was since he was so passionate about it but his students weren't. The homework is basically completion and exams are short multiple choice.

Mark Sullivan is a great professor at OSU. His lectures are super boring though. Didn't go to any after the first midterm. Tests are exactly like the study guide, but the study guide is long. Offers a lot of extra credit - we were able to get 50 extra credit points! Would recommend!!
He is a very good public speaker. He is interested in helping students out.
I love Mark Sullivan! He always tells the best stories, cares about his students, and is a great person to know. He is a genuinely good guy and 10/10 would recommend taking a class with him.

Take him. Lectures are interesting and gives points for attendance. Need online access for quick assignments which you can check your work and correct it before submitting. Exams based on study guides. Also curves a lot and gives extra credit. Easy A

The class is really easy and the tests are very strictly based off the study guides. The lectures are kind of boring but he does tell some interesting stories as he as good experience in corporations.
Great Professor. The course overall is not hard. Professor Sullivan will give a bunch of extra credits and curve the exam if necessary. Take him if you could.

The class is so easy if you never go to class and just study a couple hours for the class you should get and A. Sullivan is a nice guy and is a very successful man and would have gone to more of his lectures if it wasn't at 8.
I would recommend Sullivan to anyone.  Easy class, get a good grade and go to his office hours.  An extremely well-connected individual who would love to help develop a student possible.

Not a very good lecturer but a ridiculously easy class. Exams were based exactly off the study guides, he gave a lot of extra credit, during lectures he thought he was a motivational speaker. I stopped going to class after the first exam and still got A's on the last two. Unfortunately required buying online access to do hw (points for completion)
Easy class. Study guide is all you need for the exam. Almost word for word. Gives a ton of extra credit. Funny guy. Class isn't necessary.

By far one of my favorite professors at Ohio State. He genuinely cares for all his students, even in his big lectures. Whether its one last pep talk before our exams, or sending us emails of encouragement. He offers a decent amount of extra credit, which helped boost my grade.

Mark is one of the worst teachers I've had at OSU. Spends the first half of most classes telling nonsense stories about his work experience, often repeating in numerous sessions, then proceeds to go through slides in a random order without talking much. He doesn't know how to use computers and his test review prep is usually filled with mistakes.
Dr. Sullivan is awesome! Study Guides tell you everything you need to know and most of exams were true/ false. If you go to office hours he will be helpful

Mr. Sullivan is very proud of his accomplishments and takes every opportunity to share them with the class. After the 3rd lecture I stopped going and just read the texts and took notes from there. The study sessions/guides are useless. If you e-mail him for help his responses are rude and condescending just like his attitude in person.

If you put in the effort, this class can be very beneficial. Professor Evans is tough and makes you work, but he is happy to help and provides plenty of extra credit opportunities. Be sure to really read/take notes on the Moresteam readings and take detailed notes during lecture. Any negative reviews are most likely from people who want an easy A

He's a funny guy but tough grader and if you ask him questions he says it should have been covered in Moresteam. Dumbest and hardest class I have ever taken. He is very educated and knows his stuff but not good at teaching.

You can know the material and still do bad on exams. It is the most wishy-washy class you will take. Professor does not care about students success and constantly belittles students in class. If you ask a question he will only say "we covered it in moresteam, I don't know why you don't know it" and he will answer that to EVERY question.

I will start off by giving him credit - he absolutely knows his stuff. But that doesn't mean you will do well . His exams are open note and averages are around 61% if that tells you anything. Most ops students do not go on to take their green belt because his class makes it seem miserable and impossible.

I enjoyed Doug and the class despite it being very difficult. The content was well prepared and organized, and he is hilarious. I really thought this was the most beneficial class I've taken. Six Sigma Principles is an excellent course that I would recommend to anyone, even outside of Operations, who is thinking about being a manager.

I enjoyed him and the class despite it being very difficult.  The content is very will prepared and organized. I really thought this class was the most beneficial class I've taken. Six Sigma principles is an excellent course that I would recommend to anyone, even outside of Operations, who is thinking of being a manager.

MB is super nice and willing to help when needed, however every point matters in this class! There are very few points, and sometimes it seems like the points are disproportionate to the work required (5 pts for a book report), but if you put effort into every single assignment, you'll be fine. MC exams count for MOST of your grade.

Attendance is worth 10% of your grade (twice a week) and no excuses for absence. She is nice but not an easy grader. She invited many guest speakers to the class, and the thing discussed by the guest speakers will be on the exam.

MB is a professor who really cares about real estate and really cares about her students. She is always accessible by phone call or zoom appointment. The material of the class is a bit dry, but she does her best to liven her class up and make relationships with the students in her class, even in all virtual mode.

Professor Wilk is the best of FCOB and every student should take a class with her if given the chance. While the class is challenging, she works hard to make everything she asks of her students worthwhile, and she truly cares about our development throughout the semester. I cannot say enough good things about her given the character limit.
Class is not easy, people struggle a lot due to lack of participation. Not recommend.
An amazing professor! Really knows her stuff and dedicated to teaching. Change my major to this field because of her.

Wilk is such a great teacher and this is the most interesting class in the MHR curriculum. She expects you to work hard, participate, and think for yourself. She's such a good teacher that you're happy to work hard and do well in the class. I can't recommend this class and Wilk as a teacher enough
Great class and great teacher. Highly recommend! The most interesting HR class I've taken. No textbook but a course packet. No exams. A couple of papers!

Wilk is a FANTASTIC professor. This is not an easy class; more of a challenge than most HR classes but she is very clear, helpful, and organized. Definitely the most interesting class I took all quarter and I actually learned a lot. I strongly recommend this class/this teacher!

She moves so fast and still goes over the time limit every class. Nothing she talks about are on the tests. Her handwriting is pretty bad and when shes rushing its not legible. Not a knock on her either but the love captions cant even understand what shes saying

This professor is very difficult to understand and goes at a very rapid pace. She does not have neat enough handwriting to even understand her notes. I will say she is very passionate, however the complexity of the class mixed with the difficulty to understand both her voice and scripture makes this class very frustrating.

Nice prof but does not teach well. I only took her because the others were filled up. Took my first test, studied hard, knew everything, and got a 62 because she did not teach a lot of the material. Lectures maybe discussed 4 things. Very fast talker and fast paced class. Hard no matter what prof, but she makes it harder. So nice though!

hard to understand but such a sweet lady. she did not seem to teach the material very well because nothing she said was on the exams. heavy coursework load class i would switch to someone else if i had to do it again

The best class I have taken at the Ohio State as it helped me prepare me the most for the real world. Tons of experience from Prof. Altan and every session was a great learning experience. He also helped me to find a job and wrote my recommendation letter. Amazing professor, down to earth and brilliant.
Great class and Professor!

Professor Park is one of the best professors I have had at this university. He really cares about his students and their success. That being said, the course can be difficult for some especially if you are not great with math and statistics. I would recommend using office hours wisely and attend all lectures if possible to get an A.

He is a very nice guy and really cares about each student. He tries his best to help prepare you, but this course is hard if you're not naturally good at stats. He gives lots of extra credit but you still need to go to his lectures for participation points.
Dr. Park is the best professor I have met at OSU. He is very kind and always willing to help students. The course itself is very hard, don't hesitate to go to his office and talk to him.
Great teacher. Wants you to succeed. Lots of information in the class but no homework or textbook use. Highly recommended!

Seunghoo is a great professor. He really enjoys teaching his class and is great at giving lectures. He can go fast in the places he needs to be slow, and slow in the places he needs to be fast, but other than that he is really good at what he does. He often shows clips from the Office to explain what he is teaching.

Professor Chung is a great professor. Homework is easy and exams are not hard if you pay attention. Hes also such a wonderful and caring person who is accommodating to his students, especially during COVID (a rare gem at OSU). Students, take his class. OSU, give the man a raise.
Seunghoo is definitely the best professor in my past three years at OSU. He tried to memorize all students' names and showed a lot of care to all students. His lectures and materials are very clear.
Ok class

Have you ever wanted to spend your money on something and get absolutely nothing in return except for more debt? Then take this class! Does the professor show up? No! Does he teach anything? No! Will you be forced to teach yourself and still pay for it all? Yes! Don't miss out on this deal of a lifetime and sign up today!
